text: My mouth is watering just writing this. I now live in Seattle, WA and would give anything to have a Lou Malnati's pop up here! I know Chicago is best known for their deep dish, but I'm telling you, the thin crust is where it's at...Both are actually amazing, but the thin has the most perfect consistency and you can control how much you're eating a little easier :) My office still orders this regularly and it never gets old!
I like to get my Chi-Town Deep Fish fix when ever I'm in town. I can only handle 2 slices!! The better of the 3 major Deep dish chains in the Chi.
Delicious pizza! We ordered "the Lou" and were very happy with the flavor, portion sizes and service. Definitely worth it!
It was not good! If you want to try Chicago style pizza, go somewhere else or get a personal size and share it with your group of ppl! :) just for the sake of trying it

One of my favorite pizza restaurants but the one I go to is located in Oak Park. I have never been to the one on Wells.  My location in Oak Park never disappoints.   I love the "Lou" pizza.  Nice clean restaurants with friendly great employees.

The pizza was INCREDIBLE!  I liked the efficiency of putting my name on the reservation list and getting a text notification when my table was ready. It was a little confusing to navigate to order a pizza (it was recommended to order while people wait for their table since the pies take about 30 minutes to make) and when I did, the staff were rushed and not really nice.  I got to my table and didn't get great service from my waiter. The whole operation was kind of like a factory line and not a completely welcoming environment. When I was leaving, I asked for directions to Ohio St and the employee said they were from the "north side" and don't know this neighborhood quite well...? 4 stars because I loved the food, but the staff experience kept me from giving it the full 5 because restaurants CAN be busy, but customers CAN get good service at the same time.

This is CHICAGO NOT DEEP DISH pizza. I would've rather went to UNOs for a deep dish pie. Ask any Chicago native, Giordano's or Pequods are the only places to go. Do not waste your time with this gimmick, Mickey Mouse chain if you're in search of the real deal. Was put on hold 3 times only to reiterate why I was calling only to be met with rude service. They want your credit card in case of reservation no shows? Who do they think they are a 4 star Mechlin restaurant? I think I'd rate Olive Garden over this nonsense. Service was slow, dumb and all of our pizzas came out flat and undercooked. Only thing you'll be walking away with from here is a night on the toilet thanks to the raw sausage and chewy dough. Overall bad pizza, not high thick or cooked even after I sent it back after already waiting 40 minutes. What a shame. You've been warned!

Outstanding pizza. Different than the other major Chicago pizza chains and that's a good thing. Each major pizza chain in Chicago has a slightly different way of making their pizzas. Lou's is just delicious. Very saucy. And the crust is just amazing.

This place was super packed.  It did take a very long time to get our food.  It's understandable with the amount of people they had tonight.  The customer service was amazing if it wasn't for that I would have gotten up. I'm glad we stayed the pizza was amazing!!
Tried Lou Malnati's and Giordano's deep dish pizzas on my first trip to Chicago. Lou Malnati's was better in my opinion by far. The "Lou" with sausage was our favorite.

Best Pizza in Chicago. The Sausage Deep dish is truly amazing, the crust is delicious. The service was excellent, attitudes, responsiveness, all 10/10. I couldn't recommend any other pizza place more than this one.  The location is superb, seating perfect, why are you still reading this? Go! And Enjoy!

Let me preface this by saying the food is very good. If this is what I am to expect deep dish to taste like, I think I am off to a good start. My experience with the service was appalling however. Management, you really shouldn't allow your staff to diminish an experience that should be outstanding.  To be fair I was one of a party of 13 arriving for a 9pm dinner reservation. I stress reservation, to point out that the purpose or scheduling one is to be prepared for guests. I digress. The restaurant was not ready. We hovered around the door for a few minutes, then escorted upstairs to two tables that would only accommodate a portion of our party. It wasn't until another table of two left that we were able to add our other three members to the group. Fine. No big deal.  Enter our server, Tonya, or was it Terry? Right off the bat she looked stressed. Was she overwhelmed with such a large group to tend to? Who knows. She made it clear that she was in a hurry and not in any position to be polite. My colleague is Vegan so we asked it they had Vegan options on the menu. No, the pizza is not vegan. We then asked about the bruschetta. Her reply, and I quote "are you always this annoying, or is it just today?" My head exploded but because I was with work colleagues I didn't snap my head. I wasn't the only one who kept mum. She really didn't want to ask about the bread. In a tone that was forthright, yet polite, I requested that she ask the kitchen about the Bruschetta just to be sure. She did. Anyway, the bruschetta wasn't vegan either. I forget what my colleague ordered.  The rest of the team well H.A.M on the deep dish. The classic, the mushroom and the cheese were all ordered and devoured with pleasure. But, we are getting ahead of ourselves. When it came time to serve said pizzas I couldn't tell if I was being yelled at for ordering my food or being yelled  at because there was so much. In a loud voice "okay, I've got two Classic, where are they going," "well hand me plates and I'll hand you the pizza!"  At this point everyone was bewildered at her tone, her body language and her hastiness. When we discovered we were missing two additional pizzas the team opted not to push with ordering them. Since it would take 45 minutes for them to come out. We were quite ready to finish our food and leave as quickly as possible.  Miraculously (perhaps she overheard our whispering) our server tried to redeem herself. "May I serve you another slice," looks like the pizza order was fixed your pizzas are on their way." They came, we took them so go.  What a missed opportunity by Lou's, all because of one lousy server. The floors weren't clean either! Our Chicago based team will be sad to hear about our experience I am sure.

Great friendly vibes and loved the sports memorabilia  that decorated the walls.  The staff was prompt, friendly and made great recommendations on sizes/portions for the group. Now let's get to the pizza...One of my favs for Chicago deep dish.  Good ratio of cheese, crust and sauce.     Recommend getting there early to help with the wait as it is very very popular.

Interesting way to manage the queue of people who want to try Lou Malnati's pizza. You check-in and then wait for a text when your table is ready. As you wait outside the restaurant, you get the nice pizza smell outside (weather permitting) which raises your appetite too. We ordered "The Lou", Calamari Fritti, garlic bread and minestrone soup. All the dishes were delicious and quite filling. We were so full that we had no space for dessert.

There are so many other places you can get deep dish pizza from in Chicago!!! We (group of 6) visited Lou Malnati's pizza yesterday for lunch prior to heading to O'Hare for our flight.  We arrived around 11:15am, so the restaurant was still fairly empty as they had just opened. All of us had our carry-on luggage. We asked for a table for 6, and they took a minute to seat us. The staff decided to seat us upstairs- keep in mind there were clear tables on the ground level- so we all had to carry our bags up to their second floor. Our table wasn't yet ready, so we waited near another table that was set up for 7, and asked if it would be ok if we sat there. The waitress said no, and explained that the table was set up for 9, despite only seeing 7 place settings... and proceeded to seat us at a table in the far back, by a service door, and next to a large group on a food tour.  Waiter took a while to come over, I'm guessing because we were sat so far back in a corner. Assuming this was because we had luggage. He took our order and left.  During the first interaction with our waiter, we explained that we had one dairy allergy at the table. No, this is not someone who decided to cut out dairy, go vegan, whatever. She has a severe allergy to dairy (different to being lactose-intolerant). We explained this to our waiter. Normally at other restaurants when we explain her dairy allergy to our wait staff, they respond quite attentively. This waiter seemed to brush off our statement, and carried on taking the order.  We ordered a few appetizers to share, and our friend with a dairy allergy ordered the bruschetta, again asking for her order with no dairy.  Our first appetizers came, we ordered the chicken wings and calamari. Upon asking the man who was refilling our water if the chicken wings had dairy, he said he didn't know. We had to ask him to check for us, or find our waiter. He never returned to our table with an answer.  Our waiter returned to our table for something unrelated, and we asked the same question: Do the chicken wings contain dairy? He said he didn't know, and we had to prompt him to return to the kitchen to find out.  About 10 minutes later, he returns to assure us that the chicken wings didn't have dairy in the breading. My friend proceeds to eat one of the wings.  About another 10 minutes passes, ironically while she was telling our group of another time at a restaurant they had messed up her order and the aftermath of that day. We then see the manager and our waiter approaching our table. The manager asks "did you eat the chicken wings?" We all knew where this was going and were SHOCKED. We even asked if he was joking. The manager let us know that the wings did in fact contain dairy, AFTER she had already eaten the wing.  It is shocking to me that a restaurant chain would be so dismissive and rude about a dairy allergy. Every staff member we interacted with were unprofessional and dismissive, and we were absolutely not impressed. They offered us a gift card (we gave it away because we don't live in Chicago) and offered to comp our meal.  The manager and waiter offered their apologies, but we left before finishing our food. I would never recommend this place again, especially to those who have sensitivities to food of any kind. I understand these kinds of this can happen, the reason for my review is the combination of lack of knowledge of the menu and attitude the wait staff took with our group when we inquired about whether or not the appetizer contained dairy.  Food was average, but will never return to be talked to or treated that way again! It's a shame because the restaurant on N State St (we were on Wells St) did not share this terrible service. *side note- as we were leaving, the table we asked to be seated at in the first place (the one the waitress told us was used for groups of 9) had a group of 6 seated.  tripadvisor.com/ShowUser…

Had the best wings calamari!! There cocktail sauce had a marinara flavor to it can't wait to have that again when I'm in town!  Had deep dish sausage pizza excellent!! Will be coming back and taking some to go also!

This is a tourist pizza stop for peeps that are "non-residents" to Chicago. I have had my fair share of trying mom n pop spots and prefer them over LM. Their pizza is good but I've had better. The service was great but I would probably suggest checking out other pizza joints in Chicago.

I love Lou malnatis. It is our go to Sunday night pizza. However it is not even 50% of the time I place an order that I get what I really ordered. When you pay $40 all in, delivery tip etc, for a medium pizza. It would be nice to get what you paid for.  Yesterday I was shorted two toppings that I ordered. I went over my order on the phone at least 3-4 times. But I didn't receive my onions or green pepper. The ingredients that I did receive were barely on there. I could count on two hands the amount of sausage crumbles I received.  I also asked for crushed red and parm cheese. Asked 2-3 times to make sure they bring it, as they never do.  Lastly, my pizza was like soup. Very undercooked.  I know these sound like small things, but add them all up and pay $40.00 for 6 slices of pizza and.... it is not a very satisfying experience. Sunday night hbo and Lou's is something I look forward to all week. But man, what a disappointment it is to get a product like this.  Lou's does have the best deep dish in Chicago, just beware of the details when placing your order. #veryunsatisfied #moreoftenthannot

Very generic, it is the same as all deep dish pizza, which means you enjoy it, but only eat it when friends or family are in town. It was the best of times, it was the worst of times. Many sides, many sides.
Great service and delicious food. We wanted to try the classic deep dish pizza chicago is known for, and we were not disappointed.

Very good authentic Chicago deep dish. Solid pizza menu with basic salads. Service can sometimes be hit or miss. Deep dish is the winner here, thin crust is not noteworthy. A tad on the pricey side for the portion size.
Gram, Papa, Gavin and I had the deep dish pizza!  It was well worth the wait.  Our waitress was great too!
This is the best deep dish pizza in Chicago! I always always always get the pepperoni deep dish when visiting with my boyfriend. It's our favorite!
Thank you Lauren for great customer service + recommending us the best two options for pizza! It was simply the best pizza I ever had, literally!!

I kept reading that this place is a must visit. We were seated right away but things got busy quick. Pizza takes 45 minutes which feels like forever so get an appetizer. The personal size pizza is perfect to fill you up. I have to be honest the pizza was nothing special. Maybe I just don't like deep dish? The deep dish cookie was REALLY good.
This is THE place for Chicago style deep dish pizza.  It is the first place we eat at when we visit Chicago. Worth the money and the wait for great pizza.

Came here on a Friday afternoon for what I was hoping was a quick bite. I sat at the bar, where a snippy bartender took my order. He ran off before I could finish the order, so I had to call him back and finish adding toppings. After 45 minutes I asked about my pizza, and the bartender brought up that I should've gotten his attention. Not like I spent 15 minutes trying or anything!! They didn't clean the seats, so unfortunately I also sat in some pizza sauce. Asked the bartender for some napkins, which he threw at me.  Lastly, I asked for the check. The guy was standing right in front of me and completely ignored me.  Service is abysmal. They charge extra per topping and I thought the pizza was just okay. Not worth the wait and not worth the hype.

Of course it's the best! My only complaint: my wife and I are vegetarians and ordered a mushroom pizza. It came with sausage underneath the cheese-which is delish, but I didn't want to complain because we were having a great night and it's 45 minutes for deep dish.
It was ... okay. I love deep dish pizza, so I was a little disappointed when I had this after being told they're the best,

The place is always busy. Just moved to the city and my whole family was here (11 of us). We were seated at a huge, comfortable table and the service was great! Drinks were always full and the pizza was served from the pan straight to us from the waitress. The deep dish is amazing! We got the cheese and pepperoni. For the veggie option, we kept it thin crust and it was still one of the best pizzas I've had. I drank the whiskey mule all night and the cocktail stayed consistent. Highly recommend this place - but make sure to make a reservation for larger parties.

Very cool place.  Waitstaff was great.  We ordered the cheese cubes for an appetizer. They were out of this world.   We wanted to try authentic Chicago pizza so we ordered the classic with the butter crust.  It was very good.   Its not the best pizza Ive ever had and its the only Chicago pizza place I visited so I cant compare.

I was told it's a great deep dish pizza place during my first time staying in Chicago . I guess I'm not a fan of any pizza at all. (Yelp and google for this pizza restaurant have so many reviews!!!). Service wasn't great, but I guess because restaurant is busy, understaffed so it's understandable.

The pizza was OK. I wasn't too impressed. We got the sampler appetizer and honestly we could have just been happy with that. The crust wasn't my fav... Maybe Chicago pizza just isn't my thing. Service was awesome though.
I felt disappointed to say that prior to coming here, I believed that I've had authentic deep dish before. AMAZING. Just try it. It's definitely a must visit if you're in Chicago.

After seeing Hamilton my husband and I worked our way up here for dinner. I was expecting a huge crowd but was amazed by the fact that the place was half empty when we arrived. We got seated immediately. Service however was very slow and took a while to get waited on. Although they have both deep dish and their Malnati's specials we decided to go with thin crust since we were pretty much worn out. Our waiter said it would take 45 minutes to prepare but since we ordered thin crust he said he would check on it and we would probably have it sooner. The main dining area is decorated with jerseys of famous people.  They have near the entrance a sign that says text message area. I guess they must use texting if there is a line. I noticed the place was a bit old and when I went to use the ladies room I had to wait since there was only one stall and it was in a small area. We did however get our pizza in 15 minutes. We ordered a small mushroom and green pepper.Toppings are extra on cheese pizzas and they do note that even if you order half topping then you pay the full price of the topping. I did see many people ordering for take out or doggie bags since you get so much. Place can get very loud at times. There were 6 generous cuts to the pizza. They were good but not anything that I would find spectacular. Maybe if I had the deep dish one that would have made a difference. There are other items on the menu besides pizza. Even for desserts my husband spotted a chocolate pizza but we were pretty full to go beyond the pizza we shared. You can eat either indoors or out. You can even sit on a high top or at a booth. The choice is yours. I No trip would be complete without trying one of Chicago's famous pizza places and we were glad to have the opportunity to enjoy one.

I've been to Chicago once before and had Giordanos and absolutely loved their pizza. I was going to go visit them again because I knew I'd enjoy myself and it would be a no fail dining experience.  Of course I had to reference my fellow Yelpers and see what they had to say since I haven't been here for about 7 years. I'm glad I went off my plan and took the "risk" of trying Lous. I definitely can see what all the hype is about, their deep dish pizza is definitely a Chicagoan staple.  I was staying far from this particular location but had to check it out because the ones close to my hotel were take out only. Arrived at this location and saw a lot of people waiting to be seated. It was good and bad, obviously because I know people want to eat here and the pizza must be good and bad because I was bracing myself for probably a minimum of an hour wait. Was sunrise when I gave my name and they gave me an estimated time of 30-35 minutes. They let you pre order Pizza before seated as it takes about 45 minutes to make.  Sweet! So I thought to myself I've got plenty of time to check out another Chicago place to eat, Stans donuts. Looked it up, saw it was .7 miles away and called the uber. As soon as I arrived at stans, I got a text saying my table was ready and they'll hold it for 5 minutes. CRAP!!! Texted them back and said I was in the bathroom, whoops.  My table was ready within 15 minutes. Okay, now for the nitty gritty. Was planning on only getting the pizza but someone suggested the wings. Being the fatty I am I of course ordered it, wasn't sure if I should get the bbq or the buffalo style so the waiter suggested both sauces on the side and ranch. Hell yes. They arrived and they were mighty delicious. How the heck do I eat this and not be full, or pace it as slow as I can and wait for the pizza? I was hoping they weren't that good, but they were. So hard to do when you're hungry and have been saving your appetite all day for this meal. Alas, my pizza arrived..half pepperoni half sausage. Omg, so good. The crust was nice and crispy and my first bite and a burst of flavor. Pizza was expertly made as it left me to wonder how the toppings don't fall off.  You can taste all the ingredients in every bite, pepperoni, cheese, sauce, crystal working in perfect harmony.  So glad I made the decision to go here.  Now I need to go back to giordanos and have myself a little contest. But wait, there's more. As I had to unbutton my pants and had no shame gluttonizing my way through the pizza and wings, I had to finish it off with their dessert. And yet again, it was bomb. It's a pizookie  basically, a chocolate chip cookie with a bunch of vanilla ice cream and whipped cream. Idk what's different in this one vs bjs but it was amazingly good. Cookie was good, ice cream and whip cream. Geez, I can go back just for that or any of the three things I had separately.
A good classic Chicago style pizza. Great atmosphere and location. Just be prepared the deep dish takes like 40min. But the spinach bread appetizer can hold you over! Must visit in Chi!

This is a must visit when we are in Chicago.  Full food service at the bar if you can find a seat and the bartenders are always excellent.  Expect a 45 minute wait for deep dish.  Dont get pissy at the bartender because you didnt know that.  Get an appetizer and drink or two.   The personal size is fairly small.  I get the small which is marked as serving two, but if you are hungry go for it.  Add extra ingredients.

Service was fast and friendly and the decor is great (especially the old skateboards), but the pizza fell flat for us: there was little to no salt in the dough, which made it painfully noticeable. It made me feel like I was eating a communion wafer, and I haven't been in church for years. It took me right back to Sister Miriam smacking me with a ruler at Saint Mary's High School.  The sauce was a little plain for us, being just crushed tomatoes. There may have been something else in there, but if there was it wasn't very noticeable.  We heard amazing things about LM's so we gave it a try. We're always excited  to try restaurants we've never eaten in, and this is no exception, but the pizza just wasn't to our liking.  We fall in the minority, and It still sits as one of the highest-rated spots in town to get a pie, but not for us.  I'd give it a shot if you've never been there.

This was good and a fun experience. I don't know if it will make the frequent list for us to dine at. We ordered the Chicago style pizza and it was good, not great. The bruschetta however, was wonderful! I would give the staff a B- on attentiveness.

This place was highly recommended to me from a native Chicagoan, now a New Yorker. And I never forgot the name and what a cool one, Lou Malnati. Sounds like a gangster's name. But in this case, the gangster of Chicago deep dish pizza. Being that I live in NYC, I have so many pizza spots to choose from. $1 pizza, my favorite pizza place, vegan pizza, neopolitan, the classics(Joe's, Ray's, Artichokes, Bleeker etc..)pizza chains--and this is just a small fraction. I came to Chicago with my nose-to-the-sky knowledge on pizza and was ready for what Lou had to offer. I was sat at the bar as soon as I arrived, 935pm. I had intended for the restaurant to be mobbed, but as far as I can see there was enough space on the floor to perform The Nutcracker. I'm just glad that I don't have to wait for seating or have to sit outside--has been humid lately. An expressionless bartender asked me if I wanted to start on a drink. Nope, just a Coke. I had already skimmed the menu and knew I wanted to start on the mozz. sticks. 10 seconds later, I said I might as well put in my pizza order. And he said, might as well, it DOES take 40 minutes. But he said it like a jerk would say it. Like if common sense should have taught me this. I immediately developed a bad taste in my mouth. I couldn't let the bartender in his lonely island take away from the hype. He did mention getting the butter crust and I was later glad I did. You see, optimism. My 7 sticks came out about 10 minutes after ordering. They were gone just about as soon as they were presented to me. I like them hotter(temp) than served and the tomato sauce accompaniment was nice and chunky. And not 40 minutes, but in 25 minutes  my personal deep dish pizza with pepperoni came out. Given to me briskly and with no eye contact. It was an interesting wait though. Got to see the staff do a lot of dancing, and dancing with whipped cream in their mouth, and play patty cake, and dance some more, and the bartender likes sandsurfing--I overheard. BUT THAT PIZZA!!! Boy, was that a delicious circular and singular sensation. I felt weird having to use a fork and knife coming from the land of slices. But I got a personal so I was able to still use my paws. I asked the bartender to go light on sauce as well. Yummy, and buttery and a taste that was so satisfying and that lingered. Each bite had the promise of a happy ending on my palette. Boy, was that a great piece of doughy heaven with poking pieces of pepperoni. I wasn't savvy on the pan sizes until after I ordered. But I think I could have easily took down the next size(for 2). I know I will be back. Maybe at this location, or maybe at another. I need to experience the greatness of this pizza once or twice again. Hope there's friendlier service next time.

2nd Stop while on my Chicago trip. I had high hopes for this style of deep dish pizza.  I ate a Small Malnati Chicago Classic ($15.45) and I could only put down 2 of the four slices. Overall it was a good pie, however, it was a bit overpowering with garlic. My favorite thing about the pizza was the sausage with every bite. I like the way the sausage was spread over the entire pizza, that part of the experience was amazing. I have nothing to compare this to except for the east coast, thin crust pizza we eat on a normal basis. That said, I would probably only eat this style of deep dish pizza 1 time a month. At least now I know what the rave is about even if i do not agree :)
The deep dish pizza of my dreams! Was there around 6pm on a Sunday and the place was packed. Prepare yourself for a wait, but it's worth the wait!
Even though it's a chain they don't mess around. This is some great pizza. Family owned! Excellent ingredients. The sauce is awesome.

Not sure what all the fuss is about. Huge line outside and servers seem to not have that personal touch. Food was good, but definitely not outstanding by any means. Maybe it's because I'm not a huge fan of deep dish too, but everything was just okay.

Nestled in the heart of Chicago, this place keeps themselves very busy even on weeknights. We visited this place and had a 40 minute wait on a Tuesday night. However, they let you place your pizza order right away because the pizza will take about 40 minutes to cook. Folks, well worth the wait. The pizza was amazing. We had the standard pepperoni and sausage deep dish with butter crust. The sausage was like a layer of sausage, like a pancake. Very flavorful through and through. We ordered some drinks to go with it. No I would not recommend them. They tasted fine, but had no strength in them. But we did not come here for the drinks so I don't take anything away from them for that.

This place had really good pizza and wings. The thing that really turned me off was the wait we had for our pizza and the attitude of both the waiter and the manager when we complained. If the waiter had told us there would be a long wait, then it would have been fine. Instead he avoided our table and failed to inform us that our pizza would take 45+ min to make. We waited over an hour and saw other patrons come and go while we waited for our food without an update from our waiter. When I spoke to the manager and told them that we just got off of a long train ride (28hrs) and had been waiting over an hour for our food with no type of communication from our waiter, he didn't seem at all bothered. Besides the poor service, the food was really good. We ordered wings, and they were pretty large and tasty. We got chicken sausage on our pizza and that tasted pretty amazing as well. Good food but poor service.

True Chicago style pizza. Deep dish pizza. Get the one with the butter crust, onions, spinach and mushrooms. Great baseball memorabilia. Busy at lunch time. They have indoor and outdoor seating. The pizza is so filling! We had the small enough for two people! And we were both full. Had the coffee, which is good too. I like the exposed brick and wood floors. A NYC loft type feeling. Go early!!
So overrated.   Soggy pizza and crazy long wait.  I've had much better pizza in Chicago. Service was so so.

This was an amazing pizza!!! I had a bad taste in my mouth from the first Chicago deep dish at another restaurant but had to try one again at a different restaurant. This is the place. Make sure you get the "butter crust". Simply awesome!! Great staff and service also.
Great service, good pizza. Order deep dish pizza while you're waiting to be seated or it will take forever.

Very good deep dish, although not as good as my still-reigning-favorite, Pequod's. We got a large pie, half Classic (which comes with sausage) / half Lou (which has spinach, mushrooms, tomatoes, and a three-cheese blend), both of which were good. I do think I may have liked the cheese or pepperoni more, but hard to say. Regardless, overall I thought this was very good, but not close to Pequod's.

If you want pizza - this is not the right place. If you want an overloaded open-face cheese pie - maybe. Apparently this chain is a local institution, although I was never quite able to understand why.

Wow. I hadn't been to Chicago in over 20 years and I was excited to have some good deep dish pizza again. Unfortunately the pizza was very thin and dry, nothing like what a Chicago deep dish pizza should be. The service was pretty awful as well. Maybe it was a bad night, but I sure did expect a lot more from them.

I've been to Chicago dozens of times, and I've eaten deep dish pizza, but I'd never had deep dish in Chicago. A crime, I know. On a winter visit to Chicago my boyfriend and I decided to right this wrong and check out Lou Malnati's for a late lunch. We sadly had just missed their wonderful-sounding lunch special and thus opted to split a medium Malnati Chicago Classic - sausage, extra cheese, and tomato sauce on their signature butter crust.  The menu has serving suggestions for the different sizes, and though there were two of us we picked the medium (serves three) because my boyfriend wanted leftovers. I am here to tell you that you do not need to size up to leave with extra pizza. Despite being ravenous when we walked in, I was only able to take down a slice and a half and my boyfriend two and a half. Even a small would have left us with extra slices.  The pizza itself was delicious and decadent. I generally hate sausage, but Italian sausage done right is a treat and I'm glad I trusted my instincts to give it a try here. The amount of cheese would make any Wisconsinite feel at home, and the sauce was a tasty topper. The butter crust was, as advertised, buttery. You will definitely feel like a 'Da Bears Chris Farley after enjoying a meal here.  I went into our lunch fully intending to order their Chocolate Chip Pizza after a previous stay in River North that taunted me the entire time with the smell of fresh-baked cookies. However, after my gut-busting failed attempt to eat a second slice of our deep dish I had to abandon all hope. Meal or dessert - never the twain shall meet in my belly during a LM visit.  Service was good. When you arrive you can put in your order while you wait for a table due to the long cooking times. We were seated just as we made up our minds and were about to place our order. Due to the long wait between ordering and our pizza's arrival we could have used another check-in to refill drinks, but that was my only complaint. Once we got our pizza our server was great about checking in to make sure we were happy with our meal and that we had everything we needed.  Deep dish pizza isn't something that I can do regularly, but I could definitely see working this in once a year or so on one of our Chicago visits.

My first Chicago deep dish pizza experience. Other than the fact that I had to wait about 40 minutes for my pizza, it was an amazing experience. Even though the best pizza (overall) is in New York, I get why Chicago deep dish has its fame. Lou Malnati's proved how deep dish pizza should taste... I really like it. I'll visit again on my next trip to Chicago.

Loved this deep dish!  So much food!  There was 3 of us and the medium was way too big!  All the flavors worked so well together and the crispness of the crust was amazing.  The cheese tasted so fresh.  It was super hearty.  This was my first deep dish and it was great!  We also got the tiramisu - all the ingredients were perfectly balanced and it just melted in your mouth!

Came on a Friday evening. There was a long wait. You get in line to put your name down and they text you when your table is ready. After you put your name down, they give you the menu so you can pre-order your pizza. We ordered a small Chicago style pizza, Buffalo wings, and the minestrone soup. Surprisingly, I liked the wings best here. The soup was average, I've had better. I was super excited to try Chicago style pizza (even though many people have told me it wouldn't be as good as New York's pizza). I was a bit disappointed. The tomato sauce was really tasty but the cheese was too heavy and hard. It wasn't melted at all. There was a big layer of it on top of the crust. I don't know if that's how all Chicago pizza is made but I wasn't a  fan of it. Next time I'm back in Chicago I'll give the pizza another try.

First time visiting Chicago. The concierge at the hotel recommended this place and said it was the best for pizza. I'm not a big fan of deep dish pizza in the first place. I tried the "Lou" and it was just alright. It didn't have a lot of flavor to me. It was kind of bland. I also got the Malnati Salad which was amazing. That was the best part. Salad was on point. I would go back for the salad but not the pizza.

The stuffed spinach bread was out of this world. My party had the Malnati Chicago Classic pizza, which was top notch. Luckily, we went when we did because when we were leaving, the wait was out the door. Will go here again when visiting Chicago.
MY GO TO PIZZA PLACE IN CHICAGO. Amazing, fast delivery & always pleased with the pizza!! So yummy!

Another good visit to Lou's! The lunch special is a great deal. 6 inch personal pizza, salad and drink for under $10. Lunch was super busy. We got seated at a table that was basically in the waiting room. Not very private. The server was new too. But once again the food was wonderful! My pizza came out before the salads because we pre-ordered so that is a warning.

Omg!! Definitely worth all the hours of waiting for that truly authentic Chicago deep dish. We went with simple cheese but it was so flavorful and I wanted more and more. I would recommend the location on North Wells St. as the one to go to! They have great staff and awesome service!

Liked this even more than their north side location. Same excellent pizzas but better vibe. I was there early in the day - around 5pm and I managed to sit down. After 6:00 on a weekend - forget about it. Great experience.

The place was good for pizza, definitely something different. The pizza was really big and thick. My group of 6 adults actually had trouble finishing it. But there was a taste on the pizza was odd. The juice of the pizza tasted kinda like an alcohol. But other than that, it was actually good.  The cheese was extremely good. I could definitely tell it was high quality cheese. When I picked up the pizza, it was a never ending strand.  But other than the sauce on the pizza, the place was actually ok. Loved the inside of the place. Also provided free valet parking. And all the staff were really friendly.

I ordered the Lou's Style Pizza which was amazingly delicious..the only problem is that whoever added the tomatoes put a couple of butt pieces of the tomato in which the core on the top was evident..and it was several pieces like this...pricey pizza should have quality tomatoes??????!!!!! Also the crust was burned around some of the pizza......bummer! The salad and salad dressing were delicious....

Sadly a bad experience at the River North location. I usually enjoy Lou Malnotti's, but everything about this visit was bad to worse. The wait was well over the hour I was told, finally received the "text" after it seemed like an eternity of constantly refreshing the web address to see what number position we were and then seated outside. Ok, I admit I said outside was fine....but, that was almost an hour and a half ago, now it's cool out that it's nightfall and you see I have two kids in tow. Whatever, just want to eat and go. Corner table outside, closest to where the group of guys are smoking...are you effing kidding me??!!! I address this to our server and she kindly tells the guys no smoking there, ok, great, Thanks! Place our order for the kids menu, because of course they ask you to pre-order your pizza for faster service...nope, still a half an hour after seating did we get the Medium, thin crust, half pepperoni and half basil/onion...Yes, not the deep dish, but a pretty basic and general pizza, why did it take so long???!!!! Best part is when that pizza arrived... What a hot mess!!!! The basil/onion side literally had HUGE chunks of onions I had to scrape off if I had any intentions of speaking to anyone else last night, cheese was scattered and uneven throughout, I mean Wow, how in the hell do you screw that up??? Believe me when I say the Giordano's in my freezer looked 1000% better than that thing. Last part of this useless trip and waste of money, after all of this, we go to the bathroom and there is ONE STALL.  Are you kidding me???!!! There is a wait of over an hour and a half, I am somewhere in the 40 position, meaning 40 effing parties ahead of me, its RIVER NORTH busy....and you have ONE STALL in the LADIES ROOM??!!! UNBELIEVABLE!!! ‍ ON TOP OF THAT, ITS A FRIGGEN PIGSTY??? Ugh!!!! NEVER AGAIN!!! Moral of the story...should have gone to Gino's East on LaSalle  What a disaster going

When you go to Chicago, you have to try their Deep Dish Pizzas!  & not just one, you have to try a few in order to find out which one is the king of all pizzas. This was one of the best reviewed & most talked about pizza joints by all of our Uber drivers.  The deep dish takes about 45 minutes to make so they recommend you order appetizers while you wait but  I say wait it out because once the deep dish comes, you will get so full & it will be that more satisfying. The "Lou":  A vegetable based pizza on top of a delicious garlic Buttercrust.  So much ooey, gooey cheese.  Yum, yum, yum!  We ordered a small & that was plenty for us. Also, you can get this pizza shipped to you nationwide!
Very good pizza, if you like this style.
Worth the 45 min wait ... The LOU deep dish with butter crust and the MANALTI salad were delish, would definitely order again.
Whomever didn't give them 5 stars must not like pizza. It was awesome! Some of the best I have ever had. Calamari was also cooked to perfection. My wife and I will be back next time we are in town.

Sooo good!! Our waiter was so nice and accommodating - Lucas was his name. The garlic bread was average but the deep dish pizza with sausage and pepperoni was amazing!!! I would definitely go back if we could, but short vacation:/

Best Chicago style pizza, period. Get the buttercrust! Homemade sausage is excellent. Choose your time to visit carefully as there can be some serious wait times. Or get it delivered UNCUT so that it stays hot and non-mushy.

Holy deep dish pizza batman! This place is phenomenal and totally worth every minute of the wait! This was one of the must do's on our annual girls trip to Chicago and boy am I glad we didn't miss out on this spot!! We arrived around 5 or 6 in the evening on Sunday (8/6/17) and this place was packed. We reserved our table then put our order in and I proceeded to the bar. I ordered the local IPA they had on tap and it was crisp and refreshing. I put my phone to charge as they have outlets under the bar area only. They told us the wait for a table would be about 25 minutes and I only had time to order a beer and plug my phone in and they had already called us, yay for good service and timeliness! We were told to go upstairs and then the waitress escorted us to our table. Our waitress was really good! Very friendly and prompt on everything we asked for, I wish I would have got her name.  When we arrived at the table we ordered the stuffed spinach bread, it came out quickly and was full of oozing deliciousness.  After the spinach bread I was eagerly anticipating heaven in my mouth when my pizza came out. I had ordered the Lou; it comes with mushrooms, spinach, chunky tomato sauce, and globs of mouthwatering cheese.  I am a pizza lover so for me this experience was orgasmic, it was as if only I and "Lou" existed and boy was it delicious! I literally didn't hear any conversations going on around me and just sat and enjoyed my pizza and beer. Next time I am in Chicago, without a doubt, I will go visit good ol' Lou Malnati's for another pie.

My deep-dish was fantastic.  Its crust was like butter, its cheese was slightly browned, and its sauce tasted fresh and fruity.  I sat at the counter at the bar and my bartender was energetic, happy, and provided great service.

Lou Malnati's was recommended to me by several people when I arrived to Chicago and trust me, it won't disappoint. If it's a cool summer night the outside sitting is perfection. Their menu holds a large selection of items ranger from appetizers to dessert and each one sounding equally as delicious. We decided to get the bruschetta and a deep dish pepperoni pizza. The bruschetta was so refreshing and fresh that we almost ordered that as our meal. A few minutes after the pizza came out and I must say, there wasn't much of a waiting time. We were also really entertained by the people watching and the awesome service that time kind of flew by. Note: the Chicago style deep dish pizza has the sauce on top and the cheese on the bottom. Kind of different from your typical pizza and very filling.
best pizza crust on the planet and the cheese cubes are to die for!!!! i'm not a pizza person but when i want pizza its gotta be from lou's!!!!

I was once skeptical about deep dish pizza. It's just a lot of sauce, and a big slice of pizza that will fill you up. How good can it be? Boy was I wrong.  After polling from locals, Uber drivers, my friends who visited Chicago before, I have decided to try Lou Malnati's pizza over the other chains that are around town. Since we had a tight schedule, we didn't want to wait in line and wait for the pizza to cook when we order, so we decided to call in and ask for to-go.  Their medium deep dish pizza has 6 slices (serves 3-4), and their large deep dish pizza has 8 slices (serves 5-6). My group weren't too hungry, and the 6 of us shared the medium deep dish pizza (so we each had one slice).  When I opened up the pizza box after picking it up at the restaurant, I was really nervous that the pizza would go stale or not be as fresh since it was sitting inside a pizza box for roughly half an hour. As soon as I bit into my pizza, all those worries went away. The cheese were so stringy, and the butter crust was amazing.  I seriously don't know how else to describe the slice of heaven I had, other than asking you try it yourself!!
My go- to fav Chicago Pizza!! Butter crust is the best!

I split a small pizza with a friend--the perfect size for two!  We got the Lou (tomatoes, mushrooms, spinach, 3 kinds of cheese) and it was spectacular. I'd never tried deep dish before, and don't consider myself a true cheese lover--but I was blown away by the flaky crust, comfort food flavor and the pure fun of eating it with a knife and fork!  (Also, the cheese really didn't overwhelm the pizza--there was a lot else to enjoy on the plate.) Sat outside and enjoyed a view of River North passers by.  Highly recommend!

Its ok !  We ordered the sausage and the basic pizza.  If you like a sausage patty squished at the bottom of your pizza you will be a fan ! Lol ! We found the sausage chewy and this is comparing to other Chicago landmark pizza places and pizza in Phila & NY.  As far as service we would rate the location as a 1 . It was difficult to get drinks, refills and any attention from the staff. Again comparing to other Chicago locations and other large city busy pizza places. I would definitely try the other main stream pizza joints first before heading to LMs , this after being there many times and having tried them all !

Had fried calamari appetizer (a little tough) and house salads (the lemon garlic dressing is to die for!) to start. House salad was really good sized, and had a lot of stuff in it. Had the Malnati Chicago Classic deep dish pizza, in a small size for the 2 of us. It was really good, with not too much sauce (a problem with a lot of other "deep dish" restaurants). Very flavorful, with the meat and cheese. And the crust! Wow, delicious - reminded me in a good way of the homemade pizzas my mom used to make with biscuit dough!

Lou Malnati's is definitely the place to go if you're looking for A Chicago deep dish pizza . We tried their most popular pizza, the classic (sausage pizza) & the Lou (a veggie pizza). The sausage pizza was pretty gross after the first bite. It has a thick layer of sausage on the pizza and has way too much meat for any normal human to consume with out gagging. I really could not handle it. The Lou was delicious. Mushroom, spinach, and tomato pizza. The tomatoes did make the pizza a bit soggy but still delicious. Overall, I'm a thin crust type of gal but Lou Malnati's definitely serves decent deep dish pizzas. *Line can get pretty crazy so try the bar*

ordered a small deep dish pepperoni = received a sausage deep dish. i ordered the spinach bread with no onions. it was LOADED with onions. my service was marginal at best; i would suggest Giordano's;  i rarely have a bad experience there.

As a tourist from Cali, this was one of my bookmarks since it's highly popular. After Lollapalooza, we were craving a nice deep dish but we were exhausted from the event. Thankfully they were able to deliver to our hotel!  I highly recommend their Chicago deep dish. You can tell the sausage is homemade because of the flavor. I really love how crispy the crust was but at the same time, everything in the middle was soft. Just taking one bite from the pizza will take you to Pizza heaven and back-- especially how Ooey-gooey the cheese will string from your mouth. Phenomenal! The chicken fettuccine was also very delicious! The pasta tasted like it was made from scratch with its perfectly creamy Alfredo sauce and bits of chicken. Delish!

Beat the dinner lines arriving by 5:30p Saturday.  Smartly after taking name for table, they let you order your pizza to start baking.  15 minutes later we were seated, ordered salad and drinks.  30 minutes later after we enjoyed salad, pizza arrives!  Simply delicious pizza.  Staff were all smiles.  Excellent Chicago experience and must do when visiting.

This was another popular and hot restaurant. One hour waiting outside on the street. While waiting, preorder your food, get a drink and wait some more. Got a classic deep dish pizza, and BBQ chicken salad. Don't trust that you are hungry and can eat a lot pizza. I saw while waiting a couple walked out with a leftover box, handed it over to a young dude waiting to get in, saying they ordered too much and could not finish. Ours was a medium, gosh, it took a great effort to chew down just over half a pie. It was a great pizza, great size and very filling. Not tomato paste, it's crushed tomato and pulling yard long yummy cheese.  Got a leftover piece, keep it or toss it? Should have give it away to a hungry waiting dude.

JUST LOVED THE DEEP DISH PIZZA OVER HERE !! We ordered the salad and the Malnati classic pizza which is made with sausage.This was just awesome. The servers are great, service is great, PIZZAS are awesome ! In my last 5 years of eating pizza, this certainly is one of the best ! A must have in Chicago !

Which Chicago pizza is best?  We vote for Lou's hands down. YUM!  Order a cold beer, the Malnati salad and the pizza.  The basic deep dish pepperoni is the family favorite.  Every time we visit Chicago Lou's is a must.

Pizza is usually great although it can vary from location to location.  Service and food at the Lincolnwood location is usually great.  Ate at the Buffalo Grove location last summer and the Lincolnwood regulars felt the pizza wasn't as good. Try the Malnati's salad; it is tasty.
Probably a little bit healthier and freshest tasting deep dish of the chains but not as much savory flavor as competition.  However, if you're visiting Chicago, Lou's must be on your to do list.

This is an outstanding pizza place to visit in Chicago and this is coming from a New Yorker. The deep dish pizza was unbelievable the ambience and the waitstaff was incredible. Make sure you go there with a big appetite because for four of us it was very hard to complete one pizza pie.

Despite looking like so many generic restaurants in the first floor of a newly built or renovated luxury apartment building, this is still a lou malnati's and it is still excellent. Also, the person on the wall behind the register is either Lou Malnati who looks like Newman from Seinfeld or it's actually just Newman from Seinfeld. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

I've never had deep dish pizza-and I've been told Lou Malnati's was the place I had to try in Chicago. And it for sure didn't disappoint. I'd recommend getting the buttercrust for the pizza-it adds a better taste. Also, if you sign up for emails through their free wifi, you can get a free appetizer with a purchase of $20!
What can I say, this is the best pizza in Chicago, and this was as good as usual. The service was good, and the prices were right. I love Lou's.

Took my friend who was visiting me here. Got the Malnati Chicago Classic, the stuffed spinach bread, and calamari fritti.  Before the verdict, two relevant points:  1. This was my first deep-dish pizza in Chicago.  2. We were starving and ready to eat a horse.  So my confidence on the correctness of judgment is not super high. But I loved it! I loved the tons of sausage on the pizza, and I especially loved the spinach bread - so soft and full of melted cheese.  All in all I appreciate how satisfying this whole meal was - at the end of the meal, it was OUR turn to be stuffed.  We waited for 45 minutes because we went at the peak hour on Friday night, but I'd love to come back here when it's less crowded and get another round.

Was it worth waiting an hour to get in, and 45 more minutes for the pizza? Yep. The best crust we tried in Chicago, tons of toppings, friendly and attentive waitresses. We would wait again in a heartbeat.

So my wife saw this spot on Yelp and wanted to go try it out on our vacation. The waiter was really nice at first but towards the end I don't know if he was hot (as we had a table outside) or maybe tired, but he seemed like he had a little attitude. We ordered the bruschetta and that was amazing! We then got the deep dish cheese with the buttered crust. I took one bite and it didn't taste like much. It wasn't horrible but I was expecting way more flavor. If you don't smoke or hate the smell then don't sit outside, because people will come outside and smoke right in your face. Street meter parking was $8 for 2 hours. I didn't get a chance to go inside at all so I have no comments on decor.
I am born and raised Chicagoan. Hands down the BEST deep dish in town. Don't waste any time and get there!

There are a lot of great deep dish pizza places in Chicago, I've tried them all and Lou Malnati's stands above them all. The crust is to die for, buttery heaven. The sauce is simple yet great. If you are in Chicago, this is one place you must not miss.
The deep dish needs a little more sauce in my opinion but I liked the crust more than other Chicago spots. Bruschetta was good. Service was ok.

This deep dish pizza was well worth the 30 minute wait! A perfect buttery crust and an enormous portion of toppings. When we visit Chicago again, we would choose this place over uno's pizzeria hands down.
Deep Dish House Sausage is the way to go. Love the pizza and the service is fast. Thank you!

Simply the best deep-dish in Chicago! Before I moved from the suburbs to downtown, I would eat Gino's East, but after finding this place there is no going back! When craving a deep-dish pizza, Lou Malnati's is the place!
Such a great experience at Lou Malnatis. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Kevin the manager was great, he and his staff showed why they are the best restaurant in the Chicago area.

Where do I begin...? I had pretty high hopes as a tourist that this place would be a must on my to-do list but I was so disappointed. Disclaimer: we ordered the thin crust pizza and a personal size deep dish so I can't speak for the taste of the bigger sized deep dishes that come in an actual cast iron skillet. We waited for about 40 min for a table. We did the preordering thing, thinking our pizza would come around the time we got seated. Nope. We waited a total of an hour and 15 minutes from the time we stepped foot into that restaurant to eat our pizza. Fine. I get it. It's packed.  But when my pizza comes, I at least expect it to taste good. Nope. The cheese has hardened. I mean, we just got it. Not like it hardened over the course of our eating it. It came like that. And then the waitress, as friendly as she tries to be, didn't even think to let us know when our pizza would come out. AND tell me how the tables that got seated after us got their pizza first. Save your money and go elsewhere. Waste of time.
Pizza is great, their beer list is awful, what a shame you can't have a good beer with good pizza
Great calamari. House dressing has a sweeter taste to it, I'm not really into it, but the pizza is PHENOMENAL....
YUM! We had a great dinner here. Thanks for letting us reserve a table in advance by pre-ordering our pizzas. Great service and happy bellies! A Chicago MUST!
Amazing this has to be the best pie.ever really!!!! price is great .large enough to share .a real find..

Arrived in Chicago armed with ample pizza recommendations and 9 out of 10 suggested Lou Malnati's, so I had to experience the hype for myself. There was a 25 minute wait for a table (which was fair), and we were given the option to place an order before we were seated so we'd only wait 20-25 min before our pizza was done (which was brilliant).  We were able to snag seats at the bar where I ordered a beer. The wait went by pretty quickly (I hadn't even finished my beer), and we were then seated in a roomy and rustically-decorated upstairs area that I absolutely loved. The reason this place lost 2 stars for me was that the pizza came out on the colder side of lukewarm. We had ordered extra cheese and when the pie was cut, the cheese cut like a block. There was no stringy goodness as my slice detached from the rest of its comrades. That should've been a red flag.  My first slice was a volatile bag of mixed emotions. I would be torn between disappointment and mild satisfaction as I bit into various parts of the pizza that were still warm versus parts that were now room temperature (and the room was cool. The AC was GOING...summers in the midwest are no joke). However, it was my second slice that sealed the deal. The slice was now completely room temperature and the cheese had the texture of greasy rubber. Not cool. I did not know that cold deep dish pizza was the epitome of human disappointment before that moment. Maybe it was just a one-off for Lou Malnati's, but seeing as I was visiting from 1700 miles away, I highly doubt I will be visiting again for a second chance when there's so much good food in Chicago. TL;DR: Cold pizza. I've had pizza arrive hotter from the Papa John's delivery guy.

We were staying at the Fairmont and phone ordered for delivery.  An hour and twenty minutes from time of order to delivery, which they tell you when you order.  $4.50 delivery fee added to the bill was really reasonable.  Arrived on time and piping hot.  My wife got the personal size cheese deep dish.  I got the small classic deep dish and added the spinach mix.  We shared an individual house salad with reduced calorie ranch dressing.  My wife's pizza was a miss.  Didn't seem as deep, not as cheesy or as saucy as the one I had.  Mine was excellent.  Terrific, fresh tomato sauce and the spinach mix with basil and garlic was the perfect addition.  Very cheesy.  The salad was your basic house salad, nothing fancy about it but good size and crisp lettuce.

We ran into Ramon, in the elevator of our hotel, and the smell of the pizza made us curious. He recommended that we try the deep dish at the restaurant , so we ventured over there to eat. COMPLETELY WORTH THE HOUR WAIT, we will Definately come back! And cheers to Ramon! Great customer service . :)
When we are in Chicago and hankering to have pizza delivered, we always call Lou Malnati's. It is the best! We like the spinach and garlic on thin crust.
Not my favorite pizza in the city but it's still good. The pizza dough tasted stale but the toppings were good and the salad starter was great.

O.M.G. Do yourself a favor and go eat here! We had to wait an hour and fifteen minutes but it was well worth the wait. This is the best pizza I've ever had! The crust is amazing, it's crunchy throughout and not doughy, the cheese is out of this world, the sauce has small delicious pieces of garlic, and you get sausage with every freakin bite!  The worst part of it all was that I wanted to go purge in the bathroom so I could keep eating more!

My friend won a gift card to Lou Malnati's and so we stopped in to the carry-out location on Damen. We walked it home, and then made a salad so it was just a touch cold when we finally sat down to eat. Definitely need to eat it hot! It was good, but not OMG my mind is blown good. Just typical Chicago-style deep dish. I've been eating left-overs the past couple of days and it's not any better the day after.  The girl who checked us out at the front desk was very sweet and had our order ready to go right away. If you need to get something fast to feed a crowd, this is a good way to do it!

The hype is warranted. I grew up in the Chicago area ("da Region," Northwest Indiana) and have had and loved Edwardo's, Gino's East, Giordano's, and the original Uno but this was the best deep dish I've ever had- a small (feeds 2!) with sausage, just too much to dream. That damn crust, ohhhhhhhhhh.....

Had a 55 minute wait wasn't too bad because it was  such a nice night. They told us we could order ahead of time before we were seated because pizza takes 30 minutes in the oven. We ordered early and also wanted appetizers but they said we had to wait to order when we sat down for that because they are way faster than the pizza. We're seated about 10-15 minutes after that, ordered our apps waited a good while and the pizza ended up coming before. Wouldn't have ordered the apps if we knew the pizza would come before because none of them compare to the main dish and none of us were hungry for appetizers once we had a slice down but the wait for the pizza was worth it!!! Get the buttercrust pepperoni deep dish! Soo good

Not sure how impressed I am with Chicago deep dish pizza.  There was about a ten minute wait when I came on Thursday night around 8:30 pm. Checked in and gave them my number- they text you when your table is ready. You can then go in and preorder your pizza.  Got a personal size pepperoni pizza with Buttercrust and additional mushroom topping. It was tiny! And the pizza wasn't super hot when it came- the cheese was kinda thickened and not melty. Sad. The crust didn't blow me away- was pretty unimpressive, really (not light and fluffy as they described it). More squished and crunchy. Left me wondering what the normal crust looked like and whether I should have just gotten that instead of paying extra for Buttercrust.  My personal pizza was $11. Coke was $2.60. Total bill came out to $15.17 before tip.  Overall, not impressed. Not to be blasphemous or anything, but Zachary's deep dish pizza in Berkeley is way better!

Our fave Chicago style pizza place! The three cheese bread was good, too. You are able to order your pizza when you put your name in for a table so it makes the wait not so bad. Roberto was our server and he was great. Love the atmosphere of this location.

I can't stop obsessing about this place! I seriously recommend Lou's deep dish pizza to everyone that's in town. This quaint little restaurant is filled with so much history and delicious smells lingering all around. The locals love it, so you know it must be legit. Get ready to wait a little since it always gets packed but as the saying goes, "all good things come to those who wait". Don't make this your quick lunch stop, you're bound to spend at LEAST 2 hours in here. Enjoy the experience. Take it all in.
One of the best places in Chicago for typical deep dish pizza. Love it! Be prepared to wait. You can also take out if it is too busy. Always on my list of places to eat while in the Windy City.

Not impressed, taste wise and texture wise. Our CPK pizza is actually a lot better. I guess maybe how Chicagoans like pizza but not us. In addition, the service is slow and bad, with water not being refilled, no plate and folks on table until food brought out. I think tourists better go to CPK for better food and service. Not recommended!

The pizza was delicious the service great. The tables were unlaquered wood. And accumulated grime could be scrapped thru with a fingernail. Along with crayola marks. When it was brought to the servers (and hopefully managers attention) we were moved to another table in no better condition. Later while we ate a young man cleared the table and wiped it down with a damp rag. It did no good. This accumalated grime could and probably does hold any number of bacterial baddies. So please don't let your food hit the tables surface. Maybe paint the tables so aforementioned damp rag might do some good.

After having take out my husband and I decided to come in for our last meal before traveling home to the east coast. The servers were so attentive and friendly. We started with the chip trio! If you're someone who loves bruschetta as well as dipping sauces this is for you. Every bite tasted fresh and delicious. We would definitely Order this again. For our main meal we ordered the Chicago special (deep dish with sausage and fresh tomato sauce, not your normal sauce). Every bite was amazing! You'll most definitely need a fork and knife for this. Absolutely one of the best pizzas I've ever had!

You can get the Restaurant Quality but you need to learn the art of PCR.  That being said Lous is the ONLY pizza you can re-heat two or three time and it just gets better each time.  That dense Wisconsin Cheese is unlike any pizza ANYWHERE. Regarding PCR See below: Now that Lou's  is popping up all over Chicago - we now have the luxury of having it delivered right to our door.  Our standard - Lou's Deep Dish Butter Crust - UNCUT with a Lou's family style salad IT'S A MUST!  with the sweet vinegrette. ATTENTION WING FANS  GET THE BUFFALOU'S -  I dont' know how they season the wings but they are awesome just on their own - sauceless  if you get delivery DO THE THE SAUCE ON THE SIDE - otherwise you get a steam room version of them and they don't hold the crispiness you get table side at the restaurant. REGARDING DELIVERY - Well...I'm still giving Lou's 5 stars because well it's the best deep dish in the country.  But the delivery of this Chicago Icon does require some PCR - Pizza Crisping Rehabilitation.  I wouldn't recommend the pre baked because unless you have a commercial oven - it's not the same as their blast furnace pizza ovens.  1. Have your oven heated to 500 and invest in a pizza stone and get that sucker HOT. Most likely if your delivery driver is not driving like Mario Kart your pizza will be in tact.    2. Realize they build their pizza with the sauce on top with no cheese to swaddle it - and it's  - essentially seasoned crushed tomatoes that are fresh and delicious but VERY JUICY.  So once you get the pizza - slide it into the oven for about another 10 minutes and that juice should evaporate or settle into the pizza.  If you're in a hunger delirium take 2 paper towels and gently lay them flat on the pizza - DON'T BLOT it - just lay it on the pizza and tap the towels a little and  the extra juice will absorb enough to make it puddle free. 3. NEVER order it UNCUT - you're liable to get something that looks like a car accident victim. You won't be able to cut that with anything but a pizza cutter the crust is a hearty foe. 4. Finally - just understand that cardboard likes buttercrust and because of that you will not have that firm crust as crispy as if you have it in the restaurant.  But on those cold winter nights - if you invest a little "rehabilitation" and some safe harbor by taking your UNCUT pizza out of the box and giving it some PCR (Pizza Crust Recrisping)...it doesn't get any better than Lou's for deep dish. While the restaurant is still the best way to experience Lou's with some PCR you can enjoy your Lou's without the noise the bustle and the travel.  Nothing better in the winter than a good night home with family with a good movie surround sound and surrounding a Lou's Deep Dish Pizza in your pajamas.
Best deep-dish pizza in Chicago!  Butter crust was amazing. This place is the real deal. Great staff and the wait was short. Pre-order you pizza and it will cut down on the wait time.
The beat pizzeria in Chicago..  Thin crust with Pineapples and bacon is my favorite. Any pizza, oops "I mean pie" is great choice.

Not safe for celiacs!  I am not super sensitive to cc right away, but I was sick within an hour of eating here.  Sick, sick, sick.  Still sick the next day.  Definitely got gluten, and based on my reaction, it was more than just cc. Review of food before illness - the crustless pizzas (sausage crust) was not very good.  Too much sausage, cheese wasn't melted.  I left most of the crust on the plate and ate some of the toppings only. If you aren't celiac but just choosing gf and wiling to risk this place, go with the gf thin crust. Celiacs avoid! My gluten-eating companions said the regular thin crust was not good and the thick crust was good, but not great.  Not worth the hour wait.

Four of us had dinner at Lou's. Ordered a family bowl of their house salad and a medium deep dish veggie. Very fresh ingredients. Friendly service. Good Pizza, great crust. Not sure if worth the long wait, however. Tips: get there early since wait time is long - 1.5 hours at 8pm on a Monday. Pre-order about 45 mins ahead while you wait to save time.
Absolutely delicious Chicago-style deep dish pan pizza, the best of its kind. Prices are reasonable. "Try it, you'll love it."

We were visiting Chicago on business and of course wanted to try pizza. We asked many folks before heading there and since most mentioned Lou Malnati's we headed to one close to the hotel. It was quite busy, but they take your order for pizza ahead of time at the counter and I guess fire it up once you are at your table so you don't waste time ordering it at the table. We ordered the classic with the sausage and cheese. We started with a house salad which was tasty. I also had their italian style margarita..which funny enough tastes JUST LIKE the italian margarita at olive garden. Figure someone from OG must have visited a LM and tasted the margarita and decided to "borrow" it..who knows..quite funny. So for the pizza..since this is our first ever chicago pizza, we cannot really compare it to anything else. Well..up in San Francisco Bay Area in Petaluma, there is Old Chicago Pizza Co that has chicago Style. We LOVED that pizza..it was made in same style with sauce on top, but the thick  crust had cheese tucked in it and the cheese was oozy and stringy...yum!  So for Lou's...the toppings were quite..hmm..solid? The cheese was not gooey at all. It wasn't bad..just not what I am used to. It was tasty enough..but was surprised the ingredients were more "compressed".  All in all a good meal. Glad we had some pizza while in Chicago!
Service was great, the pizza was good but I felt it wasn't hot enough when it got to our table , however still good pizza . The salad was amazing , and a great portion.
We especially like the crustless pizza! And now that they've opened a New Location at Lincoln & Montrose (much closer) GREAT!

Had the Chicago classic deep dish and chicken Marsala pata. Both were good.  The Marsala was light and full of flavour. The pizza took about 45 minutes but it was worth the wait.  I am not a big fan of pizzas- I do not like it that much but this was a bomb! So delicious and fresh. The crust was just perfect- buttery and crisp.  Cant wait to go back and have some more.

If you like deep dish pizza, this is the place to go! Super thick and buttery crust chock full of flavor. I would recommend just getting the original pizza with just sauasage and tomato. Fills you up really well, I can barely finish two pieces of it. Prices are reasonable and overall a great experience. Keep in mind that waits here at any time of the day are pretty staggering... I guess it attests to the fact of the good food! Take my vote with a grain of salt because I'm not a huge fan of deep dish pizza. But this is probably one of the best ones I've had!

Been a customer for 7 years. I have only ever delivered. Deep dish is incredible- the cheese is not too salty, and the tomatoes are not too sweet or acidic. The bruschetta is fantastic. I had one bad experience, but they made it up to me. I will continue to order from them.

2 advices - 1. Don't come here on an empty stomach like I did! You will starve to death waiting and stalking the poor waiters! Ordering ahead doesn't really help unless you are in for a very long wait for seating. 2. Don't order the individual size that serves 1. You won't get much of the toppings and the crust will hurt your mouth. Other than the long wait, service was fine, something you'd expect from a pizza joint. Pizza was ok, I've had better even in Atlanta.. but definitely not worth the really long wait..

Great service! Even though two medium pizzas were ordered for just two people dining in, our server didn't miss a beat and understood that we wanted to try a little of both and take home the rest. We chose the classic and lou, the latter being vegetarian. Both were good, but I, the carnivore, preferred the flavor profile of the lou more. On top of that, these pizzas do take time to make so you might want to consider an appetizer to hold you over. We saw people supplement with salads to balance out the heaviness of the pizza. One note, the pizza does travel pretty well and I think that's credit to our server. She took the time to box things up table side and gave us plates, utensils and packets of crushed red pepper and cheese.
My favorite pizza place in Chicago! We've even gone so far as shipping their pizza to family and friends for special events and baby births!
Ordered a small deep dish pizza with a side of pizza sauce. Pizza sauce is literally a can of super chunky tomatoes   Onions on pizza were tough and raw.  So disappointed.

I'm not a deep dish person, but Lou's pizza is so good! The sausage they use is the best and they put a lot on their pies! What I loved though was how the crust came up the side of the pan and stayed nice and crispy on the edges. We didn't have any salad, but their salads looked amazing and I can't wait to go back and try one.

The pizza takes forever to cook (standard for deep dish), but they don't let you order ahead like the other deep dish options in Chicago. Personal pizza preference aside (I prefer Girodano's), the staff here are inattentive, and the beer selection sucks. Sorry I'm not sorry, Lou's is overrated.
A+ chicago style pizza.  Love this! would highly recommend to anyone wanting a chicago - style pizza in chicago!

Yup, Chicago Pizza and the places that serve it suck.  I've finally made up my mind.  I tried Malnati's, Uno, Giordano's and Pizano's, so you can't say that I didn't  give it a shot. The sauce is always watery and tasteless, without even a hint of garlic.  Like pomodoro vs. marinara maybe, to make a pasta comparison.  The outside crust is almost always too hard, due to the long time required to cook something as thick as lasagne. Lou Malnati's in particular is plagued by service problems even if their version of the Deep Dish is the least worst I've tasted.  An hour to get an appetizer?  90 minutes to get a pizza or a seat?  Wall to wall tourists?  Check, check, and check.  If you want to lose your sanity come here on a weekend night.  You can have my seat; I won't be using it. Other reviewers who didn't really like it gave this place 3 stars because they have become a famous brand.  I docked them a star for taking forever. And to you Chicago natives that argue your thin crust, square slice is the real Chicago pizza, please tell the rest of the world.  Deep dish is giving Chicago a bad rap.

Was a very underwhelming experience. The restaurant itself was filled with screaming children and I later saw there were multiple locations, so had I known, I would've went to the one on Rush. It looked much nicer.  The pizza was very mediocre but maybe that's because I'm from the east coast and have had some amazing pizza in my life so the bar was set very high. The crust kind of reminded me of the ones from a frozen pizza.

I have to come here every time I'm in Chicago. It IS worth the 45-50 minute wait. I was pleased at how smooth the hostess was handling the crowd. We added our name on the list along with a number for them to text us when our table was ready. The best part was that there was a little link we could click on when we first got a confirmation text that shows us what place in line we're in. This was perfect because we didn't want to get caught up with all the shopping so it was nice to see. I'm literally writing this review with my mouth watering as I'm yearning for a deep dish slice of pizza from Lou's with all my heart. The Cobb salad I believe it was is heavenly and a perfect salad to share with your table. The next thing we shared was garlic bread with the marinara sauce. The marina sauce that they offer is not your basic sauce from the jar. You can tell this was handcrafted with love because there was something very special in there and it was quite addicting. Next up is the pizza of course. One slice was heavy enough to keep me full and satisfy my needs.

I was soo excited to try this place. I had high expectations for deep dish pizza, and honestly, I was a little disappointed.To me it's not as good as NY style, but if you like see dish it's still good pizza. Fair warning, it takes. FOREVER. To get your pizza. Make sure you get an appetizer!
Good pizza and especially like the veggie with their cornmeal based crust!

I had hear good things about Lou Malnati's and even though I had DDP the night before, I didn't think I could leave Chicago without trying it here.   Perhaps my high expectations didn't help, but I was a little underwhelmed.  I had the personal Malnati classic (with lean sausage), and while the crust was as good as other reviews said, the pizza itself was just OK.  From the presentation, to taste (the sausage was a little bland and there was hardly any cheese or sauce), I was just expecting more.  I truly do believe that if I had gone with a group and ordered a larger pizza (baked and served in the skillet), I may have added a star.  On the bright side, their house salad with the creamy garlic dressing was very tasty, and service was good.
Lou's Pizza is the BEST Pizza. Their salad and dressing is also Delicious. Two thumbs up!!!  They even ship their pizza. #Nationwide!!!
Best deep dish I've ever had. The crust is buttery and crust. The sauce is great and the cheese was plentiful without being overwhelming. 10/10 would eat again.

Super busy on a Saturday evening but it was well worth the 45 minute wait! Restaurant allows you to place your order upon arrival so that it's basically ready when you're seated. Out server, Tina, was FANTASTIC!! We got the classic pizza and it was AMAZING! All in all it was a wonderful experience! Only wish I had More time to retune and request Tina... Even if I have to wait an hour!

It was my first time in Chicago and this location had the best review on yelp. It looked very warm and welcoming. The customer service was great wish I could say the same for the food. Wouldn't recommend or revisit.

I was not impressed with the deep dish pizza here. I heard a lot of good things about this place, but the pizza was just ok. The sauce was very watery, and the crust wasn't that good. I would recommend Pequods instead, but this could just have been a bad order, who knows.
I love this Pizza.  Excellent quality of ingredients.  The crust is delicious too.

Delicious but heavy ! Definitely bring your stomach!  While the food was great, it takes awhile to get your food. I  came around 3pm and we ordered food at the pre order place, but it took an hour before the food finally arrived. When we asked about the status of our order, they told us " it'll arrive when it'll arrived " so that was unhelpful. Also the calamari was good but it's different - the breading is like fried chicken in feel.  Other than the slow service, the food is pretty good- if you're not used to heavy food with a good amount of carb, meat, and cheese, it may take some adjustment!

As a traveler on vacation...who planned on enjoying Chicago pizza...this place is meh. I have had Ginos and that was so much better. Definitely not coming back here. Next Chicago vacation trying a different place for really good Chicago deep dish pizza!

So good!!!!! We tried both Lou's and Giordano's while we were in town. Both were great, but I prefer Lou's for the amazing sauce and buttery crust. We also tried their cheese sticks which were also very good. We went right when they opened on a Saturday so didn't have to fight any crowds.
One of the top five Chicago pizza joints...love this place!
