Love this pizza. Deep dish is not over doing it and I do feel guilty after having a few slices but it's worth it every time.

By far the best pizza I've ever had. Covered in toppings, thick flaky crust, flavorful sauce. It has everything you could ever want in a pizza. A slice or two goes a long way, three of us couldn't finish a large. Only downside is the wait is painfully long for dining and take-out. Its a busy place though and I'm sure it takes a while to cook the pizza through so I won't hold it against them. You can always grab a drink at the bar while your waiting too.
Order before! But very good deep dish! Wait staff did an amazing job!! We ordered half pepperoni and half sausage. Highly recommend sausage!!

I heard mixed reviews about Lou Malnati's but decided to give it a shot anyways. One of the must-eats for a first timer's trip to Chicago is deep dish pizza. I don't regret choosing Lou Malnati's for that at all.  Yeah, there will probably be a wait. It's the famous Lou Malnati's. But that's okay because each pizza takes 40 minutes to cook, anyways. While you wait, you can preorder your pizza and they will text you when your table is ready.  What makes their pizzas good is the crust. BUTTERY. GOODNESS. You MUST get the Malnati Chicago Classic for the buttery crust - you can get it with sausage or pepperoni. The crust is a game changer. The tomato sauce was a bit on the tart side for my taste but it didn't bug me too much. Perfect amount of cheese. Decent amount of sausage. Also the Malnati salad was a good appetizer to get while waiting for your pizza to finish baking. It's light and refreshing and the sweet vinaigrette is the icing on top.  By no means did Lou Malnati's convert me into a deep dish lover. I am still a thin-crust lover through and through. But overall this was one of my top meals in Chicago.
My very first authentic Chicago deep dish pizza. Fork and knife are needed but I just used my hands. So yummy. I am a fan of this place! you will need to share it with a few people.

I have been to Lou Malnati's in the past on the recommendation of a friend from a Chicago. It once again did not disappoint. We went on Wed essay night around 9pm and there was still a 20 minute wait. But it went quickly. They took our number and then exited us when our table was ready. We were also given the option of ordering our pizza ahead of time to help expedite he process when we got our table. We didn't do this but I wish we would have. While we waited for the table, we went to the bar. It wasn't big and I felt like I was in the way. When we got to the table it took about 40 minutes until we got our pizza when we ordered. The waitress recommended doing the butter crust on the deep dish pizza and we were not disappointed. There were 2 of us and we got a small pizza. It was sufficient without making us feel over stuffed and like we were wasting. Although it was so good and I would have loved leftovers. Looking forward to coming back for the deep dish.

It was our first time trying Chicago deep dish pizza. The staff was very friendly and efficient. I like how you can go ahead and put in your order while waiting to be seated. We ordered the classic deep dish pizza (sausage and pepperoni) and it was super filling. It was delicious. My only complaint was our drink we ordered was made incorrectly, ginger ale instead of ginger beer. Other than that, it was a yummy meal!

The amount of Lou Malnati's Pizzerias around the Chicago area make it seem like a fast food chain. Do NOT be fooled however, the deep dish pizza, the appetizers, the service, and the atmosphere is nothing like a fast food chain. Their pizzas are made from scratch and you are forewarned that it will take 40 minutes for the pizza to cook. I highly suggest their fried calamaris for an appetizer paired with your favorite beer, in the summer potentially a Blue Moon or an Angry Orchard cider. For a pizza, I suggest The Malnati's Chicago Classic. The description is simple, but the pizza is far from it. The crust and the bread are perfectly crisp, and not soggy at all, with every bite providing a perfect combination of sausage patty, mozzarella cheese, and tomatoes! Perfect place to try Chicago's deep dish pizzas!!

After a few weeks of research we decided to give Lou our first try, disappointed, we had calamari, bruschetta, and the classic Lou Deep Dish , food across the board was cold, pizza was lacking flavor, service was good

So it was my first time in Chicago and I had to try the Chicago deep dish. Looked up this up and decided it to be the best to try. I was not disappointed at all!  First, make sure whenever you sit down make sure you place your pizza order. It takes about 40 minutes to make.  Second, go ahead and order yourself the cheese bread. It's half a loaf of garlic cheese bread that is a great filler, especially for the price, while you wait.  The pizza itself was delicious I loved every bit of it. It's definitely more of a pie or cake, which is to be expected since it's a deep dish. The layers of meat and cheese and sauce keep you coming back bite after bite. Before you know it you've had two slices and are like geez... I still have another slice left and I'm stuffed.  Deep dish wouldn't be something I would order every time I order pizza. I prefer Sicilian or NY style pizza, but if you want a great deep dish pizza with great cheese bread go ahead and stop in.

I didn't think the dip dish pizza here was that good, not sure if it was just the kind we ordered (Chicago classic) or what, but it was just average. So, I don't understand the vibe. I liked the service and the inside considering it's a very casual place but the food is not something I'd crave or want to try again.

While I don't like deep dish pizza in general, this place was better than others I've tried.  What I like about this place is that you can get the pizza crust on the bottom crispy and add a butter glaze to the crust (which you absolutely must otherwise it will be a  disgusting soggy mess!). We put an order in for an all cheese deep dish with a the crispy crust/butter glaze and half of it with pepperoni and then waited about 10 min to be seated. We can around 5:30 so it wasn't packed yet but by the time we left there was a huge line. Since we had to wait 40 min, we got the house/green salad in the individual size and it was perfect for sharing. The pizza came out pretty good, again, I don't really like deep dish, but it wasn't soggy like others I've tried and it wasn't as thick. It was way too saucy so next time I'd ask for less sauce.  The only part that could be improved is the pre-seating service. When we first came in the host seemed completely lost and just stared at us for a few min. Then once he put our name down he told us to go pre-order the pizza. That went smoothly but when we were called to sit down, the same confused host started walking towards the back (we followed him), then he turned out and got menus, handed them to use and told us to go upstairs and someone else will seat it. I'm not sure why we had to go back and forth and why it was so confusing for an employee who probably seats many people a day to tell us right off the bat on where to go. Once we got upstairs we were quickly seated and from there the service was fine.

Don't go to the touristy Giordanos! Lou Malnati's is delicious and the true chicago pizza. We went at around 5 so it wasn't too crowded yet and we didn't have to wait in a line. When we left though around 7 there was a long line out the door. We ordered the Malnati salad and the classic medium deep dish pizza for the two of us (we took a little home). The salad was good but a bit overdressed. Definitely order the dressing on the side. The pizza was delicious although in my opinion it could have been a bit cheesier! Big chunks of sausage and the sauce was thick and full of tomato pieces. We even got two frozen pizzas to take home on the plane with us. We will be returning!
loveeeee the pizza, you can never go wrong with a pizza from here. For a deep dish close to home, its the best.

One of the best places to get Chicago Deep Dish Pizza. Gets crowded every night of the week. Very small bar area, so even though I was by myself, I needed to wait for a table. They have a lot of seating upstairs. Nice place, good friendly service and the best pizza around. If you don't preorder your pizza you will have a 40 min wait after ordering. Decent beer and drink selection as well.

One of my most favorite places for amazing Chicago style deep dish pizza! My two favorites are "The Lou" pizza and the "Malnati's Salad"! Both are delicious!! Lou Malnati's never seems to disappoint! Highly recommended.

Was really excited to try out this deep dish pizza spot on our first night in town. Put our names down and were told it would be a 25 minute wait. We "pre ordered" our food and sat down. After 45 minutes of waiting, the front desk realized our name had not yet been called.  Once we were seated the waitress read our pre order in which we said, yes items ordered as correct. We proceeded to wait over an hour (for our personal + small pizzas, the two smallest pies you could get). We noticed that every party in the room had been served and on their way out. It was pretty obvious that our order was not "pre ordered" at all and actually had been completely forgotten. I understand restaurants can be busy but what bothered me most was the waitress looking at us and not once apologizing for the insanely long wait time or error.  We patiently waited and after almost 2 hours we received our pizzas. One of which WAS COLD. Completely disappointed and at this point really nothing else could go wrong with their service. Won't be returning.

Well, thanks to Lou Malnati's, I now understand why people love deep dish & also how so many places fail at making it taste good. This absolutely changed my opinion on something I hated every time I tried and the only reason I went to Lou's was due to the urging of a dozen or so friends.  It is well worth the 30 minute wait for this crispy delicious pizza. It's not bready, it's not even thick, it's just AMAZING. I had to go back a second time in less than 24 hours & I expected not to like it.

We were walking the streets of Chicago on a quest to find the best deep dish pie in town, several folks had been asked Lou's was the spot. Well we got turned around & around and finally called an Uber, good thing too we were way too far away to continue the urban hike. As you would expect busy at 8:30 on a Monday night, 25 minutes ok. Here you order your pizza so it's being made as you wait, ok that will speed things up. We were sat at a sidewalk table ordered our drinks and split the salad, the dressing intriguingly sweet and it worked. The medium pie tasted like spaghetti sauce with sausage on cheese filled not quite pie crust minus the butter part of the pastry. There are no choice of toppings only choices of pizza. I ate the pizza with a knife & fork, the pie had cooled and we didn't get that stretchy goo of mozzarella. It thought "Italian sheppards pie", the tomato flavor of the sauce was outstanding. I'm not going to say it wasn't good and it wasn't bad but been there done that keep the shirt. Foodguy-Martin

I've been looking forward to this visit for weeks. My pizza came in the time it was promised and it wasn't cold nor was it hot. it was somewhere in the middle and made me feel pressured to eat it quickly before the cheese became rubber. How long do these things stay in the oven? I'll try out Pepuod's next time to see how they do.
Pizza is overrated. Let's talk about the real reason to come here... cookie skillet. Heaven sent. Get extra ice cream.
We went original and were not disappointed. Plain deep dish with cheese. They accommodated our large group (12) as well.

Loved this place! Since I was solo, I sat at the bar with no wait. It was a very chill atmosphere, one tv at the bar. I was greeted by the bartender, my bad for not cleaning my ears out, he had to repeat everything, although the music wasn't too loud. I pretty much knew I was going to order a personal pan deep dish, went for the Lou Manati classic.  Even the personal size comes out in 20-35 min (i wasn't counting, but was warned) I enjoyed every second of that pizza! Crispy, but not overcooked, juicy from the tomatoes, and the meat made it super filling! I enjoyed my two Goose Island wheat beers, paid in a flash, and left. I think there was an upstairs and curbside seating.  Very family friendly place. Great deep dish pizza!

Classic Chicago deep dish.  The Malnati salad is the best salad in town, both in the restaurant and take out / deliver.   My favorite is the Malnati Chicago Classic.  My wife is gluten intolerance and her choice The Crustless Pizza.   No bad options here. Same quality at locations around city.

Came to the restaurant right when it opened on a Saturday for lunch and there was a line out the door. This was our first time visiting Chicago, and we wanted to try Chicago deep dish pizza. We shared a small order of "the lou". It took 45 minutes which the waitress warned us about. The pizza was really good. good service, good atmosphere. Would recommend.
Tasty, but too much sausage for me and I am not fond of the crust. I am a New Yorker, so not my thing, but can understand the quality and uniqueness to Chicago.

I went based on the ratings from Yelp!!! I wanted the best Chicago style pizza I could find!! Now I'm traditional NY style pizza chick, but I had to try it. It was very buttery, thick and saucy, I had pepperoni and was only able to eat two slices!!! Pretty good, I still prefer my NY style pizza tho. I had wings for an app, the blue cheese was better than the wings: they were ok but taste like previously frozen wings. The restaurant was nice, clean and open. The staff was friendly and services was good. I recommend visiting for the Chicago style pizza, butter crust

So Chicago is known for deep dish pizza. And Chicago has many pizzerias that serve their own twist of deep dish pizza. So... how do you choose the best deep dish pizza spot knowing that there's many others. If you're like me, you probably think "whats the best spot" , "where's the best bang for the buck?" , "I don't want to waste my time" , "I don't want to be disappointed" .... well I'll make it easy for you... Go to Lou F'N Malnati's!!!! As recommended by a few Chicago natives and locals, we went to see for ourselves if it was everything it was hyped out to be. On our first visit, we ordered the "Chicago Classic" - which basically is sausage, extra extra cheese, and their signature tomato sauce. And when i say sausage, I don't mean sausage as in carry out pizza sausage... you know, little turd pieces of sausage scattered across the whole pizza?.. well, no no no no no.. none of that here at Lou's. Here at Lou's, I mean sausage as in a whole freaking slab of sausage (lean sausage may I add) covering every square inch, every square centimeter on the pizza!! The "Chicago Classic was so good, so meaty, so cheesy, and oooohhh the crust, Oh so buttery!! We also ordered "The Lou" which has some veggies on it such as spinach, tomatoes, and shrooms. That was good also but, hey I'm a meat kinda guy so I prefer the Classic Chicago! Aside from the pizza, they also have real good appetizers. Some appetizers that we tried that is worth mentioning are: the calamari, chicken wings and mozzarella sticks. On our last night in Chicago, we decided to do delivery out to our hotel, not knowing when we will get close or even get our hands on this authentic deep dish pizza again.  Being that I am a meat lover, ordered a custom combo, sausage and pepperoni. It was meaty delicious.  Recently, I found out that besides Chicago/ Illinois, there is only one other city/ state that has the pleasure of having a Lou Malnati's in the U.S. ... and that is Phoenix, AZ. Living in Las Vegas, I was ecstatic! It is about a 4-5 hour drive or I have the option on taking that hour flight. Will try to make it a point to visit at least every other month LoL Yes, all for this. Best pizza I've ever had! That's because I've yet been to NYC or Boston. But who knows if they can slug out Lou's and Chicago in general to take the crown as best pizza? We shall see.. it's a personal preference anyway. Enclosing in 4 words: The Hype is Real!

The best deep dish pizza in Chicago, period. I don't care what they tell the tourists about Giordano's but I've grown up with Lou's and it never disappoints. It is technically "Pan" pizza but it has thick layers of cheese and tomatoes (not just tomato sauce). The salads and other dishes are great as well but the pizza is the star. Also, for those of you cutting carbs, I recommend the "meat-za" which is a layer of sausage with all the pizza toppings, instead of crust.

My girlfriend had never had deep dish pizza before so I wanted her to come try Lou's for her first time. We ordered the Chicago Classic with the butter crust.  The sausage was nice with a good amount of fat and the tomatoes cut through the sausage with its perfect acidity. The balance was great. I do wish they had more varieties in their deep dish, we wanted a supreme style deep dish but you have the option to build your pie if you'd like. If you are in Chicago and have not tried deep dish then this is the place I would recommend.
The best pizza in Chicago! Delivered, picked up or dine in. Lou's special with mounds of sausage and cheese is a super star food dish. Deep dish that is...

Was choosing between pequods and here. Lou's has gluten free pies for my wife and older son. 30 minute wait. In line to preorder when they called our table. Had a large salad. Fresh, delicious. Pizza was 45 coming out. Our deep dish was worth the wait

***THIS IS THE SPOT FOR CHICAGO STYLE PIZZZAA!!!!*** Coming to Chicago, you think, "well damn, I sure would love to try an authentic deep dish right?" This is theeeee spot to go my Yelp friends! Yes, Yes, Yessss! It gets mighty crowded, so do be wary of a lil wait time. But it is worth it, I promise you! There are both bottom and top floor seating options. They prompt you to order the pizza you want up front since it takes 40 minutes to cook, then you wait to be seated!  Ok so, fast forward to us being seated... Voila! The deep dish large pizza has arrived! Oh my lantaaaa, the aroma just engulfs your being. The waitress cuts it at the table for us and plates it. The large pizza was easily shareable between 4-5 people with seconds to spare!  The pizza - ooooey, gooooey goodness! Everything you can imagine a deep dish straight from the kitchen of Chicago would be! Thank you, it was grrrrreat!

It was the first time trying the famous Chicago deep dish pizza and I was really really skeptical. We ordered half with sausage and the other half regular cheese and..... it was very good! I would never thought I could like a pizza like that one but it was a very successful experience! The only thing I didn't really enjoy was the crust which tasted a little bit weird and it was really hard to cut. Besides that, it was good!
Lou's is great Chicago pizza, make no mistake about it. It's one restaurant that has expanded without loosing quality.

Good pizza. Their spinach salad was really the star Not sure if this is the best deep-dish in Chicago...or if I'm not just a fan of deep-dish. Either way you have to the pizza when in the Windy city and this is a solid place.

Why 4 stars? Because I enjoyed it, but I've had better.    ---   ---   --- I've been a huge fan of deep dish/Chicago-style pizza for a while now, but had only tried Lou Malnati's frozen version in the mail, so I knew that my visit to Chicago was definitely going to consist of a visit here for the real deal. There was quite a lengthy wait, and unfortunately, it was cold/rainy outside, so we crammed into the bar area and stood around to wait for our table. After 30-45 minutes, we were seated and were ready to devour some 'za! While I did enjoy the pizza, I've actually had better in the Tampa Bay area, at Paul's Chicago Pizza. The crust at Lou Malnati's was a bit different than what I expected - it was actually a little bit hardened. I didn't think it was a bad thing, but just not what I imagined it would be. But the primary reason I prefer Paul's in Clearwater is because it's just absolutely swamped with cheese, where Lou Malnati's had plenty of cheese, but it just wasn't quite the level of Paul's. I recommend trying extra cheese, if that's available on the deep dish!

I went here to try my first Chicago deep dish pizza and was very disappointed. I tried the Lou's: the crust, cheese, and toppings had no flavor--very bland. Service was good though. Sadly, my local friend said that Lou's is the best she's eaten.

Absolutely the best pizza I've ever had in my life. Once you get one whiff of their food, you don't mind the long wait. They restaurant's app shows you how far down the wait list you are which makes the wait go faster. The original Lou Malnati's deep dish was cheesy perfection. The service was also phenomenal!  We appreciated Zach's patience with us!  I recommend you ask for him as your server!  Lou Malnati's is a must during any visit to Chicago!

We were pleasantly surprised at how serious this place is about its beef; sliced thinly, flavorful, decent portions, and very tender and juicy. Unfortunately, it is lacking in almost all other aspects. To start, the cheese on the beef sandwich wasn't distributed evenly. The fries that came with it were at room temperature. Perhaps we're spoiled by west coast deep dish pizza because the toppings here seem liquidy and less flavorful. Perhaps the west coast pizzerias aren't constrained by traditional views on deep dish pizza and can innovate around things like honey with the deep dish crust (which is amazing!) This would've otherwise been a three start restaurant if it wasn't for the horrible service. Our waiter disappeared for almost the entire time we were there (almost 50 minutes). We had to ask for ketchup twice (the first person we asked seem distracted; he was texting in the kitchen when I was going to the bathroom). As a final note on the bathroom, no seat covers... not cool.

It was a very good place to eat. The sausage is the best. They put a whole layer of it under the sauce. The only reason I gave it 4 stars because I didn't like the sauce as much as else where. I would say my 2nd favorite pizza place in Chicago behind giordanos

Best deep dish in the city. The salads are amazing. It is super busy anytime you go so I recommend coming prepared to wait awhile. Also I recommend the deep dish with pepperoni only. The ones with extra toppings are just not as good.
Over rated is an understatement. I would say it loses to Pizano's (which uses the same family recipe)

This is one of our families go to places to bring our young kids.  We all enjoy the great taste of their thin crust plain cheese pizza, but where it is at with me is the thicker crust sausage pizza. This is my favorite sausage pizza in Chicago.  They have been growing their locations throughout the Metro area and you can find them in most neighborhoods. A very family friendly dinning spot and does not disappoint.

If you love cheese and crust, this pizza is life lol. The only thing I didn't love was the amount of chunks of tomato on top of the pizza. WARNING atleast 45 minute wait just for your pizza, another 45 to be seated.

Did lots of research to find the best pizza place in Chicago and many said this place. And I knew I was there when the line of people were waiting outside and even more people were inside.  There was an hour wait once I finally got inside and put my name down.  They did have free pizza made and sitting on the counter for those who were waiting which is a nice touch.  They were also allowing people to pre order which is a good option. While I don't know how much longer it would have been if I didn't pre order, it's still better than waiting and hour for a table then ordering.  Got the deep dish option with the famous butter crust and a thin crust personal pizza.  Th thin crust option was pretty good. It's crispier and more like a cornmeal crust which is different. The toppings I had were chicken sausage, mushroom, and the spinach mix which has garlic and onion in it. So good.  I know people like deep dish but I sure don't so I was very pleased with the thin crust option.  Only con is I wish the small was smaller honestly. It's meant for two people vs one like the menu said.  Worth a stop seeing as the whole town is there lol

Love the crust of the deep dish Pizza here, crispy and not oily. Cheese and tomato were also very tasty. On the down side, 1h wait for a table at 8:30pm, 30+min wait for pre-ordered pizza and the starter we ordered while waiting for pizza came like 30s before the pizza itself.

Average to slightly better than average Chicago style deep dish pizza for the time it takes to get it! The wait to get in on a Thursday at 7 pm was about an hour. There is no room to have a drink while you wait so go across the street to The Bottled Blonde where the selection of brew is extensive and the "scenery" is spectacular ;-)  Lou's will txt you when your table is ready.  Beer selection could be better at Lou's. They only had one IPA and they had run out of it.  Despite ordering our food when we put our name on the wait list, it took about 45 minutes to have it served.  Probably why we didn't have to wait for the pie to cool down some

I really wanted this place to be great. Yelp hasn't disappointed me before , but this time sorry to say more recent non flattering reviews are spot on. I don't like writing negative reviews , but I was so disappointed in the pizza . We were two people , we ordered a thin crust buttery cheese pizza with basil.  45 minutes later still no pizza .  The place wasn't that busy . After talking to the manager he said sorry your pizza got burnt we have to make another one.  Due to our mistake-  pizza on the house .  Ok cool , that was very nice of them .  The pizza arrived . It didn't even smell like I normally smell of pizza that makes you want to just dig in.  It was bland , crust was like cardboard , tomato sauce tasted like out of a can and just really nothing special .  Even for free I barely finished one small piece , and I normally eat  3-4 pieces of pizza . We left a tip for the waiters cause they were really nice.  But honestly the pizza just wasn't good. It's really too bad cause the people who work there were all really nice .   I just don't get why people think this place is so amazing . Am I missing something here ? Or maybe it is just me ?  But a few other reviews described exactly how I felt , so it isn't just me.
Trying to decide who has the best deep dish. This one was good, but more expensive than Pizano's and not as cheesetastic. I had it delivered and it came with everything I needed.

Seriously the best pizza I've ever had!  Husband agreed.  We got a slice of cheese pizza as part of our food tour and it was deeelicious!  We tried to go again while visiting Chicago, but it was 1.5 hour wait.  Will try again next time we're in town.

Pizza is amazing! We got the large, deep dish pepperoni, and had trouble finishing it between 3 people.  They also have a gluten free pizza crust, which I believe is made in-house, so it isn't Udi's or anything. My girlfriend has Celiac's disease and raved of the crust.  They also have a "crustless" pizza, which I believe is made out of sausage. It sounds good, though my party didn't have that.  Our server, Jason, was probably the best server I've ever had in a restaurant. Very friendly, personable and great sense of humor. He came back multiple times to check on us and make sure we had everything we needed, even though he also had a huge table to deal with as well.  The pizza takes about 40-45 minutes from the time you order it, but it is WELL worth the wait. Don't get any appetizers, because you won't be able to eat much of that huge, delicious pizza.

We went here the night after having Giordanos and I must say this place is far superior. The sauce is excellent and fresh, the sausage is tasty and the atmosphere is better, and also their text messaging system to let you know your table is ready actually works unlike Giordanos. I would say this is a must have for any pizza lover visiting Chicago

One star for the worst service! We put our name in and "pre-ordered" our deep dish. We waited about 45-50 minutes to be seated. We were under the impression that the pre-order meant the pizza was timed to go in the oven while you wait. Not the case! They don't put the pizza in until AFTER your seated. This saves virtually no time. On top of it all, they gave us the wrong pre-order ticket and got our dessert order incorrect. The table next to us had the exact same problem. As for the food, the deep dish was disappointing. Cheese was too thick and didn't love the flavor. UNOs is better and I can get that back in Boston. This was a no-go for me

I'm not gonna lie, even though I'm not a fan of deep dish pizza, when in Chicago one must try. It was actually pretty good. We shared a small Chicago classic pizza because we didn't want to get too full. We also ordered beers and a salad to share. Wait takes a while and they ask you to order first because the pizza takes time to make.
I order from Lou Malnati's all the time, I love their deep dish, butter crust pizza. I get it with sausage, mushrooms and low fat mozzarella. Yummmmmmmmmm Also I am a Malnati rewards member.

I'm obsessed with this place!!!  The fiancé and I spent 4 days in Chicago, and I had two people from my hometown message me saying I HAVE to try Lou Malnati's. Sooo obviously we had to try.  We luckily had no problem getting a table and were able to sit at a booth right away. First things first, the menu all sounds DELISH. We had the hardest time deciding on what to try. Our lovely waitress recommended the Chicago Classic. A butter crust sausage pizza that they're well known for, and we were not disappointed. That crust was hella buttery, but equally hella tasty. The crushed tomatoes on top was the perfect balance to all the sausage and crust. Super thick, the definition of a Chicago deep dish. Absolutely would get this again. We also tried the Lou but on a thin crust, maybe not quite as spectacular as the Chicago Classic but still great. Good enough to have again for sure.  We love loved this place. We have plans to go to Chicago in the future, and we absolutely will be back!!

I went to Lou Malnati's couple years ago, but I am fairly new to Yelp so I'm choosing to write the review now. The closest one to our hotel was this location. We put in out reservation and got seated after about an hour or so. It was a Saturday night so it was very busy.  The restaurant itself is really cool. As a sports fan, it was cool to see many old jerseys hung up on the walls. The brick has a certain uniqueness to the restaurant, making it feel more authentic.  We ordered the Pepperoni deep dish pizza, and after 30-45 minutes it came out. It looked incredible. The service was excellent, as they cut the pizza in front of you and then plate your food for you. I've had a lot of pizza from a ton of places, but this was the best pizza I've ever had. The cheese stretched like it was straight out of a video. The sauce tasted amazing, and the dough was as fresh as it gets.  We then decided to get the chocolate chip cookie pizza. It was the vest version of the cookie I've had to date. Pizza chains and other restaurants make this dessert, but Lou Malnati's perfected it.  A lot of research went into choosing the best pizza place to go to on our trip. There are many rivals in Chicago, where people claim X has THE best pizza. I took a chance on Lou Malnati's and it did not disappoint. I'm sure you can't go wrong with the majority of deep dish places downtown, but you can't go wrong here.
We had the classic; that sausage!!!!!  My god. It was the most amazing pizza I've had. Staff was very friendly and the bartenders know how to pour a beam a cola!  You have a customer for life.

Excellent Chicago deep dish style pizza. Been to this Wells St. location and out in the suburbs as well, always consistently good. Also have had their lasagna, good traditional style Italian comfort food. All reasonably priced.
BEST. PIZZA. EVER....Thin crust (butter) or pan...get the Malnati's salad with his dressing or the creamy garlic. Sausage is, I believe, Malnati made.

SO GOOD! We ordered a small Chicago Classic and it was the perfect amount for two people. Crunchy, buttery crust, chunky tomato sauce, and lots of melty cheese. I have tried several Chicago pizzerias, but Lou's is by far the best. Well worth the wait!!

I'm not a true deep dish lover, and Lou's was never my favorite. With that being said, they are consistent and reasonably priced when it comes to the Chicago deep dish game. Their beer selection is lacking, and if you want something besides pizza, I would consider going elsewhere. I've grown to appreciate their pizza. Therefore, I would recommend Lou's to new comers.

Came to Chicago and had to try deep dish pizza. With tons of options, I did not know which one to choose. Eventually felt that Lou Malnati's was getting more recommendations than the others. I headed over to the location on Wells around 11:30am on a Saturday. It wasn't packed but it seemed like a tour group was heading in there around the same time. I ended up sitting at the bar since it was convenient and they have full service there as well. Didn't get any drinks besides water and chose the Malnati's special (personal size). They were not kidding when they say it takes about 35 minutes but watching tv for a bit and chatting it up and the time kind of flew by though I kept thinking about the pizza. It finally came out and after a photo, I dug in (with a fork and knife. Fork and knife not required but helpful. When you first look at it, the personal size didn't seem too big but it was deep and heavy so it is enough. The crust was amazing. It was the perfect crispness and felt almost like a pie crust. As for the filling, I felt the cheese was too tough and not gooey at all. it felt like a block of cheese underneath the sauce and meats. As for the meats, it was overwhelming. The sausage was laid out over all of the pizza and there was no other flavor that permeated through. The tomatoes on top also leaked out some water so if I didn't let out the juices, I felt the crust would get somewhat soggy. I love deep dish and I was definitely looking forward to getting some in Chicago. The pizza was decent but not as good as I expected. Overall, the service was decent as well but I felt a bit pushy in terms of getting a drink (even though I was sitting at the bar). I will have to try out the others to do a proper comparison...

If you have had Lou Malnatis, you know.   If you haven't, you are likely either not from Chicagoland or you aren't a huge pizza fan.    Pizza is my go to, and Lou's is one of the best pan pizzas (get the butter crust) out there.   There is a reason they ship this stuff around the world.

So this is pretty touisty, but good.  We got the "Butter Thin Crust" which my mate suggested and it was very good.  I would say that I would have done the traditional deep dish next time but overall it had nice cheese, good sauce and a nice crust.  I stil would say I like NYC thin crust better. Overall a great place, but it very busy and the pre- sit down experience is not great. They give you a window of when you will sit down and you order the pizza and then you get your pizza 20 or 30 minutes after you site down.

The wait was long but it was worth it , we sat at the bar and we ordered the calamari , stuffed bread , mushrooms and spinach deep dish pizza and it was delicious , the bartenders are very attentive and 5 stars to the service . The only reason why I gave 4 stars was that we found a piece of hair on the plate underneath the Lettuce of the calamari after we almost finished . The bartender told us he will take it off but I guess he forgot about it when he gave us the check, it really didn't matter because We did almost finished the calamari and we were very happy to be there .

I called a Togo order and when they say how long it will take they aren't messing around! It was promptly ready at the time they said it would be. It was my first time having deep dish pizza and it was AMAZING! We had a medium pepperoni and sausage. The place is hectic and very busy! The environment is also pretty loud and close together with the large volume of guests that come thru it shouldn't come as a surprise. Like most popular places in the city there are lines and waits associated with the experience. Keep that in mind when you visit :)

During my first night in Chicago wanted to try Chicago style pizza and chose this s place for the high reviews. At arrival we were welcomed promptly by the hostess and put us on the waiting list and were told we could be sat at a table or bar. We decided to have something to drink while waiting and headed to the bar, where a stool was available. Two guys were behind the bar,  one was the bartender and one barback, assuming this since the second wasn't even looking at the guests at the bar. We finally ordered beverages and a second spot got available at the bar. Asked hostess if we could seat there and she replies is first come first served. Lucky us, in general we prefer to eat at the counter. Ordered the Malnati Chicago Classic and ten minutes later pizza arrived and bartender served us the first round (of pizza, of course). As my first ever experience I thought it a was a bit could but believed it was the way it's supposed to be and didn't mentioned to my girlfriend. Few minutes later she mentioned to learn we were having and below serving temperature pizza, with firm cheese. The stuff behind the bar were too busy to even ask how was everything, and it wasn't until we finished our meal that the bartender asked us if we wanted another drink... OVERALL: Friday's are busy and if you focus in quantity over quality you're not doing things right. My first dinner ever in Chicago in a place a chose and trying a "classic" dish was bittersweet, lacking the sweet.

TIP: Use NextMe app or website to place yourself "in line" and call in to order your pizza when the wait time ticks down to 40-45 mins. You will save yourself from eyeing your neighboring table's pizzas and comforting your rumbling tummy.  You see, my friends and I weren't as smart and waited in line for about 45 min, then about 10 min until we were called we realized we could place an order beforehand. So in addition to the 45 min, we waited another 30 or so min at the table for the pizza (Lord, give me patience...) For 3 people, we ordered the thick crust medium size "Lou" (2 slices/person) which was piled up with fresh vegetables that were cooked only slightly so they still held their form. The crust was super crunchy and honestly, the highlight of the pie. After about 1 slice, we all felt so full. One of my friends decided to take her other slice to-go and my other friend and I decided to tough it out and finish it.  Regarding service, everyone who works here was super friendly and enthusiastic. and HELPFUL. My friend who paid by card, forgot her card there and realized when we were almost back at our hotel. We called and asked them to hold onto it for us past their closing time. They said no problem. We got there ~10 min past 11 pm, and after checking my friend's ID returned it to her. We didn't get the chance to catch their names, but to the staff of Lou Malnati's, THANK YOU!

We often have Lou's and it's the pizza of choice with my colleagues. It is always tasty whether we have it delivered, dine in, or stop by to pick it up. Both the thin and deep dish are great. Highly recommend a salad with their ranch dressing to go with the pizza...absolutely delicious!

Samantha and Sarah were so informative and enjoyable. The Classic pizza and dad were a perfect end to a great day.  The ranch dressing is house made and it made my mouth water. And I hate ranch dressing.  Must must must eat here n

SOLID solid Chicago style deep dish pizza. Some pro tips: This place gets busy. And I mean really busy. A 30-45 minute wait for a table during peak hours is not unheard of. Also the pizzas themselves take 30-45 minutes to bake. Do yourself a favor, order your pies **BEFORE** you get seated. Trust me, it's what the locals do.  We started with calamari and four cheese bread. The cheesy bread was "meh" but the calamari was good.  Two medium pies fed four hungry guys and one hungry gal.  As if on a timer, 30-45 minutes after ordering our pizzas came out. "The Malnati" was chock full of meat and cheese -- essentially a meat lovers classic.  From their menu: "Made with Lou's lean sausage, some extra cheese and vine-ripened tomato sauce on Buttercrust." The "Lou" was a veggie pie with spinach, mushrooms and tomatoes. Both were good in their own right.

First time to Chicago, had to try pizza,  since it's my favorite food,  second only to cereal.   Well,  pizza was ok and service was friendly but sparse. Lovely tiny blonde waitress took our order,  warned us pizza  takes 45 minutes to come out, brought drinks and then disappeared after she dropped off the pizza (to their credit it was only 30 minutes).  When we asked for check she asked if we wanted a refill. Yes we did,  ten minutes ago.   The small pizza,  billed for 2, was  small but filling.  Sauce is acidic and nothing special.  Cheese is abundant and flavorful.  The crust is disappointing; it was beautifully crisp but tasted only of flour.  Not awful but I'd try elsewhere next time.

You can't get deep-dish pizza much better than this. It's a simple menu, but that isn't a problem. There is a long wait, but you can order while you sit in the front. It's one of the first places people think of when asked where to go for deep-dish pizza.
Came in for lunch and grabbed chicagos infamous deep dish pizza and boy was I not disappointed just keep in mind the pizza does take almost a hour to come out so order up on appa

This place is a must-go, even if you are just in Chicago for a day! The pizza is delicious and true to the classic Chicago style. Not only that, but all of the food is delicious here. We ordered the signature salad, and we absolutely loved it. Everyone at our table agreed it was one of the best salads they had eaten in a long time. Overall, an excellent restaurant and well worth the (relatively short) wait.

Meh, I've experienced better really nails it. Blah! I mean really! Very disappointed considering so many people think it's THE place to go for deep dish. My guess is that it has lost its mojo since it now seems so touristy. The place was packed for lunch when we got there and we were told that the pizza would take 45 minutes. We were 4 adults and two children and they say us in a round table which barely fit all of us, we were knocking elbows. To top it off it was in the middle of the dining room close to the stairs and the kitchen exit. Extremely uncomfortable!  I ordered, my oldest ordered a plate of ravioli and the server recommended we get the adult version. We did. Turned out that he still got us the kids' version which had 3 miserable and unappetizing ravioli on them. The sauce I'm betting was Ragu or something because I've tasted better from store bought. It was pretty sad. We eventually had to order a second plate of ravioli for my child.  So, as far as the pizza goes...I got the small (thank God!) Chicago Classic with a couple of extra ingredients. My family got the The Lou, the large size for three adults. My youngest got a personal cheese pizza. Honestly, the most satisfied person at our table was our 7 years old. The rest of us were very disappointed with our pizzas. Mine didn't have enough sauce, the other adults didn't like theirs because it had TOO much sauce. The pizza looked like a lumpy mess, kind of those failed attempts you see in the internet compared to the pizza that it was supposed to look like. I'm sure there are many other places in Chicago to get decent pizza. This is not it.
This place right here is very good and the employees are friendly. If you like sausage in every bite then this is the place to try! Very tasty

From New York and love my traditional pie but this was my first deep dish experience and I wasn't disappointed. It was perfect amount of sauce and cheese. A small was the perfect amount of food for 2.
Long wait but it was worth it.   St Patrick's day parade that day slowed things down a bit. Great pizza.   Whole family loved it. Tried one meat pizza and one veggie pizza.  Both were very good.

Wait was long but it takes 30 mins to cook a deep dish ... tte wait was worth it like u can go do whatever they send uva text when it's time...... and plus the pizza was amazing like a half a slice filled me up

For me there is no better pizza in Chicago. I happened to work down the block from this location, but have tried others as well. Their crust beats all other "Chicago style" pizzas. Much more than just a name, this pizza deserves its legendary reputation.

No trip to Chicago would be complete with a visit to Lou Malnati's to feast on their specialty deep-dish pizzas.  After a trip to Millennium Park to do "touristy things," my friends and I decided to stop here for a quick dinner. We came at around 9 on a Monday  evening and there was about a 20 minute wait for seats. No biggie. Once we were seated, our server greeted us and took our orders. We settled for an order of fried calamari, Lou's bruschetta and the Malnati's salad. All 3 appetizers were delicious and were amazing to munch on before our deep-dish pizzas came.  For the pizzas, we settled for the large Lou and a large sausage thin crust. Be warned that the deep-dish pizzas take about 30-45 minutes to prepare since they make everything fresh. Once our pizzas came, we all looked forward to digging in, and at the end, we weren't disappointed. The pizzas definitely filled us up and were delectable. We even had a few slices left over to take home.  Overall, I definitely enjoyed my experience here and I'll definitely be back whenever I'm back in Chicago. Our server was quick and efficient and even had the patience to deal with 10+ rowdy college kids.

Deep dish isn't my absolute favorite, but this place does a good job with the format. The pies are kinda like lasagnas, and they hold up really well as cold leftovers. I've only ever had delivery, so cannot comment on the restaurant itself.

We went here on a Thursday night around 8 and there was no wait. We ordered calamari for appetizer and a medium famous deep dish with sausage and mushrooms. The appetizer arrived shortly and it was delicious. The pizza took about 25 minutes (on the menu it says it'll take about 30 mins), and it was definitely worth it. The pizza was really cheesy and meaty and really filling. I love pizza and could almost eat a whole pizza by myself but only 2 slices of this pizza and I was full because it was so packed with cheese and sausage.  I would definitely recommend this place and plan to visit again. They also have outdoor seating and I plan to being my puppy next time.

Being new to Chicago, I asked the front desk of my hotel for a recommendation to a great Chicago Deep Dish Pizza. I was led here by the front desk representative (Shout out to him for recommending this place). It's in middle of downtown so it was a short walk for us. At a great location and the outside patio looked amazing. We were welcomed in and they quickly got us a table. We didn't know what to get, so we were recommended the Malnati Chicago Classic Pizza and the chicken Alfredo.  Before you order the pizza they always warn you that it'll take around 40 minutes for a pizza. Even though the wait for the pizza was long, every single minute was worth it. The cheese and the flavor was just on point! My favorite part was the crust(me being a crust guy!). The bread was not burnt neither undercooked. It was just crunchy and chewy at the same time. I would recommend this place to tourists who are visiting chicago that wants to taste the classic thick deep dish pizza from Chicago!

Came here as the first stop of a River North food tour. The slice was a simple sample but it didn't lack flavor. I can't give it 5 stars untill I get the real Chicago deep dish! Coupled my slice with a Blue Moon. Coming back for a real slice soon! Great service and good food. Bust spot and worth getting. One lovely lady I sat with during the tour mentioned she had a pizza shipped to Nashville Tennessee! If that doesn't tell you how good it is.. Not sure what Will! Yes, they will ship out of state! Get yours or one for a friend!

I'll start off by saying that I'm a NYC pizza kinda gal. I like pizza so of course I have to try the deep dish. When in Rome right? So the wait wasn't too bad although we got there early-ish. We waited about 15 minutes but soon after, the wait time was around an hour plus. Then when we sat down, the waitress told us that the pizza would take half an hour to make after we ordered. It took 45 minutes for the pizza to come out and it wasn't hot! Tisk tisk tisk!! I would expect it piping hot if it's made to order... out of the oven and served immediately. That was a bit of a disappointment bc the cheese held together and wasn't melting as expected.  The pizza was good.. just good. Never ate pizza with a fork and knife but it's a must with a deep dish.
It's a toss up between Gino's east and malnati's for me. I think I'd go personal deep with Gino's and large deep to share with malnati's Uno's was my first love, but it can be hit or miss.

Lou Malnati probably learned everything he needed to know from Ike Sewell, the guy who founded Pizzeria Uno and Pizzeria Due. But he nonetheless improved upon that knowledge, and now we prefer his version of a tomato pie over all others. Now my partner and myself don't indulge often, and while I am still a fan of Pizzeria Uno's pies, it is always Lou's when we do our Pino (Noir) and Pizza night. .Their Lou's salad is fabulous, their wings, while not a value item, are respectable enough for an occasional treat. But Lou's deep dish pizza is our one true favorite. While some prefer the buttercrust (us), others need to be mindful that Lou's will cook your pizza the way you prefer: Regular, gooey, or well done. If you're not a fan of softer dough, get your pie well done. If you don't want it dry, order it gooey. Lou Malnati's aims to please, you just need to ask your server about this. After all, Chicago pizza is legendary for good reasons. Oh, and if you don't want to deal with dough, Lou's has a crust-less pizza! They use a large sausage patty as the base, and pile the sauce, cheese and other ingredients on top of that before baking it. It's great for gluten-free dieters and others who are avoiding the carb-loading that eating pizza usually involves. Nico, one of the managers at the original Lou's in Lincolnwood, IL, runs a tight ship, is very personable, and seems to have great relationships with his staff. We have had their thin crust version, and it's our recommendation that you get this style of crust half-baked, and take it home to finish the process. This guarantees a hot, freshly made pizza experience.
In Chicago had to try the pizza.  Lou Malnati's does not disappoint.  Service was good and pizza was great.

Having only tried Giordano's and Gino's East from our previous trip to Chicago several years ago, I can't really comment on how the deep dish pizza at Lou Malnati's compares to the other two.  I thought the pizza was decent and definitely filling.  I do remember the buttery crust being extra special compared to the other two popular joints.  I'm am only giving the place three stars partly because of the service.  I felt that it was a little disorganized since we were asked to switch tables initially.  Also, we felt that the server could've been more attentive and followed up on how our pizza was or if we needed anything else.  Perhaps I was expecting too much going in that the experience was a little underwhelming.

Trendy spot with decent service.  The pizza tasted yeasty and undercooked.  The outer crust was amazing and buttery.  The meats and sauce were delicious.  The appetizers were average.  It's fine for out of towners I suppose.  Our waiter was on the ball and we enjoyed our stay.   Frankly,  it was a let down given the hype.
Best oohy gooey Chicago pizza made hands down.This crust is a meal in itself thick and satisfying.
This place is so good! I loved their fresh ingredients. We couldn't stop pocking at it!

Probably the best pizza I have ever had!! I am from LA and my God Lou Malnati's isthe best. My buddy and I took a trip to Chicago recently and Lou Malnati's was on our list. We tried it on our second night being in the city. It was our second time trying Chicago deep dish and this was the best we had. We liked the whole concept of ordering when you get to the restaurant and having your order ready when you take a seat. The wait was definitely worth it!! The cheese on the pizza was probably the greatest cheese a pizza can have. If youre headed to Chicago, Lou Malnati's is a must try!!

All Chicagoans know that pan is not the way pizza is in Italy.  Now that Chicago has so many types of pizza, the comparisons and arguments are way off.  Comparing Neapolitan pizza to Chicago pan pizza is like comparing lace to denim. Way back, Chicago had thin pizza (yummy cheesy, choose your own topping,  piping hot, sometimes corn meal on bottom) and Italian Bakery pizza (yummy, only sold in pieces, tomato sauce, maybe a little cheese on top, and maybe sausage. Then in the 60's we started up with pan pizza; first was Uno's & Due's, then Lou Malnati's. Malnati's was better right from the get go; others soon followed, and Chicago pan became our "it" pizza.  If you want the best Chicago style pizza, Malnati's is the place- several locations these days. Pan pizza carries out great-if you carry out, don't have it cut- stays hotter! (I also order it well-done and I get the "butter crust"-no worries, it's not butter. ) BUT, I LOVE the Randolph street location- the outdoor area is one of the nicest in the city, and, the rehab Malanti's did inside brought out the best of the old warehouse- a gentleman's bow to an old, hard-working Chicago dame-  and, miraculously, the parking is free. Near the Madhouse on Madison. TVs on with sports, full of Chicago sports paraphernalia. And, the lasagna's great, too.

Best deep dish in Chicago. We tried Giordano's, we tried Uno. But then we spoke to the people of Chicago and unanimously they told us to "stay away from the tourist trash and just head straight to Lou Malnati's Pizzeria.  So we did, on our last night in the city. And we were not disappointed! The line was out the door, but somehow we got a table at 5:30. It takes about 30-45 minutes for the pizzas to cook, so many times they let you order ahead of being seated, that way your pizza will be on its way to you before you know it. We had the Chicago Classic pizza but added basil. The buttercrust is the best part. It's crisp all the way through and melts in your mouth. Just the right amount of cheese and the best tomato sauce there is. It's made of actual tomatoes.  Great atmosphere, greater pizza, great prices. Check it out for the best Chicago Deep Dish!

Have been going around Chicago trying all pizza and this pizza was great....now for the bad part. 35 minute wait for horrible service and bland pasta. I order app it came cold. Asked for drink 10 minutes. Then asked for extra sauce it came with my bagged up food..... really lacking on customer service and  speed. Manager needs to step in and try to help out. Ruined experience just because no one is running show and preventing these issues. Get more managers to help out the one female manager I saw was changing trash in toilet obviously she is being over worked.
Delicious pizza!! Calamari was so fresh and salad was great. Just gotta wait because everyone wants to eat Lou's! I don't blame them!

I was in Chicago for the day and was told by many to try this place because it was the best pizza place in the city. After waiting an hour for my personal pan pizza, I was not impressed. First, I ordered pepperoni (an extra $1+) and there was none on my pizza. Second, it was really just average. I don't know if it has to do with being from New York, but for me Chicago pizza is all talk if this is the best they have. I also added the buttery crust (an extra .79) to my pizza and either the place just neglected to make it that way or it was not as flavorful as I had imagined. I'll stick with my New York pizza.
Who doesn't love the sausage patty deep dish or the thin, butter-crust, garlic and sliced tomato?  Heaven!
Came to Chicago for some deep dish pizza. The crust was way too dry. I did, however, enjoy their salad. It was delicious!  May or may not return in order to try another pizza
Went to Chicago. Looked for great pizza. Got great pizza. Already excited for the next time!
World's best pizza.  Period.  Love Uno's and Gino's and Giordano's, but Lou Malnati's beats them all.  Get the Chicago Deep Dish or go home.

The deep dish pizza is FABULOUS! We shared a large deep dish and a family-size salad for four adults and it was more than enough. The service was great - they even put olives and blue cheese on the side for our picky salad eaters. The star reduction is because the chairs could be more comfortable.
This place didn't disappoint.   The local Chicago pizza was well worth the wait.   Beer was cold and service was solid.

Good pizza.  Order once in a while for delivery.  Just as a point of reference, I recommend that if you order for delivery, ask for uncut and well done.  The pizza travels better and is as close to the fresh out-of-the oven taste as you can get for a delivered pizza.

I've eaten here a few times and the pizza is ok.  Unfortunately, I'm also a neighbor and have asked them repeatedly to stop having their grease-pit truck (Mahoney) from pumping so early in the morning.  The noise lasts for an hour and sounds like a train outside our windows.  They've said they would postpone to later in the day, but that lasts for a few weeks and then returns.  I bet the CEOs at Mahoneys and Manalti's would be up in arms if I blew my horn outside their houses while they were still sleeping, but they are so inconsiderate of others.  Keep this in mind while you're eating.

This pizza place was recommended to us by several people.  I'm really not sure why!! If you like fake bacon bits on your salad and velveta cheese in place of cheese curds for the fried cheese appetizer, then you may like this resturant. They are extremely slow, so plan to spend the whole evening there . The waitress dropped the pan holder on the floor and and just picked it up and reused it, with out cleaning it. If you want good Chicago style pizza , skip this place and go to Giordano's. You'll be much happier , and they'll feed you real foods , not fake processed ones .

I don't generally like deep dish pizza but I'd go back here. Good serving staff, decent food. They were 5 minutes late with an order of wings so comped it. Very busy but we got a good table quickly and our waitress was attentive.

Came here to try deep dish pizza for the first time even though I've been to Chicago a few times. This place was recommended to me by my friend who said it was the best pizza he's had. So I came in and expected big things... We ordered the spinach bread and two personal sized pizzas. One was the classic with their lean sausage and the other was the spinach and cheese one. I actually liked the taste of it but maybe deep dish isn't my thing because I felt it was too much crust. I am more into thin crusts and also Neapolitan style.  The pizzas did come quite slowly but we were warned. Additionally, the stuffed spinach bread was quite delicious.  Staff was nice and quick to see if we needed anything. Value 4/5 taste 4/5 service 4/5 ambiance 4/5

As a native New Jerseyan, and frequenter of NYC, I feel confident in my knowledge of proper pizza. That being said, Lou Malnati's was the absolute worst pizza I've ever had in my entire life. That honor used to belong to the Little Italy section of Cleveland. I have no idea where these positive reviewers are from, but they clearly don't know pizza. Don't waste my time with "But it's Chicago style." No. Just no. I was given a plate of crust with a cheese and sauce swamp on top of it. To top it off, it had no taste whatsoever. This putrid pie was complimented by tremendously slow service. I occasionally wake up in the middle of the night with PTSD episodes of this horrible horrible pizza.

Tourist review.  I am not a pizza fan but this is by far my favorite pizza place in Chicago.  The pizza had a huge layer of huge pepperoni chunks, cheese, and sauce to top it all off. It would have probably tasted better if I didn't have it delivered but I'm still not complaining. The pizza came with a small pool of juice from the tomatoes.  The pizza oozed with melted cheese. Every bite was a nice burst of pepperoni or sausage. The pizza sauce on top added a well balanced of moisture making the whole pizza easy to eat.  Would I go again? Yes!!!! First time around, I bought 2 frozen pizzas to bring back to LA.

Wonderful deep dish pizza. Lasagne was superb. Nice selection of draft beers to go with it. BUT service is SLOW. BEER WAS WARM BY THE TIME THE FOOD ARRIVED. and they were not that busy. Otherwise a great place.
A great Chicago Pizza must!  The butter crust is wonderful.  Enjoy!
doesn't beat giordanos in my eyes but its great!

Ordered to go and good thing I did, this place was jumping.  I wasn't overly impressed with the pizza itself.  I am format of town so maybe its just not what I'm used to?!?  Tried  different pizza place last time that I liked better.  The Buff a Lou wings though are great!!!

This place was highly recommended for deep dish pizza. It takes 40-45 mins to make so we started with the bruschetta appetizer, which was quite good - fresh cut tomatoes and basil on garlic bread. We had the Chicago classic deep dish with tomato, sausage and the butter crust but we were a bit disappointed....the tomato sauce and sausage was good, but there was so much thick cheese...not melted soft cheese but very thick mozza which I found difficult to eat. It wasn't bad but not mind blowing and maybe my expectations were too high. Overall there was good service and free wifi.

Great deep dish pizza and cookie pizza. If you're going to Lou Malnati's, just come for those two things. I didn't give this place 5 stars because I tried some of the appetizers (wings, bruschetta) and they were disappointing. Not very flavor or tender. Kind of boring. Also we were seated in the basement and the ambiance wasn't great.
Not as great as I thought it would be, would was ok overall. Service was slow!

This is my first time having deep dish pizza in Chicago. I heard about Loui Malnati's being the place to go, so it was worth a try. When we came, we were told the wait would be about 30 minutes for seating (it was really about 5 which was nice). Pizza takes at least 30 minutes to be made, so it may be a good idea to call in advance or bring something to do/be prepared to entertain yourselves for awhile. We tried a small 1/2 Lou 1/2 Classic Chicago (charge is for the more expensive of the 2), which is good portion size for two people.  The Lou itself had copious amounts of cheese, which was nice intermixed with some spinach, mushrooms, and tomatoes. I do think I like the classic better because of the rich flavor. Note that the sausage seems to be one large flat piece of sausage (rather than smaller pieces). The butter crust, was indeed more buttery than most, but not as amazing as it sounds, unfortunately.  I don't have much to say about this place. It's a rite of passage to try deep dish in Chicago and yes, it was good, but I'm not dying to come back.

We were only in Chicago for 9 hours and had a few priorities. 1) Chicago Cubs game 2) Chicago pizza When Lou Malnati's was recommended by local friends, we had to go. Our waiter, Collin was very attentive and recommended everything we ordered. It sooo delicious! I definitely recommend the spinach artichoke bread and any deep dish pizza. It will not disappoint!! Also, high praises to our server. Collin was awesome and we really appreciated him.
First of all, I am not a fan of deep dish.  It is very much like a casserole.  The service was good and everyone else liked the pizza.  Just not me.  I am a thin crust person.

I went for lunch and the place was nice. The pizza was good and the restaurant itself was very sleek. The pizza itself was smaller than I would've thought though and for me it seemed to taste like every other pizza.

When in Chicago, eat deep dish pizza. I ordered a personal size dish of the Malnati's Classic Chicago Pizza. It was crowded, but I was alone so had a chance to sit at the bar. The pizza takes a little over 30 minutes to cook so they also have a bar to order drinks. When the pizza came out it was hot and fresh. Everything tasted so fresh and all the ingredients tasted high quality. The crust was crispy and buttery, sauce tasted of fresh tomatoes, cheese was plentiful for every bite, and sausage was meaty and fresh. I'm not a big fan of Chicago deep dish in general, I'm more of a thin crust pizza fan, but I would recommend this place!
A classic for tourists but youll always feel sleepy afterwards. Gets pretty hard to power through with the last couple bites but the ratio of dough-sauce-cheese is always good.

Our first time in Chicago and of course we had to try the famous deep dish pizza.   It's was worth the 2 hours (1 hour wait for our table and another hour for the pizza).   Excellent pizza.   We also ordered calamari (it was ok but the sauce was good) and buffalo wings (it was also ok).   Anyway, we went there for the pizza.   Next time no more appetizers, because the pizza was humongous!   Their Bloody Mary was also very good!

I love this place best pizza in the world if anyone ask this is the place I'm recommending the atmosphere is amazing & so homely. I love their chicken alfredo pasta omg it's to die for & the pizza is so good that you don't have to even ask for extra sauce like most places this is the spot for the best pizza in Chicago

Last night in Chicago so thought I'd better try the infamous deep dish pizza that's spoken of. It's okay. The service was much more enjoyable than the food; it really highlights the difference between Australia and the incentives driven by tipping culture in the States.
The BEST. I have never been disappointed. I talk it up to all of my family and co-workers and have never oversold it. Delicious deep-dish and a tray every time I am in Chicago.

If you're lactose-intolerant or dairy-free, I'm sad to report that they do not carry non-dairy cheese here. It's probably the norm in Chicago, but I thought I'd mention it for similarly unfortunate souls looking for Chicago deep dish that won't make you shit your pants. The crust is dairy-free as long as it is not Buttercrust - duh.  My friend has historically disliked deep dish, but he thoroughly enjoyed his Malnati order. I got a personal sized Classic with no cheese and enjoyed the hell out of it - wasn't even eyeing the cheesy pizzas at my table with envy while I ate my delicious monstrosity. The crust, sausage, and tomato sauce still make for a great Chicago deep dish experience. The personal size pizzas are equivalent to about two small slices.
The deep dish pizza was amazing. The margarita, not so much. They use all that processed  mixer crap. But overall a nice experience.
Screwed up our order, got the wrong bill and it took forever to get the correct bill back. We didn't get compensated for any mistakes.

When it comes to Chicago style pizza, Lou's is the best. The Chicago Classic is my personal favorite. The sausage they use is just wonderful. Then the sauce is what really makes it. The vine-ripened tomato sauce is the best pizza sauce I've ever had. There appetizers are worth it as well. I'm a fan of the hot wings and bruschetta. When in Chicago make sure you stop by this historic pizza joint!
Good Chicago style pizza if you like deep dish. The servers are great and welcoming, making this place a great stop. The starter platter and the garlic sauce was the icing on the cake!!!

I usually don't gravitate towards deep dish, but when in Chicago, you gotta.  All of my Chi-town friends said to go to Lou's, and I see why.  It was great!  The crust, in particular, was buttery and crispy, and maintained its crispiness even on the bottom underneath all the sauce.  Speaking of the sauce, it was fresh, tasty, and the right amount.  I was afraid the cheese would be too much, but the balance between it and the sauce was perfect.  The personal size was a good amount, too, and the bf had one slice leftover from the small size.  So, I wouldn't say I'm converted to Team Deep Dish, but when in Chicago, this is a great choice for a tasty deep dish pizza meal.

Come here on Saturday evening around 5 pm and the wait for a group of 4 was only 20 min or so. They tell you to preorder the pizza because the deep dish takes about 30 min to get to the table. So I'd highly recommend doing so as well.  The malnati was great!!! Their sausage was rly yummy. The Lou was a little soggier for our tastes. We also made the mistake of ordering a Large and a Medium for just 4 ppl when the menu says it would normally feed 7 ppl. I was with pretty hungry young adult men so they were able to finish the majority though.
Good deep dish pizza, great crust. The cheese is really good but a little too much on the pizza for me. Our server was nice and quick with refills.

I guess if you come to Chicago deep dish pizza would be something on your list to try. I am a big fan of pizza in general. Being an East Coaster, I have to say that deep dish pizza is not for me. Not really a great beer selection here- pizza and beer go hand in hand.Pizza choices are ok. What I did like was it wasn't too much bread compared to some other deep dish pizza options. This is just a basic pub place.
Oh man- carb- less pizza, and it tasted not only good, but amazing!  Awesome staff and decor, just oozes the best of Chicago , can't wait to return.
So good! The best Chicago style pizza in town! The salad is very tasty and portion is big too. Will come back just for the pizza!!

Salad was very good because it was laced heavily in dressing that was pretty sweet. I suspect it wasn't very healthy - but you don't come here because you want to be healthy ;)  We had a large group and they were very accommodating and instead of bringing out large pies they served each slice separately to us. My favorite pizza was the plain cheese and vegetarian one. My favorite part of the meal was dessert! :)
Delicious!!!! Very highly recommend. The buttery crust is amazing. Definitely need to try it out if you haven't already.
This IS pizza. You've not experienced REAL Chicago Deep Dish Pizza until you've come here.

I'm a huge fan of pizza to begin with, but the pizza here is to die for. As someone from out of town, I will certainly be dreaming about this place until I make it back to Chicago. If you're looking for a good pizza fix, this is the place to be!

I walked into Lou Malnati's with a lot of hope for a decent midday stop and bite to eat. Overall, I was incredibly disappointed all around by the service, food and experience provided by Lou Malnati's.  Our pizza took fifty minutes to come out, which wouldn't have been an issue if it were as hot as a pizza straight from the over should be. Our cookie pizza was completely dough and obviously just wasn't done cooking. I had thought that maybe it was just a certain part of the cookie, but the entire thing was mediocre because of the texture being a sloppy mess after the whipped cream and ice cream soaking into the dough. For a $7 dessert, there's a certain expectation that a consumer has. My edible cookie dough just fell short.  I will give the flavor to both of my items great remarks: the taste was totally there, and the proportions were PERFECT for my liking.  Our service was mediocre. Our waiter wasn't very helpful, and elongated our checkout time to the point of extreme frustration. I even asked to pay up front because we were tired of the neglect and have places to visit during our time here. Our waiter showed up five minutes after we sat back down and took our payment, then dropped off the card and receipt without any final remarks.  We won't be visiting again when we come back to Chicago. Hopefully we just caught them at a bad time, because it seems like a happening establishment, but it's pretty hard to advocate that any other visitors should make a stop here.

The deep dish cheese pizza is simply to die for. The cornmeal crust is the best I have ever eaten. The salad with creamy garlic-lime dressing is also fantastic! Not a place, however, to eat at often unless you are intent on clogging your arteries. But for an occasional treat, Lou's is hard to beat.

According to all our research on Yelp, Lou's seemed like a clear choice when trying our first Chicago deep dish! Lou's was roll your eyes backwards good. I enjoy Patxi's back home in the Bay Area, but Lou's takes the crown here. There crust is so good! Buttery, crispy, and you can taste the freshness of all the ingredients that run through the pizza. We got the Malnati's Chicago Classic Pizza and added extra pepperoni on top. The aroma from the pizza when it hit our table instantly told us this was going to be one of the best deep dishes we've had. It definitely did not disappoint. The crust of the pizza was so buttery, paired with a huge chunk of sausage in every bite. Be careful with what size you order here because deep dishes are no joke, we went with a medium and still had two slices leftover.  Aside from the pizza, we got an order of the Calamari Frites which is always a solid appetizer, no complaints.  Service was excellent. Since deep dish takes a little over half an hour to make, I liked that they let you pre-order your pizza while waiting for a table so that by the time you're seated, you're waiting no more than another 10-15 minutes for your pizza. They also text you to let you know when your table is ready which is always nice! The restaurant was very lively with lots of crowds. The basketball game was on, people were flooding the bar, and the restaurant itself had a home family feel to it. If you're having trouble deciding on where to go, this is the place to be.   5/5.

So good! We stopped here a few months back on my husbands first trip to Chicago & he had to try Chicago style pizza. I love Chicago & have been to Uno & Giordano's and Giordanos is my fav... I think they still have a slight leg up on Lou Malnati's (first loves die hard). We arrived shortly after opening bc we had an architectural tour early afternoon (again, hubs first visit so we had to do the tourist stuff). We ordered a salad which was large enough to share for two. We also ordered a small deep dish pepperoni. Good thing we didn't get anything else. We were so stuffed after a piece each! I felt so awful leaving behind our leftovers bc it was so good! It's a bit expensive, but it's Chicago so everything is. It's a great spot!
Yum, yum and yum.  Order the deep dish classic and allow 45min for pizza but OMG so delish! The butter crust on this pizza is incredible.

Strangely I've found that a lot of Chicago locals don't seem to be fans of deep dish pizza, but personally I love it. Sure, it's super heavy and you can only really get through a couple slices before wanting to die, but how can you not love that much cheese and dough on one plate? One thing I do not love about Lou Malnati's is the wait, but they do have their system down. They allow you to order your pizza while you wait, and we got some drinks at the (crowded) bar and were able to make due for the 40 minutes or so until our names were called. Once we sat our pizza was already on its way. Pretty impressive!  Though the pizza was piping hot, ooey gooey, and mighty tasty, I was surprisingly also really into the Malnati salad. With olives, romaine, gorgonozola, and an amazing sweet vinaigrette, it was one of the highlights of the meal for me!  With or without the salad, you'll leave absolutely stuffed after your deep dish pizza experience. Just be prepared to feel pretty gross and full for a while... it's worth it!

After an rough experience at the West Loop location, we were thrilled to have such a great experience at this location. We arrived around 4:40 - and were pleased to find that the joint was already jumping. After our initial experience at West Loop, we were relieved to see that their bartender was already working - and working hard, shaking up some delicious margaritas. All of the staff we encountered were friendly and welcoming.  We had a spinach salad with goat cheese and strawberries - YUM! For pizza, we shared the Lou, and it was delicious and filling.  The food was great, the service was great.

#3,499? seriously? the fact that this many people take the time to write reviews - testament to the excellent pie they make..day in...day out.  Walking distance from my hotel, The Gwen. healthy walk about 20 minutes but worth it. I knew this location woud be crazy - perfect storm of the National Restaurant Show in town, a Friday night and the BEST pizza, hands down. Four deep at the bar.  I began stalking the people at the bar so i could snag a seat. Ordered my thin crust pizza and a cold Corona as soon as the bartender could see me (smiling).  perfect timing: 20 minutes later, my pizza arrives as I was able to sit down and watch the Cubbies drop one game (but oh..my Cubbies!!).  This is a very healthy sized individual pizza and I make no apologies for eating the entire pie. It's not often I can get to Chicago and eat at Lou's. This place is incredible.  The bartenders work very very hard - wish they could enlarge the bar area though.  LOVE this pizza.
Overall, it was a not bad experience first time driving deep dish pizza. Personally, I like thin crust pizza better. The environment and vibes were on point btw!

Heaven has a name, and it's Lou Malnati's. Wow. Best pizza I've ever had. A pepperoni Malnati's Chicago Classic. Unreal. Super tasty and great service. Yes, over and over again.This pizza alone is worth a trip to Chicago.

This place is good but I do prefer other deep dish pizza places in Chicago.  I was disappointed they don't have a beer on draft.  Also, the atmosphere, service and set up of the place can seem a bit like you are in a nicer fast food place, not a really nice sit down dining place.
Some of the best pizza you can find! Great service and dont forget to try the salad and wings, they are great too!
Great Chicago deep dish pizza!  Loved the ambiance the prices are reasonable.  This is a must when visiting Chicago.

It was my first time in Chicago, so I had to hit the perfect deep dish slice as my first stop. I did my research and told my local friends to take me straight to Lou malnatis. I was not disappointed at all, the cheese/sauce/bread ratio was absolutely perfect. Each bite was its own trip through heaven. For some reason the slices with toppings weren't nearly as good as the classic slice but I was still super content with my meal.
