I was super excited to try real Chicago deep dish for the first time. Let me start off by explaining how much I LOVE bread. It is the very essence of life to me. The crispiness it can give and also softness and when extra butter is involved... Ohhh man. So yes, I LOVE bread. Now, one of my favorite things to eat is pizza. I mean, it has bread (super important), but you also get other yummy items like tomato sauce, mushrooms, peppers, different types of meats, etc all in one dish. You'll noticed I didn't mention cheese and that's because I'm anti-cheese, but for pizza I will tolerate it.  OK, onto my experience. The wait was ridiculously long. It's a famous place so I understand and we had 6 people so OK, I get it. But what confused me the most was them explaining we can order while we wait... But they don't actually start making it until we actually sat down and even then we have to wait for someone to confirm the order. What was the point then?? It was about an hour wait for us. Then when we got seated, waited another 5 mins for them to get us water 4/5 waters and then confirm our order. And then another hr to get the food. Hmm... If the food is good, I guess the wait is worth it. But, no. It wasn't. Pizza came, we ordered deep dish and thin slice so we could try both. The servers were really weird... I would think they'd just leave the pizza on the table and let us dig in, but insisted on cutting all the slices and serving them to us... OK, no big deal. That's nice I guess. BUT once everyone got a slice of each, there were of course still some slices left and they just stood there staring at us like they wanted someone to take the rest... Why not just leave the rest on the table??? They eventually did... But I just thought that this process was just really strange. Anyways, so the pizza. Pretty disappointing. It wasn't crispy and buttery like many people state and also barely any tomato sauce. The inside of the dough seemed like it could use some extra time in the oven to cook more. And the toppings... More like what toppings?? Cheese, again I'm not fond of, but even I know that wasn't good. My husband who LOVES cheese as much as I love bread said it wasn't good. So yeah... Not sure if it was an off day for them cause everyone else seems to rave about this place, but I definitely would not come back. Especially with that wait. No thanks. The thin crust was just OK, nothing special. Both lacked flavor.

This is one of my new favorites for Chicago pizza. I've never tried anything but Pizza but its never let me down. Keep in mind, this pizza is SUPER FILLING. I find that we order 1/2 of what we would elsewhere. If you get extra sausage, know you're getting a manhole-cover size disc of sausage over your entire pizza. Two pieces and you will be stuffed!

This is my first time here in Chicago and I was looking for a good pizza joint that served to locals. No I'm obviously not a local, but if it's good enough for locals to eat it's got be good for me.  I made it a point to have my first pizza experience here. And I'm glad I did. Pizza was tasty and hot. Just like I like it.  Pizza is good, and liked the cheese used. Make sure to get your crust buttered and garlic'd. It's the only way to properly enjoy their pizza.  If you have a chance and want to get good local foodie info from the #mostfunceo, this is what the waitress calls herself lol.  We ordered the medium cheese and pepperoni deep dish and the sausage and cheese small deep dish.

Over the last six months, I've ordered delivery of a small, Buttercrust, Cheese & Sausage Pizza, and an order of Buffalo Chicken Wings, to an Elmhurst address. The pizza always arrived in a perfect state, but the Buffalo Wings were always a toss up. Were they cooked correctly? Were they overdone or underdone? Were they dry from to little Buffalo sauce, or would they have the proper amount of sauce? When I first started ordering wings, they came out perfect. But now six months in, I never know what I'm going to get. On my last order, I ordered two orders. When they were Delivered, the packages were cold, and it wasn't because the delivery took to long. It was because the wings weren't cooked long enough. After delivery, I bit into the wings, which were pink and raw. I contacted the Elmhurst Manager, and didn't ask for a replacement. I just wanted Rosie to know that the cooks aren't consistent. I have a credit for two orders of wings, but I won't use it, because I no longer trust that location. I'm not sure, but either they changed suppliers or cooks, and both are not doing a good job. I'll go to BWW for wings in the future. I'll trust Lou's for pizza, but not anything else. In six months, I can't get a decent order of wings. That's my opinion, and only mine. But I've been a Kitchen Manager in the past and have dealt with this type of problem. I'd like to contact the owners, but don't have their contact info. I'm no longer going to use Lou's as a supplier. I simply cave trust them, and those two orders of underdone wings cost over $20.  I can no longer spend that money on inferior food. It just costs to much not to be done right. I only wish that upper management would drop in on this stores and review the cooking practice, so that the practice was uniform from store to store, because  sure it isn't, at least from my multiple experiences. The Manager, Rosie, knows who I am. But even after this, even though I have credit, I won't be contacted. I'm one person. I'm not important. Just order pizza. The other items are hit or miss. If I were management, I'd be looking at staffing, because I don't believe they share the vision of the company. I know I'd be very engaged in it as a former Kitchen Manager for the Howard Johnson's chain, The Ground Round. We always listened to our clients. Always.

I've had many a slice of Chicago style pizza over the years, and this was one of the better experiences I've had. The front of house staff seemed extremely lost but our server here was fantastic. The food was amazing. Can't wait to come back!
I'm very glad I chose Lou's for my first foray into Chicago style deep dish. Service was exemplary and the food was fantastic. No complaints.

I had high expectations. The wait was the worse for pizza on a Saturday night. Probably waited about an hour outside, received a text to come inside and wait more. They had me order pizza before going in to be seated because that's how they operate and said it takes time to make the pizza. To order other food that's not pizza, you have to be seated. Once seated we waited about 40 minutes or it seemed longer than that for wings to come out. The wings were really good and thick, plenty of meat and sauce, but it's weird how they came with no carrots and only had celery.  I loved the wings better than their pizza! Chicago style deep dish pizza was good but not amazing. The crust was crunchy but hard to cut through since they suggest you eat it with a fork and knife. I like eating pizza with my hand and cheese to be melted or fully cooked but this one was not. The cheese was stretchy and doughy not done baking? The pepperoni was weak on flavor and not many toppings. I'm just really surprised or not use to this type of pizza. I ordered half Lou and half Malnati and they almost tasted identical. Everything was excess cheese which is too much for me but that's not bad. I was expecting the pizza to be thicker and deeper as I've seen on television and YouTube research. The pizza arriving to the table was another hour wait after my appetizer of wings came which is horrible wait time for a small order of pizza!! The waitress even said "your pizza will be out in 2 minutes", liar. I'm just being nice with 3 stars because I really liked the wings.

Best pizza ever, I recommended their specialty one just as it comes. It was the best clean straight forward flavors, the tomato sauce taste was superb, the sausage had a great flavor the whole thing was amazing. Ordered (3) individual for the two of us and it was more than enough.

If you didn't try deep dish pizza, did you really even go to Chicago? It was hard narrowing down a single pizzeria to visit during our trip, but a lot of Yelp lists and locals seem to like Lou Malnati's. We came on a Thursday night, and there was no wait for a party of two. I loved the atmosphere -- very Chicagoan and classic. Our server was friendly and made some great recommendations. And just a warning - deep dish pizzas take about 30 minutes to make, at least here, so this is definitely not the place for a quick bite. Stuffed Spinach Bread: 5/5. Knowing we'd be waiting a while for our food, our server recommended ordering an appetizer to nibble on in the meantime. The Stuffed Spinach Bread was small, but so flaky and delicious. I could've eaten five of them. It wasn't so much "bread" as it was a crust - it was like a Hot Pocket, if he went off to college and became a successful businessman. Malnati Chicago Classic Deep Dish Pizza: 4/5. This was our first time having deep dish pizza ever, but our hopes were high because we're pretentious. Unfortunately my lactose intolerance meant I could only have a few bites, but I got the gist...very delicious crust (their signature "Buttercrust" I believe), lots of tasty meat and gooey cheese center. Really good! It fell slightly short of our expectations because it wasn't as deep as we'd hoped, and the cheese was almost rubbery, which is strange because it shouldn't have been sitting out for long before arriving to our table. Malnati Salad: 5,000/5. AMAZING. BEST SALAD EVER. This salad is huge and definitely for sharing, but I did some damage because it was so dang good. There must be some banned substance in the dressing or something because I couldn't stop eating. I feel bad for my future salads. They'll never come close.

I did love the food but unfortunately our waiter was incredibly aggressive- from the minute we sat down it was as though he was rushing us through our meal to clear the table for another guest.  Our party of 6 arrived early and placed our name on the list for a table- when we did this we also "placed our pizza order" or so we thought- upon being seated we were told by the pushy waiter that he would then put the order in- odd.  We ordered an appetizer and salad also- something to note, the salads are HUGE!! Our group of 6 barely made a dent in the serving!   Again the pizza is great, by far my favorite Chicago deep dish.  I will give you another shot Lou, just hopefully not with the same waiter! The most aggressive part was when the food was delivered and he insisted on cutting and serving the pizza out- he barely gave us time to decide what to eat- it was an intense experience!  The only other con is the size of the "waiting area" you are essentially crowded in the doorway and when you're told 45 minutes to wait for a table that can be a huge turnoff- probably why it only took us 20 minutes to get seated!

The North State Street location is sooooo much better. Tonight we ordered a Buffalo Chicken Salad and Deep Dish Pizza. Where do I start....I couldn't taste anything but bread and my salad was full of watermelon with the rind attached, rotten lettuce, water and steams. Lesson learned won't be ordering from this location again

This place has nothing on Gino's east. Honestly, it's just generic deep dish that you could get anywhere. The crust is bland and the tomatoes are from a can. One word, lame. You will have to wait no matter where you go for deep dish, so I would definitely go back to Gino's.

Don't get me wrong, it's good.  But it is not the best deep dish in the city.  This location is great in the Gold Coast and easy to get to.  Expect a wait, but there is plenty of seating and a good bar area.

A Chicago must!  Excellent service and attentive servers. My personal recommendation/favorite is the "Lou" and don't forget to add pepperoni. It compliments the veggies perfectly. The Malnati Chicago Classic is good too but the sausage patty can be a bit overwhelming. They even have the option of ordering half and half of the different kinds of pizza. 4 stars because there's a 45-minute wait for any deep dish pizza. Also, the waiting area is extremely small and often blocks the entrance of the restaurant.

Love this pizza!  My hands down favorite.  The sausage deepdish is great...the crust...everything is perfect.  I also love to order a large pizza and then get the big family size salad, it is so fresh and great with the pizza and that dressing!!
That buttery,  crunchy, deep dish crust... Fantastic! It was probably the best pizza I have ever eaten. I must get back to Chicago to have more of this pizza.  It was the best part of my trip.

My boyfriend and I came here on Saturday a little after 5PM and were seated immediately at a booth. Lou's is a casual, cozy pizza restaurant. We ordered the calamari and a medium deep dish (half The Malnati Chicago Classic and half The Lou - yes you can do half and half!). The appetizer took 25 minutes and the pizza 45 minutes to be served.  Can I please say how the calamari appetizer is literally one of the best calamari I have ever had? When it was served on the table, I was not expecting much already because it looked too crispy and fried. But wow, the combination of the calamari with the house dipping sauce is AMAZING. The dipping sauce is not your typical tomato sauce. It's refreshing and it reminded me a little bit of a mignonette sauce used for raw oysters.  The deep dish itself was tasty too. I liked The Lou more than The Malnati Chicago Classic simply because I'm not a very meaty person. I also don't love to eat cheese... so the triple cheese on The Lou was a little much for me. The tomato sauce that Lou Malnati uses is homemade and so so delicious. If you read the description on their menu, their vine tomatoes are handpicked from California (or something like that). Note that they have suggested portion sizes and I advise you to listen to that. For two, a medium was WAY too big (my boyfriend claimed he could finish it). A small would have been perfect for us and maybe even a little bit leftover still.  The service was also phenomenal, even during the Saturday evening rush at the restaurant. Basically, the homemade tomato sauce and dipping sauce made the experience a great one for me. As we were leaving, there were about 40 people waiting around in the lobby, on the stairs and outside for a table. Good thing we just missed the wait!

What a great experience. I came here at around 5pm on a Monday evening. It was right before the dinner rush so I got a seat at the bar and waited for the bartender to ask what I wanted to eat. He was very informative about the menu and what to expect when ordering their deep dish pizza. Words can't describe how delicious it was. I ordered the Lou Malnati personal pie. 10/10 for sure. Highly recommend. The food was great and priced extremely well.

This was the first stop when my friend and I arrived in Chicago. Literally, we got off the plane, put our luggage in our hotel, and then walked here. This place is an institution in Chicago, so we knew we had to go there. We got the Lou Malnati's deep dish, and while it was good, it was a little disappointing. The crust was just ok, the toppings were a little sparse, but the marinara sauce was great.  The service was excellent, though!
Pizza just doesn't get any better than this. We even ship it to friends in dry ice for special occasions.

A lot of people prefer Lou's when it comes to Chicago style deep dish because of the crust, and I'll admit it's good crust, nice and flaky. But, for me, that's where the advantages of Lou's cease.  Lou's deep dish certainly lacks the cheesy goodness and volume of toppings that Giordano's or Art of Pizza boast and it also doesn't have that light fluffy crust that Pequod's can boast. Plus I find the wait, especially at this location, to be much lengthier - Giordano's especially just seems to turn tables a little more quickly. Lou's thin crust is kinda the same story. I just find that the other pizza places offer better options when it comes to thin crust and there are plenty of local mom & pop pizza places with good thin crust. My two cents: opt for other pizza than Lou's.
Thin crust pepperoni  Holy pizza Gods   The most delicious, buttery crust, heavenly slice you will put in your mouth! I promise! Definitely getting it again...THIS WEEK!

What can I say? Pizza the best ever! It was Chicago!! Have always wanted to try it! Everyone there told us we couldn't leave without trying this pizza! It was incredible!! Tasted even better leftovers for breakfast!! AND IT WAS VEGETARIAN!! I was in love!

In my books this is the true winner of the Chicago deep dish contest!! Always a must when guests come to Chicago from out of town! Service is a true reflection of the leadership of this incredible company. My family craves it to the point we send them frozen pizzas to other states by LM brilliant shipping program. A MUST when visiting the great city of Chicago!
Got the calamari, cheese bread and of course the butter crust.  Couldn't have been better.
so good, one of chicago's best.  Their sausage is hard to beat and delicious butter crust
Great Deep Dish Pizza !  This is classic Chicago Pizza, their pizzza recipes come from the original Chicago Deep Dish Pizza creators.

Visiting Chicago for the first time and had to try some deep dish. The place was packed, yet all staff was very nice. Our server was excellent. The Malnati deep dish was excellent, but incredibly filling! Make sure to order an app as it takes some time to cook the pizza.
Lou's has solid deep dish pizza, but there are definitely other options in Chicago. The single portion size is a bit smaller than other spots.

I came here because one of my friend talked to me about this place. When we arrived, waiters were waiting and talking and looked bored. They didn't pay attention to us and there was a horrible odor in the restaurant. They put dirty socker shoes on the wall (you can see the dirty grass and mud on it!). At this time I wanted to leave but we stay because we thought that maybe the food worths it. The waitress was very unhappy and fed up. After 40 min our pizzas arrived. The vegetables inside the pizza were very good and pretty healthy and tasty, but the dought was too crispy and very hard to eat. I won't come back and I don't recommend to go to this place as there are so much places better than this one.

Hosts were great!  Service was excellent! Pizza was wack. I don't eat cheese, I got the Lou with all the veggies tho. I thought maybe it was because it was cheeseless, but my partner was unimpressed with her pepperoni pizza. The crust was crispy and crunchy, but didn't make up for the swamp on top of it. there was a giant party in the room, and the servers brought out like 9 big pizzas. So maybe their focus was elsewhere, and it was just bad timing to have dinner then. I may go back, but not until I've tried other options.

Very good deep dish pizza and desert here! The proportions of the pizza are reasonable, so when you take a pizza for 1 person you can actually finish it! They have good beer and good service, and the price is reasonable.

This is my favorite pizza place in the city (dining in, take out, or delivery). They cook everything to order so it's very delicious and ingredients seem really fresh. The service at the register (if taking out) could be more pleasant. The ladies always seems like they hate being there. Other than that, this is my go to place when anyone's in town and wants Chicago style pizza.
Great pizza! Came here with my family and we shared the large deep dish lou, the house salad and a pitcher of sangria. The food easily fed 5. Great place to bring visitors for "Chicago Pizza"

Very delicious deep dish pizza. It takes approximately 40 minutes for the pizza to be ready. We also ordered Wings and they were on point as well! Must try if you are in town. Excellent customer service! :)

My Uber driver recommended Lou Malnati's as the best deep dish in Chicago. I'm glad I took him up on this recommendation! The restaurant was full, but luckily I did not have to wait too long for a table.  Calamari - I had high hopes for this appetizer, but unfortunately it fell short. For starters, there was barely better breading. It was also a little rubbery. Chicago Classic Pizza - Very tasty and balanced. Their crust was crispy and buttery, and the deep dish pizza wasn't just full of cheese and sauce. The sausage is laid out in larger chunks, which was interesting! In all I was satisfied with this pizza. The service was decent, and the prices reasonable. I'd definitely come back.
My favorite pizza in Chicago and the world! Excellent service and they deliver! Love the menu but it is hard to order anything other than pizza. Love the buttercrust!
It's all about the crust with this take on the historic Chicago deep dish.

Can't visit Chicago without trying an authentic Chicago deep dish pizza!! Researched for a good pizza spot and Lou malnati's kept coming up. So many locations, we happened to be close to this one. We had a medium size malnati classic. It was more than enough for two people. Came out perfect temp, hot, cheese melted perfectly, crust was delicious. Definitely comfort food! Great for any occasion!
My entire family loves Lou Malnati's! We think the best deep dish in the city! I grew up eating Lou's and now my kids are obsessed with it too! A Chicago classic.

Classic Chicago pizza! You will not find better. I love the taste, the crossed, the sauce - - everything about it. Also love their salads. I would definitely recommend getting one to go with the pie. Only thing I found lacking was our server. He seemed a bit overwhelmed by the crowd.   Never really got a order right
The food is awesome,the best deep dish in Chicago, the staff is fun and great, a must do when shy-town.

they do make a very good pizza..  i would say give it a go but for instance.. 2 medium pizza and a really really good garbage salad ( try that out ) 60 bucks.. Chicago is a big city and such but man it would  feel great if that was 48 bucks .. I guess ya just get over it.. it's a must stop regardless .. the pizza did feed 5 people light eaters  so I suppose 12 per person is pretty good.. it's one of the best for sure

Great pizza every time.  Opened a new place in Phoenix, and it is mobbed with former Chicago people and others who call eating this pizza a religious experience.  If you have never eaten this pizza you owe it to yourself to do it at least once.

Very delicious! We came to compare it to Giordano's. Verdict: Giordano's in Navy Pier is better.  However, I did really like this place. I would still come back. We got a free appetizer since we joined their email club, which was awesome. The pizza was less expensive than Giordano's. I would so come back. Service was great. Wait wasn't that long for a table at 8pm on a Sunday evening.  Must try both everyone!
Lou!  This pizza is crazy.  It might just be my favorite food.
The best pizza chain in Chicago hands down.  Don't stop into a tourist trap Chicago deep dish restaurant when you can find Lou Malnatis in the Gold Coast.

The pizza is legit the best pizza in Chicago.  We ordered the classic and it did not disappoint.  Catherine our sever was awesome! She made our visit very enjoyable.  Make sure u finish your pizza or else you will be labeled Buttercup for life  Great Time!

If you're serious about trying Chicago pizza, you can't miss Lou Malnatis. My first love was Giordanos. Tried Gino's and was underwhelmed. Lou Malnatis sausage and cheese blew both away. It's worth the wait!

Simply the best pizza in Chicago.  The deep dish has a fantastic crust and the tomato sauce is very chunky.  Thin crusts are always perfectly prepared with fresh ingredients that will take your breath away.  Mouthwatering delicious pizza.
The deep dish pizza is okay. I prefer the thin crust  pizza. The pizza takes 40 minutes and I rather go somewhere else like MOD pizza. Not worth the wait. The service is good.

Attention GLUTEN FREE people! I've been gluten free for almost 4 years (Food Allergen not choice). Lou's has the BEST GF pizza I've ever tasted. It's deep dish and absolutely amazing. If you're looking for a decadent, rich and flavorful gf pizza, look no further - try Lou's, you won't be disappointed.  Furthermore, we had a larger group (13) and her great service, quick refills and had a great time. There's a great casual atmosphere that makes you feel at home even if it's your first time there.  Pricing is moderate. My personal gf pizza was about $15, which I consider it well worth it The only con I can give was the sangria. It was priced well at $30 for a pitcher, but it tasted liked watered down wine. Definitely wouldn't order again.  Overall, great place, vibe and food. Check it out!!!

this is my favorite pan pizza. went to location in lincolnwood il years ago and loved it then . i know live on southside of chicago and pick mine up on 95th street in oak lawn. their  sausage and mushrooms always taste so fresh and the crust is thick with a crispy edge.i dont care for lots of sauce so this is great for me .....wish they would open a sit down location on south side of chicago or suburbs ..

The pizza tastes like a scrumptious meal, it's simply delicious (love the Lou), the bruschetta is good and the tiramisu is out of this world. These guys and gals must be doing something right, have not been disappointed after countless orders.

AMAZING pizza! Loved that we were able to put our pizza order in (when we had a 40 minute wait) and walk across the street to a bar while we waited. They texted us when the table was ready, we sat down ordered the cheese bread and a round of drinks(all came within 10 minutes) and as we were finishing the first round the pizza arrived. All perfectly made and great timing! The pizza was awesome, loved the crust! The staff was friendly and inviting. WILL be going back! 5+

This review is purely on the service of this restaurant. Upon arriving we were told it would be long wait (which is perfectly fine) however then the hostess proceeded to roll her eyes and talk nasty. The food may have great reviews however this service especially from a waitress which is the first person you see when you walk in is unacceptable. Not only did they lose a group of 15 today, but we also will NEVER come here again. What a rude waitress, so unfortunate she ruined the restaurant for us.

Best Chicago pizza I've had.  Sauce was spot on with lots of cheese.  We also enjoyed the spinach bread for app.  Only gripe was tap water......wish there was some better filtered water.  But small gripe.

Finally, got to try the food at Lou Malnati's. Was very busy. We had to wait for like 5 mins even though the hostess said it would be 20. Unlike most of the people who go here for deep dish pizza, my gf and I didn't want that at all. We started with 3 cheese bread, which was really good. Then we ordered a Malnati salad and a small gluten free pizza. The salad was big in size and could easily be a dinner for one. The gluten free pizza was nice and crisp. My gf loved it as she always craves for nice gluten free food. Overall, nice place for family dinner.

I started with the Giant calamari served with lemon and marinara with the cake. Marinara so good you could drink it. Then I had the Lou special which I added onions to. This is the best pizza I've ever put in my mouth. It's like making love to your taste buds. Because it was my birthday, they gave me a complementary deep dish chocolate chip cookie with vanilla bean ice cream whipped cream and a cherry on top. I will definitely be back.

We had to get deep dish pizza before we left Chicago! We came to chi town for MLK weekend and hours before we had to be at the airport going home, we stopped by Lou's. We ordered "The Lou" and it was phenomenal. It was the perfect temperature, cheesy but not too much, and I loved that the vegetables still tasted like vegetables.  They warn you that it can take 30 min or so before the food comes out and I greatly appreciated that. We weren't too hungry when we arrived so the wait was fine.

Believe the hype. This pizza is the best when it comes to any of the local places with more than a couple of locations. There are still great mom and pop independent places but, when it comes to multi establishments, this place is tops.

We were in town for the weekend and couldn't leave without Chicago-style pizza. Everyone recommended Lou's, but didn't particularly mention a location to hit up. Fortunately, enough we happened to be in the River North area.  We came with no reservations and was anticipating a line. However, we were coming at the end of the lunch rush on Friday afternoon - just as the restaurant started to turn for dinner. We were able to have a peaceful late lunch looking seated next to the upstairs windows. I guess we kind of got lucky with that.  Our eyes were definitely bigger than our stomachs. We ordered the garlic bread appetizer and a medium Malnati's Classic. We had more than enough food for 2 people. Despite our waitress warning us that the pizza usually serves 4 people, we figured we were that hungry. The garlic bread good as greasy, but tomato dipping sauce helped even it all out. The pizza was absolutely delicious and best eaten warm with the ooey-gooey cheese spilling over. I wished we ordered a salad, just so we would feel better about our gluttony. Packed up the rest of the pizza in a box. Unfortunately, by the time we got back to our apartment the pizza slices had formed into a layered pizza block. Put in the fridge and surprisingly it was delicious cold as well the next day on my flight back. Even if it was cold, it was better than any airport food I could have bought.

For dinner on my first night in Chi-town, I knew it had to involve pizza. Deep dish pizza. I've heard the saying that only tourists seek out the famous Chicago-style pizza, but this spot looked like a local's favorite. Lou Malnati's looks like a tavern or pub and has a welcoming vibe. Very patriotic with their sports team memorabilia decorating the walls. The staff is great: super friendly and attentive. The chain restaurant of Lou Malnati's has traditional dishes you'd normally find at an Italian restaurant - with the exception of the pizza. We ordered the fried calamari as an appetizer and the chicken pasta and cheese deep dish pizza for our entree. All enough to share between four people and have some leftovers. The calamari was good - not greasy or overly cooked to the point of overly chewy, just the right amount of chew and crunch. They came with a cocktail dipping sauce. The chicken marsala pasta was delicious: rigatoni pasta covered in a creamy, white sauce mixed in with chunks of chicken breast and mushrooms and topped with shavings of parmesan and slivers of basil. It felt homemade, which is what made it better. The pizza is allotted a certain amount of cooking time which it tells you on the menu, so hopefully you're not in a rush. Either way, it's worth the wait. We ordered the large pizza and only six out of the eight slices. They're thick slices of pizza. Crunchy on the outside and soft and chewy on the inside with a hefty amount of cheese and sauce; you'll be happy you waited thirty minutes. Their dessert menu did look enticing, but we were so full from dinner that we could not fathom eating a chocolate chip pizza or tiramisu. I'm sure it was fantastic.  You have to check them out if you're craving really good Italian food.

So this is kinda crazy, but we came here for the pizza and left raving about the salad! Don't get me wrong, the pizza was amazing...everything that I wanted a Chicago deep dish pizza to be! (Make sure you get the butter crust!) But we shared a Malnati salad before our pizza came out and it was the best salad I've ever had. I wish I could eat bowls of it every night!

Fairly good pizza, but I don't understand why people make such a big fuss. I like Giordano's quite a bit better, but Lou Malnati's isn't bad either. To be honest, I prefer deep dish pizza in San Francisco (Patxi's, Little Star) because of the cornmeal crust. Lou Malnati's crust just tastes bland.

When you're in town for only 24 hours and you have to eat Chicago, you get deep-dish pie.  However, being gluten-free (not by choice, trust me, i wish I could smash my way through a Chi-town hot dog/pizza/sammich fest), I figured I'd be relegated to crying sorghum tears over another one-size, flat, cardboardish, probably-bought-from-Udi's-and-marketed-as-"'made daily in house" pizza.   Damn, I was SO wrong.   So Lou Malnati's gluten-free deep dish isn't really a bread crust; it's made out of sausage.  Hold up. Wait.  Rewind.  A sausage crust available in multiple sizes, you say?  And I don't have to pay $5 extra for it?  Whoooooo Yep. And after careful deliberation, myself and a friend opted for the smaller size (and a two-slice serving was pretty filling). The pie took a bit of time to make, prob 20-30 min, but I'm used to waiting a bit longer for my grub so I was ok with it, besides, I needed to let my three lunches settle anyway.   Once it arrived, the smell of the freshly cooked sausage topped with fresh mozzarella just wafted its way up to my face,  slapped me and said "Welcome to Lou's!" Delightful spice, fresh tomatoes, amazing sauce, I was sad I couldn't eat more, and am even sadder I left the extra slice in the hotel fridge.

Insanely good. I'm from the east coast and didn't even know that Chicago deep dish was completely different than the Pizza Hut deep dish we are used to around here. One of the best pizza's I have literally ever eaten.
Brilliant Chicago style pizza in a place with a great vibe.  Looking forward to going back - loved it.

Had to have deep dish pizza while in Chicago and this was by far the best! The crust, sauce, the cheese it was all so good. Not a huge fan of deep dish compared to ny style.. but still tasted delicious.  BE PREPARED TO WAIT. We waited for probably an hour to sit and then some for the pizza as it takes awhile to be made. Luckily they allowed us to put in our order while we were waiting to be seated.

I was in Chicago for a couple of days so I didn't get a chance to try too many pizza joints. Sad to say I thought Lou Malnati's was pretty underwhelming, especially considering the long wait. Maybe it was the pizza we ordered (pepperoni and sausage). The sausage wasn't so great. I'm obviously not going to judge a city's pizza by one meal; I hope the next experience I have of the pizza changes my mind.

Of course you have to try the Chicago deep dish when you are in Chicago!  I ordered the famous Malnati Chicago classic deep dish and a side salad.  YUM. The deep dish was delicious and flavorful! My first time trying deep dish and the crust along with the meat, sauce and cheese melted in my mouth.  The Lou malnati's salad dressing is BOMB Also!! Would definitely come again and recommend :)
This is my favorite pizza in Chicago. Yum yum yum. They do deliver but it never really tastes the same!

First let me mention that I am NOT from Chicago. But on a recent trip there I wanted to try the best authentic deep dish that the city had to offer. There were several names that repeatedly surfaced after a few minutes of research, Lou's was one of them and it happened to be the closest to my hotel.  This place was good. It felt authentic inside. Had that quintessential red and white tablecloth feel that is necessary for any down home Italian joint.  We ordered the deep dish and were cautioned by our server that it would probably take about a half hour. We agreed and that would have been great but it took a full hour to get the pie.  It was good. It was not any better than Uno's deep dish though which is a big ol' national chain and available just about anywhere. That took the uniqueness off of this experience for me but that's just as much the result of the fact that Uno makes a pretty great pie.

The deep dish is the best in the city in my opinion. The crust is to DIE for, and there's a perfect balance of sauce and cheese.  My only complaint is the thin crust is not as good as many other places. But it's more of a deep dish restaurant anyways, so stick to that and you'll be fine. Also the Malnati salad is worth a try as a split appetizer.   I also know quite a few people who work as servers here, and because of this I know the company treats their employees very well and most enjoy working here.

This place has quite the hype around it but after going, it is totally worth the hype.   We went for dinner on a Saturday so we knew it would be busy but also knew we would wait for a table. We were told it would take 30-45 minutes but we were seated in about 20 minutes.   Out waitress was very attentive given how busy it was and we were happy with the service we got.   Adam and I ordered "The Malnati Chicago Classic" and we were so beyond happy with what we got. Since it is a deep dish pizza it does take a little longer to make but the wait to get or food wasn't too bad and in the end we were so full and had so much left over that it was worth it. The sausage on it was perfect. I loved that it covered the entire pizza and not just crumbled around the pizza, it ensured we got a good amount of sausage in every bite. Also, the sauce wasn't over-powering and there was a perfect amount of cheese. The crust was softer but not chewy and it wasn't too crispy. It was literally perfect.   This place knows what it is doing and I am so happy that it does know, it made coming here amazing. I highly suggest coming here if you are in the area.
best pizza in chicago.. love big lou's salad!

I don't know what these people are thinking! Had one of the named special Lou pizzas I think and it was just bland and blah and un appetizing. Wow disappointed since people say this is chicago best. I'd rather eat a frozen pizza. Yea I said it. Go somewhere else and try and find something with flavor
Great deep dish pizza. You can't do better.  Good drinks and a good bartender.  What else could you ask for on a cold Sunday night!
No really sure why everyone goes crazy for this place. The pizza is not great and its very touristy af.

My first review of 2017!  DISCLAIMER  I'm not actually at Lou Malnati's in Chicago. I'm in the comfort of my home in Portland Oregon watching the Golden Globes eating my Lou Malnati's pepperoni pizza.  The pizza was a gift from one of my favorite sales reps who lives in Chicago. It was one of 4 Pepperoni Pizzas that she sent me for Christmas. I gave each of my 3 brothers a pizza.  These Lou Malnati's Pepperoni Pizzas are an excellent representation of the definitive Chicago Deep Dish Pizza. They are OUTSTANDING! Thank you again RB! Sent from my iPad According to a Fengshui Master in HK: This February won't come in our lifetime again. Because this February has 4 Sundays, 4 Mondays, 4 Tuesdays, 4 Wednesdays, 4 Thursdays, 4 Fridays & 4 Saturdays. This only happens once every 823 years. This is called money bags. So share to at least 5 people or 5 groups and money will arrive within 4 days. Based on Chinese Feng Shui. Share within 11 minutes of reading.  I'm not actually at Lou Malnati's in Chicago.
I went here over thanksgiving vacation.  This pizza is the most amazing deep dish I have ever had.  I can't wait for the next family visit !

Went to the Oak Park Location with a friend. We had there traditional thin crust pizza. I have to honestly say that neither I or my friend were impressed with there pizza. I think Salerno's has a much better pizza.

Penne ala Malnati can you say YUM!!! Also their Tiramisu  is one of the better ones i have EVER had! The The Malnati Chicago Classic was good, but unfortunately I am more of a thin crust pizza person.  Still dreaming about that pasta though!

This one is my favorite of the popular deep dish pizzas. I actually really recommend doing the veggie stuffed pizza - it's delicious! The environment is also fun and the waiters have always been super nice. I live right next to one and the temptation is always there! Be prepared though because deep dish pizza is heavy!

Picking the best pizza place in Chicago is kind of a local obsession, and Lou Malnati's takes the cake! Great pizza in a great part of Chicago. If you want to try Chicago style pizza this is the place to go to.
Best pizza I've had in Chicago, possibly the best pizza I've had anywhere.  I've eaten at a few deep dish places in the city, and this is by far my favorite.
Amazing deep dish pizza! If I were you, Id get the deep dish pizza with pepperoni. Great and safe place to bring your family when they come to visit in the city!

This is some of the best pizza I've tasted. So good. I was staying a couple of blocks away and the hotel suggested I arrive early because the restaurant was small and fills up quickly. They were right. I walked up about a half hour before the restaurant opened and there was already a line. The restaurant did fill up quick and probably not even ten minutes after it opened the bar and all of the tables were full and there was a wait. I sat at the bar and not only did I enjoy a couple of local Chicago brews, but I took the bartender's suggestion and ordered some garlic bread to tide me over until my pizza was cooked. It does take a bit to cook deep dish, I think I waited about 40 minutes, but it was worth it.  I think you'll find that it's worth it too.
Great pizza and wonderful lunch specials! Its a great spot for visitors that want to try Chicago style pizza!

My favorite pizza joint by far 100 percent worth every penny. Get a large pizza so you can take some home otherwise you will be wishing a day later you still had some more!  The salads go great with the pizza. The wine is pretty decent as well.
In my honest opinion best pizza in town, and the same awesome taste at any of their resturants.

If you're into crispy deep dish then this place is for you! I got the Chicago deep dish style and tbh, I enjoyed the crust because I like the crisp  definitely fulfilling. You get to place your name first and then place your order as well so when you get seated, you won't have to wait for the pizza as long. However, I went during 9 pm and no wait; I suggest for those impatient people to do that and just eat later to avoid the hangry-ness.  Side note: the minestrone soup was actually pretty bomb!

Stopped by here on our trip in from LA because almost every local we talked to said we had to try Lou's for deep dish.  We went for lunch and got sat right away, it wasn't too busy.  We got the buffalo wings which were incredibly tender and delicious and then finished with the Classic Lou's deep dish and it was great.  The crust is buttery and crunchy and has a ton of flavor.  The service was pretty slow (not the food, I know deep dish takes awhile to cook) server was nice but only came by to take our order and drop the bill never saw him in between.  Overall a good experience and would definitely recommend.

I LOVE PIZZA and finally made my way to Chicago. Had been dying to try acutal chicago deep dish pizza as i've mostly been a NY Pizza kind of guy. It was definitely good but...not amazingly mind blowing? maybe it got hyped up too much but it just was OK to me. Would definitely recommend it if you're visiting Chicago. If you're a fan of knife and fork pizza it's perfect but I like eating with my hands.
I think deep dish Pizza is vastly overrated, but this is the best of the lot and I do order it on occasion.  Good place.

I decided to come here after a friend recommended it to me to try when I was in Chicago. As a New Yorker, I'm often convinced that New York pizza is the best pizza, period. After this trip, I can honestly say that a fair comparison cannot be honestly made. NY-style pizza and Chicago deep dish are two entirely different things. You eat deep dish with a fork and knife and you eat NY style with your hands. Try to do one or the other and you'll either look weird in NY eating your slice with a fork and knife or you bathe your hands in oil eating deep dish in Chicago with your hands.  Now onto the real review here for Lou Malnati's. I was in town for work and decided to give it a go before heading back to O'Hare. Service in the afternoon was quick and easy and I struck up a conversation with the bartender there that afternoon. He helped me walk through their menu and ultimately convinced me to get the Lou. I got an individual portion just for myself. My oh my, was I surprised to see just how much a small pizza was and how filling it was! The crust was flaky and the sausage was a perfect complement to the pizza, though the oil on the pizza was a bit much at times. Fork and knife definitely needed! The staff's recommendations were spot on and their pizza was something that allowed me to taste something unique to Chicago. I enjoyed the food overall and the service was great. Granted that it wasn't a super busy late Friday afternoon (it was 25 degrees out) I was glad to have been able to eat some good Chicago deep dish while also being able to converse with some locals.  The debate between who has the better pizza between New York and Chicago needs to be put to rest. They're two completely different things. If you're in Chicago, pay Lou's a visit...they have multiple locations. Great spot!

Our first experience with deep dish Chicago pizza. it was very good. We had pepperoni and mushroom pizza with buttercrust. We would definitely visit again. The beer selection was also great and the place was kid friendly.

Wow... this pizza is what dreams are made of! I was excited to try true Chicago deep dish, and even though plenty of other places in town claim to have it, Lou Malnati's was really special. Walked in on a Saturday and it was crowded, so we waited for a table. You're able to place an order while you wait for your table, which is brilliant because it does take a while for their pizza (forty or so minutes). As it was just my fiancé and I, we snagged a bar table instead of waiting for our reservation. Our waiter was so nice and brought our beer quickly while we waited for the pizza to cook. My fiancé's silverware was dirty and he immediately brought a new knife and fork; really attentive and personable! The pizza was amazing; we ordered a small pepperoni deep dish, and it was the perfect size for two. The cheese is on the bottom with very flavorful tomatoes on top, and their Buttercrust is divine. I've heard some people find it "too cheesy," but those words aren't in my vocabulary so I'm not sure how to respond. The pizza was also super reasonable, making it an excellent lunch before walking around the city to burn a few calories off. Lou Malnati's will be my go-to for deep dish and I'm looking forward to a return visit!

Its great but they dont know when to take off the meat.That is why I give it 4 stars.It is good the staff is helpful but we were in there for 5 min waiting to order and 20 min to get it.I still like the pizza though
Another great visit! Our server, Ana, is very nice. She is very attentive and we had a great chat with her. The classic deep dish is a must! Great buttery crust and very filling.
Always a great place to eat deep dish in Chicago. But usually is always packed! Go figure.
You can't go wrong with Lou's. Deep dish is much better than their thin crust pizza. Never dined in, always do delivery. One of Chicago's best pizzas!

Um yep this place is awesome!  From that buttery crust to the lean Italian sausage to the homemade tomato sauce on top, Lou Malnati's is the standard upon which I judge Chicago deep dish.  The service here is top notch and the servers are spot on with their recommendations.  Loved the spinach cheese bread.  It was called something else but basically it was spinach with tonnnns of gooey cheese baked in a delicious flakey crust.  I recommend the baked cookie dish with ice cream and whip cream for dessert.  Carb overload but totally worth it!
Was a charming location, wait staff was friendly despite their being busy.  We ordered the deep dish sausage pizza, which if you love wall to wall sausage is for you.

I came here with my mom and sisters after hearing good things about it while in Chicago from locals. We had tried Uno the day before. I personally liked Lou's better than Unos, but both were delicious.  The wait was so long and we were starving by the time we sat down. Even though we put our order in at arrival we had to wait almost 45 minutes for our pizza. They were busy of course.  Definitely go if you have the time, but don't go super hungry because you're going to have to wait!

Chicago is known for deep dish pizza and so that was what my friends and I were set out to try. Lou Malnati's was recommended by both of my friends as Giordano's was deemed the tourist trap. We got one small pizza (meant to share between two people). I wanted The Lou for that garlic butter crust but my friends wanted the Classic since it had meat. We were able to compromise and get our pizza ordered half Lou and half Classic.  The wait was expected to be half an hour and usually the small pizza is cut up into four pieces but since we were three people, they asked if we wanted it cut into six pieces instead. I didn't have much expectations for deep dish pizza. I had expected it to be similar to lasagna instead of pizza but I was wrong. The thickness was only about an inch deep and it came in its own personal pan but our server helped served each piece on our plate.  THE LOU This was my favorite simply for those Roma tomatoes. So flavorful with the sauce and three cheeses and the garlic butter crust. If it had meat, it might be even better.  THE MALNATI CHICAGO CLASSIC This was nothing to sniff at either. It pales slightly in comparison to The Lou in my opinion in terms of flavor but since it has sausage, that brings it back up a notch. I ate with a knife and fork and cutting into the crust can be a little difficult. During my last piece, I stabbed my pizza and it popped off my plate. Whoops. 5 second rule. I'm not letting that slice go to waste. I'm usually a thin crust pizza kind of girl but Lou Malnati's is beginning to change my mind on deep dish pizza.
This is by far the best pizza we've had in the States. It tastes home made, and the deep dish crust was on point.

I wanted to give this place five stars, but I think we can all agree it shouldn't take 20 minutes to be greeted by a waitress when a restaurant isn't all that busy. When we did get greeted, it turned out that our waitress was very friendly. For my first Chicago deep dish pizza, I thought it was great. I wasn't really digging the crust, but the flavor on the inside mattered more. We got half the Lou and half Malnati Chicago Classic. My boyfriend and I both favored the Lou more. I'm not a huge Italian sausage fan, but the lean sausage on the Malnati was a game changer! We shared a small, and it was still a lot for us! The other issue we had was seeing the crowded staff standing around past the bar. With that much idle staff, I'm not sure how it took 20 minutes to get us a waiter. :(
Our first experience with Chicago style pizza. It was wonderful. We had to order it again before we left and headed back home.

Me and my fiance saw this place on yelp with the highest rating. We went there it was crowded..so ordered to go.. 2 personal pizzas of their specialties. It was over priced but not as much as Gino's East. Paid almost $50 with the addition of a couple of toppings. The wait was a little long but we understand they were busy. The pizza was good...had it for leftovers the next was not bad.  We may go back to give it another try.
The atmosphere is always great. The pizza is delicious. They even have a no-carb pizza for anyone on the Atkins diet! I'd give it 5 stars if the staff were consistently more pleasant.

It's Lou's... what else would you expect.  Stuffed spinach and sausage was perfect.  The thin pepperoni was good... but I think they cooked it at the same time as the deep and it was cold. Still tasted good.  I'm a born and raised Chicagoan and try to get Lou's every time I'm back home... and have it delivered a couple times a year too.

Lou's is well known across Chicago for the deep dish pizza. Having tried Lou's and giordanos, I'd have to say I'm more of a Lou's fan. The crust is the selling point, very buttery, it has an excellent flavor and crisp. I actually prefer the thin crust, so whatever crust you pick, Lou's is a great choice!
love lou's pizza, dont like the thin crust though otherwise good operation and pick up and delivery are good

Okay, here's the deal. I don't like their pizza.  I don't like deep dish in general, but I particularly, seriously, don't like theirs.  Okay, so that's my problem, why the heck do I go there?. When I have guests in from out of town, they always want to go, and they always enjoy it. I turn my nose up at the pizza and have the spicy buffalo wings, and I like those just fine, and go through a huge pile of napkins and make a mess, so all good. The crowd is bustling, once you get seated the service is generally very good, and it's a pretty fun place to go, get a pitcher of beer and enjoy watching your out-of-town guests get into Chicago style pizza. So as much as I don't like their pizza, I am still a fan for the overall noisy, crowded, fun experience.

When in Chicago here is the place to go for deep dish pizza! The butter crust is the bomb and their sauce is the best. I really love their salads as well and they are huge. The service is great each time I have been here when visiting Chicago, even when they are extremely busy. I highly recommend Lou Malnati's for pan pizza. I'll keep coming back each time we're out that way as there's no other place like it I've found! 2016 Review #85

High praise for "The Lou". I have never been to the restaurant but I attend an event which orders Lou Malnati's every week.  Now, I have had a couple decades of pizza, more than enough to last a lifetime, and I am Never happy to see pizza served at an event even if it is free. However, I was introduced to The "Lou" which is a vegetarian deep dish pizza, and I am sold.  I am not even a vegetarian and I actual Look Forward to having a slice every week, even after many many weeks I have not grown tired of it.  The "Lou" has converted me back into being a pizza eater after many years of being a pizza avoider.  What more can I say.
This is the best deep dish in the city of Chicago....that is all.

i moved to Chicago about 3 years ago and could not try the pizza fast enough that every one talks so highly about. it was different than florida pizza being that it was so thick and takes 45 minutes to cook. but it was well worth the wait and now Every time I visit Chicago i always have to stop by and have some of their original deep dish pizza.   It is by far the most delicious pizza I have experienced.

A colleague and I were in Chicago on business and we had to have Chicago-style pizza. Our hotel suggested this place as it was right around the corner from the hotel.  We were seated right by the window at a high-top table.  We shared a salad and pizza. We started with the Malnati Salad - Romaine lettuce, tomatoes, black olives, mushrooms, salami bits and gorgonzola cheese with our Sweet Vinaigrette and romano cheese.  I loved everything in it.  And it was huge.  The two of us could not finish it. For our pizza, we had the Malnati Chicago Classic - Made with Lou's lean sausage, some extra cheese and vine-ripened tomato sauce on Buttercrust. Super thick and gooey.  Loved it.  Definitely a knife and fork pizza and very filling. If you are looking for authentic Chicago style pizza, this is your place.  Its a fun atmosphere with sports on the TV's.  Definitely will be back the next time I am in Chicago.

This is always a big hit for catering our quarterly meeting.  We had salad, deep dish with different toppings, and thin crust with different toppings.  The delivery was on time and the pizza was piping hot.

Came here on a weekend trip to Chicago, wanting to try some real Chicago deep dish pizza. I have to say it felt like your standard Italian chain restaurant (which I guess it is). Everything--food, service, atmosphere--was all perfectly solid, but nothing special. We tried the "Lou" pizza (spinach, mushrooms, tomato and cheese), which was all right but a little bland. Same with the garlic bread we tried. Seems like a safe bet for a decent meal, but next time I might venture out and try something a little more independent to get something more interesting.

How cool was it that when I alluded to the deep dish pizza being lukewarm bc we made changes to the order that waiter brought it back out piping hot and unnecessarily comped. Chicago institution and glad to have visited.
Don't let the wait in line deter you. They have you order the pizza while you are waiting so when you sit down you only have to wait a few minutes more. Genius. Delicious! Get THE LOU deep dish.
This is one of my favorite places for Chicago deep dish pizza. Their pizza is perfect and every time I have out of town visitors I bring them here. Never been disappointed.

There was no wait when we went for lunch and we were seated right away. The waitress was very helpful when we asked for suggestions. Everything on the menu looked appetizing. We finally decided on their house salad and a deep dish pizza. The food was absolutely delicious! I don't know what they put in their salad dressing, but it is addicting. The pizzas were made to perfection and the crust was very crunchy and chewy. We ended up buying a bottle of their dressing on the way out because I knew I was going to crave it. It's that good!
If you like the deep dish pizza you'll LOVE this place!  The salad is good the pizza is Great!  And they have New Holland Brewing The Poet which is hard to find awesome beer.

Good deep dish pizza and open late!  Not too crowded if you come in late, but man, I was surprised how many people were walking into the restaurant at almost midnight!  And they kept letting people in, which was pretty cool MOZZARELLA STICKS: terrible.  awful.  stay away.  It tasted like they barely made it out of the freezer before getting on the plate.  I think the appetizer menu exists only because the deep dish takes ~45 min so they want you to have something to munch on, even if it's awful. DEEP DISH PIZZA: the pizza came out a little underdone.  I would have liked the dough to be more cooked, but it came out a little doughy and floury.  The menu does say you can request the pizza your way but I didn't know what standard was but if I knew it was undercooked pizza i would have requested it be well done dough. Loved the sausage topping. The Small doesn't give you as much a feel for deep dish since it's really only 4 pieces.  It's not a stuffed pizza though. Ask for ranch dressing.  Well if you like it, but dipping the crust in ranch dressing is so good. Liked this place way better than Giordano's.  One thing Giordano's had going for it was that you can order your pizza as soon as you check in, so even if you wait 45 minutes, your pizza is starting to get fired up so when you sit down, you don't have to wait as long.  Giordano's has more of a "stuffed" feel to it and way cheesier, but the flavor for Lou Malnati's was better for me. Went late at almost 10:45pm and waited maybe 7 minutes to sit down.  It wasn't a long wait at all but I was surprised that almost all the tables were full!

Got off the Plane checked into the hotel and went straight to Lou Malnati's Pizzeria Oh My what a treat. We started off with the brochette it was Amazing a must try. Then we had the Chicago classic I would eat here at least once a week if I lived here. We came to town to watch the San Francisco Giants play the Cubs we were overly impressed with the City of Chicago and the people.

A friend of mine from Chicago once shipped me frozen pizzas from here after discovering that I'd never been to Chicago. The frozen cheese pizzas blew my mind so I was pretty eager to try the "real" version. They recommended the chicago classic, which I got (switched out the sausage for poultry though). It takes 45 minutes to come out of the oven (oy) so I opted to get a soup too.  Soup was pretty good. Service was so-so - unimpressive considering how few people were actually at the restaurant. Then out came the pizza in all its glory. I have to admit that I was far less impressed with the classic than I was with the plain old cheese. The crust and dough was absolutely spectacular but the ingredients themselves overpowered the pizza (which by the way is really heavy). I'd recommend sticking to 1 ingredient to really enjoy the flavor. I love pizza crust (arguably more than the pizza) and their crust was mouthwatering. Worth going just for that! This was the only pizza I had in Chicago so I can't compare but it is worth visiting to try and taste for yourself!

Don't do it to me Lou! Gosh this California girl was hoping for magic and yet it didn't blow me away.. I'm trying to justify why, maybe I didn't earn it? Like maybe I didn't walk around town enough to finally get there and really say wow.. I don't know, but I'm willing to give the pizza another shot..
Lou meets all the pizza hype and then some. The thin crust pizza here is something else. Definitely going back!

Well worth the trip ... all the way from Utah.  The first time I had a Lou Malnati's pie was a couple years ago when a Chicagoan co-worker had a few shipped to Utah and shared them as Christmas gifts.  The frozen version was pretty darn tasty, but when I got to Chicago today that memory led me straight to Lou's for the real deal ... and the real deal did not disappoint!  The pies take about 40 minutes to cook, so if you are in a hurry, this probably is not the place. But 40 minutes is the perfect amount of time to enjoy an order of Lou's traditional buffalo wings, a cold drink and some sports on the bar TV.  I ordered the classic Chicago deep dish pepperoni pizza, though made a mistake and went with the "personal" ("feeds one") variety.  Being a hearty eater, I certainly could have slammed down a small, "feeds two" pie, but that doesn't mean I was disappointed in the food--only my apparent lack of ordering skills.  My pizza was terrific!  Seriously, I am going to insist that my work meeting crew order some Lou Malnati's pies for lunch tomorrow, and you can rest assured that I will be devouring more than a personal pie then.  Bring it on!!!
Holy Smokes!! The BEST pizza in town! Words can't explain. Experience it for yourself. 5 stars!

The service and ambiance were good. We watched college football while we ate lunch. The garlic cheese bread was great, pizza was pretty good. My favorite part of our meal was the cookie pizza dessert. Definitely save room for that!
I've had this place and Giordanos, and lou malnatis is hands down waayyy better! The pizza is juicer and the crust is amazing! Get the small pizza, it's perfect for 3 people.

This place is large and one of the top tourist spots to get some deep dish. I came here with a group of 8 and enjoyed their pizza. We got a veggie pizza and the classic with sausage. I actually liked the veggie one over the sausage. The veggie pizza had more flavor and taste, and the sausage was a tad dry.
The best pizza in the country.  Remember, if getting it delivered, get it uncut!  Will not be soggy!

This is some of the best pizza in Chicago.  Delivery takes a while during busy hours, but that's understandable. We got the deep dish Malnati Chicago Classic with Spinach mix added, and it was excellent.  My wife and I enjoyed it very much, and would gladly order from them again.

I used to work across the street from Lou and usually order for lunch. Many occasions I recommend it for all staff when we wanted to share lunch also. The pizzas are always so delicious and you can taste the freshness in the toppings. The only thing was that it takes quite a bit when you order the whole pizzas. One time we thought the person we sent to order the pizza got lost because it took an hour for him to come back.

Sensational pizza, Chicago's favorite and for a good reason. The deep dish pizza sets the standard for Chicago style. I happen to prefer a thin crust, and it turns out that they also do that very well. As a bonus, our entire family likes their sweet vinaigrette salad dressing (I even found a way to buy it online). Note that since every pizza is made from scratch, the wait at one of their restaurants can be long. We usually call ahead and do carry-out, which turns out to transport very well.

Every Chicagoan has their spot for Deep Dish (which maybe it's just me, but I only eat deep dish at birthday parties and if people come in from out of town). Lou's is my spot and I'll sing it's praises to anyone who dares whisper the name of an inferior competitor when someone asks to try Deep Dish for the first time (or second or 95th time).

Not sure how I feel about this pizza place or if it's just deep dish pizza in general.  Came here STARVING so good thing we ordered appetizers since they told us the pizzas don't come out until like 45 minutes later. We ordered one order of the flatbread that came with 3 different types of dip. This was able to feed our party of 6 - Portions are huge. The dips were good. There was a garlic one, a cheesy one, and one that looked like hummus (It wasn't hummus but couldn't tell what it was). After eating this, I was already full.. haha. The menu said a medium sized pizza only feeds 3 people. Therefore, we ordered two medium sized pizzas. Little did we know, we didn't even eat the second pizza. One medium pizza was enough to feed a party of 6. We ordered the Lou (which is the veggie one) and the Malnati (sausage). The one we actually ate was the Lou. Even though it was veggie and had no meat, it was just so heavy and just wayyyy too cheesy. Definitely felt a little uncomfortable after eating this meal because of the grease. We togo-ed the pizza we didn't touch. After about an hour, the pizza was a hardened rock of cheese. We sadly didn't end up eating this pizza.  Also, it is super cramped inside. Very friendly staff though.

After trying Giordao's, I have to say that this pizza didn't wow me. Lou Malnati makes a thinner deep dish, which means less cheese and sauce. If I want a thinner deep dish, then I would much rather go for an authentic Italisn pizza. But for a deep dish pie, the deeper the better.
Great place. Even if you are from out of town locals love going here. Make sure you get the butter crust and always ad Giardiniera to the pizza as well to make it a complete chicago treat.

The problem with hype lies within itself. In dating I equate it to this: you fancy the pants off somebody (because, presumably, they are awesome) but they kinda know they're awesome, so they make you an deep dish pizza that is... pizza. That might seem harsh (non-sequitur), especially since my expectations is what's at fault here. I had heard great things about Lou's pizza, flew in from LA to try a classic Chicago Deep Dish staple, and once I got in, staff were friendly enough, I sat down, and ordered.  Deep dish takes a while... ... ... ... ... ...it arrived. Not very ceremoniously and soul-crushingly small (to be fair it was personal size). I took my first bite, it was tasty, cheesy and pizza-y everything I expected a pizza to be... but nothing spectacular. The good thing about pizza is that it is good, even when it's bad (*insert sex joke here*), Lou Malnati's pizza is for lack of a better word: good, but as far as the hype goes, expect to be merely "-whelmed" neither over or under.

There is nothing negative one can say about Lou Malnati's Pizza.  It has a great crust, with an extraordinary sauce, and the toppings are great.  I enjoy all varieties of their pizzas, deep dish and thin crust.  I have some dietary problems but I am absolutely thrilled with the thin crust, reduced fat cheese with sausage bits.  I highly recommend Lou Malnati's to anyone who visits.  My sister loves when I send her "Lou to Go" pizzas and my nephew loves Lou's salad dressing.   This is a must for anyone visiting Chicago.

Ate here twice during my 5 day stay to Chicago.  They delivered to the hotel both times.  The first time we met with the deep dish sausage/pepperoni and the second night we went thin crust sausage/pepperoni.  Both were amazing!  I liked the deep dish and my wife liked the thin crust better.  Delivery took an hour both times.

I had the personal sized classic deep dish with sausage on it. It was bland and the crust was soggy. I don't want a salt mine on my pizza but this pie needed a serious pinch of salt on it. The actual pizza versus crust ratio was terrible, almost half of what you get is soggy crust. I personally far prefer giordano's for their deep dish. Will definitely not come here again.

I think they have really good pizza. I got a simple vegetarian pizza and it was delicious, and I really love thin crust. The place was nice, with friendly customer service, however the washrooms were not that clean. I would come back here again.

First time trying a deep dish pizza at Lou Malnati's : great spot ! We decided to be kinda healthy by sharing the Malnati's salad - with Romaine lettuce, tomatoes, black olives, mushrooms, salami bits and gorgonzola cheese with our Sweet Vinaigrette and romano cheese. It was delicious, fresh. Nice blend of ingredient. Then we ordered a small deep dish pizza (way sufficient for 2 people), with half of the Malnati Chicago Classic ( with Lou's lean sausage, extra cheese and vine-ripened tomato sauce on Buttercrus) and half of the Lou pizza. The pizza was very tasty, very cheezy, yum ! The Chicago classic was my favorite. The space is pretty typical of deep dish pizza places in town, with some jerseys on the wall. Service was great as well. Overall I prefered Lou Malnati's compared to Giordano's.
Nice place. Very busy but fast. Service is attentive, food is good, prices are great. What else do you need!
My favorite Chicago style pizza.. Order ahead as it does take a while but pizza and house salad are amazing

Great pizza and great service.  We had deep dish pizza with sausage and cheese bread with marinara sauce as an appetizer.  The marinara sauce and the tomato sauce on the pizza were excellent--bright, fresh and flavorful.

This place always has a long line stretching all the way outside their front door so I just get take out. I love their "The Lou" pizza, never get sick of it. It's a must-eat for all my out-of -town visitors. Many people like their sausage deep-dish, tried it once, just too much meat for my taste.
So far my favorite Chicago deep dish better than Giordano's and Gino's east. The crust is buttery and sauce is tasty. I would go back.
Got a small pizza to share, a bit smaller than I would normally expect but still yummy. Has a great atmosphere. the wait was pretty long but it was a Friday night so not totally unexpected.

[ Food ] -- The "Lou" Personal Pizza -- The Malnati Chicago Classic Personal Pizza [ Ambiance ] -- Seated right when we got in despite the World Series Victory Parade outside -- Super friendly staff even though they had a bunch of tables to service (tough job) -- Warned ahead of time that the pizza would take about 30 min to make [ Parking ] --  Street parking, not too many spaces --  Probably better to park and walk there [ Size ] -- 2 adults [ Cost ] incl. tax & tip -- $26 As it seems most people are saying, this seems to be the Chicago deep dish pizza spot!  Super excited and the people are incredibly friendly.  We were told the pizza would take awhile because they made it fresh (30-40min).  When it arrived, it was cheesy and the outside crust was slightly buttery which I like!  However, the flavors and amount of meat was a little disappointing.  It seemed as bit bland to me, but maybe it gets better if you get a larger pie?  Not sure, but for me, Chicago has a plethora of food options not restricted to deep dish pizza.

The deep dish classic is what we got and it was goooood.  However if you are coming here and are hungry, it takes almost 40 minutes after you order to get your pizza... So best to call ahead.  Service was very friendly

This was a sweet place for my first venture into Chicago-style pizza in Chicago.  The wait wasn't terrible for a Thursday night and the salad and pizza was awesome.  I'd give them a five but the bar service was a bit off (and packed).  I think I was shorted $5 from the bar on a beer I got when we were waiting then one of the Goose Island IPAs tasted like a Miller lite.  I don't think either was intentional, the place was just slammed with business.

I always wanted to try Chicago style, deep dish pizza and my dream finally came true. We came here around 5 pm on Monday and luckily it wasn't busy yet. I liked the deco, family friendly, cozy, a classic pizza restaurant. Since it was our first time, our server was very helpful to explain the menu. She suggested some appetizers, otherwise, we would be waiting for up to 40 minutes for the pizza. We ordered chicken wings with buffalo sauce, 1/2 The Malnati Chicago Classic and 1/2 The "Lou" for two people. For the appetizer, it tasted fine. I loved the pizza which we ordered tasted amazing! We couldn't decide which one we loved more. I was additive to eat the part with cheese and stuffed very quickly. I preferred thick crust pizza over thin ones because they were much filling. By the time we left, people were line up outside of the street.  The pizza here totally blew off my mind and I wish I could take down more than two pieces a time. First time here but it won't be the last time. I will be back for sure.

My husband and I went there before the big dinner crowd at 3:30pm, but it was already so busy and crowded, we were able to put our name in and preorder our pizza. We ordered the Malnati's salad and the classic Malnati's deep dish pizza plus pepperoni, WOW!!!!! The best deep dish ever! They are busy, due to being famous, so expect to wait for your pizza, but well worth it. It is a little pricey, so what! I would come back and I would bring my family.  By the way, we ordered a large pizza and we could only eat 2 pieces, due to being deep dish each slice is big and thick! I will be ordering pizza for shipment to San Diego soon so my family can experience the deliciousness of Lou Malnati's Chicago!

I do not like deep dish but I really enjoyed this pizza!  Perfect balance of crust, sauce, and cheese!  Relaxed environment with helpful servers who cut your pizza for you.  A definite must for anyone visiting Chicago!

The Roma tomatoes. The crust. Oh the cheese. But the Roma tomatoes!  Oh my.  This pizza was three main players all having a Me party while heartwarmingly, at the end of the story, realizing they're all in this together, and that things wouldn't have been the same if they had gone at it alone. Wow.

Coming from California and the land of horrible pizza.... this place was awesome. . Great crust, perfectly cooked and very tasty. Sat at the bar. My bartender David was spot on. Friendly, fast [well not the pizza, takes 40 minutes to make... well worth the wait] and informative. Thanks for the great experience Will definitely be back .

Incredibly disappointing.   No joke not being a hater.    I'm 45 year old foodie.   Trust me.   Airplane food.  Scan alert!!! Go anywhere else.   I'm pissed.  My fist ever Chicago pizza.    Ahhhh.   Bummer.   Total waste of calories.   Never received private email
Always love the malnati salad. This time I got the lou pizza with sausage. Remember to add the sausage as it makes it so much better!

I'm sorry--I hate to be a traitor to my city but I'm probably one of the few people in Chicago that hates deep dish pizza and stuffed pizza.  I'm a pizza purist. I've seen how these folks make pizza crust.It sickens me how they've taken a classic Italian food and bastardized it to fit American taste. No Italian would put butter in their pizza dough EVER!! Pizza should be simple---dough, sauce, cheese and choice of toppings baked in a brick hole in the wall. The crust should be thin because if I wanted to eat bread, I'd go to a bakery. If you have to have a Chicago style pizza, I'd suggest Connie's, the original Nancy's in Elmhurst or Giordano's. Otherwise, if you want to eat REAL pizza then go to Vito and Nicks on the south side  or Nonnie's in the burbs. Chaio!
This pizza is all about the tomatoes. Very good, just wish there were more of them. I thought it was a bit dry as a result. Don't get me wrong, still very good. Crust is solid.

We ordered delivery from this restaurant based on the great dining experience we had last year. The pizza we received was cold, dry and tasteless. The Malnati salad we ordered was good, but the "salami pieces" described on the menu were just what tasted like bacon bits - so disappointed with that as well.
My 20 minute wait was 45. The wait staff was not very attentive.  had to ask for a refill twice and my check 3 times. Pizza wasnt bad.
I always have the chicken loui and the deep dish stuffed spinach pizza they're good. I hate their thin crust pizza it's horrible and tasteless.
best pizza in chicago hands down!  love love love both deep dish and thin crust. we have lou's at least every few weeks. if we don't, we'd have lou's withdrawal!

I'll keep this one short and simple. Awesome pizza and wings! The pizza crust was nice and crispy. Excellent service and they stay open late. We came in around 10:40pm and they closed at 11:00. But they never once rushed us. Clean restrooms and lively atmosphere. Awesome spot for a bite!

We ordered the deep dish pizza and fried calamari to share between my husband and I. The pizza honestly wasn't that great. It was quite dry and hard to chew, but the calamari was superb. I was quite disappointed at their deep dish pizza, would not order that again in the future. Maybe I will come back and try their other dishes next time.
Got the deep dish pepperoni pizza and it was really good. Service was attentive and friendly. Would definitely recommend this place.

Best deep dish I have ever had.  Tried Gino and UNOs, but prefer Lou's by a lot.  Recommend there meat deep dish with their awesome sausage, and their veggie deep dish.  Get butter crust in both.  Only been to Lou's twice, and second trip the meat pizza wasn't hot, just warm - it was still good, but not as good as it should have been.  The veggie was better, and it was hot.  First time visit I had thought sausage pizza was a bit better than veggie.  Can't wait to try the new AZ location.  Now AZ has best deep dish & best thin crust @ pizzeria Biancos!!!
Always a great choice! Pizza is consistently amazing! Hard to describe the crust, with its buttery deliciousness! Must try it!  Malnati salad is also at the top of my list!
Love Lou Malnatis. I use the take out place in Mt Prospect. The deep dish pizza is the best . Also the brushetta if awesome! I always ask for shredded mozarella cheese to spinkle on top
Considering the price/size/taste of the pizza, is quite a bargain

Maybe I'm just a New York pizza girl through and through, but this was my first experience with Chicago pizza and I think Lou's is overrated.  We arrived for an early lunch at 11:30 and were seated immediately but it was 15 minutes before a waitress came over and acknowledged us. Thus, I had a bad impression early on. We decided to get a small "the Lou" pizza to split between two people. This is a veggie pizza with spinach, mushrooms, and tomatoes.
