Since we knew the pizzas took a while, we wanted an app and decided to go with the stuffed spinach bread. This bread was amazing and was the highlight of our meal...super cheesy and delicious. However, we were disappointed with the pizza. The crust was bland and definitely not buttery considering that they call it their "buttercrust", and the cheese and toppings were just alright. Nothing to write home about. The atmosphere is casual, with TVs both upstairs and downstairs. Prices are reasonable considering how filling the pizza is. Maybe Chicago pizza just isn't my thing, or I should try one of the other well known spots for it to see if they do it better.

First the good stuff:  I am a long time Chicago area native, this is my favorite deep dish.  Love the crust(I like the regular better than the buttercrust upgrade).  Always order a sausage, mushroom, onion - but like some of the other reviewers, don't like the way they have the sausage as one large piece the same diameter as the pizza.  The flavor is great, so we order it with "sausage crumbles" to take care of the too much sausage ratio.  The salad was good, really enjoy our meal every time! Now the part that pissed me off:  the greeter at the door.  As we were leaving our musical at 10:30, I called to see if there was a long wait (if so we had the option of carry-out as our condo is very close by), and told no wait.  When we arrived, there was no waiting line, but told the wait was 35-45 minutes.  "A party of 9 just showed up".  Not pleased, but no big deal, just bad luck.  As I went to the restroom on the first floor, I saw a round table with 6 chairs, and asked this "greeter" if we could squeeze 7, rather than stand waiting 35 min or longer to sit down.  Again no one else waiting.  He said no, just go to the bar and get a drink.  OK, I understand.  I walked upstairs to the other restroom(first floor had a wait), and at the top of the stairs was a beautiful table big enough for 7-10, and a few other 4 tops all open, bused and ready.  As i came back downstairs, I tried to think how I could ask again without being obnoxious.  3 employees were standing at the desk talking, so I waited.  The "Greeter" was looking straight ahead and would not acknowledge me, so I thought maybe he was on the phone or something.  No, just rude.  I kept waiting.  A nearby manager asked if I needed something, and before I could answer, my greeter friend said "no, he's just going around the restaurant trying to find a table, and I already told him to wait at the bar."  He still wouldn't talk or acknowledge me.  That is when I got pissed me off.  I wanted to leave, but my family is much nicer than I am, and the manager said he would take care of it.  5 minutes later we were seated and had a great meal and night. I understand how I could be perceived, but this guy was just an ass with a bad attitude.  We love the pizza so much I stopped the next day to pickup a frozen one to take back to Michigan.  I was hoping to see my greeter friend, but my wife was glad he was not there.  OK, I feel better now... Additional info as of 12/7/16:  The General Manager of this location did call to follow-up.  He handled it very well, had spoken with the "greeter", and had a good explanation.  He encouraged me to try them again, and I will!

This is THE chicago deep dish.   As someone who has lived here my entire life, and been spoiled with homemade deep dishes of my own perfection, this is one of the few places that never makes me dissapointed that I paid for it, instead of raising my own garlic-Herb buttercrust. Must try for all deep dish heads.
Man oh man...my tummy is so happy. The classic deep dish is the ultimate. There are so many options for some delicious meals. Visiting the Windy City make Lou Malnatis a must have pizza place.

I was in the are for the SOFA expo, and wanted to try the famous deep dish pizza. I tried Lou Malnati's and Giordano's, and I have to say that Giordano's was much better than Lou Malnati's. This, in no way, means that this was bad, it was still really really good pizza.
Best deep dish that I was able to try in Chicago. I would definitely go back. The crust was out of this world and the tomato sauce was outstanding. Service was good but not a wow factor.

we waited 1.5 hours to eat here but it was worth it! the pizza was amazing. service was eh, though it was extremely busy and probably couldn't be avoided. they allow you to preorder if you wait a long time, which is good because the food gets thrown in the oven as soon as you sit

The deep dish roma tomato "Lou" pizza was as authentic as it gets in Chicago.  We LOVED it.  The energy and ambiance was great, and the service was wonderful - it was a 45 minute wait for the pizza, but they let you know that ahead of time, and it is SO worth the wait. :-)
Always great service and food!!! I was so glad when they came to the neighborhood years ago.

I finally got to experience Chicago Deep Dish Pizza! My co-worked and I got a tip by our boss, who is from Chicago, that this was the place to go. Literally 1 hour off the plane and we were here at this location. Traffic is pretty terrible to get into the city, but once you are here you are in. We ordered the The Malnati Chicago Classic with pepperoni on top. The crust actually resembles some type of pie crust. Right above it is sauce and sausage. Its much different than I thought as the sausage is one large piece the same diameter of the pizza. Above that is the traditional toppings of cheese, sauce, and pepperoni. It was pretty amazing, but after two slices it was hard to eat more. The amount of sausage is what kind of threw me off. I would have preferred less as the ratio from meat to cheese, sauce, and crust was just not right. The food quality was great, but it was not 5 stars for me.

It was Wednesday night and we got our name and number down. We walked around the city for about an hour and a half before our table was ready. The pizza was good and pretty cheap, only $20 to share between 3 people. It was filling enough for us. I would have liked the cheese to be more melted, but everything was solid and sturdy. Another place that I'll be swinging by if I ever come back to Chicago. Lots of other pizza places that I'll need to try as well. 1 pizza in the 4 days I was there wasn't enough.
Great dinner and service!  Brian our server was the best!  Must try this.. apps great and pizza awesome

I've also ordered their pizza online to be delivered to me back in New England.  I was curious to see if it had the same real flavor of Lou's.  Spot on!  Got it delivered still frozen, easy to reheat, and fantastically delicious.  I openly wept!!!  I will order again, as this is an awesome meal.
Delicious deep dish! Takes a while to make but worth the wait.

The deep dish pizza I had was undercooked.  The dough was a tad raw for my taste.  What was cooked was delicious.  For the wait, I'd skip it all together. Their waiting list is a horrible mess.  They claimed to have called me several times.  I was inside and listened carefully. Update:  Shortly after this review was posted the restaurant attempted to call me back to remediate my not so positive experience.  I appreciated the effort not the attitude and lack of resolution when I returned their call.  My name is not Nicole.
Good pizza, although a little heavy on the sauce. Crust is delicious and buttery! The dessert pizza is a nice treat if you have any room left after the main course.

The wait was one hour for two deep dish personal pizzas to-go. The crust is definitely different from Giordanos--crispy and more buttery. I personally prefer Giordano's though, but it depends what you prefer! I'd say go for the experience. Standing in line wasn't that bad because it created those great memories waiting with friends in the middle of torrential rain :)

Deep dish pizza again?  After a very disappointing pizza at Giordano's, I didn't want anymore pizza for a while. Hubby wanted to try Lou's so off we went. We got there early and missed the big crowds who showed up at 7 PM.  Our server, Sara, was very nice and made sure my water glass was always filled. The tap water in Chicago tastes good, unlike Southern CA water.  She checked to make sure we were OK during the 40 mins wait for our pizza to cook.   We started with a house salad. Plenty for 2 but can be shared by 3.  The pizza was worth the wait.  The crust was so much better. We got the Lou's Chicago which had a crispy, buttery crust ( I really couldn't taste that much butter) with sausage and delicious tomato sauce topping. The small was more than enough for us and we even had a slice to take back.  This is one of the best deep dish pizzas I've tried.   The tables are not too closely packed together but we could clearly hear the conversations of the tables next to us. One was a daughter with her elderly mom and the other couple talking up business , possibly someone trying to get hired.    Would recommend this place for your Derp dish pizza.

If you like or want to try deep dish the Lou's Chicago Classic (sausage) is the best there is to me. Excellent Malnati house salad.  Also the vegetarian "Lou's"  thin crust is exceptionally good.  Really never had a bad experience - always great - just plan, order or book reservations well ahead of need - as it gets crowded.

I'm a Giordanos fan and pretty much always go there when in Chicago. However I tried Lou's and it did not disappoint.  I went in on a busy afternoon for lunch but quickly pounced on a seat at the bar.  As usual lunchtime hours at deep dish joints offer a good deal on personal size pizzas, which is what I ordered. For $10 you get a soup or salad, a personal pizza, and unlimited refills of soda. So how can you beat that? It made for the perfect lunch and I really liked their pizza.
lots of cheese thought to be the best deep dish in chicago chain search for the mom and pop places in chicago to get the very best
The pizza was fantastic.  I preferred the Pepperoni than the Sausage.  Others were the other way around.  The Chopped Salad was the best I have ever had.  I highly recommend.  It is worth the wait.

Overrated and overpriced - No wonder this place is full of tourists! We waited for 50min for take out, the pizza was mini and not tasty at all. The sausage looked almost "sick" in color... Very very disappointed.

Lou's as we regulars call it is the best Pizza in town, bar none.  The thick crust is out of this world.  I eat a mostly vegan diet, but have to splurge on Lou's every few months.  The salads are really good as well.  I go to the original Lincolnwood location which is really fun with lots of Chicago sports memorabilia throughout.  They now have on-line ordering for take out which is great.  Love Lou's!! Been going there forever and will continue to go for as long as I'm around the planet.
First time trying on deep dish pizza. It was great, wish it was hotter and the cheese was more melted and falling off the spatula. But it was definitely good.

Came at an extremely busy hour but they have a great wait system. Name goes down, you get a text with a link and you can monitor where you are in line. While you wait you can pre order your pizzas - genius! This made it so our pizzas came shortly after we were seated - efficient! Pizzas themselves were so good! Got the Classic and Lou. The massive amount of cheese and the buttery crust were perfect! I'd say skip the appetizers and focus on the pies!
This place has my favorite Chicago style pizza. Get the Chicago classic and enjoy!  Pizzas take awhile, 35-45 minutes, I would suggest getting the Lou Salad or bruschetta.

I'm an "out of towner" and don't have anything  to compare it to; but the pizza was good. I wish I would've got a small instead of a personal; but I didn't want to be greedy.  Note for newby's...it was beyond crowded. Idk if it was the World Series or not; but the wait for 1 was about 40 mins, with an hour to cook the pizza. It was nice that I was able to put my pizza order in so that it was ready close to being seated. Next time I'm in Chicago, I'll try another location so I can compare!

This place has a name and a lot of hype as a must try. My experience was less than what I had hoped for.  It was about 45 min. wait, they have this thing they say to save time that they half cook the pizza while you wait. I must say it is noticeable when you ate it.The sauce was ok the crust was flaky but seemed it was cooked earlier and reheated.  The cheese not really hot as you would expect. Management got in contact with me after my initial review to see what was the issue.  I have modified my review based on that as I am a firm believer that anyone who try's gets extra points.  I would give it another try.

Best Deep Dish Pizza in Chicago! We arrived just before the rush, little before Noon. There was about a 15 minute wait. Shortly after it filled up. The place is rather large plenty of seating for groups/families and etc. We started off with the wings, they came out hot and crisp, the seasoning had a slight kick which was well warranted. We had them without the wing sauces. Absolutely delicious. For pizza we had the pepperoni and sausage deep dish. Tip go for the smaller size than you would normally get. Overall Great experience and should be added to your places to stop in Chicago!

We asked a friend of our for the best pizza in the city and he told us to go here. So we had pretty high expectations going in being in the middle of Chicago and all.  While it wasn't the best Chicago style pizza I've had, it was exceptional.  First of all, it's nice that even when it's busy inside, they let you order before you get a table because of the long cooking times for the pizzas. Secondly, they told us that we would have a long wait time however we did not experience that. We got there during the dinner rush on a Saturday night and we waited 15 minutes when they said it would be 45.  When we did get our table we noticed that is was hectic but our server was experienced and was very good about checking in on us. He cut our pizza for us at the table and served us our first slices which felt nice.  We were very pleased with our experience, we had a lot left over. We wanted to keep it but we decided to talk to a homeless guy on the way home and let him have it. All in all, a fantastic night!!!
Had the Malnati Salad and the Malnati Chicago Deep Dish and both were seriously delicious.  Seriously.  Can't wait to have it again!
The way it makes me feel they should call it Lou Mal-naughty's. Too tasty for deep dish and easily one of the better pies  10/10: Not giordanos

This place is a Chicago institution and I can see why. We were quoted an hour wait when we arrived at 7:30 p.m. on a Thursday, but they took my cell number and texted me a link to check where we stood in line. Everything was very organized, including the waiter telling us exactly how long it would take to get our wine, salad and pizza. And the spinach salad and Malnati Classic pizza were both delicious. I'll go here every time I'm in Chicago. They have food and customer service down to a science.
Literally the best pizza in the entire world.  Nuff said.

WOW this place was amazing, The place is big and I didn't have to wait to be seated. I ordered cheese bread for appetizer which wasn't anything special just average. On the other hand the pizza was amazing, the only negative about the pizza is you are gonna have to wait minimum 45 minutes for your pizza to be made. So be prepared to wait and yes it is definitely worth the wait. Overall great food and i will be back
Classic Chicago pizza. If you are traveling to Chicago and experience Chicago style pizza- then you can't go wrong with Lou Malnati's
Deep dish Chicago Pizza the way it should be. Oh and while watching "Da Bears!"  Perfection!

3.5?  Maybe expected too much.  Got the basic pepperoni deep dish.  What am I supposed to be amazed by????  The salad was great and the garlic bread was great as well. Service good.  No wait because we got there slightly before 5. When we were coming out though, it was getting pretty packed.
Great pizza!! There is always a silly battle between NYC's pizza and Chicago's pizza. So they ask...Which one is better...So I betrayed my roots and voted Chicago!

So if you ask me, I'm a ny style pizza fan or better yet a Detroit style pizza fan.  But sometimes a good deep dish is what you crave.  I'm a fan of the giordano's but I don't think it's fair to compare he two.  They are two distinct styles of deep dish.  I do like the buttery crust at Lou's.   It was a long wait to get in but they do have a slick way to preorder the pizzas while you wait since they take a while to cook.  Maybe because we were sooo hungry, and because of the wait, we were pretty satisfied with the meal.   We ordered appetizers because we were so hungry but probably shouldn't have.  Just stick with the pizza. My only complaint was that the pizza didn't seem fresh.  It didn't seem like it came straight out of the oven.  The cheese had firmed up and wasn't as melted as if it were fresh out of the .
There are some great pizza joints in the south loop but if you are looking for deep dish this is simply the best'

This was my first ever deep dish pizza and when I asked someone for a recommendation as to where to eat my first, I got a resounding Lou's from every one of them. We came here pretty late on a Friday and expected a long wait. Our wait ended up only being a little more than an hour. We were able to easily get to the bar to get drinks while we waited and even ordered our pepperoni deep dish (I had not previously known this was ordinary since the pizza takes so long to cook). Once we sat down we ordered another round of drinks and a salad. The reason I knocked a star off is because the second drink (Moscow Mule) I received was not very good. I continued to drink it as I really dislike complaining at a restaurant unless absolutely necessary. I think instead of vodka, gin was used. We ordered the Malnati Salad and it was really good. We all expected to eat a little bit then prepare for our pizza, but I am pretty sure we all went back for at least seconds. The salad was in a giant bowl and was perfect for a table to share. Finally came the moment we were all waiting for, the ZA! I was mesmerized by it and was very happy when the first slice out landed on my plate. It had the absolute perfect ratio between crust, sauce, cheese, and pepperoni. My eyes were bigger than my stomach and I assumed I would eat 2 slices. I barely made it through the first and was completely full and satisfied.  Their large pizza was the perfect amount for 4 people, we had 3 women and 1 guy. I will definitely be coming back to Lou's next time I am in Chicago!
lame pizza tasted like cardboard , limp caesar salad lettucetasted old and dressing was almost  flavorless. After three visits to this location with similar results I wont be returning

This place was so good, as soon as we got back from Chicago I ordered Pizzas to have shipped to us.  They were so good! The service was fantastic.  The pizza we ordered was Lous specialty.  The crust is amazing, the sausage, and all around great quality ingredients make this place special.  Seriously you need to try this, and if you won't find yourself in chicago, order it shipped!

Delicious!  They delivered 15minutes earlier than they told me (but it still took 1:15min).  But it was worth it.  The pizza was so yummy!  We were in Chicago as tourists and wanted to try the "deep dish" pizza. We got the plain cheese pizza - such a reasonable price too! It was even good the next day.  I normally don't like microwaved reheated pizza, but the crust held up to the challenge.  Yummy again!

When you visit Chicago you have to have real deep dish pizza! That is not up for arguments or question. Lous gave me exactly what I was hoping for in a chicago style pizza. My boyfriend brought me here on our last day in the city and I was not disappointed. The building is rather average and seemingly small. Once inside it expands into a back room as well so it offers more space that you would expect. But due to high demand if their oh so gooey pizza it's pretty packed with tables and a full bar.   The place was hoping when we got there so we had to wait for about 15 minutes before we were sat. Which was fine. But once sat our sever was Kady and she was great! So busy but was definitely on her toes and was keeping up well.   My boyfriend and I ordered a glass of wine each and decided to split an order of fried cheddar cheese balls, on my request. They came out nice and warm served with marina sauce, and they were very good! A good option other than just motz sticks. We ordered our pizza, a small deep dish with sausage, onion, spinach, garlic, basil and tomato sauce. It came out fresh out of the oven and was sliced right at our table and plopped hot and oozing with cheese onto our plates for us! If this wasn't Chicago style deep dish then I don't know what is? This pizza was so good and very flavorful. I'm a crust lover and boy did their buttercrust make me happy. Crunch and semi salty and butter, couldn't have been better!  If you're looking for awesome Chicago style pizza this is the place to find it!
Great pizza overall. Sometimes you will get a pizza that's overly salty like I did last night or strangely sweet. But overall the pizza is delivered on time and it's amazing.

Classic Chicago deep dish. I had to try it while in town. Plan ahead, it takes 45 minutes to cook. Don't order a personal pizza, it takes away from the taste (dried out). I prefer thin NY style, but this was decent. A must try if you are from out of town.

So I thought I'd try this place after seeing all the reviews. Pizza was decent. I think maybe if I had gotten one that was larger than the personal size I would have gotten the full experience. I've had deep dish at another place, and I just liked it better.  The wait is long, so don't go hungry. And pre-order your pizza so they will already have it while you're waiting for your table. Baking deep dish pizza takes time, so this helps with the wait once you're seated.

Make sure to add the butter crust!!! It's delicious!!! I've had it given to me as a gift and someone shipped it to me, this place is soooo much better than I thought. Totally worth coming and tasting it freshly made.
I love this pizza! The deep dish with pepperoni  is awesome. But honestly, it cant compare to Beggars Pizza....Its a close second though.

My first ever Chicago deep dish pizza!  A bit doughy and heavy for me. But I have to say, I wasn't expecting the slices to be so big, I definitely underestimated this pizza.  I ordered a pie thinking I would eat at least 3 but failed miserably. Oh well, leftover pizza tastes just as good the next day!

This review is a joint rating of the 5 people in our group. All 5 gave it the full 5 stars. Lasagna, Penne Ala Manalti, bruschetta, deep dish lou classic with pepperoni and cooked well done. We all shared and we all loved everything. I highly recommend! The marinara sauce is to die for :)

My friend brought me this place and said this is one of the best pizza place in Chicago. We are ordered the trio drip with chip, one medium classic pizza and one medium the Lou. The trio drip is a good pick and the garlic drip is my favorite. The pizza is big and filling. Between the two I like the classic better than the Lou. The classic has a big flat sausage and cheese on the pizza that is my favorite. We are in a group of 5 guys and we have one slice each left from the two pizza so beware that the portion when you are ordering.

We had a pretty bad service experience with our waiter but the manager came and made it right by bringing us complimentary food and ensuring that our pizza finally made it out to us. I appreciate him taking ownership of the situation and turning what had been a very bad experience into a more positive one.  That being said, all of the food that we ate was delicious! The deep dish pizza was one of the best that I've had!! We also had the malnati's salad and bruschetta and both were delicious. I would go back and order the same food again.

This was highly recommended to me as a first time visitor to Chicago. Wait here is not absurd, about 1 hr for me coming in as a solo diner on Friday evening. They're nice enough to take your order ahead of time and also take your number to text you when your table becomes available. They provide you with a link to a website that tells your position, which i thought was very useful. I started at position like 50 something? Not sure how accurate it is as I got seated when my position on the website was at about 10. Anyway, good marker that would allow you to walk around and come back in time. Make sure you do come back in time, they allow you 5 min to show up when your table is called otherwise you forfeit it.  I got the classic pizza or something that has sausage and their "famous" butter crust in a personal size. It's a pretty reasonable prize at about $12. One of the best pizzas I've tasted flavor wise, not sure how they did it, but I was quite impressed. This place easily would have earned 5-stars but I felt they messed up either accidentally or intentionally. The pizza I received was warm, not hot. And by warm, I mean the cheese didn't have the melted or gooey effect I usually expect from a pizza place. Rather the cheese stretched a tiny bit before tearing. Unsure if this was how pizza was normally served in this style, I ate at Giordano's and they served the pizza much hotter than Lou's. Overall impressed with the flavor enough that I'll be back again, but hopefully the pizza will be much hotter and "fresher" tasting next time around.

Recommended by a Chicago woman waiting to get off the plane. It is eveything she said it was. Delicious deep dish buttery, luscious sausage, great sauce. Our waiter Graham was exceptional. The Malnati, classic salad has the best dressing.

Stopped by while I was in town. It's a cute place right off the Magnificent Mile, but their food was pricy, and the deep-dish pizza wasn't the most impressive. Was thankful for our server constantly refilling our bread, since we were starving!

Found a seat at the bar and we avoided the wait. Started with cheese bread and then we each put away a personal deep dish pie. Cold beers and decent service. Nothing more than expected at a pizzeria. Recommend for a casual dinner.

This was recommended for the best deep dish  Pizza in Chicago and we were underwhelmed.  The server was excellent and very nice. She knew a lot about the menu. We started with salads and the spinach bread which was decent. The Pizza wasn't memorable.

I strongly believe that Lou Malnati's is as much a local spot as it is touristy. If I lived in Chicago, I would easily be ten times my weight, thanks to Lou! Eileen L.'s REFVIEW for Lou Malnati's Pizzeria RELEVANT INFO * Always a wait at this poppin' pizzeria - we were quoted a 30-35 minute wait, seated within 10.. score! * Order your pizza at the cashier while waiting for a table * The Wait App shows your place on the wait list... wowowow!! * A bar at the entrance/waiting area to help make the wait time go faster and more bearable * This place does not take full-service lightly: Catering available, and you can order pizza from anywhere in the world and they'll ship it to you! O_O EXPECTATIONS GOING IN * Deep Dish Pizzrah!!! FOOD * Calamari Fritti ($9.75): not sure why we ordered this while we were in Chicago, but still a solid appetizer nonetheless * Chicken BBQ Cobb Salad ($9.95 small; $14.95 large): this is perhaps the most Midwest salad I have ever seen... the small is a large facewash bin filled mostly with chicken and bacon tossed in BBQ sauce with a smidgen of greens * Chicago Classic Malnati's ($12.95 Small): buttery, crispy crust topped with a ton of sausage, pepperoni and stringy mozzarella * The Lou's Special ($9.95 Personal): the tomatoes... drool... VALUE * Super affordable! Enough food for two full meals for the two of us for $50 IMPRESSION OVERALL * Yelen was so nice, and took great care of us * Food came out quickly, and nothing disappointed ENVIRONMENT / AMBIANCE * The place is rowdy, but when you pay close attention you can hear Motown and Disco music playing in the background WOW FACTOR * Classic Malnati's.. classic!
The deep dish pizza was very very good.  Service was good too.  The deep dish pizza is huge! Even a small was huge.  Definitely worth trying.
For Pizza, one of my favorites. Love the deep dish. Truly a fun spot. Been going there for years - always good. Lot's of locations and all are consistent.

Really great deep dish pizza.  Went there with my wife who is from Chicago and knows all the pizza places.  I am from New York so we both know our pizza's.  We ordered a deep dish (a must) with all the toppings and were not disapointed.  Waited about 35 minutes after for our pizza to arrive (everything is fresh and prepared to order) and the wait was worth it the pizza was great.  Crust is perfect, right amount of toppings and boy do they have the flavors right. When we got back to Alabama we ordered one, that arrived by UPS in a few days.  Was packed in fry ice and arrived in great shape.  The pizza was good but not great. It was also very expensive as one might guess.  Would not order it shipped again

I ended up getting stranded at O'Hare so I figured I'd get a room downtown. I knew deep dish pizza would be on the menu for the evening but couldn't decide between this, Geno's East, or Giordano's. Finally I chose Lou's and I'm really happy I did. It was absolutely delicious. I had the pie delivered to my hotel room and it was still steaming hot when it got there. I will be in Chicago again in two weeks and I'm looking forward to eating a pie in the restaurant this time.

Pizza is a touchy subject for Chicago-ians. This is my "go to" place for Sicilian: great sauce-cheese-topping taste combinations. Service has always been great, on-time and accurate. Typically, we get take-out and eat at home. While I've eaten "in" at the Wells St location, we get most of our pies from the Lincoln-Wrightwood shop, can't say that we've ever eaten "in" there. The Lincoln location is a typical Pizza-Italian restaurant, no reason not to eat in except that home is close and more comfortable ;-)

Very disappointing and not worth the 50 minute wait. The pizza was super greasy. The crust tasted like a frozen pizza. The salad was too sweet and drowning in dressing. The waitress asked how things were but walked away without waiting for the answer! Not at all impressed.

I really wanted to like their pizza. But sadly, it was bland and uninspiring. BC Pizza is much, much better. Even Papa John's is better. The only things I can think of that could be done to improve is make the pizza more flavorful. The crust was bland, so some seasonings such as salt, butter, or olive oil in that might be helpful. Fresh, high-quality ingredients and seasonings would create better flavors in the rest of the pizza. The best pizzas have chewy, slightly sweet crusts.

This place is incredible. My husband and I can't stop talking about it. We both love pizza and were both excited and nervous to try Chicago-style deep dish. Our friend took us here, and we loved it. We shared a big salad and the three-cheese bread for appetizers, and both were incredible. I had a personal deep dish with onions, peppers, and the fresh spinach mix and my husband had the Malnati Chicago Classic. So good!! Word of warning - there is quite a wait but you can order your pizza ahead of time so it's ready when you get your table. It was also very hot in the dining room in the back, so dress accordingly.

Wow.  Really delicious and friendly service!  First stop after hopping off the plane.  This really is good deep dish, and this is coming from a new yorker!  Just enough sauce on top, thick layer of cheese and flat sausage on a buttery crust...amazing! Nice space with 2 floors and a limited drink menu!

Came highly recommended and not disappointed. Portions are large, family style salad was more than our party of 4 could handle with an appetizer and the large Malnati's. We took half the pizza home. The BBQ salad had good flavor but the bacon bits and tortillas added too much crunch and became tiring to eat. Pizza was very good! Came early for lunch 11:30 and sat down right away, when we left at 1pm, a ton of people waiting in line.

We went there on a late Saturday night while we were visiting Chicago. There were lots of ppl waiting for tables, and we waited about 30 mins. We ordered a cheese pizza, a the "Lou" pizza, and a Malnati Salad. The pizzas were good, and the Malnati salad was the best salad I have ever had. I miss it so much. I wish I could order a delivery to LA now!
I love it, butter crust? Yes please!  Thin crust yum, deep dish yum, pasta double yum.  You can't go wrong here...

Every single person who's been to Chicago told me to try Lou Malnati's Pizza. Can't go to Chicago and not order a deep-dish pizza.  The place was just starting to get busy when we came, we were seated quickly. By the time we left there was an hour wait.  We ordered a small pepperoni deep dish and a small The Lou deep dish. Too much food for two people, but hey its vacation and we took it to go (I had leftover pizza for breakfast. I regret nothing).  They tell you once your order is placed it will take 30-45 minutes. Not to worry they serve beer and the wait staff is on top of refills.  The pizza is worth the wait! Comes out hot, they slice it and serve it and it is delicious. The crust is so good, and I am not a deep dish fan. My favorite was the Lou.  Did you know they deliver frozen pizza nationwide?!
From Utah so pizza really isn't a thing. So always looking for amazing joints to visit when traveling.  Lou's knocks it out of the park!  Glad to be in Chicago!

Living in Houston, I have to admit that I am far from an expert on Deep Dish Pizza. That said, every time I am in Chicago, I always seek out a deep dish pie. I have tried several of the most highly rated deep dish pies and always come back to Lou's. The signature butter crust is fantastic and the quality and quantity of filling keeps me coming back. I had the individual pie this time and the filling seem a bit less generous than the full size versions I had before. It was still great.  Accompanied by a good beer and I was very happy. You will wait about 45 minutes for your deep dish.

ALWAYS PACKED! Been here twice and waited about an hour to be seated. But the wait is worth it, because their deep dish pizza is too good and instagram worthy. I had their veggie deep dish and it did not disappoint. Better go there with a good friend so the wait time goes by faster and not too hungry otherwise the wait will make you hangry

Disclaimer: I've only ever had their stuffed  pizza.  The bad: Their selection of pizza toppings is limited which is a bummer.  If you get sausage its an entire layer sites across the pizza which is overwhelming and almost gross.   The good: Delightful crust, excellent sauce,  gooey cheese and a staple in Chicago pizza.

Deep dish pizza is a must when visiting Chicago. Decided to try this place because of the great reviews on Yelp. The trio of dips with pizza chips was great! Hummus, roasted garlic and spinach artichoke dips were perfect with the crispy pizza chips.  The portion was big enough to share with 3 people. I was so full after the appetizer that barely had any room for the main star, the deep dish pizza. The Malnati Chicago Classic had a crunchy crust but the sausage patty tasted alright. It was a huge thick sausage patty which lacked some flavor.

Visited Chicago for the first time a couple weeks ago, we were told Lou Malnati's was the best place to go in the area we stayed. It was right up the street from our hotel! (We ate here twice over a 3 day weekend).  Service was great, pizza was delicious and dessert was the perfect ending to our trip. We can't wait to return!

Well, I finally made it here. And, it was good, not great. The service was good, the pizza crust was good. Overall good but not great. Maybe I'm getting old and deep dish is just too much for me. Hey, I finally got to eat here and didn't have to wait in line!

I think Lou malnati's is the best deep dish pizza in chicago.  The crust is buttery and melts in your mouth.  The classic pizza with sausage, mushroom, and pepperoni was very good--the salad with the house dressing was very good as well.  This is not the meal to have if you are watching your calorie intake, but every now and then it is an excellent choice for pizza.  Oh, and if you need gluten free or a lighter veggie pizza, they have that too.

Upon visiting Chicago, Lou Malnati's was the highly touted deep dish spot that we wanted to try. I don't know what it was when we went.. If it was too busy, they were understaffed, or for some reason that escapes me, but our experience was less than par that left a sour taste in my mouth. The wait was expected, but what wasnt was the seating of multiple 4 tops before my party even though we clearly put our name down first. It was only until I went inside and ask the hostess about it was when we finally got a table. Maybe it was really coincidental that our table just came up when I decided to ask, who knows.  Next our server took an exceedingly long time to take our order. Now my qualm is not with her service, but the speed of the service. She herself was extremely nice and helpful, but it seemed that she was second guessing and taking her sweet time despite the rush. We put our order in before we were seated per request of the hostess in the beginning, and was told by our server that it would take 15 minutes to come out. IT TOOK AN HOUR. Tables around us got theirs before us, and to top it off, it was WARM. It was cooled to the point that I was able to pick up the metal pan with my bare hand and the inside most of the pizza was cold. They reheated it for us and gave us a free dessert, but by no means did it compensate for the time we lost waiting for a table and our pizza. We didn't account for the extra hour that we lost instead of exploring Chicago's secrets.  Maybe our experience was a bad one, and I hope no one else has to wait that long for anything here. If you do go, set aside an ample amount of time for the waits.

Was lucky enough to check this place out on a recent trip to the city.   100% will come back the next time I visit.  This pizza is the stuff dreams are made of.  I never know how decadent pizza could be.  I want more, and I want it now!

When in Chicago, one must deep dish.  I should mention that I absolutely detest deep dish pizza.  What's the appeal?  It tastes like a fancy quiche with too much tomato sauce and not enough cheese.  I would rather get a thinner slice (I lurve New York) with double the cheese and  a little less butter (at least noticeable butter).  I was expecting this to be a disappointing Friday night experience, but I heard that this is one of the better popular deep dish spots in town.  While waiting for our table to be ready (a one hour wait), we decided it would be best to order the pizza 30 minutes into the wait (that way it would be ready relatively close to when we were seated).  Ordered the vegetarian deep dish (forget the name because I was definitely tipsy at the bar by that time).  It was surprisingly delicious!  I loved the garlic bread too.  For two people, you are better off getting the small and splitting (it's a thick and heavy slice of pizza).  Anyway, I had a good time and although I'm not a fan of deep dish due to two poor experiences in the past, this has slightly changed my perception.

The food here is great. This is the best deep dish pizza I've ever had. The salad was great too. Honestly this could have been a five star restaurant but the process of getting in was too difficult. First, we were quoted a wait time of 45 minutes. They also let you preorder your pizza (since they take a while to cook) so that was a plus.  Meanwhile, we waited almost 90 minutes (outside on the street with two hungry kids - never fun).  Once inside the process of getting to your table is difficult and the service is friendly but not great. I really liked the food and I'm glad we tried it but if we come back to Chicago we would probably try a different pizza place.
A must if you're in Chicago! Worth the wait. I was born here and this is the Chicago pizza I miss!

Carb loaded before the Chicago marathon- great pizza, bruschetta and salad! Service was fantastic. We put our pizza order in with our name for a table. 40 minutes on Saturday night was well worth the wait. Family friendly and great food.
Very loud, my pizza was pretty much raw when I asked for it well done. Very nice server though.
Really good service and well the pizza as well. Thanks lou malnatis

Not worth it.  After a night of boozing (Prohibition Tour), we came to Lou Malnati's for some pizza.  We checked in, pre-ordered our food, and waited patiently.  When we were finally seated, we still had to wait quite a while for our food.  When we finally were served, the pizza was just so-so.  The sauce was too garlicky, the crust both doughy and crunchy, the toppings too heavily proportioned.  It was good enough to take back to our hotel for a midnight snack, but not so good I plan on going back.  My search for the perfect Chicago pizza continues.

Very good deep dish pizza. Personal size looks pretty small but it's filling. My boyfriend got the small (larger than the personal) and he was pleasantly stuffed, as he's a huge pizza fanatic. He says it's great pizza and he's from NYC, so I think it's opinion holds some weight. If you want some Chicago deep dish, you can't go wrong here!

On our trip to Chicago, we just had to try deep dish Chicago pizza. After researching many pizza joints, we decided to try Lou's.  We shared a personal sized pizza and side salad. It may seem like not a lot of food, but it was the perfect amount for us. Being tourists, we didn't want leftovers, as we were continuing our day in the city and didn't want to take food with us.  The pizza was very filling and rich. I'm not a huge fan of deep dish pizza in general. I am more of a thin crust person. However, this was a good deep dish pizza experience. The crust was crispy and buttery, sauce was tasty and not too salty. The cheese was good quality, not too rubbery. I liked the long string of cheeses that come off the pizza when you try to eat it. The server gave us the heads up that the pizza would take 30 minutes, which we were prepared for and fine with. Good quality food takes time. If looking for the Deep dish Chicago experience, I recommend this place.

5 stars deep dish pizza. Not recommended to try their thin pizza. The thin pizza is signature of NYC and should only be eaten in the city (smile). Also try their signature malnati salad (non veg). It was the greatest salad I ever tried, even my mom who doesn't like salad, loved it
Really nice service! Ordered the classic deep dish pizza, bruschetta, and calamari. Came out pretty quickly and we went there around 5pm so there was no wait!

We checked out 3 deep dish pizza places during our visit to Chicago for the weekend... Peqoud's, Giordano's,  and Lou Malnati's... Lou Malnati's definitely did not disappoint. We had the stuffed spinich bread for apps, which was pretty decent. The pizza was our first experience at Chicago deep dish pizza and it was really good. I think the crust might have been slightly better at Peqoud's  For dessert we had chocolate chip pizza, and damnnnn, was it really really good.  Let's just say it was so good, that one night we are at Peqoud's for dinner, but we came back to Lou's just for the chocolate chip pizza for dessert...

There's a reason Lou Mal's is synonymous with Chicago pizza. Yes, you'll wait forty five minutes to an hour, but then you will receive a pizza the likes of which you will eat nowhere else in the world (except another Lou Mal's, obvs.) Crunchy butter crust, squeaky fresh mozzarella, and perfectly seasoned tomatoes plus your topping of choice. The sausage and pepperoni and spinach and mushroom are family favorites, but honestly you could put anything on these pies and they'd be delicious.  Now stop reading this and go to Lou Mal's. Yes, now. Right now.

As a California girl one of the first things I wanted to do in Chicago was eat some famous deep dish pizza. With the help of my boyfriend we compounded a list of places based on reviews and suggestions from friends and family. We narrowed it down to Lou Malnati's, Giordano's and Pizano's I believe.  Out of all three places Lou's hands down took the cake! What made it better was overall taste, the butter crust was insanely delicious and the toppings were so balanced. Service was also great, it was the only place where you could preorder the pizza while waiting for your table. Since each pizza takes 30-45 minutes to bake the preorder while you wait is genius for the hungry customer. Overall would highly recommend!
Excellent pizza.  Love the crust.  Hard to pick between Lou's, Due's or Pizanno's for best pizza- they all are outstanding!
mediocre pizza at best... save yourself the trouble and go to Gino's East

When in Chicago, you gotta get a deep dish.. or two.  Lou Malnati's was our second deep dish stop. We preferred this over Pequod's. The main differentiator is the crust, Lou Malnati's signature Buttercrust is freckin' delicious! We shared a small pan among two people which was more than enough food for us. We had an extra slice to take back which I was really debating on finishing! I might have had to be carried out of the restaurant if I did.. My only gripe is that there was an excessive amount of cheese for my preference. We wanted to experience it 'as is,' but if we ever make it to Chicago again, we're definitely requesting light on the cheese. I don't usually crave pizza, but I'm drooling thinking about this.
Best deep dish in Chicago.  Go for the butter crust you won't regret it.  I'm a fan of the typical Sausage & mushroom, maybe add some spinach if I'm feeling "healthy" :)

My Chicago visits are defined by lots and lots of pizza. My personal favourite remains to be the Malnati Chicago Classic. That out-of-this-world food butter crust was indescribably good, and combined with layers of cheese and sausage, deep dish could not possibly get any better. Based on food alone, Lou Malnati's would undoubtedly get 5 stars from me. However, I review on the whole deal. Unfortunately, the service seems to be lacking at this Lou Malnati's location. While my server was very informative in helping us choose our pizzas (you can order half & half flavours!), the waiting staff who brought the pizza out was not so great. He didn't let us snap a single photo of the pizza before cutting, and he kept cutting one less slice than we needed at the table. It was frustrating because he didn't look or listen. (My server knew what my table wanted, but there must have been miscommunication.) So, I'd suggesting reiterating your request to the waiter when he comes with the food. Also, the restaurant tends to get very busy, so I suggest dining early!
The wait is long! But food is oh so gud. I know pizza is the thing but please also treat yourself to the house salad (unless you don't like or eat bacon). You won't regret.

It's all about expectations. After eating at Pizza Uno I thought the thick-pizza pie idea was fake. I was wrong. This thick-pizza was excellent and the bread complemented vs over-bearing. Basic beers. Location is a 2 story victorian house. Wait was ok.

I totally understand the hype surrounding this place. My husband and I are on a cross country road trip and we knew we needed to stop and try true Chicago deep dish pizza. We were not at all disappointed! We got half of the Lou's and half of the Malnati's classic. Both were excellent, but the classic had the most delicious sausage I've ever had on a pizza! This was definitely worth the trip!
Being from the East Coast, I was totally not sold on Chicago Deep Dish.  As with many people not from the city, Malnati's changed my mind. Great Chicago Deep Dish. I'm a convert.

Absolutely awesome place to be at. Fantastic service, good pizza and salad. Th manager was visible and friendly. Mark the manager kept the place moving, but you didn't feel like you were being rushed. We were told there was a 35 minute wait so we went to have a drink at the bar. We only waited 15 minutes and our table was ready. I highly recommend this place. Our dining experience from start to finish was wonderful. If we're in the area again we'll definitely be back!

I had a horrible experience today. I ordered online and received confirmation that my order was taken at 11:45 AM. My cold pizza arrived at 1:40 PM. This was especially annoying because when you order you see a little video about how great Lou Malnati's cheese is. The owner was showing how great the cheese was, but I only got cold clumps of cheese.  And there was just no love, no effort whatsoever put into this flavorless cold pizza. The small deep dish was about $23 with delivery. A complete waste of money and 2 hours of my time. I'll stick with Pizano's from now on.

Let me admit, I'm not the biggest pizza person - and not a big fan of beer. If you are, you might enjoy this spot. Compared to other deep dish pizzeria's it's more spacious and has a more expansive menu. The waitstaff seemed really happy and we're definitely attentive. Ingredients weren't as fresh as I like them, but I still enjoyed. I'd visit again but I'm not in a hurry.

My review mostly comes from all the hype around this place.  Everyone kept saying how good this pizza was and stuff, so my girlfriend and I finally decided to pick up some deep dish pizza since we were in the neighborhood.   The pizza was good, no complaints.  But it was just that.  To be fair, I did pick up the pizza to go, so perhaps when I go back and eat at the restaurant, my review might change.  Overall, its a place worth checking out!  Lou's is a safe choice.
First experience with deep dish Pizza and it didn't disappointed very delicious! This California boy loved it

The Chicago-style deep-dish pizza we had at Lou Malnati's was OK. If you order a deep-dish pizza, be prepared for about a 45-minute wait. It takes a while for these pizzas to be prepared. The menu says the pizzas take 30 minutes, but our wait was closer to an hour. I actually had my first Lou Malnati's deep-dish pizzas in Atlanta -- they were shipped to me as gifts through Lou Malnati's Tastes of Chicago ( yelp.com/biz/tastes-of-c… ). I tried both a pepperoni and a sausage deep-dish pizza and they were delicious. The pizzas I had at home and the pizza I tried in the restaurant were very similar. I don't know if that's a good thing or bad thing considering how terrible I am in the kitchen (even with frozen food). This Lou Malnati's is located in the River North neighborhood of Chicago. It's a little over a half-mile walk from the south end of The Magnificent Mile (about a 12-15 minute walk). I chose this place for our group for lunch because it had a 4-star rating on Yelp with about 3,000 reviews. I would consider this place touristy. We showed up on a Monday around 2:30pm, hardly a peak time, and it was still busy. There's both indoor and covered outdoor seating. We were seated in the dining room in the back where there are booths and tables. They've tried to cram as many people in this space as (un)comfortably possible. It was such a tight fit that servers were constantly brushing up against us throughout the duration of our meal. When we first sat down, one of the servers accidentally painfully poked my friend in the arm with a pen. SMH. The atmosphere is casual. The dining room has TVs playing sports and Chicago sports memorabilia (mainly jerseys) adorn the walls. The restaurant sells both deep-dish and thin crust pizza. They come in four sizes from personal to large (serves 4). The standard pizzas have simple ingredients: cheese, sausage, and pepperoni. The cheese comes from Wisconsin, the sausage is local (not sure about the pepperoni), and the tomatoes come from California. They have a veggie deep-dish as well as their trademarked "Buttercrust" which you can add at an additional cost ($0.75 per pizza) plus over 10 additional enhancements/toppings if you so desire. In addition to pizza, they have appetizers like bruschetta and calamari; soups, salads, pastas, sandwiches, and desserts. We went with the "Malnati Chicago Classic," small size (serves 2) for $14.95. FYI, a personal runs $9.45 and a large runs $24.95. The Malnati Chicago Classic is made with sausage, extra cheese, tomato sauce, and Buttercrust. While the pizza was good, it didn't seem exceptional to me. I was actually expecting there to be even more cheese (out to the edge of the deep-dish pan) and I was expecting the crust and cheese to be burnt in places. Instead, the crust had hardly any char whatsoever and tasted rather plain. The Buttercrust was noticeably richer than plain dough though. Admittedly, I think I was expecting more of a cheesy caramelized crust like those served at Pequod's. Overall, I thought the quality of the pizza and its ingredients were fine. Other items we ordered included a medium Caesar salad with grilled chicken for $8.75 and an order of the "BuffaLou" chicken wings for $8.95. They were alright too. The Caesar was made with Romaine lettuce, lean chicken strips, chopped tomato, shaved Parmesan cheese (a healthy amount), and crunchy croutons tossed in Caesar dressing. Six wings came to an order of the BuffaLou wings (on the apps menu) with celery and ranch dressing on the side. These were basically your standard buffalo wings that were slightly spicy. The staff was friendly and welcoming. If you've never had deep-dish pizza in Chicago before, Lou Malnati's is one of the classic places to get it. According to the menu, this location in River North is the oldest (established 1986) of its four city locations. Another place to consider is competitor Giordano's. There's a location about a block off the Mag Mile at Superior and Rush.

I am new to Chicago and have been looking to lose my deep dish virginity. Lou's didn't disappoint. I am never going to be a fan of the sauce on top of the pizza, but the sauce is so fresh and almost pureed looking. I had the staple, The Lou, it was great. Loaded with an abundance of meat and cheese, but the crust is what elevated it. Buttery and crisp that blended with the ingredients of the pizza perfectly. Going to Lou Malnati's will require a wait, both for the busy crowd and also for the time to make the pizza. Nothing much can be done there to prevent that, it's just always a busy joint. The ambiance is fine, it is nicely lit and includes a ton of Chicago memorabilia inside. Lou's is all about the product though. I will always be a fan of thinner crust, but I definitely came to respect Lou's and its deep dish.
Pizza was good. Bartender took awhile to greet me. Beer selection ok, but not great. White guy next to me given parm and red pepper, but never offered to to me.

As a pizza lover, I couldn't wait to try an authentic Chicago style deep dish pizza in Chicago, and at Lou malnati to boot.  Overall it was ok. Had better pizza in Atlanta. Wish the thickness of the pizza was due to heavy toppings more than just the crust. I've seen and had flat NY style pizza with more toppings on the pizza itself.  Good experience overall

Love me some Lou's!!   If you haven't been here, I feel sorry for you and your taste buds. Go hungry, you will come away stuffed.I do not visit Chicago without making this tops on my list for dining. Nuff said.

From out of town, walked up to the hotel with a Malnati pizza box in hand.  Doorman said, "I've lived here all my life, best pizza in town."  Got to the room, opened up the box....best pizza I've ever had, ever!

The pizza is heavenly. I could eat it every day for the rest of my life if I knew I wouldn't die. We had reservations but it was a busy night so we had a small wait- totally expected!  They have an awesome system going on where you can order your pie at a counter right after you walk in. Since the deep dish takes a hot minute to bake, this streamlines the process for both the guest and the business. You smart little cookies! I'll never skip this place when I visit Chicago!
My second most favorite deep dish pizza in Chicago. Cool place and friendly staff. Make sure to get the butter crust.

I absolutely love Lou Malnati's! Among most deep dish places I've tried, I've loved the flavor and simplicity of Lou Malnati's. I get the sausage and mushroom. YUM. The service takes a while (maybe 45 minutes to bake) so don't come starving hah. Otherwise, when your pie comes...enjoy the smells, take a bite and enjoy the deliciously flavored marinara sauce and cut into the sausage patty the pie has. The crust is just a perfect thickness. SO SO good.

My boyfriend and I went on a Sunday around 1pm and they took us in right away, there was no line. We ordered the Ceasar Salad and cheese sticks to start. Both were very good. We also ordered the classic deep dish pizza. Everything tasted so fresh. I wish I could have ordered to go and bring some back to Los Angeles.

Definitely my favorite deep dish place in Chicago. I'm not a huge fan of deep dish in general, but I'll eat at Lou's any time. This place is fun as hell. Loud, crowded, and the perfect atmosphere to sit around a couple of pitchers and delicious pies. The butter crust here is delicious, and really makes the pies tasty.  I'm a big fan of the Malnati Chicago Classic, which has sausage and extra cheese. I've had it with added pepperoni and jalapeños too. The "Lou" is also fantastic, despite the fact that it contains no meat. It's really a special pie that tastes amazing, so I recommend you try it even if you are a dyed in the wool carnivore like me.  For an appetizer, I recommend the buffalo wings. They are fried really crispy, tossed in a delicious sauce, and are totally awesome.  Lou's is the real deal, with great food and a really fun venue to boot. Highly recommended.

I came here on a Friday evening around 5 pm with one other person. We were told it would be a 25 minute wait, but we were seated about 5 minutes later. We had the option to preorder our pizzas before we were seated, since they take about 30 minutes to make. The personal size was sufficient for each of us. I got the Malnati Chicago Classic; the buttercrust was really good. The cheese and meat slid right off the crust when I cut into it, which made it kind of messy, but it was still very tasty. The service was good although we had to wait a little at first because it was already quite busy. Our server was very nice. When we left around 6 the place was unsurprisingly packed.
Loooooouuuuuuuuuuu Good pizza. Great times. End of story. Much better than Giordano's!

The famed Lou Malnati's doesn't disappoint. We ordered Lou deep dish pizza, spinach stuffed appetizer bread and a house salad. Everything was great.  Tip: go early on weekend nights. We came at 5:30 pm and had to wait 5-10 min to get a table. When we were leaving at 7:30 there was more than 40 min of wait time.

We visited Chicago last week and we excited to try Chicago deep dish pizza! We chose this location and didn't get disappointed. We were aware of  waiting time since the spot is extremely popular. We ordered some calamari as an appetizer and were amazed by the freshness of the food! We also went for Lou's special deep dish pizza with mushrooms, spinach and three cheeses. Pizza was just yum and our waiter was extremely helpful. Definitely worth of waiting.
This place is a must. Not only is the pizza a delicious Chicago staple, but the service is great, location is perfect, and the appetizers are delicious.

Went here on a food tour and the pizza was buttery and delicious!  We had the deep dish plain Pizza and it was popping hot and gooey cheese.  I would definitely recommend this place over any other so called pizza place in Chicago.

Visiting Chicago for the first time, my husband and I knew we needed to try deep dish. We tried both Lou Malnati's and Giordano's on our trip, and Lou Malnati's was by far our favorite. Now we know why everyone raves about deep dish. The crust was thick and buttery with the sauce contrasting very nicely. We got a medium and had leftovers for days- would definitely go with the small next time.  In terms of the great New York vs. Chicago pizza debate, my answer is both. They're both winners in their own right and can't be compared.
Best pizza in Chicago!! Great service, great space.  Get the Piz-Ookie!
OK stuff, nothing great. More of a chain. I feel there is better pizza in chicago, but it was good.

My native Chicago friends tell me that they consider this place is a tourist trap. I thought Lou Malnati's served a good deep dish pizza! This place was right on time for a couple of tourists fresh off the plane exploring a new city. It was a little pricey and I got there near closing so I had to deal with people cleaning tables while we scarfed down our pizza. Otherwise it was a good experience in a nice location.

Visiting from Boston and Lou Malnati's was recommended me by the hotel to be the best Chicago deep dish pizza, so I just had to go.  The wait for a table was less than 10 minutes and I sat outside.  The waitress was just awesome- very pleasant, great service, and I was really happy.  I ordered a small pizza for myself, which I thought i could handle, but it was actually too big!  Next time, I'd get the individual.  Delicious pizza and a great experience all around.

5 star for what it is, a casual pizza place that makes the classic example of Chicago deep dish pizza. Some may prefer more artisan or complicated versions. But I think the simplicity is the virtue. Simple bright tomato sauce , mozzarella, thin sliced pepperoni. $9 lunch special is a bargain for downtown with personal deep dish pizza, good size dinner salad, and refillable Coke.
Always solid pizza. Order with extra cheese. Love the salad dressing.

We were in town and had to get our Chicago deep dish fix.  After asking around town, we decided on Lou Malnati's.  I really don't get what all the hype is about.  The ingredients were not quality, the cheese was mushy and not stretchy, the crust was flaky like pie crust, the whole thing was unimpressive and not good at all. I had one slice and didn't finish it.  We ordered mozzerella sticks and those were frozen, not even homemade.  Not sure what the fuss is all about but the best thing I had was my drink.
Go here!  So much fun!  Also for someone with celiac disease they offer two options - a thin crust or a sausage crust!
Meeeehhhh~ I guess I'm not big into Chicago deep dish style pizza but I've had better. The salad was the highlight of our lunch (yummy little bacon bits in their signature salad).
one of the greatest things i've ever eaten. best pizza i've ever tasted, regardless of "style." must have!

Great place. Very popular. Nice atmosphere and our server was pleasant. This place was recommended by a local to try Chicago deep dish pizza. We were not aware it takes 30 minutes to cook so it was very fresh! Green salad was okay. It is definitely worth a visit!

So we asked so many people while we were in Chicago where to go for pizza.  This was the answer or Giordona's so we landed on this one. We waited for a minute and were seated. Our server was busy but took our order.  We got our pizza and it was good. Not great but good. And I do really think it is about personal preference for sure. I personally like more sauce and a thicker sauce which this was not. The crust was good.  I would've liked a hotter(in temperature) pizza but we ate it and left. Small pizza. Two pieces per person for two of us. Might return. Might try others.

Major let down. We were told we'd be seated in 25 mins but that we should order our pizza ahead with the cashier. We placed our order ahead. It took 45 mins before we were sat at our table. The pizza came out with our drinks 20 minutes later. Our pizza wasn't fresh. It was room temperature and it had clearly been reheated, because it was sitting out so long. I would have preferred to wait longer and have a fresh pizza. This restaurant prefers quantity of guests before quality of pizza. The service was also very slow. I don't recommend this place nor do I recommend ordering ahead if you want a fresh pizza.

I have to buck the trend here. I don't see the high ratings. I find the crust to be greasy and bland. Great sauce, tons of cheese, too skimpy on the pepperoni. I went to Giordano's a few years ago and would like to return to compare.  Atmosphere is great! Would like to see a bigger draft selection and a craft root beer.

PRICING: It's easy to overspend here. Like you think your bill might be $50 because you aren't paying attention, and then it turns out to be $75. Just be careful. Or just don't be me. Whichever is easier. PIZZA: The pizza here is really good. I mean, it better be, right? The crust is delicious. A browned buttery crust that really handles that rest of the flavors well. I much prefer Lou's crust to any other pizzeria's, though I like the sauce at Gino's East better. SIZE: If it's two of you, just get the small. Don't do it to yourself in getting the medium. You can't do it. I don't believe in you.  OTHER FOOD: I also got some mozzarella sticks, which were a bit redundant with the pizza, next time I would try something else.  Would recommend.

We went here on a holiday weekend and waited an hour and five minutes for our table.  It was worth it.   Totally worth it!  When you arrive and give them your name they will ask for your phone number.  Give it to them.  They will text you and you get to see where your place in line is, while you wait.  Then you go to the counter and order your pizza.  Just your pizza and then when your seated you'll order any appetizers or salads.  This is suppose to get your pizza to the table quicker.   Ours came out a little too quick when we got seated. It beat our garlic bread and mozzarella sticks.  I was peeved at first but it was so amazing I didn't care!!  We took home the leftovers and had them the next night for dinner.

I come here almost everytime I visit Chicago. The deep dish pizza is delicious and ultra filling. I can hardly eat 2 slices because they are so fat and loaded in the best way possible. The wait time was super long every time I went there, but I always leave highly satisfied. Staff was great, and you can order before sitting so that helps save time too. First timers should definitely try it, but after the 5th time for me its starting to lose its MUST GO status a little.

I used to be a Giordano's fan, but I came back and everyone said I needed to try Lou Malnati's.   They couldn't be more right because I was in heaven!! The flavors are just perfect and it was even better the next day for brunch

This was my first time trying deep-dish in Chicago, although I've had a few run-ins with deep dish in San Francisco (Little Star, Patxi's). From word of mouth, I heard the best way to order is to-go, then pick it up because pizzas usually take 45 minutes to come out. Good suggestion because it's the perfect walking distance from Navy pier, Millennium Park, and other sightseeing touristy spots. When I arrived at the original Lou Manalti's, there was a crowd of people and probably a 30-40 minute wait on a Wednesday night, which attests to its popularity.  I got the Chicago Classic - lean sausage, tomato sauce, cheese on buttercrust - and it was good, but nothing life-changing. The sausage overpowers the other ingredients, so I didnt pick up the sauce flavor that much and the cheese was kind of just there. Again, pizza was good, but I guess my expectations were a little higher.

The last two times I have hit Chicago I had Lou Malnati's. While it can be a wait, the wait is worth it. man, it's good. The salads are great too but that pizza tho. I can't wait to get back and get another slice.

I would give a zero if I could. Down the street from my building. They deliver rotten, I mean spoiled, food. What idiot place does this and thinks there won't be bad reviews? Thanks to Yelp now people will know. Tourist trap with rotten food. I wouldn't go to this place if I were you, especially considering all the other really great pizza places in town. Even Bottled Blond across the street has exponentially better food-which is not rotten.

Lou's contacted me several times to speak about my experience and they have went above and beyond to listen to my concerns and rectify whatever happened during my visit. I am sooo extremely impressed by their sincere effort to listen to customers and improve their business. I have not come across many organizations as nice and as attentive as Lou's. I have had a few organizations message me to change their reviews. At first they offer a deal or an inventive to go back and retry, but normally I politely decline since I already had a bad experience the first time and don't see how going again when they are on their best behavior would solve anything. The companies then have proceeded to flat out ask me to change the review with various excuses or even angry threats. Lou's did not even mention anything at all about changing the review. It appears they just were genuinely trying to make sure I ended up being happy with the service! I cannot wait to try their spinach pizza.

A lot of people told me to check this place out, so a group of my friends and I went to check it out. I love the look and feel of this place. I went around lunchtime and it was busy and felt like a pub, was lively and had a lot of cool memorabilia surrounding the place. I ordered the Malnati Chicago Classic. It was super filling and tasty. I thought it could have used a bit more of flavor, while it was good, I thought it could have been a little better. This place had one of the best bloody marys we had during our whole stay in Chicago though!

Being a native Chigagoan, I've lived my life consuming great deep-dish pizza. Uno and Due are wonderful, Gino's East used to be very good before LUEY acquired the chain, Giordano's is about 7th on my list. HOWEVER, Lou Malnati (former chef at UNO) created the perfect pie... Great spices, great ingredients, great crust, great toppings... all mixed together to create what our family believes to be the BEST pizza in the land...  Get a fresh one (don't take home a frozen one or have one shipped unless you are prepared to sacrifice a little bit of the pleasure of having a freshly cooked one.

Pretty solid spot! While I think I still love NY pizza more, this was some delicious pizza. I came in on a Thursday afternoon and it was a little dead so grabbed a seat at the bar. The bartender was great, we talked for quite a bit and he gave me some solid Chicago tips and what to order there. I ordered the stuffed spinach bread to start, it was delicious and very filling! It could have used a bit more spinach but overall the flavor was fantastic. I would definitely consider getting this if you come in. I ordered the Lou Malnati's special which is a large piece of sausage instead of chunks. It was fantastic, and also filling (personal size). I felt it could have maybe used a bit more sauce, and it really didn't feel like extra cheese but I think that was just perception vs. reality. As everyone mentions it takes 30-40 minutes so get an app if you're hungry. I enjoyed the service and the food and if I was back in the Windy City I'd probably come here first for my deep dish craving. Weirdly enough walking in, sitting down there is a giant Babe Ruth cut out on the wall. Something I didn't expect, but the Malnati's were from NY. Just a fun piece of information.
Really great pizza! We went to pick up after it says pizza was ready to pick up.  We waited for another 20 mins still..

Had the deep dish pizza and it was okay. Not really a fan of theirs or giordanos, but when in Chicago... The customer service was great! We ordered half cheese half sausage and they accidentally gave us all sausage, so our waiter didn't make us pay for it. We didn't even ask for that or complain at all, they just offered to not make us pay the bill. It was super nice of them, id def go back (but order something other than the deep dish) not my thing lol
Pretty good pizza But the thin crust I ate in Racine was tough to beat So that is why only 3 stars
Lous is THE place to go for deep dish pizzas.  Deep dish, extra cheese, pepperoni and butter crust.  #diedandwenttoheaven
Not a deep dish fan. This was very much a chain restaurant and didn't feel like authentic Chicago. Get the thin crust.

Visited Chicago from LA and heard this was a must-try.  Line was over an hour long wait.  Once seated we ordered typical appetizers, wings, mozzarella sticks, cheese bread etc.  You could taste the store-bought refrigerated taste.  We were full once deep-dish pizzas arrived.  For all the hype, I wasnt too impressed.  Tasted pretty much like LA's Pizza Hut.
Best pizza ever!!!! It's was everything that "Chicago style pizza" is supposed to be and better.

Hands down the best pizza in Chicago! Don't be fooled by Gino's or Giordano's - if you want deep dish come here.  My favorite location is the Gold Coast one and I've never had to wait more than 20/30 minutes. They don't take reservations but have a bar and you can pre-order your pizza so it comes out pretty much right after you are seated. Highly recommend!

Best pizza on the planet.  Always get the buttercrust and it's always best in the restaurant out of the pan so it's crispier.  There are many locations now, though usually consistency is not usually an issue.  If you take it to go and eat it out of the box, just know it is even better out of the pan (or out of your oven - order it uncut and crisp it back up for 10 minutes).
Best Chicago pizza ever---goes great with a 312 also!
The deep dish hits the spot! We got a large pizza and it lasted for two meals for 3 ppl. So yummy!

If you are visiting Chicago for the first time, you MUST go here. We are staying at the Beat Western in River Front and the parking employee recommended this place for a good classic Chicago Deep Dish pizza. I went here last night. The wait was supposed to be 25 minutes but we found two seats at the bar and skipped the wait! The bartenders were very nice and accommodating hence the busy night they had. We ordered a mule (custom with triple sec) and Goose IPA for drinks and got the classic deep dish pizza from the restaurant and really enjoyed it! I thought it was nice how they warned us that the deep dish would take 40 minutes and we in return ordered some more beers to enjoy the wait. The pizza was amazing. I would recommend getting a smaller size than you are used to for regular pizza because this deep dish stuff is very filling. I usually eat a good amount of food and could finish a regular medium size pizza without lifting a muscle but with this medium the two of us still had two pieces left over!

Like all reviews below, this pizza is AMAZING! Being from California, I never had deep dish pizza like this and don't think I can ever go back to eating "deep dish" where I am from bc there is no comparison!  I came here on Friday around 4:30pm and had no wait bc we were early. We got half cheese half half Chicago Classic(sausage). It took 1 hr to come out once we ordered. The butter crust - amazing. Cheese - super cheesy and gooey without being too much. The sausage was a whole entire thin layer on top so every bite had sausage. The tomato sauce - so flavorful, not a strong tomato taste. I highly recommend going here if you are a tourist - it'll be worth the wait! :)
Great individual pan pizza with plum tomatoes. Also can get frozen to take home- also good.

Alright, here's the deal. The 2 star didn't come from the service. From what I heard, this place had one of the best deep dish pizzas in Chicago which is why I visited. Im from the DC area and tried different pizzas in different areas. For appetizer I got the calamari which was average. Nothing that sticked out about it. I don't know which one specifically I got but it seemed closest to a supreme pizza. It was cheesy and good, but it  something just didn't seem to hit the expectations. Maybe my expectations were too high? Who knows. Something just seemed off about the sauce for me. I'll definitely try it one more time next time. The wait wasn't too long during dinner time so that was a good thing. I'd recommend you guys try it though for sure!

Pizza was great, there was a ton of sausage on the pie, and it lived up to the name! My hubby and I were visiting Chicago for the weekend and everyone said Lou's was the place to go, and we're very glad we did!! The bottom crust was a little larger than I expected for deep dish compared to Geno's we tried last time in Chicago. But Lou Malnati's was still the best pizza we have had. We will definitely be back to visit our next to Chicago!!

As visitors to Chicago, this seems to be one of three main pizza places that both locals and visitors enjoy visiting,  We tried two of the three and this was our least favorite of the two.   Now we know, people's opinions vary on the deep dish pizza subject in Chicago; however, this is our opinion.   Compared to the other place we tried (see our other review) we found this pizza to be lacking in so many departments.   First of all, what did we enjoy?  We enjoyed the fact that you could order ahead and then pick it up.  When we arrived at 8:15PM for our pick-up order on Saturday, September 3rd the wait was over 2.5 hours.  Not only was the sidewalk blocked creating a safety hazard; however, people were ordering to go and then sitting on the sidewalk outside and eating, creating a mini camp of sorts.  It was really weird. Anyway, we picked up our pizza (a small) for two and then took a Lyft to Navy Pier and ate there.   We found the crust to be plain (compared to the other place we reviewed), we found that there was virtually no sauce, and we found the pizza just to be rather plain and not that great tasting.   Again, our opinion; however, not impressed.

Came here yesterday  around 2pm and had a small pizza with poultry sausage and black olives. The wait time was 1 hour to be seated and 1 hour for food. My server was rude. Pizza was blah and overpriced. Not sure what all the fuss is over this place. I would not recommend

The pizza is just great here. Hands down. The reason for 3 stars is because of an incident and the service. The waiter didn't check with us for coffee refills and didn't give us water. A busboy walked by and spilled all the remaining residues of another plate all over my shoulders and arms. Now I smell like vinegar.... I didn't want to file a complaint to the manager since we don't want him to lose the job. But it seems like there should be a discount or an apology to me for all the trouble. Now I need to get back and change which kinda ruined my day.

Chicago is known for it's pizza and this is obviously a place for Chicagoan's.  I'm originally from the south, it would take some getting used to.  My family enjoyed it and there is a popular appetizer we ordered (sorry I forgot what it was) that was truly excellent...IMO, better than the pizza.  Overall if my family enjoyed it, then I'm satisfied.  What are Moms for?  :)
