Waited 30 minutes to get a seat and another 20 minutes to get the pizza. Pretty long wait but worth trying. Chicago classic has cheese and sausage, wish cheese too be heavier and less sausage.

Best tasting Chicago Pizza around. While all the pizza places differ slightly, this seems to be the place where most local people prefer for deep dish. Try the butter crust, and even the simple cheese pizza is delicious.
Probably the best deep dish I ever had. The sauce is unbelievably tasty. What are they marinating those tomatoes in? Magic?

I was so excited to try the infamous Chicago Pizza. We ordered the stuffed spinach bread which was good. We got the Chicago deep dish pizza. Truthfully, I was a bit disappointed with it.. The pizza is not as thick as I thought. The cheese is a bit weird, but service was good.

I love Lou's!! There's probably going to be a wait if you go on the weekends but you cannot beat the pizza. Once you get a table it takes about 40 minutes for your pizza to arrive (unless they let you order while you're in line, then it's a little shorter). I always get the Malnati Chicago Classic and I love it. Lou's offers a special "butter crust" that is simply unbeatable. You can also get a "sausage wheel" on any pizza, which is exactly what it sounds like and absolutely delicious. The service is friendly and the family sized salads are a great investment if there's enough people in your party. Deep dish pizza isn't even my favorite kind of pizza, but I love going to Lou's!

The first time I came here I got the Chicago Classic to go. It was about a 35 min wait and by the time I got back to my hotel to dig in, the sausage topping had shifted and the cheese didn't stretch when I bit into it, which is my favorite part of eating pizza. The crust was good but verged on being too buttery. The second time I dined in with friends and thought it was better. Got the bbq wings and the pepperoni.

My sister & I went there on a Sunday night at 9 PM. There was a wait, but luckily we found two seats at the bar. Service was a bit slow and he wasn't as attentive since our drinks were empty most of the time. Wait time for pizza is around 40-45 mins. We ordered the Manalti Chicago Classic.  I wasn't thoroughly impressed. Maybe because I am more of a NY pizza kind of girl? The flavor was alright, but nothing to write home about.

Other than having to wait 30 mins for your pizza to be ready, we enjoyed out night out at Lou Malnati's. For my family of three, we ordered the large deep dish with sausage. It was very delicious but one slice is enough! A must when you visit Chicago.

This the best pizza place I've ever been. The hubby and I were recommended this spot from an uber driver. We were visiting from California and we were heading to a different restaurant and when the uber driver started to describe the pizza and how it's his favorite place we decided to skip on the plans we had and headed to Lou Malnatis Pizzeria instead.  We ordered "The Lou" with pepperoni and sausage! It was delicious that buttercrust was amazing. Just thinking about it right now I want some. Must try with sausage and pepperoni. If that's too much meat just try it with the sausage.  We also ordered the stuffed spinach bread and buffalou wings with a little kick as appetizers!! Everything we ordered was perfection!!! I wish I lived closer. We went twice during our visit and had the same order.

We were in Chicago for a last second trip and what a great time.  We went on a Saturday night so there was a little bit of a wait but it wasnt that bad.  All the apps that we had were amazing as well as the service.  Our waitress was quick and friendly.  Cant say that I was the biggest of fans of deep dish pizza before (maybe because this was my first time having it in Chicago)  but Lous did not disappoint!  We got a couple pies plus the apps for the 4 of us and couldnt even come close to finishing everything!  The pizza was great the next day for leftovers and will be returning next time I come to Chicago!
Love this place,,,, great food,,,very friendly servers and nice ambience so what more could you ask for?

Visiting my brother in the city as he is working at the Goodman Theater, we wanted to go to my dad's favorite pizzeria and get the classic Chicago style pizza! It was also my boyfriend's first time in the city, so we wanted to introduce him the right way! When we got there, the place was packed and there was a 45 minute wait. It wasn't an issue as they said we could pre-order the pizza and it would he made while we waited. About 50 minutes, and we got seated.  The server was friendly, but we realized that "pre-order" really just meant "it will take 5 minutes off you deciding what pizza you want and THEN the order will be placed AFTER you sit down". So, it doesn't really mean what they say it means.  The pizza was amazing and we got 2 mediums for the 4 of us to enjoy a good 2 slices and have leftovers. This is also good for larger groups as the pizzas take the same amount of time to bake, rather than ordering a large and a small.  The 4 stars is more for the service we were given, the wait time, the false advertising of the pre-order option, and the fact that it was FREEZING in the restaurant as it was a relatively cool evening for a Chicago night in August. Get the Classic, you won't be disappointed.
The pizza is outstanding, the service is friendly, the atmosphere casual.  Chicago has a lot of great pizza places - this is my favorite.

When people come from out of town insisting on deep dish, we visit Lou's.  Fresh and delicious, we will all agree that deep dish pizza is not really pizza but it doesn't matter because it's just flat out good.

Been a fan of Lou Mainati's since I was a kid. Love there pizza , and consider it a true Chicago icon. I would give them 5 stars but I noticed recently hit and miss with there pizza. Sometimes under cooked. Nut the manager is always good in fixing the situation.
Get a Lou with no mushrooms and add pepperoni. Get it xtra well done, deep dish, with buttercrust.

I took a day trip to Chicago and wanted to maximize my experience of Chicago and what better way to do that than with some deep dish pizza? I decided on Lou Malnati's due to suggestions from friends as well as raving reviews on yelp and I was not disappointed!  Ended up ordering the spinach bread and the Malnati Chicago Classic and both were amazing! The spinach bread is a smaller sized loaf of bread filled with cheesy goodness and a little bit of spinach as well. The pizza with the butter crust is amazing as well! Took about 30 min for them to make the pizza but it was definitely worth the wait. The crust has a really nice crunch to it all around and every bite was filled with ooey gooey mozzarella goodness and Oh my, they definitely do not skimp on the sausage! Instead of bits of sausage, it seemed like they had sausage on every inch of the pie! A small pizza and the spinach bread were more than enough for our party and I would highly recommend the deep dish pizza here to anyone!

Its been two weeks since I first had Lou Malnati's and I still cannot stop thinking about it.  Wish I was in Chicago right about now to have a slice of their delicious pizza! I was in town for a girlfriend's birthday and came to this restaurant for an early lunch. The restaurant fills up quickly so get there early to avoid the long lines.  By the time we had finished our meals, there was an hour wait already.  For starters, we had the stuffed spinach bread.The sauce on the side is perfect with he bread.  We ordered a large pizza of the Malnati Chicago classic.  It was split among 4 girls and we still had 2 slices left over.  Request that the pizza be cooked well done.  Our server recommended it cooked that way and I couldn't have agreed more.  The pizza was dripping with so much cheese and sausage.  We also added spinach which added a nice balance to all the flavors coming from the pizza.  Definitely a must try!

Had to try deep dish pizza while in Chicago. We were seated immediately outside, super nice evening. Our server was great! Friendly, helpful, made it an enjoyable experience. Tried chicken wings, delicious! A little crispy, perfect amount of sauce, yum! Also shared a small deep dish pepperoni. Very good. So filling, we only had a slice each. Glad we tried this place.

If you are reading a review for Lou Malnati's to determine whether or not you want to try it, I will assume you are visiting Chicago. This is one of the greatest pizza staples in the entire Chicagoland area. They are renowned for their deep dish, and it is truly excellent. One of the more out of the norm things they do is their sausage deep dish pizza- you don't get little chunks of sausage, there is a giant, unbroken wheel of it! Sausage in every bite! If you are looking for something other than deep dish, they have some other great options for you: their thin crust is great, with great thin slices and a very crunchy crust to top it off. If pizza is not your thing, they make a ridiculously good Caesar salad (just don't count the calories, you may hate yourself). My personal favorite here is "The Lou" which is a buttercrust deep dish pizza with mushrooms, spinach, tomatoes, three cheeses, and a blend of spices that compliment it all perfectly. If you want to experience true Chicago pizza, this is one of the top two. Be warned, as it is so wildly popular, it can get very crowded. And don't forget that it does take a little while longer to fully cook a behemoth of a pizza that is their deep dish.

True Deep Dish Pizza! When you think of Chicago, you think of the home of the deep dish and Lou Malnati's Pizzeria delivers just that! The lines are long for a reason and you'll need to place your name in line 40 minutes before your stomach gets hungry but it's all worth it. I had the butter crust pizza with the huge slab of sausage right on top- just great! Hot, crispy and filled with the flavors you love- cheese, meat and the herbs and spices that pull it all together nicely. Staff are friendly and very attentive. An additional bonus is that their bathrooms are very clean. Bottom line- Unos has nothing on this place, for the real flavor of the deep dish- this is the spot!
Looooooooooveeee them! I have never gotten an order wrong! They always come on time with an abundance of extras like plates and forks as requested.

My Goodness, Deep dish, Thin Crust, Desserts, Customer service, Cleanliness you name it...... TOP NOTCH PLACE!!! Even the salads and Sandwiches are 5 stars. If you come to Chicago there are hundreds of 5 star places to eat but I warn you...... DO NOT miss out on this place

Great deep dish! It was my first time having deep dish and after that first bite, everything I thought I knew about pizza was a lie. Who knew pizza could be juicy, chewy, fresh and absolutely no greasiness!! My mind was pleasantly blown :)

Being from California I'll say Zachary's (Oakland/Berkeley) deep dish is much better and more flavorful, and Patxi's is average.  Use that as your gauge of this review. Maybe I don't know what to expect from Deep dish Chicago pizza or maybe it's what we ordered.  The food was average bordering on somewhat bland, and price was ok.   We didn't have a reservation but it didn't take too long to get seated for party of 2.  They have a good system for putting in your pizza order while you're waiting for your table so that the long wait for deep dish isn't too long once you're sitting. Nothing to rave about for the food or the restaurant.  Next time I'm in Chicago I'll try another deep dish and let you know if it's just me and my sketchy relationship with deep dish pizza.

As caterers, we get many diverse client requests & being in Chicago, the "Taste of Chicago" request comes up quite often.  Now, as all Chicagoans know, a Taste of Chicago menu would not be complete without deep dish pizza & Lou's is always our go to!  They have always been more than accommodating to our & our client's requests & go above and beyond to make sure all parties involved are satisfied.  Delivery staff is always prompt and friendly; we know we can always count on Lou's!

My friend and I walked across the city to come here and I would say it was quite worth the walk! We had to try their famous deep dish pizza so we opted for a small sized cheese deep dish and split it. We also ordered wings and calamari for appetizers, as recommended by our server. The wings were good but calamari was a bit disappointing. The deep dish pizza was the best of the meal and even though I am not a huge fan of pizza I really enjoyed how flavorful it was. This pizza place is a must when in Chicago!
all i can say is i love lou malnati's!!!  one of my favorite pizza's.

Stopped in last night around 10 PM and it was fairly busy. Tried to get a table but we were pretty tired from walking around all day so we got it to go. Ordered the Lou with half mushrooms half none, brought it back to the hotel. Everything was piping hot and mouth watering. The cheese is always melty and amazing, the best part is always the tomato slices on the top, I'm a huge tomato guy, love them. Always tell my friends who are heading to Chicago to go here!

I just want to go on the record and say, Chicago style pizza is not very good (Chicago pride keeps many from speaking up about such a touchy subject), BUT if you're going to get pizza thats not wood or coal fired, get Lou's. Their crust is the best, and really just in general the ingredients are better (referring to Gino's, Giordanos, etc). Get the cookie pizza desert. They say money can't buy happiness, but I don't think whoever said that tried a cookie pizza here.

When we got to the restaurant, we were told it would be a 45 minute wait. They said we could order the pizza ahead of time so we wouldn't have to wait. We thought to ourselves, perfect! Boy were we wrong. The pizza was cold and there was no sauce on it. When we asked for more sauce, the waitress said she would get us some. 20 minutes later, she asked how everything was. We asked for the sauce again, and she brought it 5 minutes later. Only got one refill for the hour we were there. Terrible service. I would never go back.
Called ahead for a personal deep dish and arrived to a nasty woman at the register insisting I'd ordered a small. Couldn't even finish a slice anyway.

Delicious! We didn't try giordano's, so I can't compare, but everything was tasty! The cheesy bread was good, but nothing super special. We went at like 4 on a Saturday and only waited a few min! When we were leaving, the wait was an hour!
Best deep dish in town! The new location in Lincoln Square has a great outdoor patio.
Lou's in Chicago was good, but to wait for a pizza for 50 minutes is a bit much. Product did not equal the wait but still good.
Love their pizza! If you want deep dish, I'd make a trip to this place.

I absolutely love this place, from the atmosphere, our server's customer service, and of course the pizza itself. I would definitely eat here again. If it's your first time, be prepared you are going to be waiting as it is not a huge location. Definitely worth the wait though!

We've been to both the one in Lincoln Park and the one in River North.  The dining experience is always lovely.  There's something about this place that is homey, but maybe, it's because we've dined here for the last 20 years.  The pizzas are never disappointing.  My favorite experience though is my order of 6 frozen pizzas that I had shipped to Hawaii as a gift for a Coast Guard friend who was stationed there.  The pizzas arrived on time, still frozen, and we joined them for dinner upon arrival.  They heated up wonderfully and was just as good as in the restaurant.  Makes an impressive gift indeed!

Okay,  I'm a huge Chicago pizza lover and  sorry, the pizza here was disappointing. The dough was very hard and what happened to the sausage patty that covers the entire pizza? The staff was unconcerned about customer service and the place needed cleaning. Maybe it's the location or the time we visit but, I want visit this location again.. Disappointing and the only reason 3 stars because I know they typically has good food and service.

Delicious! We arrived with a party of 6. They told us to order first and seating would be about 45 min and we should order then so they can start making the pizza soon. We were seating in about 35 minutes. Appetizers ordered and arrived within 15, and the pizza 10 minutes after that. the food was all so prompt!  Lotsa beers on tap to go with your pizza. The calamari is sooooo fresh and one of my favorite things. You can't go wrong with anything you order.

#Amazing Chicago style Deep Dish Pizza my friends!!....it was so packed tonight with 1+ hour wait times that I almost didn't get a seat.   Atmosphere was very cool, I highly recommend this place.   Great Pizza with that Buttery crust too....

Excellent gluten free pizza! Usually pizza places under cook the GF pizza and its soft and just...gross. This crust was thin and crunchy. Perhaps a bit too crunchy for some, but I loved it! **For those with Celiac or severe gluten allergies, the menu does warn that Lou's GF pizza does come into contact with cutting/prep surfaces that are also used for gluten-iferous foods.
Not as good as I thought it would be. May be because we are vegetarian. So don't want to comment more. Wait time is long, so plan accordingly.
Lou Malnati's is the Banana Republic of Chicago deep dish (Gino's is GAP, Giordano's is Old Navy).

I believe this restaurant is always busy! My friend and I got there at 19h30 and was on waiting list. They took our phone number for them to text whenever the table was ready. They also gave us the menu to preorder pizza only. Appetizers and salads can be ordered on the table.  By 20h00 our table was ready, so we waited for 30 mins! Apart from pizza, we ordered MALTANI SALAD and it came in 15 mins! It was DELICIOUS! The salad was sweet yet has savoury taste from salami bits! Sooooooo gooooooood omg definitely worth to try! Then our pizza was ready 35 mins after we got our table! We ordered small MALTANI CHICAGO CLASSIC and it tasted AWESOME! Cheese was sooo gooey and the toppings were delicious! However we couldn't finish the crust tho.... Just like any other famous touristy restaurants in Chicago, their service tends to be really quick, yet friendly!  Overall, it's definitely worth to try!

Best deep dish in the city! Make sure to make a reservation though, because this place is always filled with tourists. Definitely order the deep dish here & don't forget to get the buttery crust! After having this for the first time this summer, I definitely think this is a once a month type of meal. It's a very satisfying meal, but it also is a heavy one!

My favorite style pizza is really the Brick Oven Style Pizza. Having lived in New York City, I've had the best of all pizza. Though the closest I've ever had to a deep dish was Pizzeria Uno. So of Course being in Chicago, my dining partner and I had to try the Deep Dish Chicago Pizza which Chicago is famous for. We arrived for lunch on a Thursday at 11:00 a.m. as not having to wait as I've read that wait time can be long. Believe it or not at 11:00 a.m. we got the last available table. Our server Sam introduced herself, took our drink orders while we looked over the menu. We ordered the Medium Malnati Salad and the Personal Pan Cheese Buttercrust Pizza. The salad was excellent. The Pizza was good, very thick and cheesy. I just have a personal preference for Pizza styles, but I'm so glad I've had a taste of the best Deep Dish pizza Chicago has to offer. Atmosphere is a touristy Pizza Restaurant. Service very good. Food very good, a MUST TRY in Chicago!
This place never disappoints!  The Classic is amazing, and the service is always good, which is why we will continue to come back again and again!

Let me start by saying that I am huge pizza fan! I pretty much love all pizza (yes, even the cheap Jack's pizzas from the grocery store). We have had Lou Malnati's catered to my office several times and I loved their thin crust pizza!! Sadly, whenever my boyfriend and I try to order deep dish at home, it falls short of delicious/edible. On Valentines day, we ordered the heart pizza and it came soggy and very undercooked. We informed the store of this and received a gift card in return, which was a very nice gesture by the manager of the Gold Coast location. Last night, we decided to give it another try and we ordered a large deep dish with lots of delicious sounding toppings: pepperoni, garlic, mushroom, olives, extra cheese, and buttercrust, cooked well done and uncut (per the previous managers suggestions)!! WE WERE SO EXCITED. However, our excitement quickly faded when we started eating the pizza only to find it covered with a thin slice of sausage covering the entire slice/pizza! I have a strong distaste for sausage and decided..ok..I'll just take it off and enjoy the rest of the cheesy goodness. FAIL. When you take the sausage off, it takes off the entire top of the pizza including the sauce and olives, etc. I was so disappointed. As much as I wanted to love it, I think I'll stick with Peaquod's for my deep dish cravings from now on. :(
Tragically the only true legit Chicago deep dish pizza place. The other big name spots are strictly tourist locations with shadows of their past fame and flavor. I wouldn't go elsewhere.

I know, I know what you're going to say: How can you go to Chicago without trying deep dish pizza?! Well I must confess I have never been a big cheese kinda of guy and therefore pizza has never really been at the top of my list of foods. But with so many people telling us to try somewhere we buckled and chose Lou's based on other Yelp reviews and the top deep dish pizzas on a Thrillist list. We went pretty early in the day and we were seated immediately. I ordered a sausage thin crust and my wife got the personal sausage deep dish. This pizza was different than anything else I have had. The deep dish butter crust was so good, and the cheese was just an amazing ratio. I pretty much ate half my wife's pizza and then 3/4s of mine (I had to share). Truth be told I think there was more cheese on my pizza then the deep dish. I think Lou's was fantastic. I'm told that really only tourist go there, last I checked though good pizza is good pizza

Excellent pizza! I got seated right away and the service was quick.  They found the secret with deep pan pizza. Instead of just making a Italian style pizza an loading it with extra filling they went another route. The crust is perfect and the combination of filling is just bang on.  It is the first time in my life that I waited 35 minutes for a pizza, but it was all worth it.

We live in Colorado and crave Lou Malnatti's pizza! There's always a long wait but worth it. Their pizza is so delicious. Despite the long lines and wait time, staff and service is excellent! A must visit place

I had a very hard decision to make between here and Giordano's, and I'm ultimately glad I chose to come here. I loaded my pizza with veggies and sausage... twas amazing! Even the salad was delicious. The only drawback here was the service which I found to be a bit on the slow side.  great for any  occasion, plenty of seating and menu options.

Hands down, my favorite pizzeria! I always bring out of town friends to this place, and if they say they don't like deep dish, they like it after they've had Lou's. Try the butter crust deep dish spinach. It is seasoned so nicely and tastes great. Their thin crust is excellent too. Highly recommend.

I'm really not a huge fan of deep dish (sorry Chicago) but it is a great spot to take visitors and has, quite frankly, been my go to. They do not take reservations, it is busy literally every single night, and you have to stop by, give your name, and stay within 5 minutes to receive a table. The only reason I give it 4 stars as opposed to 5 is because of the incredibly inconvenient system. Let a girl make a reservation! Other than that the pizza is pizza and everyone I have taken there has enjoyed it.

I've lived in Chicago for 9 years, and I have a secret: I hate deep dish pizza. I think it's kinda gross. I had only tried Giordanos, and discovered that pizza that needs to be eaten with a fork and consists of a wall of pure cheese simply does not appeal to me at all. I tried Lou Malnatis recently in order to give deep dish pizza another chance to impress me, and it did not disappoint! The crust is crispy and buttery, and you can actually pick this pizza up! The cheese wasn't overpowering the meal, and whatever sauce they're using over there is to die for. I work in tourism and I will definitely be sending customers looking for deep dish towards this place from now on. It was delicious. Well done.
Love Lou! Their thin crust is the best in town and their service is impeccable.

Never go in expecting greatness, right? Well- I was excited to try my oh so expensive pizza (they charge for every single topping) but was sort of letdown. I was expecting the pizza to be more deep than what we got and didn't expect it to be so hard to eat, almost needed a steak knife to cut it haha. But on the positive- the appetizers were fantastic! Get the calamari and sampler platter!
Unbelievable pizza and fantastic service!  The crispy crust and great meats were awesome!  Don't forget the cookie!
I didn't think I liked deep dish pizza, but when I first came to Chicago this was my first meal and I will never go back. It is the best pizza I've ever had and I will now forever swear by it!

Delicious !! Loved this pizza.  Close to the Merchandise Mart where we had just finished a Trade Show. Right out the back door of the Mart on the Wells side.......up a block or so.  Should be on our list to visit every time in Chicago.

Being a lover of Napoletan-style and NYC-style pizza, I had little to no interest in trying Chicago "deep dish"-style while visiting this gorgeous city - not to be a snob, but the idea didn't appeal to my appetite. However, we started out the day early and hunger struck, so we checked this place out, unaware that it's an institution. Being early and not realizing how lucky we were, there was no line and we were quickly seated. The attentive waiter informed us that if we were getting deep dish, we would have a bit of a wait for the food to prepare, so we split a sizable garden salad as an appetizer. The pizza, which we also split, was absolutely delicious - fresh and perfectly seasoned tomato sauce, excellent, crisp and tender crust, and tasty mozzarella. I couldn't believe I almost missed out on this treat and I highly recommend it to those who, like me, are otherwise close-minded about deep-dish. No, it's not traditional, but it's its own thing. Also, it is absolutely filling and powered us for the rest of the day. I recommend going early, because soon after we were seated, this place filled up very quickly! Hope to return one day!!

My father and I got there on a Tuesday night and were told to expect a 15-20 minute wait. Not bad, we figured it represented how good the restaurant was. They asked us to give a phone number and said they would text us when they were ready to seat us, and to place our pizza orders at the counter to expedite our food getting to us when we were seated. Going off of that, we placed our order (a simple large deep dish cheese pizza) and decided to go for a short walk in the immediate vicinity since it was our first night in town, it maybe took us about ten minutes. We hadn't received a text yet but decided to head back anyway. We got back and waited an additional twenty. At this point we figured it wouldn't hurt to ask if the wait time had increased. They said they called us for our table already. Huh!? They told us they would *text* us. Not too big a deal, they sat us at the next table for two, but if we hadn't asked we probably would have been waiting in the dark for a lot longer. Poor communication on their part. We were seated and the server was incredibly cheerful and friendly. She appeared to have a couple of large parties in addition to us so although the service wasn't lightning fast, it was definitely fast enough given how busy she was. She took our drink orders, it took some time to get our beer because they were changing the kegs, which was poor timing but had nothing to do with the service of the restaurant. However, the food took a very long time to come out, which was odd to me seeing they took our order about 40 minutes before we were even seated to *avoid* the food taking too long. And when it came out, it was lukewarm. For a pizza that doughy, we both agreed it lacked flavor. I wouldn't say it was worth the wait. Overall, I give it three stars for fair pricing and excellent service, but the wait for the table due to lack of communication on the part of the restaurant and the lukewarm/bland food soured our experience. I wouldn't recommend.

First, I was born and raised here in Chicago. I currently live in Florida but come back yearly for a visit. We ordered a pizza from here and must say in my opinion, this is one of the worse pizzas I have ever had in Chicago. Ordered the thin crust, it was like having pizza on a cracker. They put sooo little sausage on it, I could hardly see it. The cheese was also very little.  It was almost like buying a .99 Totino's pizza except I paid $27 including delivery. They charged $3.75 for delivery, I called them up to eye if that went to the driver and was told NO. So on top of $27+ I gave the driver a $3 tip. Would I ever order from them again? NOOOOOOO!

I'm updating to four stars because of the incredible customer service I received. Kevin, the manager at the River North location personally called to apologize and offer a replacement meal if I'm ever back in Chicago. Great service and caring about your customers goes a long ways, thanks!

Admittedly this is just a review of the food as I've always only got take out.  This location is close to where I live, so its a somewhat regular occurrence in my household.  Their pizza (both thin and deep dish) is one of the best in the city- and the crust on their pizza may be one of the best I've had in the world.  I start to drool just thinking about it.  The pizza always the right ratio of sauce to cheese to toppings creating pure bliss with every bite.  A few years ago a friend turned me on to the Malnati salad and so glad she did.  When not in the mood for pure gluttony, I'll do the salad (still far from healthy with the salami bits and cheese) which is one of the few salads to show up in my dreams.

Starved and a stranger in a strange town much? Checked into a Chicago institution and was impressed with the old school charm of this 2 floor pizzeria. Local brews check, fried calamari served with..cocktail sauce? Fail.

Came in today Tuesday am right at 11 before we left for the airport. Pizza: the sauce was very flavorful and had just enough cheese on it. The dough was perfect. Not too crunchy and not to soft.  5/5  Service: we sat at the bar with mark, amazing guy! Has such a Nice personality, thanks for the enjoyable conversation! If we ever come back to town we are coming in to have pizza and sit with mark!
Best pizza in Chicago. Buttery crust just doesn't get any better.
Loved loved loved this! The wait was long, but worth it. From the salad to the pizza, I was satisfied throughly. Just try it!

I don't know what I was expecting when I walked in, but it definitely exceeded whatever expectations I did have. It was a casual joint, and not crowded like Giordanos or Uno. Sat at the bar, watched some hockey and basketball, ordered a deep dish. All was good. The wait for my food was standard, and the pizza was everything I imagined and more. The sauce and toppings were just right. The crust was delicious. I'd have Lou Malnati's over any of the other chains.

We had a delivery order from Lou's. We ordered one pizza and were told it would be an hour before it would arrive. Ok no problem. 2 hours after we placed our order (after 9pm at this point) we called. We were told the delivery guys said he already delivered our pizza and we were eating it. Ummm...no. So we told them we had not gotten our pizza and there was no way we could have gotten our pizza because there was no way the delivery driver would have been let up into our building. So then they called back and now the story changed to our driver had brought our pizza back to the restaurant and it was going back out for delivery. They refunded our card- which was good because obviously they should. 30 minutes later the delivery guy calls. My husband went downstairs to get the pizza and the story changes yet again. The driver said he called our phone number when he arrived (this is a lie) and a lady answered (also a lie). He had my husbands cell phone number. We were all sitting watching a movie. It never rang and I didn't answer it, nor did anyone else in the residence. Also, if the driver dialed it wrong, that's odd because we have an out of state number. If he did dial it wrong and someone said we already got our pizza and we are eating now...I would double check that I called the right number- maybe I have more common sense though. It was an awful experience. Also I might add the crust was hard. Like really hard- almost as if it were stale??? Yuck. I will stick to Giordanos they are much better.
A good spot to grab a simple, traditional deep dish pizza. Wasn't wowed by the pizza itself but the establishment and service were great.

This is my second place I tried for a Chicago deep dish pizza.  I had it delivered.  It was a Friday night and they told me deliver would be over an hour but was pleasantly surprised when it arrived in 50 minutes.  Furthermore, the pizza was delivered hot and intact.  Kudos to the delivery folks.  I had the sausage pizza with the buttermilk crust with black olives added.  I thought the crust was decent.  I also thought the sauce and toppings were good.  Overall I thought the quality was good and I would go back.

Second pizza spot while on my Chicago Pizza Tour. I had Giordano's two days ago. GIORDANDO's is wayyyyy better.  Something wasn't mashing with my tastebuds. I ordered the Malnati's Classic (not pictured). Bread crust was soggy and the tomato/marinara sauce was bland. I did like the extra mozzarella cheese embedded in the pizza. I'm glad I ordered a personal size because I would have hated to trash the whole thing. Lastly,  I ordered the key lime pie hoping a dessert would redeem my experience but I was wrong. The cinnamon crust was a nice touch but overpowering.  The service was decent and we didn't have to wait long (Less than 20 minutes).  Overall, it's a must try for pizza lovers visiting Chicago. (Might have been a off day)  SN: My coworker enjoyed the Lou pizza but she did agree the bread crust was soggy. (Pictured)

Love Lou,  this was a much better experience for Chicago pizza than our last restaurant.  The server have the timing down to a science, expect to wait and hour for seating and another 40 minutes for your pre ordered pizza.   Try the Lou salad, best salad we have had in a long time.
The Malnati salad was divine & the deep dish pizza was the most delicious pizza I have ever had!!

Excellent Deep Dish! Not too greasy by usingnonly pure ingredients! Perfect crust! Size was smaller than expected - personal might not be enough for 1 Overall loved it and would surely recommend it for anyone who wants to try deep dish

I'm not a pizza snob. We don't have a real "Chicago Style" shop in Grand rapids so I was looking forward to this stop. We were on a layover stop on the railroad waiting to board the "City of New Orleans" to head south. We grabbed a cab at the station and told the driver to take us to the BEST pizza place in the area. WE HIT GOLD! God I loved this place!!!! We had a Chicago Classic and it was so good that we also returned on our trip home a week later. Can't wait to go again.

Classic Chicago deep dish. I'm not from Chicago and had never been before, so I figured I had to try this classic famous chain. It was okay. May be that I'm just not that in to deep dish in general, but the pizza was very saucy and cheese was kind of hard and not melty. Would probably try another place for deep dish next time.
The pizza was outstanding and the salad as well. The atmosphere was great.  One of the best Chicago style pizza in town highly recommend it. A bit pricey but the pizza is well worth it.
Just ordered three pizzas from Lou's last night. Always our go to for pizza night. I have yet to try a pizza with crust this delicious! Highly recommend!

Incredible Chicago style pizza at it's best!!! If you are ever in Chicago, this is a MUST!!! Fantastic pizza, extremely huge and filling !! CRAZY deep dish!!! You will never forget a pizza from Lou's!! EVER Long lines, but well worth it !!

If you want a Chicago deep dish pizza with a local unpretentious crowd, this is it! We got there around 4 it was very mellow. We ordered a salad and pizza for two and the portions were more than enough. The crunchy crust was my favorite, and the toppings tasted fresh. If you're an out of towner, this is the place to try. The walls were decorated in sports memorabilia and tv's. You'll feel relaxed and at home.
Love their pizza and the Malnati salad.  The salad is almost better than the pizza! Definitely a must for visitors to Chicago.

So if you wanna know Chicago pizza from a life long Chicagoan, don't go to Lou's. Its my least favorite pizza, deep dish and thin crust. Not a fan of their pizza dough and their menu in general. Its touristy at certain locations and their wait times are long for deep dish that isn't worth the wait. Go to Uno's or Gino's or Giordanos or Chicago's. These places know how to make really good deep dish pizza.  FYI if you look up the history of deep dish pizza, it was started at Uno's!!!! Giordano's was one of the first to create the stuffed pizza.
First time on Chicago!  Great deep dish pizza I had last night.  Very busy place expect to wait but it is worth it.  Aye at the bar and the staff was great very attentive.  Highly recommend it!
I got a thin crust pizza for lunch here once. It was somewhat greasy with a bland and hard base. (Much like Pizano's, who also can't make a crust worth a damn.) I don't see the appeal.

My favorite pizza place!  Most delicious sausage--I dont know what it is, but you gotta try this!!  Also love Lou's Spinach garlic cheese pizza; you really wont miss the meat.  but still get the sausage if its your first go round.  then come back and try the spinach.

Holy moly the line for this place was ridiculous. The first thing on my Chicago to do list was to try deep dish pizza so I asked around and was told Lou Malnati's was one of the best. When I got there the line went out the door. By the time I got to the front of the line to put my name down I was told my wait was about 30-40 minutes. The nice thing is that they will text you when your table to ready so you don't have to wait inside necessarily. Since I was a party of 1 I decided to take my chances and wait by the bar as a backup plan because it's open seating there. Right when a seat opened up I was notified my table was available. The hostess said that there were no more couples on the waitlist left so they had a table for me. Not sure how I felt about that comment, but was glad I would have a table instead of being crammed at the bar. I was pretty set on just ordering a pizza but the server told me that it would be at least 45 minutes unless I pre-ordered at the hostess stand. I wish I would've known that. So if you're reading this be sure to pre-order your pizza if you're waiting for a table! I ordered the bruschetta appetizer to munch on while I waited for my pizza. It was both a good and bad thing. Good because it was delicious (the garlic rounds were awesome), bad because it filled me up. I ordered the Malnati Chicago Classic personal sized pizza... because when in Rome right.. er Chicago.I was warned that it would have a lot of sausage, and they weren't kidding. It was tasty, but I wouldn't say I'm a fan of deep dish pizza. My heart and stomach is with thin crust pizza. Does anyone else feel like they are eating a casserole too?

Cornmeal crust is so tasty. Always the best texture and cooked to perfection. It's just a matter of taste, but I'm not into the sausage patty. But I do prefer any of the other topping combos. I usually only get the deep dish, but have had the thin crust and it's just as comparable in quality and taste.

We got Lou's delivered to the office for a welcoming event for new hires. The food was here right on time and the delivery guy was nice enough to come to the seventh floor to leave the pizzas here. They gave us plenty of plates and utensils, as well as dressing for the salad and parmesan and crushed red pepper flakes for the pizza. Pizza was delicious, as it always is. I think Lou's deep dish has just the right amount of cheese. Other places serve deep dish with extremely thin crust and a pie full of cheese, Lou's crust is just a little bit thicker, which evens out the ratio of cheese to dough in every bite. I  also really like Lou's sauce. And their "Lou's salad" is wonderful. To top it all off, they have individual pizzas! They cost $6 and are a perfect dinner for one. If you're eating with someone who has very different taste in pizza from your own, the personal pizzas are a great solution to a classic conundrum.
Every time we order catering their pizza is dry.  I am not a fan of dry pizza but overall flavor is good.
Visiting from Phoenix and wanted to check the place out since we just got one in Phoenix.  Had calamari and pie was also awesome!   Downside smell of urine in hall near bathrooms and no to go cups.

Our first deep dish pizza.  My friends all recommended Lou Malnati's so it is the first place we went for dinner in Chicago.  Now we are spoiled for any other pizza anywhere :)  More than worth the 45 minute wait.  You can call ahead if you know what you want, or order before you're seated.  A must have on your Chicago trip!

I had Lou's for the first time and it was amazing. We ordered a pepperoni deep dish with the butter crust. The cheese was so thick and gooey that if I had choked to death it would have been worth it. (Lol. J/K). Seriously, do yourself a favor and pick up a pie from here, you won't regret it. Best pie ever!

Unfortunately I was unimpressed. I was excited to go, but the pizza was underwhelming. The pizza arrived at the table kind of cold and with that much cheese on a pizza, you want it to be straight out of the oven. They have a good lunch deal though, with a salad, a personal pizza, and a drink for under $10.
Great deep dish. Was slow as anticipated and expected. The spinach salad was super fresh. Loved it.
Great food. Tried the traditional deep dish and it was great.  Staff was very professional and it was busy.

This is the place I always take out-of-towners to get authentic deep dish pizza.  I always go with "The Lou" but even if mushrooms and spinach aren't your thing make sure you upgrade to the buttercrust!! Don't be dissuaded by a long wait time- you can pre-order your pizza (which takes 45 minutes to cook) so its really not so bad.  Plus they have a system to text you when your table is ready so you don't have to wait in the lobby- just make sure you can get back within 5 minutes!

Prior to visiting Chicago, I had some friends tell me, "YOU MUST GET SOME DEEP DISH PIZZA THERE." Now, I had never been to Chicago. Therefore, I did not know which pizza place was the best. Since I was in Chicago, I figured that my attempt to get a decent deep dish pizza would be akin to "shooting fish in a barrel." While walking and taking in the sights of downtown Chicago, my friend and I decided to check out Lou Malnati's Pizzeria.   We walked into the restaurant and were greeted by staff. The staff was all smiles and made us feel like stars. The restaurant was packed, but we were seated very quickly. Our server/waitress was a young girl and she was great. She seemed like the happiest person in the world when taking our orders and serving us.   I ordered a pepperoni deep dish pan pizza with sausage and mushrooms. Once I finally tasted the pizza, I instantly thought of all the "Chicago-styled" pizza places that I have visited over the years and how their pizza DOES NOT measure up to this authentic Chicago deep dish pizza from Chicago. I definitely see what the hype is all about. If I were not a fan of Chicago deep dish pizza, I was after eating at Lou Malnati's Pizzeria. OUTSTANDING PIZZA!   I know that I will be returning to Chicago one day. I will make a beeline to Lou Malnati's Pizzeria without even thinking about it.

Best spaghetti with meat sauce I've ever had. Not too sweet, lots of meat, CREAMY, delicious. Did not like that it didn't come with bread or salad, had to order both separately. Even the freakin marinara sauce to dip the bread in was amazing. They only had reduced-calorie ranch, but the waiter assured me it was flavorful. Ordered it on the side with a red wine vinaigrette (just in case). He was right. The ranch was bomb. Lastly, the portion size...ridic. An order of spaghetti can feed 3 people, or 2 greedies :) Bread is enough for a whole table.  Chose this place randomly b/c it was halfway btwn me & a friend I was meeting. Got there around 10pm on a Friday night, line was down the street. I'm visiting from out of town & was shocked. I asked some girls in line "Are you guys waiting for PIZZA?!" They laughed & said "Yeah, hour & 15min wait". I checked in but started looking on my phone for another place to go while waiting for my friend to come. 3 tables ahead of us were no shows so our wait was much shorter than expected & we stayed. SO GLAD WE DID. I HAVE SEEN THE LIGHT. Ate my leftovers on Saturday. It's Sunday now, and I just ordered delivery through Postmates. I'm hooked. Four stars only b/c this place is absolute mayhem. Can't be mad though... business is good. Food & service are 5 star, just elbow to elbow crowded & loud. Well done! Edit: My friend had the meatball sub. The melted cheese on top had those perfect brown bubbles on it. She loved it. Can't wait to go back & try the pizza.
The same Lou Malanati's food quality you would expect. Exceptionally awful service. Appetizer wings took longer than pizza to come out and we waiting 10-15 minutes for them to take our drink orders.

This place has great service and an ambiance set for a good family dining!  Definitely tried their famous deep dish and no regrets after. There was definitely a wait but it was worth it. Their thin crust pizza is also in the top list. Don't forget to pair your pizzas with chicken wings!

Love the atmosphere, location and restaurant itself! My kind of pizza joint. The deep dish takes 45 minutes to cook so order ASAP and put in some appetizers to avoid getting hangry. The pizza was delicious! Dough was a little flavorless and "doughy" but I loved the sauce, and the cheese was extremely fresh. I got the classic, I wish the sausage wasn't a full patty size, it made the pizza fall apart after each bite. I actually prefer it in smaller bits. And the sausage was really there for texture not necessarily flavor. But I still enjoyed the pizza for a deep dish.

My niece's 18th birthday last year and they more-or less kicked us out.  I have not been back since.  I assumed we were kicked out because we were Black.  I have never been treated so poorly by and establishment.  I tell everyone I can about our experience,.

YUM!  In town for a girls weekend and of course we needed to get some deep dish pizza!  Went to Lou Malnati's and it was great! The pizza takes about 40 minutes to cook so order as soon as you sit down! Certainly worth the wait, we upgraded to their crispy butter crust and it was delish! I would certainly visit again!
I mean...no! No salt at all in the dough, long wait for a very normal not to say bad pizza. Overrated. First and last time. Goose beer make my stay acceptable.

bomb.com  I ordered a medium half Lou half the other famous one and was disappointed in myself when I could only eat 3 slices. What is wrong with me!!!!!!! So damn good tho....I can see why Pizza Hut tried to rip off their recipe.

When in Chicago, you deep dish. In all my years visiting Chicago, I had never been to Lou's (I was told I can call by nickname that now that I've been). I always stick to what I like, which is Gino's, but I stepped outside the box during my last visit. I thought the feel of the restaurant and menu were very similar to Gino's, but I never thought the pizza would taste so different! In comparing the two, I thought Gino's was saucier and had a better crust, whereas Lou's was cheesier (fine by me) and didn't have as flavorful of a crust.  Even though we were 6 starving girls, we probably would've been okay with one medium pizza (we ordered one medium pepperoni and one medium cheese due to the menu per person recommendation). But, the extra food just meant leftovers, which I had no problem taking ownership of...
Great Pizza went with my sons Nothing better than their Chicago style deep dish We shared a "small" said more than we could eat Overall a great experience
Not what i had expected it would be. Thick crust with loads of cheese. Not sure anything else after that and was wishing there was something more i could say about it.

Honestly....It's the experience...if you've coming in from the burbs, showing your kids or some in-laws then this is the spot, right in the middle of a growing neighborhood that was already progressive, just north of that triangular park and surrounded by other high-end restaurants and department stores now.  BUT If your trying to pick somewhere to bring your date, then its overrated...Unless its a tinder date and she's never had it, then get it over with you/they can say you/they did. Unless your depiction of quality is a 10 pound caloric bomb that you could lubricate an engine with if you slanted the corner of the box into your oil intake of your diesel V-dub.

Came here on a Wednesday night and was told that the wait would be 25 minutes. Turned out to be a 50+ minute wait - doubled the estimate. We pre-ordered once we put my name in the queue and was told that way we could have our pizza ready when we get our table. However we still needed to wait another 15 minutes for our pizza when we sat down. Food is good, but the management of wait times and food preparation process was sub-par. For such a strong chicago franchise, operational improvements are greatly needed. Wasted more than an hour waiting to sit and waiting for food - not how I want to spend my evening after a day at work.
Lauren was awesome and the pizza was hands down the best Chicago style we've ever had! Thank you!!!!

I had been to this location before, about four years ago with a friend, and I was in town tonight and wanting some deep dish pizza so I did takeout. I first stopped at Gino's East nearby but it was an hour+ wait for takeout, so instead I went here. They have personal-sized pies for about $10 (one topping) which was nice, I just wanted a smaller pizza for myself. Only took a half-hour so I was happy. Tasty pizza too.
best deep dish place in Chicago. Will rarely go anywhere else
Was super hungry so had to get an app and salad to hold us over on the 30 min wait for pizza. But Classic pizza was great - not too doughy!
SOOOO BUSY! But so good! Have to check it out when in the area. I sat at the bar, so was served quickly.

I'm sure everyone has their opinion on which Chicago deep dish pizza is best, but I'm sorry Lou's by far takes the cake!!! The sausage tastes homemade and there is probably a pound of cheese on each pizza plus the sauce is fresh and uses diced tomatoes rather a paste/sauce like we experienced at other pizza joints. Being Italian it was seasoned perfectly!!! I would not even waste my time with another pizza place when I'm in Chicago!
Poor management and terrible service. You're better off going to a different location.

-1 star for the wait. On a Tuesday night, 30 minutes to get seated, 15 minutes for appetizers to come out, 50 minutes for the pizzas to come out. My friend put our name down, so we got there right when were getting seated. Lou Malnati's was my first deep dish pizza experience and it's equal to or better than regular pizza. I could see myself getting tired of it really quick. But I loved the crust! I NEVER eat crust because its always so bland and not worth the extra calories, but it was so soft and butter here, I couldn't resist. We ordered the dip as an appetizer, the small Lou deep dish pizza, and the large Malnati Chicago Classic™ for 4 people. We ended up taking home most of the small pizza.  3/4 of us had drinks and the bill came out to be $82. Even with the drinks, it's a little pricey for pizza..

OMG, one of my favorite pizzeria restaurants in Down town Chicago. Lou Malnatis ranks in my top 3 Chicago Deep Dish pizzas. The best way to order is select your pizza at the counter before you are seated.  This location has two levels so it was extremely busy; even for a Wednesday evening. My family and I waited for about forty minutes to be seated. Since I ordered a large and smaller pizza, it took longer than usual.  The server was polite, however she was at times distracted and forgot about check ins and drink refills. That would be my only negative. The pizza was fantastic.. no survivor slices were spared. If you decide to visit this location, prepare to drive and find a parking garage unfortunately.   No free parking options are available. I found a meter and paid $4.00 for a 2 hour park on the street. There are however many other locations city wide, but most are call in and pick up only (no dine in). The noise level was loud because the dining area is not very big. Again, Great Pizza! Recommend. ..Absolutely :)

My husband and I frequently eat here, especially in the summer.  We like to sit outside and people watch. The food is tasty almost too much per serving.  Staff is very nice and helpful. We always take home a doggie bag.
Great pie! no question, the crust is the best part. Very relaxed and fun loving service!
I love this pizza. I wish I could order it more frequently (but then perhaps I wouldn't appreciate it as much). Deep dish cheese with butter crust! You won't regret it!

I love pizza. All kinds of pizza. And Lou Malnati's Pizza was very unique but I'm not quite sure it lived up to its hype. Of course when you're in Chicago, you are told to must try deep dish pizza. My impression of deep dish was thick dough and little toppings. I was wrong. At Lou's, the dough was actually not super thick and the toppings were layer upon layer! There's a wait though.....a long one. Definitely go there and put your name on the list then go shopping or walk around. Don't go hungry expecting to eat right away. Their system is very efficient though. They'll call you when they're ready and you also pre-order your pizza so it is already cooking by the time you sit down.  The pizza itself was pretty good. They're know for their butter crust which was the most interesting part. We got the Classic and it had sausage, pepperoni, cheese and lots of tomato sauce. Overall, it was crunchy on the edges, fluffy in the middle, piping hot and amazing on the top. The medium doesn't look like a lot when it comes out but after two slices I was stuffed. I also got a bowl of their minestrone soup which was very well made. Full of beans and lots of spices. This place is definitely worth a try if you're in Chicago but I wouldn't go back again just to have their pizza.

Best deep dish pizza in Chicago. I've been coming here for years and the pizza is always too notch. I've also ordered to go several times. I always get it par baked and then finish cooking it at home.
The best pizza place in Chicago! They bring it in to my work in the loop all the time.  Definitely one of my all time favorites
I don't even like cheese and they made me crave pizza. I hated going home. We need you in Florida Lou!!!

When in Chicago, do as they do, and grab a Chicago Classic Deep Dish.  I needed something besides the downtown tourist spots and went to Lou's for lunch.  My only regret is the personal pizza wasn't enough for me!  Almost bought a second to take back to Arizona but heard they just opened one.  Can't wait to get home but will always come back to Lou's.

Came from out of town, order at opening time.  I don't know if this was normal for Lou's or Chicago deep dish in general since it was my first time trying it but I thought the crust was kind of gross like old almost stale pizza dough. I wondered if they pre make the dough and I got one from days before that sat in a fridge somewhere but it was bad. I was also disappointed with the amount of sauce, it was barely there very bland either very light handed on the spices or they didn't put any at all. It was a cheese deep dish so there was plenty of cheese, but again very bland no saltiness to it almost like a unsalted fresh mozzarella. The "deep" dish was not deep by any means and looking through the pictures here that seems the norm. I really wish I would have tried a mom n pop place as I feel Lou's has become just the popular place in Chicago for tourists while the better pizza places are left in the shadows known only by the locals. It was kind of lousy especially for the price $18 for a medium cheese which is about a 12 inch pie at their store. I almost never write a bad review especially after only one visit but I probably won't ever be in Chicago again and after 18 hours of driving and excitement to try this deep dish it was such a let down I had to write this.
Natalie is hands down the best server. Had a great first experience here with her! Very friendly and bubbly.

Good as it gets. Some people don't like the style of deep dish pizza, It is different, but if you do you will be pleased. Service is always adequate (pizza place, not fine dining). Going back is always a no brainer.

I can only speak for the food because we ordered delivery from them. It was absolutely delicious!! We would recommend this pizza over Giordano's! Lou Malnati's pizza is more tender and the best pizza we have ever had. The butter crust is fantastic! You can't go wrong with this pizza! This is a must for tourists!

A friend and I were recommended Lou manati's left and right by seemingly the entire population of Chicago! We had already a lot to eat, so we decided to go for the Chicago classic personal pan pizza and split it. My initial reaction was that the sauce was very robust. There were whole tomatoes in the sauce, that I was very fond of. The cheese had that elasticity you look for when you pull it apart. The sausage was well seasoned and the inconsistency in size (as found in crumbled sausage), complemented the cohesiveness of the pizza, giving it that homemade feel. Also the crust was pretty crispy as well (I thought the abundance of sauce would've sogg-ified it) My only critique is that the pizza as a whole was very bland. All of the ingredients and toppings in the pizza worked well together, but it all tasted very under seasoned.  Next time we are in town, I'd love to give this spot another chance, but until then, 3/5 is all I can give.
Great time with the family.  Have tried most of the other pizza places and I think we liked this best.  Check in efficient and fairly quick.  Don't be afraid to order some thin crust also.

I just moved to the block where their Evanston restaurant is and was looking forward to trying Malnati's for the first time.  I shared a salad and a pizza with two friends; the amounts were just right, but I was disappointed in both.  The salad was fairly tasteless and the vegetarian pizza, though the crust was fabulous, was not really all that good.   I'll try the sausage one next and hope its better.
Great pizza and good family owned business. They take pride not only their food but also in their community. It is my go-to for deep dish pizza!!!

Best pizza I have ever had. Scratch that, best meal I have ever had. Had the Chicago special. Perfect ratio of cheese and sauce. Sausage is flavorful. We had it delivered and it came steaming hot. This pizza is the definition of Chicago deep dish. The other pizza spots are good, but this place is memorable. Order the special, you will not be disappointed.

Pizza was good but not great, liked the buttered crust. I sat at the bar and ordered a personal pan pizza and wings as an app. Wings were excellent nice portion spicy and lots of celery. Server was polite but 40 mins between the initial order and the pizza arriving - pizza just didn't live up to the anticipation.
Best deep dish in chicago. Hands down - best I've ever had. haha

We were expecting a good experience but were disappointed. We ordered cheese and classic deep dish pizzas. I personally expect near hot and steamy pizza for my first byte into it. However it was already cooled and cheese was not gooey. Is it how Chicago deep dish pizza is supposed to be or because the pizzas have been sitting for a long time before arriving at my table? Also the waiter came to our table only three times: to get order, to deliver food and to give us the check. We had two empty cups for most of the 40min wait for the pizza.

This is an excellent pizzaria! The variety of select items were fresh, the pizza crust and sauce were delicious for their Chicago "thick crust" pizza. I am happy I learned about this from a local fellow, near the U of Illinois-Chicago campus.   Setting was formal, but not stiff.. Perfect place!

Fabulous deep dish pizza! Flaky crust,great sauce.Yum Yum!  Made me forget Giordano's! I wish i could go there every week.The pizza is amazing.They are extremely busy.Service was great.If you order deep dish remember they take time!

I left my stint in the Midwest about 17 years ago, but remember the Chicago deep dish pizza fondly.  I've never been a huge sausage pizza fan, so instead of the Classic I always ordered the pepperoni in its place.  My husband and I turned to Yelp for a local pizza recommendation and found Lou Malnati's has nearly 3000 reviews and still pulls in 4 stars, so who are we to argue?   My hubby called in the order and the woman taking the order made a helpful suggestion for pizza size (small was enough for both of us and we have a small piece left for a midnight snack).  He FORGOT the butter crust, sigh.  But it was still amazing!  The crust was crispy, the cheese gooey and the sauce had chunks of tomato in it, giving great tomato flavor.   Hubby brought the pizza back to our hotel room.  Packaging of the pie was perfect, with a thin plastic covering protecting the tomato sauce from the cardboard box top.  The little Parmesan side was slightly less than what we needed for our taste, so if you like Parmesan ask for extra!

We went looking for the best deep-dish pizza in Chicago. Found it! The small size pizza was just right for two of us. We got the Lou traditional and it did not disappoint. It takes about 45 minutes to prepare each pizza. Our server suggested we start with a salad while we wait. Not only was the small large enough for both of us, it was a great start to the meal. It was full of fresh ingredients and just the right amount of dressing.  The sauce on top of the pie was thick but not pasty. The cheese was melted all the way through the pizza. The butter crust was nothing short of tremendous. I am not a crust person, however, on this occasion I eat every bite. No question, some of the best pizza I have ever had. The service was very good and the restaurant was full of sports photos and memorabilia. This is a must- do if you come to Chicago and want some traditional Chicago pizza. They do have other things on the menu just in case you are not a pizza person.

This place is viewed as one of the best pizza places in Chicago and certainly has the wait times to back it up. We went on a Sunday afternoon for a late lunch and had a 45 min-hour wait. We decided to get drinks elsewhere to kill time. You can pre-order your pizzas, which helps with table time. We ordered the calamari appetizer, Malnati salad, Malnati pizza and pepperoni pizza. The calamari was crispy and tasty and gas a flavorful dipping sauce. The Malnati salad was full of great ingredients, packed a punch of flavor and was dressing heavy (which I like). The pizzas were also good and way different from east coast pizza style. The Malnati pizza was good, but I wasn't a fan of the thick cut sausage. The pepperoni pizza, which I got with extra sauce, was great! The cheese was a little heavy on both pizzas, but I am told that is the Chicago way. I think the food is decent and that coming here is a must for a tourist, but there is too much hype.

What a horrible way to start my Chicago pizza journey. They say Lou Malanati's is the best pizza in Chicago but I beg to differ.  We got the large pizza with the buttery crust which is extra and I can only say that I was disappointed. The pizza has no flavor to it. It literally just cheese, sauce, and bread. The pizza came out cold and our waiter was inattentive. I won't be coming back
A Chicago must. The cornmeal dough and the fresh tomato sauce is delicious on its own add all the extras and you've got yourself the perfect Chicago style dinner.

Great deep dish pizza!  The place has a bustling atmosphere and a huge crowd often waiting outside the door.  They will take your name and order, and text you when to come back.  Unfortunately, the text they said they sent never came through, but we did come back in the quoted wait time and were seated pretty quickly.

I have never waited this long for pizza.. When we arrived and were told it would take 1.5 wait but we could pre-order our pizza so it would be ready by the time the table was ready, so we went ahead and "pre-order"... our table ended up being ready within 45 minutes so we were excited! unfortunately our waitress was not the friendliest or attentive, took 15 min to get drinks then when she took our order we indicated we had a "pre-order" for the pizza so she said ok. Thankfully we order some wings which came out within 15-20 min, no pizza... so we patiently waited another 20-30 minutes and noticed other tables seated after us got their pizza,  I decided to ask another waitress since our waitress never came back to check on us after we got the wings. I was told they would check and be right back...no such thing almost 30min later again we were about to walk out I called the server to cancel our order and she actually argued with me about how it was not her fault I wasn't informed even pre-orders can take 2 hours, which is ridiculous, I guess this waitress has never heard of customer service or being part of a "team" there is not "it's not my job or my fault" when you work with a team of people, she didn't have to argue or point fingers on her own team for not doing their job... anyways I was truly just going to leave cash on the table to cover the drinks and wings then walk out as my kid was extremely hungry... magically Tina our waitress came up with our pizzas which by the way were terrible! sauce was bland, soggy and cold, could she just admit perhaps she forgot our order... honestly Pizza chain restaurants can make better tasting pizzas..so disappointed as everyone recommended this place, maybe I need to try a different location next time. 2.5 hours for awful customer service and pizza are not worth the wait...nor the $50+ bill for personal pizzas.

I ate here back in February when I was in chi town for a business trip.  The service was excellent, the salad and the wine! However, I felt the pizza was terrible! The sauce had no flavor and it was bland. It tasted like Ragu! I may be biased since I am a New York pizza lover or real Neo pizza lover, but I have to say restaurant was a chain and seemed like would be in the fast food/casual dinning group compared to Friday's and chilis only difference it's pizza! I do not recommend this place for "authentic chi pizza".

I wish I liked deep dish pizza more than I actually do. I bet I would really enjoy this place a lot more. This restaurant was suggested to me by my friend who is a local here and I can see why. We came around lunch time and the place is super homey. Lots of sports stuff on the wall and the service was great. We had the veggie deep dish and the meat deep dish. I enjoyed the veggie one more, but I definitely did not finish my single slice. It was overwhelmingly deep for me: lots of red sauce and lots of cheese. I just think I prefer a substantial equal proportion of cheese, sauce, and crust. We also had the pizza chips and dip. Why did I get pizza chips if I was going to order pizza as an entree, you ask? Yeah, I'd question myself too, but I thoroughly enjoyed it! I liked all the dips and we were still snacking on it after our pizza. Def something I recommend!  However, I'd say the winning factor in this whole meal was the Malnati salad! I know, another odd comment, right? Yes, I am saying the salad is my favorite at this pizza joint. But you gotta believe me, this is one of the best salads I've ever had. I would come back here just for the salad! I did contemplate it while I was visiting Chicago. With the right amount of sweet, tart, and savory, it's a hit!

Pasta dish we ordered was fantastic! Hands down to that!  Pizza dish, I like the taste of it but I would personally prefer the crust to not be as crunchy and be more chewy. But again, it's personal preference.  Customer service was excellent and the wait isn't as horrific as we thought it was going to be! !  Will come back again! For sure :)
I'd give my left ____ for this Za. It really is the best I've had in my 31 years of existence.

Butter crust is smoking....wait is OK. Walk down to Bulls and Bears for a beer. Bar was crowded at Lou's.  Waitress and manager were both awesome and I will always stop by when I'm in town.  They also ship, will get some pies to Atlanta.
Love their Loutogo. I send care packages all over the US for my sons and sisters. They miss  the Chicago pizza.

You can never go wrong with a Lou Malnati's deep dish pizza. The Chicago Classic is my favorite with extra cheese, sausage, tomatoes and  butter-crust. All their food is delicious, from appetizers, salads, entrees and desserts. Their service is very good, with a pleasant staff that is eager to please.  The original restaurant in Lincolnwood is great too!

Good old Lou Malnati's paired with great service from Natalie, will definitely come back! I've been to this location a couple of times, first time service was iffy, this time it was great! Good to see they actually pay attention to customer's feedback.
Best Chicago pizza, but you have to alternate with Giordanos so it doesn't get old on you. Not a bad alternative

The yummiest Chicago deep dish pizza!! You must come here if you're in the area - many different locations to choose from. We had to wait a little, but it was worth it. You're able to order ahead so once you're seated, you don't have to wait too long until your order comes out. Tons to choose from off the menu and I'm sure you can't go wrong. For us, we ordered the Chicken Louie Pasta and the Malnati Chicago Pizza, which was filling and so so so hearty. We loved it! It definitely hit the spot on a chilly day. We took some to go and it was still just as tasty the next day!!
Best Chicago deep dish, hands down! Pepperoni deep dish with butter crust is the way to go, you won't regret it.
Simply the best pizza and salads in Chicago.  I like to South Loop location, but parking is a monster.

Hands down best deep dish in the Schaumburg are.  That's all I'm saying if you disagree you're wrong lol.  I'm a self-proclaimed pizza snob and the deep dish here is worth the drive, or the wait if you decide to eat in. My favorite is spinach with pepperoni.

This is my favorite deep dish chain out of the three main contenders in Chicago. I had the Lou's Classic which has a buttery crust and sausage. Delicious! Each piece is huge. I ordered a small by myself and could not finish it. Don't be fooled! Order a personal if it's just you. The restaurant offers some accurate guidance on how many people each size feeds.

Holy cow. My very first deep dish pizza! I got the Lou's special and my boyfriend got the sausage and the only regret we have is that we didn't get a whole pan! Seriously so flavorful and fresh! So delicious

This is a go to deep-dish pizza place to eat when you are in Chicago. When you go here, keep your standards low. I say this because sometimes the pizza will be under cooked. Then sometimes the pizza will be just right. You never know what to suspect. Overall, this place is the best. I have been going here all my life and will never stop!

Before you read the review, understand I've grown up on new haven pizza so am insanely spoiled and have a type of pizza I really like.  This place is great and a staple of being in Chicago. Of course we needed to try. Got a small deep dish and it was good. However I'm not a huge fan of deep dish (see the new haven comment above). Would I recommend to try it?  Yep. Will I have again?  Probably not.

Lou Malnati's is my favorite pizza (at least it is, so far). I haven't had to wait in incredibly long lines, and I have had all positive experiences with their pizza. Granted, the "deep dish" isn't deep enough for most tourists, but I love their pizza.
Been to Lou's a few times - excellent! Deep dish - 5 stars Chicken BBQ club salad - 5 stars Thin-crust pizza - No stars. I felt that I should have been asked to leave for trying this.
Yes the pizza is excellent. The wings are great also

The best Chicago deep dish pizza that you can get!!! Thin crust is pretty good too but I would recommend the deep dish. Also, they have amazing lasagna!!! The best lasagna Ive ever had delivered and I get a lot of lasagna delivered. They also have a really good spinach salad with chicken goat cheese and pear slices with balsamic vinaigrette!!!

I've never been a deep dish fan.  For a long time I only wanted Stuffed from Giordano's.  I then evolved into a Home Run Inn guy; their frozen Ultra Thin is fantastic.  Lately I've tried Malnati's Deep Dish.  It is wonderful pizza.   And their lunch specials are a great deal.  Individual pizza, a very large salad, and a drink with free refills for $11.    And sign up for their App for some very good deals like $30 for $50 worth of food during the week and dollar discounts based on the amount that you spend. Malnati's is well worth your patronage!

I stopped in on Sunday afternoon, my cousin who lives in Chicago told me this is the best pizza in town. I sat at the bar and was served by the bartender. I waited about 20 minutes for my personal size deep dish cheese pizza. It was fresh and tasted good but a little underwhelming. I was told later I should have ordered the "Buttercrust" and get some toppings. I will definitely take this advice next time I am in town!

The pizza is great. The service is excellent. The staff are friendly and patient. However, do NOT get toppings unless you want to be ripped off. My girlfriend and I got a small (10", serving 2) cheese pizza with olives, garlic, and peppers. We did not read the menu that carefully because the restaurant was insanely packed and we pre-ordered.  Each topping costs $1.95 EACH. So, for a ten inch pizza that had maybe a handful of olives, a single garlic clove, and half a pepper, we paid an extra ~$7.  An entire can of olives does not cost $1.95. An entire pepper does not cost $1.95. It's absurd.

Great pizza! You must get the Chicago style deep dish crust. Lines are usually out the door and they start early, but the wait is totally worth it. The salad is also good. Always a favorite when I am craving a good pizza.

I spent 6 months in the Windy City several years back on a work assignment. It was then I was introduced to the culinary marvel of Lou Malnati's deep dish pizza. There are several locations throughout Chicago serving the masses. Our team probably visited LM's at least a couple times per week and I never got tired of the pizza. The crust is hearty and the sauce is tangy and a bit sweet. Hard-core thin slice pizza lovers might balk at deep dish pizza, but this pizza is good eats. Period. I haven't visited Chicago in nearly two decades, but was hankering for LM's. They deliver to your doorstep! Order online and pop the pizza into the oven for 40 minutes after it arrives. Shazam! This pizza speaks for itself.

The first time I ever tried Chicago pizza was here. I can truly say that I wasnt a huge fan of this place. Let me start with the positives: my boyfriend and I were seated promptly, the service was good, the chicken wings were really tasty as well as their calamari, every inch of the pizza was filled with topping, a lot of cheese, the sauce tasted really fresh. The negatives: the pizza dough was pretty bland, although the sauce tasted fresh it was pretty tasteless, the was only one bathroom stall given how big and busy this place is. In my opinion I thought the pizza was a little bland. There was way too much cheese for a bland pizza dough. I mean cheese is a good thing but not if the pizza tastes just completely tasteless. I'm not going to let this experience ruin my thoughts on Chicago style pizza. I just need to find a better place. Their appetizers were good and really tasty. The pizza took about 40 minutes to be served but I heard that is the average amount of time it takes everywhere. The price was decent. I probably wouldn't return to this place. I think if it's your first time trying Chicago style pizza you should definitely go somewhere else.

for chicago deep dish pizza glory, i think it comes down to two places: pequods and lou's. any time i eat at one place, i switch my vote to that place.  they are both great places for deep dish. but i since i recently had lou's, i will go with lou's for now.  it may be off putting for some, but i love the disc of sausage, so i cant get a piece of sausage in every bite. also, i think the ratio of dough to sauce to toppings is more balanced than pequods. i dont think pequods is as doughy as giordanos but it is a bit on the doughy side.

Incredible!! The wait was pretty long for a Wednesday night (1 hour and 15 mins) you can pre order which cuts down on the typical 40 min wait for cooking which is nice. We had a salad they recommended and it was FABULOUS, we also order a Medium Sausage and Medium "Lou" they were great too! We didn't get our food as quick as I expected (we preordered) but the manager was amazing and got it out within minutes! Some of the best service I've ever had! It has a great name for a reason - food and service. Come here!! You won't regret it!

Well, I have to say I was pretty disappointed with the service and quality of food.  When we arrived, we were told the wait was appx 35 minutes. We ordered our pizza ahead of time and got a beverage.  After waiting 70 minutes, we finally were seated.  The waitress did not come to our table for over ten minutes, and tells us we have time to order an appetizer and a salad.  I thought that was odd but went along with it. She takes forever to get us a pitcher of beer and guess what another guy comes out with our pizza before she comes back with our beer. We canceled the app but she says she can get our salad right away.  Guess what, we finished our first slice of pizza before she brings the salad.  No apologies just gives the salad.   Pizza was average.  Not anywhere near the hype.
