We ordered a large so my son could have pizza for another night.  Tonight he opens the box and it's not our pizza. We ordered the classic Malnati's, It's a mushroom pizza.  How gross is that.  Bad service and bad experience.   Won't be back. #malnalti's

My first time trying was last week on a field trip with my daughter's class. Yes, I am from Chicago but I am not a fan of any deep dish pizza. We had cheese and pepperoni thin crust and sausage/cheese deep dish. It was tasty and the kids loved it.  This is the thing though - the food made me very sick 10 minutes after we left. I can tell that the sausage on the deep dish pizza was not done. It was a little pinkish so I didn't get seconds of that. Now, this could be for one of two reasons, maybe both - them rushing all-you-can-eat product to feed 6 adults and 21 children or this is just how their food is. I don't know. Born and raised in Chicago, I've had tons of pizza so to me Lou Malnati's is on the same scale as the others.
Look no further for the best pizza in Chicago. Lou's is THE clear winner for the classic deep dish pie.

Maybe it's just me and my hubby...but we had no idea what the hype was all about.  Maybe we're not a fan of Chicago pizzas?! I know..I know...blasphemy, but we just didn't like it. We arrived at 7:30 on a Friday night and we KNEW that there was going to be a wait.  However, it was a rather chilly May evening and everyone tried to stay inside and therefore made it very difficult to get to the hostess as well as find a place to stand and wait. We finally got to the hostess and we were advised that it's a 45 min wait but we could go ahead and order our pizzas so that it'll be ready by the time we're seated.  We were totally excited about this.  So, placed our order at the counter and had to fight the crowd to get outside.  Man, did I regret going outside.  It was freezing, there was no place to sit and I tried going back inside, but there just wasn't enough room. Finally, got the notification that our table was ready.  We sat down and placed our orders.  I thought that our pizza would be ready, but nope...we had to wait an extra 20-30 mins.  With that, we just decided to order the wings.  Now, the wings are delicious and we were excited to eat our pizza.  The pizza came out and I was SOOO exited. However, once I pulled out a slice..I noticed that there was TONS of cheese just oozing out of it.  Normally, this would be very exciting to me since I'm  a little obsessed with cheese.  BUT, there was just WAY too much cheese in here.  It was like bread and melted cheese.  It was too much.  We actually couldn't even finish one small pizza.  I was totally bummed. I'm giving this place 3 stars for the excellent service our waitress gave us and for the wings.  But, that's pretty much it.

This is the best Chicago deep dish I've had. Loved the location, it is a little loud but that's because it's so busy and I went on a Monday. Still think New York pizza is the best but will definitely return if I'm in town.
Sooooo cold!  Miserable.  Pizza was pretty good but seems like Gino's East is better.  We got the Lou - supposed to be the most popular.  Very filling.

Rewind to a few years back...my first time in Chicago, a group of us wanted taste the Rivalry between Lou Malnatis and Giordanos first hand. We've heard that each establishment claims to be the "best." We had come to the conclusion that Giordano's was the better Pizza once and for all.  Fast forward to a few days ago when a new group of friends came to Chicago with me and we decided to leave it up to them to decide for themselves. However, it was a little tougher this time for me and my other friend that was with me the first time around. While the sauce is robust, spicy and more flavorful than Lou's, Giordanos delievered an abundance of cheese (layered to perfection) with thinly sliced pepperoni... but the crust was a little bit more dry and mealy than I remember.  On the other hand, Lou's had the most incredible buttery, flaky crust. It was absolutely delicious. I do NOT remember the pizza being so good last time. It could have been that we ordered in last time and maybe this type of pizza is better served hot, and fresh. While Lou's doesn't serve up a crazy amount of cheese like Giordano's, nor is the sauce as robust,  it's still superb! The sausage was also fantastic here (I normally don't order sausage on pizza but we ordered "the classic")  it was thinly sliced and layered so precisely with every other layer including cheese, and pepperoni. Omg it was delicious!  So I've come to stand still, to which family owned Pizzeria serves up the best deep dish. Both are fantastic and both are affordable as a family of 4 can fill up on a medium pie. While the prices may seem steep ($20-$30) you can, and probably will be, stuffed with 1 slice. I thought I was going to be pizza-d out for awhile and as I type this, I'm already craving a slice...Lou Malnatis for the Tie!

Not bad, not bad. I liked the pizza. It was pretty darned tasty. On one hand, I didn't like the wait. On the other hand, I guess it adds to the buzz and creates the ambience. The pizza was certainly enough to eat and then take some home with you.

We were seated upstairs.  It is pretty loud and they play only one or two songs over and over again.  The decor is non existent.  The waitress was very nice and attentive.  The house salad looked good, and had a variety of vegetables, but was pretty bland tasting.  We chose the "Lou" deep dish vegetarian pizza.  It was good and had a decent crust, but I've had better.  The price was very good; $22 for a medium that three people struggled to finish two slices each.  For me it didn't live up to the hype of best deep dish pizza, or at least I hope Chicago has better.  However, if you are looking for reasonably priced, good deep dish pizza, this works.

Ahhhh, my first experience with Chicago deep dish pizza. Lou Malnatis delivers one of the best and most consistent Pizza around. I have been going here since I was a young kid and I recommend a Large deeps dish sausage well done. Enjoy :)
MY favorite deep dish pizza. The spinach bread is the best ever!

The best Chicago deep dish. It lived up to the expectations we had. Get there early because the line starts to run out the door as early as 5 pm. We got the cheesy bread which was perfectly flaky without tasting too cheesy and heavy.  We got the 'Lou' which was a veggie pizza with spinach, mushroom, and tomato. The small is a perfect size for two people.  One of the best deep dish options in Chicago!
Best deep dish pizza in the world!  Grew up eating at the Schaumburg location and my wife and I will always go to Lou's.  Their thin crust is underrated and is definitely worth trying.
Love the "new" West Loop location.  Parking, upstairs dining, and downstairs bar.

One of the best pizza restaurants!  Don't be a tourist and order the stuffed pizza... be a Chicagoan and order the thin crust... preferably with the butter crust.  Oh yeah, get a Lou's salad too.  It's awesome too.

The best pizza in the world.  The butter crust and the fresh ingredients are like the pizzas in Rome, Italy.  The deep-dish pizza is difficult to eat.  After two pieces, you cannot eat another.  The service is outstanding and the wait was minimal and worth it for the deep dish.

Sorry, Giordano's. I seem to like Lou's better. In the 20 years I've lived here, I've never taken the parental units to Lou's. Like me, they're not fans of deep dish and prefer thin crust. And they're usually not in the mood for pizza whenever they are in town, until their most recent visit. I made the mistake of taking them before Memorial Weekend began. Wait time is as can be expected and I shouldn't have been surprised. Plus, this location is smaller, even with the second floor. The hostess suggested ordering while we waited (25-30 min approx.) so by the time we sat down, our order would likely be ready. It's a great suggestion but doesn't always work out. Expect about the same time frame when seated. But it all worked out because my parents left satisfied. Also, a small size pizza is good enough for at least 2-3 people. I didn't think it would be, and we ended up with leftovers.  If you can't handle the stairs, mention that up front. I didn't notice an elevator, but the hostess was able to seat us on the first floor, making it easier for Mom A.

Okay this place was so good! The pizza was on point and worth all the hype! I ordered the small Manati pizza with the sausage. The cheese literally wouldn't detach from my mouth. That's what I'm talking about.

Not impressed. The pizza was aright, but nothing worth the wait. Service was slow (just too many customers to handle) and way too loud.  We were definitely disappointed as we had heard it was the "best deep-dish in Chicago".
In my opinion, best chain deep dish place in the city - beats out Giordano's and Pizzeria Uno by a mile!

Great Chicago deep dish pizza! I took half my leftover small pizza to finish for breakfast at O'Hare and lunch in Hartsfield-Jackson in Atlanta. My husband was not too happy with his gluten free pizza. He said it was too dense compared to other GF pizzas he's had in restaurants and the anchovies were too fishy (duh!) We shared a huge house salad that was outstanding. Service was fast and very friendly on a busy Sunday night in June when there were a lot of events and conventions going on in the city. Worth the wait and convenient if you share your mobile number - you can track your place in line and you get a text when your table is ready. Definitely recommend, just not for gluten free at this time.

2 words, "Deep Dish"! We ate at Lou Malnati's because the restaurant can accommodate large groups and we were not disappointed.  The service was great, the staff was nice and the food was good as usual.  I ordered the Lou Malnati with pepperoni and it was great. I seldom eat deep dish pizza but when I do this is the place!

Found out that I can order some Lou Malnati's pizza from  tastesofchicago.com . Since I didn't visit the pizzeria personally, I can't comment on service or ambiance. Based on taste alone, we were very happy. Our pizzas arrived all boxed up with dry ice. It was neatly and securely packed. Placed our pizzas in the freezer and when we were ready to enjoy them, we just followed their simple directions. Tried the Pepperoni, Sausage, Spinach, and Cheese. They were all delicious and made with quality ingredients. The crust was thin, buttery and crisp. The sauce was smooth, light, and flavorful. Quality ingredients are used and you can taste the difference. We are incredibly satisfied with our order.  I'm sure nothing beats actually being at Lou Malnati's Pizzeria, but for now this will do :D Yum!

So, we heard that this was Chicago's best deep dish pizza. I cannot say it is the best, but I can say that it is the best I have ever had...it is the first! We waited 45 minutes for our specialty pizza to be delivered. The server came out with it in potholders, warning us that it just came out of the oven and was HOTTTT! Not at all.  In fact, it was room temperature, at best.   BUT NOT ALL WAS LOST or a DISAPPOINTMENT!  The kitchen management took full responsibility and brought out a brand new one with apologies.  It most likely was someone else's because it only took 10 minutes, but nevertheless...Mistakes happen so making it right for the customer gives them a 4star!

Want some Chicago deep dish? This is the place. Some say it's the original, or one of them. GOOD for sure. And they've got the wait system down to a tee: order your pizza so the kitchen can assemble it while you wait for your table. Their signature salad -- like their signature pizza -- is just plain ridiculous delicious. The pizza also has a buttery crust, light yet deep. Yum!

True Chicago style pizza.  Loved the ambiance of the place and it's in a great location.  The creamy rice soup was delicious and of course the pizza, the butter crust is the best.  We went for lunch and only paid $9 so the prices are great too.  I would definitely recommend this place.

For the wait this place has, I was expecting to be blown away. I wasn't blown away but the pizza is super tasty. However, I could probably live off of pizza. We were given an estimated 1 hour wait so we grabbed a drink and hung out outside. There's barely any waiting room inside which seems silly to me for a restaurant that is almost always on a wait. We lucked out by waiting outside as their patio is first come first serve, something they didn't tell us at the host stand. You would think that would be the first thing they say, to hopefully keep the wait down. They do allow you to pre-order your pizza, since the deep dish pizzas take up to 45 minutes, which helps a lot. Our server was slammed but she was great and their bottles of wine are cheap. The spinach bread is a great appetizer and their regular size salads are huge! After an app and salad, my BF and I split a personal size pizza, advertised as for 1, and it was more than enough. It's definitely a Chicago staple and the food is good. But be prepared to wait, most likely in an overly crowded area.

This place is amazing. I've seen it on a episode of some cooking show and we felt like pizza so we decided to go here.  I'm not typically a fan of deep dish pizza, but I guess it's because I never had Lou Malnatis.  The crust is just crisp enough and buttery that you don't feel like you're getting a full mouth of dough. The ingredients on the pizza were outstanding.  They told us the wait was an hour and we only ended up waiting around 45 minutes. On a Saturday in downtown Chicago, that's not too shabby.  Portions were great. My husband and I each got our own personal size and each only ate about half.  As long as you preorder your meal during your wait (which they suggest you do when you put your name on the waiting list) the wait for the food to hit the table when you sit down is substantially minimized.  They take your number and you're texted when your table is ready.  As far as the ambiance goes, it was very loud in the restaurant but it was mostly background and didn't affect my husband and I from having a good conversation.  Pricing wise, we got two soft drinks, a beer, the calamari appetizer, and two personal pizzas for $42. For how good the pizzas were, that's a steal.  I wouldn't order the calamari again, it wasn't crunchy enough on the outside for me, but don't regret ordering it tonight. The table next to us was raving about the garlic bread.  All in all, we will absolutely be back. The wait is worth it.

We've ordered Lou's frozen pies on a couple of occasions and LOVED them.  Upon first arriving to town, this was our first stop.  We even called ahead to have our deep dish started so we wouldn't have a long wait.  We ordered a medium sausage, pepperoni, black olives and mushrooms and within 20 minutes it arrived.  I will say, it was quite "soupy".  Yes, I know the the juice is from the tomatoes, but even our frozen pizzas didn't have that consistency.  The flavor of the sausage was a little off for me.  We had talked about Lou's for months and months... and I think our pie was a bit of a let down.  We had planned to return before we left Chicago, but after having our pizza, decided against it.  I think had we ordered the personal size pizza, maybe we wouldn't have had such a "soupy" pie.  Our daughter ordered the spaghetti w/meatballs and it was really good.  The marinara sauce was fantastic, so was the homemade meatball.

I ordered out and had my meal delivered to my hotel.  The only qualm I have is the length of time for delivery.... 1 hour. Other than that the wings and salad were great basics. You can't really mess  this up!

Have to try this pizza if in Chicago. But it is super rich so could only eat one piece actually. 4 of us couldn't even finish one whole pizza. I guess it's a touristy thing to do once you are there. We went for a late lunch and it wasn't crowded.

Had the Malnati Classic and a beer. Solid deep dish. To confess I am not a huge fan of the deep dish style because I find it more bland than a thinner crust pizza. I would have preferred more seasoning in the sausage and in the sauce to offset the plainness of the butter crust. But as deep dish go a solid pie.

What can I say that everyone else hasn't already said. Been eating Lou's since I was a kid growing up in Evanston. We would make the trip often  The pizza, hot and bubbly from the oven, is the best thing. The kind of thing that makes you close your eyes and moan when your take your first bite.  The salad is really good too, but it takes up room in my stomach for pizza, so I often skip it. But if you like salad, you'll theirs.
Best of the best.  You cannot beat Lou's for deep dish sausage and pepperoni pizza.  It is the perfect combination of such wonderful ingredients!

The lady loves Lou's so we get it every time we go to Chicago.  The crust is buttery-perfect.  The wait can be long but they have a good option to pre-order with the hostess when you are put on the wait, that way you are not waiting long for your pie once you get to the table.
I was never a fan of the thin crust until I tried Lou's flaky, buttery crust!  Not all locations are the same though.

Ok, I'm only writing this to get it off my pop up once and for all.  I feel like I may as well be reviewing Dominos though!  Yes its a Chicago legend, yes it's got deep dish pizza.  Aside from all that though, if you're not a tourist, it's really not all that.  Sure you can pop in and experience it but if you really want good pizza there are about a million places in Chicago I'd recommend before this chain.  So if you're reading this in search of a great place to eat Chicago pizza please do some research because I believe you'll be less than impressed with this place.

I was super excited to try a true deep dish. So we came here based on my friends and everyone elses recommendation. Ordered the sausage. Staff super friendly even worned us it would take awhile for the pizza sat down watched some soccer and waited. The pizza looked awesome. Nice crispy toppings thick crispy crust. Then the bite. I felt like it was mostly just cheese and dough no sauce or toppings. The crust was way to buttery for me and it was stacked with grease. I really wanted to love deep dish but it's just a little to much of the dough and cheese for me. If its your thing though this place does everything else for you.

This was the best deep dish pizza I ever had.  The pizza was perfect and despite the restaurant being packed, the service was excellent.  The pizza was worth the wait and I think this chain is better than giordanos.  Overall, the restaurant was good because the pizza was crispy and flavorful

Whenever I'm in Chicago I have to have at least 1, no, more like 2 slices of Lou Malnati's pizza. The sausage is like nothing I've ever had before. It's flavorful, juicy and oh so yummy. There has never been a time when I haven't had to wait for a table but who wouldn't wait. I waited eagerly knowing that hands down I was getting ready to bite into one incredible pizza!

There's something about Chicago pizza that just doesn't compare to any other. Staff was also very friendly. This is probably the only time I will ever order deep dish pizza because it's worth. This place looks small from the outside but it's pretty spacious once you get inside. I ordered a lunch special pizza which is very convenient, small and still delicious. Definitely coming back here on my next visit.
Easily the best Chicago Pizza! The one in wicker park has no dining room but does sell frozen pizzas if you want to take one to go.

Ordered the deep dish pizza. Delivery was fine, but the pizza was not good. Very little sauce and sort of spongy crust. Overall quite bland. Much better off ordering deep dish from Tortorice's or Giordano's.
I have never had deep dish pizza before and this makes me wish that wasn't so! I am now deep dish pizza's biggest fan! I can't imagine a pizza better than this! Yum Yum Yum!!

Great ZAAAAA!!  The pizza is very similar to UNO's since Lou Malnati worked for Ike Sewell who founded UNO's (the Original Uno's/Due's) not the franchise..).  Great deep dish pizza and the Malnati salad is Spectacular!!

Solid deep dish. The crust is tender and crunchy, and the sauce is flavorful. There is too much cheese for my liking, so I just don't eat all of it. I think it's a decent place to take visitors to try out deep dish. I've taken friends visiting on 2 separate occasions, and the pizza was enjoyed both times.

The absolute best deep dish in Chicago! A+  Expect to wait because this place is usually crowded, but it's oh so worth it. The ratio of crust to pizza is 1:2 so you're not eating all crust. The service is good. I always bring out of town visitors here and the love it!  Must Try: The Lou Deep Dish with Garlic Butter Crust, Spinach, Crushed Tomato and sausage.
The pizza is always fabulous!  The thin pizza is my go to...always light, buttery, and crispy.  Lou's is one of my favorites!

Let me start off by saying I'm not a fan of deep dish pizza; however, Lou Malanti's completely changed my perspective. I'm used to eating very heavy deep dish pizza, but the pizza here was not heavy at all. Food: I ordered the personal classic, which came with lean sausage, cheese, and tomato sauce on a "Buttercrust." Best deep dish I ever had!  The crust is very tasty and not heavy! Sides Notes Ambiance: This place is on the noisy side. Service: The person who took my order over the phone was so friendly and offered really good customer service; however, when I went in to pay for my food, the cashier (a different person than the one taking orders over the phone) was not polite and friendly. Overall: Definitely try the deep dish!

Great pizza, super busy restaurant that makes having any type of a conversation impossible.  We placed our name on the wait list and were able to place the order for our pizza at that time.  When our table was ready (50 mins later) our pizza was already in the oven.  Our wait for the food was about 30 minutes beyond the time we were seated. It is really too bad that they do  not take reservations for small groups!  Food is good, but wait time is not!

This is the best pizza in Chicago, hands town. If you want true, heavy, hearty Chicago pizza, this is the place to beat. The crust is INCREDIBLE; this is because they use old pans that they never wash (don't worry, the heat kills all the germs!). I have never tasted anything like it in my entire life.

This was my first Chicago deep dish pizza experience and while I'm no where near being a Chicago pizza connoisseur, Lou did not disappoint. I definitely recommend coming here in a large group, it's more fun and you can order a large pizza for more wow factor. We were lucky because there was no wait on a Monday night and we were seated immediately. We tried the minestrone soup, so so good, definitely get a large bowl of that! For 2 people, a small pizza is the perfect size for sharing if you don't want any leftovers. You will both be stuffed. If your group consists of 2 grown men, then I'd go with the medium pizza to be on the safe side. It took about 40 minutes from the time we ordered to when we got our pizza, exactly as our server had told us. Our pizza came out piping hot. The pizza itself wasn't as "deep" as I had imagined, but the buttery side crust did form a high wall around the pie. The cheese and tomatoes were so fresh and they did not skimp on the layer of sausage. I've never eaten pizza with a fork and knife but this time I did.

I love Lou's!  When I lived out of state for six years, I missed Lou's Pizza the most, but thankfully it can be ordered and shipped to anywhere FedEx delivers too!  Now that I am back in Chicago, it is my go to pizza place and when we have guests in from out of town, we always introduce them to Lou's so they can taste true Chicago-style pizza.  Thank you Lou's for always being the best!!

If your looking for great deep dish pizza in Chicago this is your spot. The deep dish had the right amount of cheese to sauce ratio and the garlic butter crust made it taste pretty legit.  The service was good, could have been a bit better but they were super busy so that's understandable. The Waitress was really nice and patient. She had great recommendations for food and activities in Chicago and seemed like she enjoyed giving tourists the spiel.  The salads were good too but this is definitely the place you want to go for deep dish in Chicago.
Delicious pizza. Sweet sauce is to die for. I love that you can have small sizes delivered. Crust/bread is fresh and not greasy!!
Love Lou's! It's right up there with Pequod's. I stopped getting deep dish for the most part, but if you're going to go for it, go for Lou's.

Ill be honest, I am not a big fan of Chicago style pizza, but if you're going to try it for the first time, then I definitely recommend this place. I went with some friends to get pizza here and the line is really long. expect to wait at least an hour. the good thing they let you order the pizza and call you, so when you finally get your table the pizza is already pretty much done.

Wow seriously? The place is packed, I'm sure based on Yelp reviews, that's why I went. What a huge let down. I ordered a personal size pepperoni and there were few pepperonis and lots of diced stewed tomatoes. The sauce was just ok. And the dough and crust was blah. Not worth the reviews. People wouldn't know good pizza if I slapped them in the face with it.  And deep dish my ass. They just fold up the ends to make it look deep. Waste of time and money don't recommend going to this place, don't believe the hype. Go somewhere else. Came here starving and left here hungry. Even my 2 year old didn't like it. And kids almost eat anything.

The wait is pretty ridiculous. And the ladies at the front need to get their sense of time more accurate. 5 minutes was more like 30 minutes.. I was expecting rainbows & unicorns explosion in my mouth based in how popular this place was.. Well, it was good but I won't wait 2 hours for  deep dish pizza.. the stuffed spinach & cheese bread was pretty good though. But again not something I would wait that long for.. It was actually really spacious inside with an upstairs too. The waiter was friendly enough and kind of efficient. I can imagine it being stressful working there being so busy. Overall it was OK.. Nothing special despite the hype. Definitely filling and good to eat when you're hungry  (maybe that was the strategy) but sadly not worth the wait.

While in Chicago we were told to try this place for some amazing deep dish pizza. We came in on a Saturday night and seen people all around waiting. We were told the wait was a two hour wait so we grabbed some beers and waited.  When you walk up to the location it looks like a small restaurant but they have an upstairs and some setting in the back. We looked over the menu and placed our pizza order ahead of time so by the time we got seated it wasn't a long wait.  The Malnati Chicago Classic - Made with Lou's lean sausage, some extra cheese and vine-ripened tomato sauce on Buttercrust. It was awesome! Great taste, sausage was very good and ingredients tasted very fresh. Very cheesy and crust was great.  Buffalo wings - very tasty and just the right amount of spice. Had a side of blue cheese and ranch with some celery. They were also very good.  The wait might have been long but it was very worth it. The later you get there the shorter the line gets. If around the area stop by and enjoy some deep dish.

Didn't really live up to the hype. Long wait (which is ok), but when we got the pizza it just wasn't all that impressive. Lots of cheese and the fillings just didn't have that much flavor. Eh, worth trying. Pro tip: Take them up on the pre-order of pizza while you're waiting. Otherwise it takes 30-40 mins. (They are very up front it will take this long, but man feels longer when you're hungry!)

Oh my goodness. New York Pizza will never be the same ever again. Hands down, the best Pizza I have EVER had in my life. So good that I asked the waitress how it can be shipped to me in LA. I was here for a conference in Chicago for the weekend & was told to come here. I ordered "The Lou," which is a medley of tomato, spinach & mushrooms. The cheese is amazing (they use a combo of mozzarella & cheddar) along w/the butter crust. The crust is what sold me. I have never tried anything like that. My party also ordered calamari which was battered very lightly but did not lack in flavor. The marinara dipping sauce had a kick & balanced out the squid. I would come again & again & again.

First time here. Not the best deep dish pizza I have had in Chicago. Service was brusque and the pizza was served warm not hot. Noisy environment made talking with family difficult. Will not be going back. My impression was that turning over tables was more important than providing a good dining experience.
The wait was long but it was surely worth it. This is the next pizza and best ceasar salad that I've ever had. Beware, a large is too much for 2 people to eat in one setting.

On my first night in Chicago, my friends and I decided to authentic Chicago deep dish pizza. We choose this spot becuase it was only a couple blocks away from our Airbnb so it was very convenient to go here and the reviews were pretty solid. We walked in on a thursday night and got seated immediately. We decided to opt in for the Malnati Chicago Classic deep dish pizza with Lou's lean sausage, olives, and jalapeños.  I thought the pizza was ok. Or maybe I'm just not a big fan of deep dish pizza because it's way too cheesy for me. The sausage is not the usual small pieces you get at your regular pizza places but large, slices of sausage. I'm not usually a fan of sausage, but their blend of sausage and seasoning sure makes this kind pretty tasty. You really do get your bang for your buck here.  I've had deep dish pizza before in California and I feel like they all taste the same to me. The only thing that's different was the sausages and crust wises. I think I still prefer NYC pizza over deep dish, though. BUT you gotta at least try 1 authentic deep dish spot while you're visiting Chicago

Every pizza joint in town claims to be the best. Been to Giordano's in the past (which I enjoyed more) and told I had to go to Malnati's. Pre-ordered a cheese and Chicago classic (poultry sausage on butter crust dough) deep dish. Pizza came and...nothing special. It was pizza. One had cheese and one had sausage. We ate it and left. Still looking for the best deep dish in Chicago.

Delicious deep dish pizza with a buttery crust and chunky tomato sauce. This is serious Chicago style pizza and my personal favorite in the city. Wait can be long but we sat at the bar and were served by a very busy, friendly and attentive bartender.
great crispy pie. a little loud and table is tiny. but good iconic food.

Sadly this pizza did not live up to my expectation. I visited Chicago with friends we went on a Friday night.  I ordered a small Cheese deep dish, regular crust and added the poultry sausage.  First negative, the poultry sausage was a flat layer of sausage over top the cheese... This was, hmm different and unexpected. I thought it would be sausage pieces.  Second, I felt I got cheated of cheese on a cheese pizza! I guess I had to order extra cheese? I felt there was barely cheese, didn't fall off the spatular and was actually a little cold.  Lastly the dough was too thick.  I did try my friends pizza, she got the Lou Malnati Classic. More cheese on hers!  What I did like was that you can pre order your food. Because there was an hour wait. The pizza was not there waiting on us but I suppose it expedited the process of ordering and waiting.  And the size of a small was defiantly more than enough for one person.   We ordered margaritas, not strong just fruity.

YUM! I'm so glad that I did my homework on where to have Chicago pizza. This is it! No need to look any further! We ordered the Malnati Classic with pepperoni. The crust, while thick is crispy and the sauce is delicious with the sausage cooked in it. The portion sizes that they have published on the menu are no joke. My husband just had to order the medium which feeds four and of course we had leftovers because we're two people. My only criticism is that I wish they had more craft beer options.
Gluten free pizza was terrible, it didn't come cut even though I specified and they arrived 20 minutes outside the projected delivery window. I wish it were better :(

It's always packed, so be prepared to wait. The cool thing is that you can order your pizza before you're seated, so the pizza doesn't take too long once you get a table. The pizza itself is legendary and needs no introduction. The service staff are competent and nice, and my experience has been very consistent from visit to visit. So, despite the long wait, still a 5 all day. It's one of those rare places beloved by locals and tourists alike.

Probably the best pizza I've ever had outside of New York.  I ordered pick up since I heard it's hard to get a seat. When I arrived to pick up the wait was 45 minutes long.  I ordered a deep dish The Lou--never had anything quite like it. There's so much to this pizza you shouldn't carry a conversation. Just try to figure it out and you'll have an extremely good time!  I ordered a large because I got greedy. I couldn't even finish half of it and I'm 207 lbs. A large itself weighs like 3 lbs!  I'm hungry just reviewing this. Would be a very frequent customer if I lived in Chicago. To open one in Shanghai would be very smart.  Overall experience: 4.7/5

Overhyped place to be honest. Poor service. Our server only come and helped us maybe a handful of times. Asked for hot tea, hot water and straw a couple of times but didn't come within a timely manner in my opinion. The classic was good. I like the meat layer and the crunchy crust! The veggie option with spinach and mushroom (I forgot what the name was) was soggy. The wait was 45mins. Food wait was about 20mins. Again, In my opinion this place was overhyped.

Late night dinner at this joint. Got there around 930 and the wait was about 40 minutes. Luckily there were two seats available at the bar so we took them and skipped the wait. Ordered the three dip appetizer and a classic deep dish pizza with butter crust. Everything tasted very good. Service was adequate at the bar. Will definitely go back.

My basis of judgement for deep dish spans little to none, unless you wanna count frozen pizza. I visited a friend who recently moved to Chi and requested that he take me to Lou's. The wait wasn't terribly long and as soon as we stepped out to grab drinks down the block, we received a text saying our table was ready. The wait for a small deep dish was probably 6-10 minutes, relieved with a few beers and little complaints. The crust was well-done, nothing was soggy and the sausage was perfectly seasoned. Deep dish wasn't THE best pizza I've ever had but it wasn't done terribly, either.
Don't judge the deep dish pizza if you haven't tried here. You see the numbers of reviews and the overall of the stars? Yes, you don't need to hesitate. You're welcome.
Awesome Pizza the best deep dish in town,  exceptional salads, not always the best service and the wait can be very long but the food is exceptional

We ordered a Lou Malnati's pizza shipped to our door a few years back and were disappointed with it. We have heard so many good things about this place that we figured while In Chicago we would have to try it fresh from the oven. Unfortunately, the pizza wasn't significantly better than what we experienced shipped to our door. The pizza was kind of bland and nobody in our party seemed to really be blown away by it. The salad was made from a premixed bag lettuce which was subpar. The garlic bread and sauce were the highlights of our meal. We really only ordered these because everyone was so hungry and the pizza takes a while to cook. Service here was average.

I've been converted to deep dish life!  Sadly I live in a place where they don't know what deep dish is about so I'll rarely get to experience this again. Staff was great pointing out recommendations. Pizza took about 30 mins. Found out they ship pizza too! Will have to do that soon.

Located near a corner with outdoor seating (too cold and windy for us to eat outside on a Saturday when we visited), my husband and I came here for a late lunch a little before 2:30 pm. There was a wait even this later in the day. We waited 22 minutes for a table, which wasn't too bad. While we waited, an employee told us that we could actually put in an order for our pizza so that it will be ready by the time we are seated (you can only put in your order for pizza only, which is great because it does take some time for it to be made).  So 22 minutes later, we were seated with menus in hand and ended up ordering: Spinach Salad, $9.25 prior to tax- I asked for the dressing (balsamic dressing) to be on the side, which is how it came. This salad was a good size for 2 people to share and came with thinly sliced pears (added a nice sweet taste), some crumbled goat cheese and sliced red onions. I thought this salad was good, but would have preferred grilled onions.  The Malnati Chicago Classic, Small Size, $14.95 prior to tax- If you come to Lou Malnati's, you have to get the Chicago classic. This deep dish masterpiece is topped with sausage, roma tomato marinara and extra cheese. Toppings are simple, but so perfect together(but you can add extra toppings at an additional cost if you want more). The small size gives you 4 large pieces (our server cut and served the pizza for us) and honestly could probably feed 3 people (you only need to eat one slice because it is really filling). The cheese is so oozey and wished I had more it. This is a must order! Chocolate Chip Pizza, Individual Serving, $3.35 prior to tax- Not that I had much room for dessert, but I still wanted something sweet to end this meal. So my husband and I opted to share an individual serving. This serving really is perfect for 1 person (or 2 full people). The cookie and ice cream was a good match and would love to order the larger serving ($6.65 prior to tax, serves 2-3 people). By the way, if you want to order this dessert, let your server know ahead of time because it does take some time to make.  --------------------------- (Total= $29.75 after tax, prior to tip) Wow this meal was delicious! Even though a local Chicagoan (whom I met on the plane on my way back to Southern California) told me that Lou Malnati's is just "decent", I still think this place is pretty good. I would definitely come back here again the next time I am in Chicago.  By the way, the women's restroom on the 1st floor has 1 stall (was clean on this visit) but the women's restroom on the 2nd floor has 3 stalls (and was clean on this visit)

My first deep dish pizza in Chicago was about 2 years ago. I thought it was just alright, but I felt obligated to give deep dish another try since I'm back in Chicago. We came in on Wednesday night around 9 pm and we were quoted for a 30 minute wait. Since we were rather tired after a long day of sightseeing plus all the positive reviews on Yelp, we decided we would just wait here than go to a different place.  We put in our order while we were waiting to be seated. It is recommended to do so because it takes a while to bake the deep dish pizzas. We ended up ordering two personal size pizza to share - the Lou and the Malanti. We also got a house salad to share. We actually got seated in about 15 minutes rather than half an hour. Our salad came first. I ordered it with dressing on the side, but when the salad came the dressing was no where to be seen. We were sitting in the corer by the window so it was hard to flag down a waiter to get dressing. However once we got to our waiter, he brought us the dressing soon after. Even though we preordered the pizza, we still waited for a some time for them. It's just the nature of the dish, so I would definitely recommend preordering the pizza. Neither my sister nor I are fan of deep dish pizza after our meal. We definitely prefer thin crust. I never thought I would say no to extra bread. However, the pizza crust isn't very flavorful, so the extra crust makes the pizza rather bland. To me the cheese, sauce, crust ratio is off for deep dish pizza. Too much dough!! I'm still not a fan of deep dish and I think my next trip back I won't be going out of my way to try deep dish pizza.

Fantastic pepperoni deep dish pizza! We ordered that along with the three cheese bread for an app and a thin crust pepperoni. Everything was delicious, and the service was great! They have a slightly different and better crust than Gino's.
Amazing deep dish pizza! Had the classic and added spinach mix... Sooo good! First time to Chicago and I feel like I went to the right place. Also our server Sean was very pleasant. Two thumbs up!

If you ask for a recommendation for a deep dish pizza in Chicago you will get a different answer each and every time. I personally chose Lou Malnati's for my first Chicago deep dish experience and it did NOT disappoint!  Walked in and the wait was 30 minutes, luckily I spotted 2 seats at the bar so we opted to sit there. Started off with a Goose Island Green Line while Boyfriend went with a Goose Island IPA. We split an individual salad with red wine vinaigrette and ranch on the side. I personally enjoyed drizzling both dressings on my portion of the salad and thought that it was enough for two. For pizza we ordered The Malnati Chicago Classic, a size small. It comes with sausage so we added green peppers and onions. The pizza was FRICKING AWESOME!! I fell in LOVE with the buttercrust, it was so crispy which is just the way I like it.  David offered awesome recommendations and took excellent care of us too! The only downside is that it gets SLAMMED. Since we were sitting at the bar people kept coming up to order drinks and were standing around so it was tough for me to get out to use the restroom and when leaving. I would recommend ordering your pizza and picking it up.  I did not try any of the other deep dish pizza joints but I would HIGHLY recommend Lou Malnati's.

I'll be honest, I wasn't really a big fan of their deep dish here. We got 2 larges for 8 people and it was more than enough. They say one large feeds 4. The butter crust had good crunch, but was a bit bland. And the pizza was just oddly layered. The meat and cheese were each their own layer and it was like biting into a cracker with cheese and meat stacked on top of it rather than a pizza as a whole with its ingredients combined. I don't know, it's hard to explain but the pizza just didn't feel right when I ate it. Maybe I came on a bad day but I definitely preferred Giordano's deep dish. I'd be willing to come back and try it on another day or maybe get their thin crust, but I definitely was not impressed on my first visit.

The waiter I had was Chris C. and he was on top of it! The Lou Malnati's salad was the BEST SALAD I've ever had. Dead serious. Deep dish pizza is amazing and surpassed my expectations. I would recommend this place to anyone who asks me.

Alright, alright, alright, as Matthew McConaughey would say.  This is the OG to the OG's in Chicago.  Sorry, Giordano's, you're great!  Sorry, Gino's East, you're pretty good too!  But Lou's is Lou's.  I've been living in Chicago now for 7 years.  There is 1 consistent pizza place that I have been going to for all 7- Lou's.  The deep dish crust is so golden and crunch in the best way to compliment the cheese and toppings.  It will be one of those crusts that make you excited to get to the end of the slice.   I normally get the deep dish with sausage and green peppers.  Key point- the sausage is not in little bites or spread around sparingly.  You get sausage in EVERY BITE.  If I'm doing deep dish pizza, Lou's is my choice  Honestly, when people they don't like Lou's, I'm surprised.
I love the crust! It's tasty and holds up under the all the deep dish toppings. It has a nice patio area and very good service.

Some of the best deep dish pizza I've had in Chicago. I'm not the biggest fan of deep dish, but this was excellent. The service was also very good, and they were great about splitting the checks for a pretty large party. Definitely recommended!

We came hear after hearing all of the recommendations from locals & our friends! We were very excited to try the deep dish pizza. There was not a wait when we arrived. We were seated immediately. My husband, nephew, & I ordered a salad, wings, & 2 pizzas. The food took pretty long to come out. We definitely over estimated our appetites and didn't finish the food, but were so excited to try everything! Unfortunately, the pizza was heavy and a little on the soggier side. The cheese didn't seem fully melted & there was not much flavor. We may give this place another try when we come!

I would go to try deep dish pizza each time I visit Chicago. But this time, unfortunately, I decided to try this one based on the recommendation of Yelp. After waiting for a long 40 minutes, my pizza is finally served. This is acceptable since I have been notified about this and I know that is how long baking a deep dish pizza should take. However, with the long waiting, I expect a hot and stringy pizza on the table, which is not the case at all when I visited this restaurant. I can't see why I spent this long time to get this COLD pizza. Anyway, since the bad experience in this restaurant, I will never visit it again.

New favorite place for authentic Chicago deep dish pizza. Hands down, it's the best. You can taste the fresh ingredients. I tried some others like Giordanos and they don't compete with the food here. Yeah the pizza may take 45 mins to cook but the way they have everything organized you wouldn't even notice. You order your deep dish before you even sit down, so when you get to your table the pizza is pretty much brought out a few mins later.

overall amazing deep dish pizza... but you have to take into account that waiting time around 30-40 min so better to order some appetizers as well!!!  Lou pizza with spinach and mushroom was soooo delicious!!! we also ordered three type of dessert but it was or not so good, or probably just too much...

The deep dish pizza was average, but their service was pretty lame. I was not pleased with how rude and sarcastic the waiter was toward me. Sure, it was a busy night, but that was not an excuse for the behavior. I will not be coming back the next time I visit Chicago.

This is my most favorite pizza! 'Nuff said. (Guess not. I was instructed to write more. lol) Cheesy (no need to ever order extra cheese), the right portion of tomato sauce and other toppings --I religiously order onions, black olives and mushrooms. When I'm feeling extra decadent, I'll add Giardiniera peppers --YUM! And then there is THE CRUST! Lordy Lordy, what can I say. Let's try perfect, or exquisite, or untouchable, or matchless. They even offer a butter crust for those who live on the edge. It's ideal that they don't deliver to my neighborhood...I'd turn into a Lou Malnati's Pizza.
The deep dish crust was amazing. Our server was nice but not very efficient. Order the family size pizza, it's humongous.
At least in the top two when it comes to best deep dish pizza in Chicago. Always has great food, must try!
The best Chicago deep dish pizza and butter crust is to die for! Definitely coming back here next visit to Chicago. Highly recommended yum!

Chicagoans must have a high tolerance for waiting long periods of time, bad service, mediocre food and being treated like it's a privilege to eat there. We waited for an hour to get a table and then was told that our pizza would take another hour. Are you kidding me??? Two hours to get mediocre pizza?? I once bought a Pizzeria Uno frozen pizza from a supermarket that was as good as what I got here.
I love their cornmeal crust! Very tasty pizza we ordered the deep dish pepperoni with mushroom. I would love to see how it compares to Giordano's perhaps on a next trip to the Windy City!
Our table included 4 adults and 4 kids. The staff did a great job with fast, friendly, efficient and non-chaotic service. They were very accommodating . Food was great as always.

I liked Lou Malnati's, but I wasn't really impressed with the service. I liked their pizza, but I don't think it's the best in the City. I love their building! It's a really cool atmosphere, and I had a nice time!  It was my Birthday, and they did, however bring me the yummiest cookie dessert! So good! So, that was nice!  I don't know if we will come back or not, but it was a good experience overall

My sister, who's a local, got me into Lou Malnati's so when we recently traveled with some friends who were new to Chicago, we had to bring them here.  I heard this location was popular so we ended up coming after 8PM on a Thursday.  Wait time was about 40 minutes so it wasn't too bad.  At least you can put in your pizza order while you wait. For the 4 of us, we ordered a medium Sausage & Mushroom Deep Dish with a butter crust, Lou's Bruschetta, and a family size Malnati salad.  Wait time for the food was a little longer than expected.   When the salad came, it was a lot bigger than what we expected.  I wish our server would have informed us that it would be too much as that was enough for 8-10 people!  We ate as much as we can, but most of it unfortunately, went to waste.  The bruschetta was pretty good.  Nothing fancy, but still tasty.   The pizza was definitely worth the wait.  It was delicious!   I had one slice and it was just right. I wasn't stuffed like the last time I came.  Last time, I had the Malnati Chicago Classic so the pizza was caked in sauce and cheese which was heavy and overwhelming, but this one was just right so I highly recommend ordering the Sausage Deep Dish. Even leftovers a couple days later was still good.  I will definitely come back again when I'm in town!
Very good pizza - got the personal house classic specialty pizza and a pitcher of beer to split.  Got the butter crust, would do it again.  Very tasty and cheesy, flaky crust, great flavors.

We visited around 12 pm on a Tuesday and it wasn't busy when we arrived but about 20 minutes in, it became very busy and loud. Our waitress was very nice and quick. We got the three cheese bread for our appetizer which was delicious! We ordered a small butter crust half pepperoni half cheese which we were quoted about 35-45 minutes for. I wouldn't recommend coming for deep dish if you're in a hurry as it takes quite a while to make. The pizza was just ok. I'm not a huge fan on sweet sauce and tons of cheese.

OMG Lou! This is by far my favorite pizza in Chicago. I didn't used to be a fan of deep dish pizza until I tried this place. PHENOMENAL. It's the perfect combination of sauce, meat and cheese. And I also really enjoy their salads. The service is pretty good and the atmosphere has a good vibe.

Fantastic service. Because the pizzas take 30-40min to cook once ordered we started with the Malnati salad which we highly recommend. The sweet vinaigrette tied this dish together so nicely. For our pizzas we had the Lou with olives and the Malnati Chicago classic. Both were absolutely mouth watering. My husband had the malnati and in hind site wished he had added veggies. We took home the large cookie which came with ice cream. We warned it up for a dessert later and it was also delish. Go here and if you love it as much as we did take home a frozen pizza for your next pizza craving.

If I am in Chicago you better believe I am going to Lou's for some deep dish. My cousin took us to this location which was new to me. We shared a pepperoni deep dish and the salad as usually and as normal, it made me not want to leave Chicago! I cannot express how good this pizza is! It will have your taste buds doing the happy dance.  The also had a great selection of craft beers available. I was able to point my friend towards the New Holland Poet which has since become a favorite beer for him. There wasn't much of a wait when we went later on a Thursday night. The service was friendly and attentive and the restaurant itself was very clean and well kept. Our order was taken and delivered quickly and was of top notch quality as I have come to expect at Lou's. If you are looking for some deep dish and are in the area, do not hesitate to stop in and enjoy this incredible pizza!

Can't believe I forgot to make a review for this place after my trip to Chicago! I must say--this place has the best deep dish pizza in Chicago. I went to three different deep dish pizza places, including this one, and I must say this one is the best. What's so memorable about this one is their amazing, crunchy crust, and I normally hate eating the crust of a pizza! The crust had a garlic-like seasoning of its own and the pizza sauce was just out of this world--it was definitely an awakening of the ilLOU-MALNATI (did they do that on purpose or it is mere coincidence?). The tomatoes were freshly chopped and oven-baked onto the deep dish pizza while the mozzarella cheese toppled all over this hearty and savory pizza pie.  We were hungry so we also ordered their spinach cheese bread--wow. The cheese oozed out of the bread and the dipping sauce contained freshly pureed tomatoes. I guess the only minor issue is the lack of meat--the sausages specifically, but because I'm more about the sauce-kind of person, I let that slide! This place has changed my perspectives in deep dish pizza and it's honestly a go-to when visiting Chicago

I'm from CA and last month I traveled to Chicago on Business.  Lou Malnati's was the first place I went to straight from the airport.  It was my first time trying real Chicago Deep Dish pizza.  It was nothing I had imagined but better than I expected.  Considering i'm not from Chicago, I always thought of Deep Dish Pizza as a pizza with a really thick crust and tons of bread.  This was not the case at all.  To my surprise, Lou Malnati's had the perfect amount of crust (not thick at all) and the massive amount of cheese and meat was impressive.  Full of flavor.  I wish we had a Lou Malnati's in the LA area.  Now i'm just hoping my manager sends me to Chicago again.  Delicious! By the way, it's nice how they allow you to pre-order your pizza before you are seated, so that your order comes out quickly.  Good service.

Large deep dish sausage, onion, green pepper, mushroom, and giardiniera. Garlic crust and un cut. And 1 malnati Salad. That order there has been a staple since I was a kid and now that same order is for my family.  Have had this meal picked up or delivered at just about every location they have.  Now some might be better than others but still darn good.  If the whole sausage patty is a little to overwhelming or the crumbled sausage instead.  Who's ready for another slice?

We love the easy on-line ordering and always get the thin pizza with spinach (it's their seasoned spinach mix) and Lower Fat Mozzarella (cannot tell the difference!) plus they offer the option of  "well done-bake extra 5 minutes" if you like it crispy, which we do! If you have it delivered, order it UNCUT because it stays crispier... we learned that from the Manager when we dined in, and it really makes a difference. We get it with their House Salad and Malnati's Sweet Vinaigrette!! It's the best!!
I mean, the pizza is good... but there are better less touristy places in Chi-town.

Without a clean environment to eat in, we just couldn't enjoy the food. When I see that the front of the house looks like this, I wonder how much worse the kitchen is. I typically make a scene but the family frowns upon this so, I ordered their specialty pizza; the sausage was baked together as a layer in the pie and just made it taste like dog food.
The best deep dish pizza in Chicago. Period! Their house salad is also delicious.
If you're looking for Chicago pizza, look no further. Go to Lou's, get the Malnati Classic. Thank me later
Probably the best Chicago-style pizza joint in town.  Certainly very popular among the locals.  We avoid the deep dish pizzas, but if that's your jam, then you'll love this place.......

Hands down the best pizza I've ever had!  I saw the yelp reviews online and had to try it on my first night in Chicago.   We sat down and our server immediately let us know that the pizza takes at least 35 minutes to cook.  We ordered the malnati salad while we waited for our malnati chicago pizza.   I expected the pizza to be good but I was surprised by how amazing the salad was too!  I'm not sure what kind of dressing it was, but it was the perfect balance of tangy and sweet.  The salami bits added a perfect crunch to it as well.  When the pizza came out I was blown away, the cornmeal crust is seriously a home run.  I'm officially in love with deep dish pizza. Our meal was so great that we went back to a different Lou Malnati's location on our last night and ordered the same thing.  Service at both locations was friendly and attentive.  You have to try the pizza here if you haven't yet!

I had my first Chicago style deep dish pizza here last night. For appetizer we got the Three Cheese Bread. It's garlic French bread with three cheese and came with three dipping sauces (artichoke dip, hummus, and garlic sauce). The bread was very crunchy and had dices of tomato. My favorite dip was the garlic sauce for sure.  For the main course, we went with the house specialty, Chicago Deep Dish Pizza. The Malnati Chicago Classic was made with Lou's lean sausage, tasty tomato sauce, and some serious load of cheese. They did not mess around with their cheese, it was awesome! We ordered small but it came in 4 good size slices. We also ordered a small Pepperoni deep dish pizza and between the three of us we couldn't even finish. One of my friends had food coma after we were done. For dessert we got the Tre Dolci. It came with three individual portioned desserts. We had the Tiramisu, chocolate chip pizza, and the peach cobbler. Chocolate chip pizza was by far the best, hands down! Definitely give it a try when you are there.  Overall the atmosphere was nice, service was great, and the food was awesome.  It is a little on the pricy side for pizza, we spent about a hundred between the three of us (we did get 5 drinks). Nevertheless, I would still recommend it if you want to try the Chicago style deep dish pizza.

I ate at this location last week, and loved it! I'm not from Chicago, but every time I'm in town I have to eat at Lou's. I've tried other deep dish pizza in Chicago, i.e. Gino's East and Giordanos, and they've never really compared to Lou Malnati.  I highly recommend the original "The Lou" pizza. They're not lying when they say a small feeds two -- even with my appetite, we left with 3 slices of leftovers when trying to order a medium for 2. There's always a wait, but it moves fast. The venue is huge, and seats plenty. There was 40+ parties ahead of us, and only took 35 minutes. Don't be discouraged by the crowd! Grab a drink and chill near the bar.  Highly highly recommend! Especially if you're visiting the city, it's a great spot to grab some Chicago style pizza.
Very impressed! Delicious pizza, very reasonable price. Service is a little slow during off-hours, but it was definitely worth the wait.
LOVE IT! That salad is do ridiculously yummy. The butter crust is just great. Can't wait for the next round.

IMO the best Chicago style deep dish pizza!! I like how certain locations offer take away that you can bake at home.  We had a great experience here and we loved our pepperoni deep dish.  We came starved and ate the whole thing. Came in during the week around Christmas time and had no wait.  Keep up the good work!

As a New Yorker I was feeling pretty guilty for even trying Chicago style pizza...and have to say my expectations weren't very high. Well, I was totally wrong.  I ordered the personal pizza with sausage, onions and black olives. Ahhhmazzing. The crust was good...actually better than good, totally delicious! The flavors were great and the toppings were the perfect proportions.  Really glad I chose to go here for my first taste of Chicago style pizza
Glad we took the suggestions. Not from Chicago, wanted good pizza experience and it was great!

Malnati's was my first exposure to Chicago style "pizza" and I really wanted to love it, but if fell kind of short for me. The flavors were ok, but nothing special. The feel felt very much like a chain to me and not a long time city institution which was a bit disappointing. Price was pretty high for pizza, but the slices are really hefty, so a medium should feed 4 pretty easily.
Expect a long wait. But deep dish pizza was really good. The wait there was crazy. We were there for like 2 hrs at least.

Friends said if I wanted true Chicago pizza this was the place. Winner.  Friendly customer service, great old school atmosphere and tasty pies! Did not disappoint!  Looking forward to going back soon!
Excellent food, good service. The buttery crust classic was delish.

Not sure if I'm just not a deep dish pizza fan, but I tried Lou Malnati's and thought it was solid, but not amazing (especially for the price!) I had a flight to catch this afternoon, so I called ahead to Lou Malnati's so that my order would be ready right when they opened at 11am. Sure enough, it was ready and I was excited to try my piping hot personal-sized Chicago classic pizza. I do love a good crust, and particularly loved the crunch of the crust. The mozzarella was also fantastic--you could just tell by the way it stretched! Sauce was good, sausage was good. But given the price ~$10 for a 6" pizza, would I get it again? Probably not.
The pizza here was awesome wow! Definitely something you want to try if you are a pizza lover
The best deep dish in Chicago. End of story. Whether I dine in or order delivery, it never disappoints.

I have to say I've had better pizza... but they offer a gluten free crust and eating out with GF friends is difficult as is, so Lou's it was. They were nice. The butter crust was ok. The sauce was ok. Honestly it reminded me of pizza hut and that's probably not a good thing. The seating is good for one-four people, the larger groups looked uncomfortable.

I'm really struggling to know how to review this place - I mean it was actually a pretty good experience and our waitress was super friendly, but I think deep dish pizza is something I'll stick to as more of a novelty as opposed to my normal day to day pizza routine... Really packed, I tried to get in on the Saturday night and no joy so we headed back on a Sunday afternoon and only took 5 mins to wait and grab a table in the back.  The beer selection was ok and the personal pizza was tasty enough - but so much crust, felt pretty buttery (my poor heart...) and crumbly as hell.  If you're a deep pan fan then go here no doubt, but thin crust will always be the winner for me.
I love Lou Malnatis!!!!! My favorite Chicago Pizza Period!!!!

This pizza is ok. Definitely not the beat in town, but  its a good pie. Despite the hype their thin crust is better than their deep dish.  There are a lot of convenient locations throughout the city though, so it is a good option.

Loved this place! Service was amazing. Pizza was equally amazing. We also ordered the chicken BBQ salad and a Mediterranean platter appetizer. We loved everything we ordered. Very reasonably priced as well. Come hungry, their portions are huge!

I am a believer. After waiting nearly an hour, had to get my fix at a Chicago classic. Sorry to say I am not a sausage fan, but that's ok! The menu insists you should get whatever toppings you want. Either way, I couldn't resist getting the buttercrust. Since the pizzas take ~45 minutes to bake, they suggest you pre-order and have it ready by the time you sit. Pfft. My friend and I took this as: we're giving you ample time so you might as well order some appetizers and enjoy. We decided on the pizza chips and dip, which came with thin slabs of dough and a nice assortment of dipping sauces. My favorite was the garlicky one. When my pizza finally arrived, I was delighted at how stringy the cheese was as the slice pulled away from the pie. That buttercrust is no joke. It's crispy on the outside but somehow the crust also manages to maintain a good amount of bready chew inside. Verdict? Worth traveling 2,000 miles for.
Amazing!!!!! We got the classic Lou and added spinach and mushrooms. We got the regular flat bread cheese for the kids. Both crust were delicious

We ordered the Lou, a vegetarian pizza.  It was Cheesy with a capital C.  The sauce was delicious.  The pizza was tasty and soft.  It was more filling than it looked.  We could barely finish a small pizza (9 inches) between the two of us.  Boy, we were glad that we only ordered a personal sized green salad as app. A star is deducted because a server led the couple before us to their table, then left us waiting for a good 15 to 20 minutes.  I inquired with the greeter about our table.  A small table magically became available instantaneously.  It seemed to me that the vacant table had been available, yet the servers were too busy to let the greeter know, so we waited longer at the front unnecessarily.

We were visiting Chicago and went here for the first time. We were excited based on other reviews but we got there and our service wasn't great, we had dirty dish ware and the pizza was decent but not amazing.

Awful customer experience best described as misleading. Came to the restaurant and was told it would be a 25 minute wait but they allow you to pre-order your pie. What they failed to let you know is that only after you sit down do they actually cook your order (or "finish" cooking?). Anyway since I was starving - and knew it would be more than 25 minutes until I found somewhere else to eat, sit down, order and get my food, I thought this would be more efficient. Only when we sat did they tell us it would still be another 30 minutes until we would actually get food. If I wasn't so weak from hunger I would've left - but had to stay for the food. The pie was good though, I will say that. But way too long and deceptive on the length of time kills this place.

Hotel manager recommended this place to me. I've tried Giordano's and Piazano's, I personally don't like Giordano's at all... It was not crust enough, but I can't tell the difference between Lou Malnati's and Piazano's. They are both very good and definitely worth trying! We went with small Chicago deep dish classic, Italian soup and buffalo wings... And of course, we couldn't finish the wings because the pizza itself was so stuffing.

I ordered the Lou's pie with spinach, mushrooms, tomatoes, and three cheeses. To my surprise, this pie was bland. It missed the mark! I needed a little more Italian spices to make it more appetizing. I've had better deep dish! I'm disappointed.
I enjoyed my authentic deep dish Chicago style pizza, I never felt so happy about pizza until now. The famous buttercrust was everything! Great service indeed

This is simple. You order the butter crust, deep dish and regardless of topping you will enjoy the pizza. This location specifically regardless of how busy they are, there delivery time is quicker then most pizza places when you order Deep Dish for delivery.
Gino's East and Unos were once the best deep dish in Chicago (the world?) but success has led to inconsistency.  While Malnati's is doing well they have remained consistently GREAT.

This is the second time I have come to eat at Lou Malnatti's restaurant and once again it didn't disappoint. Their deep dish pizza is hands-down the best I've ever had. The crust is buttery an amazing, the sauce is zesty and delicious but the best part of the whole pizza is the tomatoes that they use on top.

So so disappointed. I really wanted to love this place, and deep dish pizza in general. There was a long line out the front and inside for a table on. Saturday evening. We were told the wait would be 45 mins but it was only about 20 before we were seated upstairs. We order a Malnati special pizza (medium) which is suited for 3 people according to the menu.  When the pizza finally came out it was lukewarm. We ate a slice each while discussing if we just plough through eating room temp pizza or whether we send it back to be warmed up. We asked our server to have it warmed up in the oven. It came back 10 mins later lukewarm again. Arg!! We asked our server whether deep dish was usually served at room temp and she apologised and replied that no, it should be piping hot. She bagged the remaining pizza for us and told us we would not have to pay since our meal had been so disappointing. Such a shame. Oh well, back to flat Neapolitan style pizzas I guess. Wood fired and always great.
Lou Malnati's pizza is probably the worst of the deep dish places. The crust and sauce are supposed to be buttery and fruity, not stale-tasting and vinegary.

While I love me some Malnati's, we've had more problems ordering here than anywhere else in the history of ordering food. As a girl who worked in restaurants (even a pizza joint) through college, I'm the first to understand that things happen. What I don't understand are shift managers blatantly lying to you when your food has been compromised, & never leaving messages for actual managers to call you back. Not cool. Things happen, & when I don't say anything three out of four times, maybe more, I think I'm pretty laid back. All I'm asking is that you treat me w/respect when I'm paying you for food that YOU wouldn't eat yourself. It's PIZZA, dude. Nothing personal.

WE LIVE IN CHICAGO!! Why people like this place is beyond me.I have been to the Oak Park location.It feels like processed food and not really great Italian.For the price,I prefer Mancini's across the street or Freddy's in Cicero.Lou's is for atmosphere,not great food.Anytime something turns into a chain it loses the authenticity of the original intention.

Wow wow wow!! Delicious deep dish pizzas, amazing buttery crush. And for anyone who has special dietary requirements like being gluten free, they have an entire crust made up of Italian sausage!! Yes you heard me right

Would be five stars but Giordano's exists. Go with Lou's if you're a sauce person, go with Giordano's if you're a cheese person. Either way, it's still delicious and a nice change of pace from the heavy, life-changing Gio's.
Who want a deep dish Pizza? I recommend this place. Great lunch special! Great staffs! Great pizza!!

Keep in mind I am not a fan of deep dish pizza. WAIT: I called around 6:30 pm and asked how long the wait was for 7 people and they said 30 minutes.  We come back around 8:00 pm and find that the wait has tripled to being 1 hour and 45 minutes! You give them your phone number and they add you to an app that tells you what your number is in line.  Since the wait was too long we decided to get the pizza to go and eat at our hotel. ORDER AHEAD: Most people tell you that you should order your pizza ahead of time.  What this means is if you are waiting for an hour, you should order your pizza at the kiosk next to the check in area 30 minutes beforehand so when you sit down the pizza will be ready.  The pizza itself takes about 30 minutes to bake so plan ahead! Unfortunately, you cannot call ahead and order but you have to be physically present.   For take out, they tell you to check back in 30 minutes to see if your pizza is ready.  If you're in a rush go earlier to see if it's ready because most likely it is. FOOD: The large has 8 slices while the medium has 6 slices.  Each person ate about 1 1/2 slices so plan accordingly.   Chicago Classic - This has cheese, tomato sauce and sausage.  For being the meat pizza it actually was the one with the least amount of flavor.  The "buttery" crust was a little hard on the bottom and not as crispy on the edges.  Definitely need a knife and fork for this one.  They didn't overdo it on the cheese, which was good and it also wasn't overly saucy.  This of course could be because we took it to go and ate it when it was slightly warm but still. The Lou - all vegetarian, but very flavorful! I actually like this one better than the classic.  The crust was a little softer too. Malnati Salad - the dressing was a slightly sweet balsamic with fresh ingredients (the family size fed all 7 of us), mushrooms, peppers etc. I would recommend this to help cut through the grease of the pizza. Overall, probably worth trying once for chicago deep dish style pizza but still didn't blow me away.
Perfect pizza! Got the Chicago Classic deep dish and the Malnati Salad. Both were excellent. Best pizza in Chicago!

LOVVVEEED IT  Had Lou Malnatis for the first time in 20 years since returning to Chicago I was worried at first it has been a while and in the past 20 years they have expanded across Chicagoland. But they did not disappoint at all I LOVED IT

First time ever having deep-dish pizza! Waitress was very attentive, gave us multiple refills, recommended a traditional deep-dish (it was our first time having deep dish)..... The pizza was incredible! Though I'm more of a fan of traditional thin-crust, I really enjoyed their pie! We had sausage and pepperoni cooked medium and I'd highly recommend it :) Kick ass first deep dish experience!
It's good, but not as good as giordano's. We're from out of town and wanted to try s couple pizza places. They have great service.

I have some of this pizza nearly every week!  I am addicted!  I always order a butter crust, pan pizza, uncut so the crust will stay crisp on delivery.  My favorite is the deep dish jalapeno. Really delicious!  The delivery people are always nice and on time too.  Bravo to Malnotti's!

That's one of Lou Malnati's Pizzeria I go to when I had pizza. Last night, I went to this River North location of how nice it is. I had medium deep dish pizza with pepperoni and black olives, Lou's bruschetta and Miller Lite beer. This place was very nice that I'm totally satisfied. I'll go there again.

3.5 stars!  Coming to Chicago I knew I had to get some deep dish pizza. At first my friend and I were going to try Giordanos, which I guess is a competitor of Lou's, but last minute we changed our mind and came here. What a great decision!  We shared the Lou's small pizza and oh my gosh was it the best pizza I have ever eaten. It had spinach, onions, garlic, mushrooms, and we added sausage. And Of course we got it with the butter crust, because well, why not? After we ordered the server asked if we wanted an appetizer or salad because the pizza would take 45 minutes. We decided against a starter and I was regretting it about 20 minutes into the wait, but once the food came out I was glad we had decided against it! Deep dish pizza is SO filling!  My only complaint was that the hostess sat our party of three at a two top booth. I asked if we could have a table that properly sat three people and she just moved us down to another two top booth. So, elbow room lacked when we were eating which was annoying, but the food made up for it.

I have to admit I've grown up eating Lou Malnati's and the name alone, makes me a little nostalgic.  With that being said, I have tried Giordano's, Pequods and seemingly every "Chicago Style" pizza place out there and nothing holds a candle to Lou's.  The crust is buttery and thick (if you go deep dish but thin is just as good) and the toppings are generous.  My favorite thing about the deep dish is that they don't throw a can of tomato sauce on top, it's actually chunks of fresh stewed tomatoes and they are so much better than sauce.  On top of the pizza their signature salad is divine.  I even buy the Sweet Vinaigrette and use it on salads at home- it's just that good!  I'll be a life long customer, nothing is better than Lou's if you're looking for quality Chicago Style pizza!

My mouth waters when I hear "Lou."  There's something about the crispy yet soft and beautiful taste of the thin crust pizza that makes my stomach a bottomless pit.  Why on earth is their recipe so freaking good? The sauce is the ultimate knocker. So good I could cry.  I literally can eat a whole box to myself and feel no guilt because it's crafted so well. I'll stop but yes to Lou. So much so that my dog has inherited his name..
Mediocre stuffed pizza ive had better. Im trying to remember the one place my friend ordered that had hands down the BEST stuffed pizza in chicago. When I remember that place I will post is here.

What a great place. I heard from the Uber driver that you can call ahead and order your pizza to be started so that when you get there you don't have to wait as long if you're in a rush to get to the airport or somewhere. We didn't do that but when we got there it wasn't very busy. The pizza takes about 40 minutes to make but so worth the wait. The crust was perfectly crisp and there wasn't too much sauce. Just a great proportion of cheesy goodness. The minestrone soup was perfect! Not too salty and a great amount of noodles and soup goodies. Great place. Great food. Very enjoyable.

So after visiting you yesterday and eating deep dish pizza for the first time, I had to get some frozen pies to take back home. It was delicious!! I was so excited to take them home to my husband. However, lo and behold, I was being patted down at the airport. My frozen pies tested positive for explosives!! They had to scan my pies and had me open one in front of explosives specialists. I was so scared they were going to take my deep dish pizza from me! I almost missed my flight back to New York but it was all worth it, Lou Malnati's! Thank you!! Anyway, service was great! The pizza crust was so good. We had the Malnati Chicago Classic and the Lou. They were both good but I think I like the classic better. The price isn't so bad either. Considering its location, $64 for some very good pizza and appetizers feeding 3 people is not a bad deal. The only bad thing I could say is that I can't find you in New York! I can't wait to go back.
I think this is my favorite pizza in Chicago, their deep dish is the best. I am obsessed, It's definitely my first choice of pizza.
Delicious then crust pizza and beautiful tasty salads! Love how they opened up the outdoor area on Lincoln Avenue!
It is as good as they claim it was!  We brought some home on the plane with us and it was still good when we got home!  I may even try their mail order version!!

Was in Chicago for a couple days and we made a pit stop here for lunch. I'm not used to having to wait 30 minutes to get a seat for lunch on a Thursday. That told me this place must be decent.  We ordered the garlic bread appetizer and it might have been the best garlic bread I've had. We then ordered two Chicago styled pizzas and they were incredible. Some of the best pizza I've had. After only two slices, I struggled to work up an appetite for dinner.  This place is a must when in Chicago.

I'm a pizza love to heart, sausage pizza not my favorite,  but this sausage pizza it's not like any other. You want it to keep coming however, a small is really enough for two people even though its size surprises you it's really feeling. The soup not my favorite but again the pizza it's their specialty and good job to them in that.

My first taste of deep dish Chicago pizza was Lou Malnati's both on previous trips and my most recent one.  The crust being buttery crispy makes this stand out to me.
