The crust balances perfectly amongst it's others ingredients and the fresh layer of tomato sauce on top brings in that sweet/sour tang to make it all come together.  I crave this pizza whenever I want deep dish Chi-style.  I'd have to put this up there in my top two favorites for deep dish.
The most awesome gluten-free pizza I've ever had!  LOVED IT!
I didn't care for the flavor of their pizza. I had the personal pizza for 2 with pepperoni and sausage. The sausage was the best part.

On our first evening of a short Chicago trip, we wanted to experience deep dish pizza.  So after some research on the best-reviewed places, this branch of Lou Malnati's proved to be within a short walk of our hotel. They don't take reservations or do call-ahead seating, btw.  We arrived around 5:30 p.m. on a Saturday.  There was about a 20-minute wait, but they do let you place your pizza-order when you sign in (given, apparently, the long cook-time required).  So we hung out in their small waiting area for 15 minutes or so and got seated.  There are seating areas on both the ground and upper floor.  Both floors were full.  The noise-level was high, if that bothers you; it was okay for us.   Service, once we were seated, was fairly prompt.  The food came out in another 10 - 15 minutes, and the pizza was very good!  I think we ordered the house special (cheese / sausage / buttermilk crust).  Even the medium is a lot to handle and we had leftovers from 3 of us (which were eaten over the next few days at the hotel).   I wish Lou had a branch in Atlanta.  Highly recommended.

Great Chicago Pizza. Well worth the visit and experience.  Very attentive wait staff.  Each pizza takes about 35 minutes to prepare, so I would recommend getting a small salad or something light in the interim.  Tip: to avoid the constant long wait times, I would recommend arriving around 11-11:20am to be seated.  Very friendly and busy place. They know what they're doing here.  Big shout to server Hector. He was very knowledgeable about the business and quality of the food here. This made the experience all the more worthwhile.
Great authentic Chicago deep dish pizza. Went there for a late lunch and it was surprisingly packed. They said a 45 minute wait, but it was more like 20 minutes. Great service and pizza.
Chronnnniiiiicc. Go get you some, this is where it's at. Awesome pizza, awesome salad, delicious cheesy bread. Killin the game, just killin it.
this was the best pizza I have ever had! this is my first time in Chicago & Lou's was my first meal here and it will be so hard to beat because that was the best pizza of my life.
My favorite pizza in Chicago, we have to stop here every trip. This place made us stop going to Giordano's and Uno.

It's all about the first today, first visit to Chicago, first day here, so first things first, we hit Lou's for their deep dish pizza!  Did not disappoint!  First, we enjoyed a couple of drinks at the bar, strong drinks and friendly bartender. Moved on to a table for 2.  First things first, ordered a bottle of Pinot Grigio from Italy to enjoy while we wait for our food order.   Fried calamari came out hot and crunchy served with a side of marinara sauce.  We ordered the Lou's special, 3 kinds of cheese, Roma tomatoes and mushrooms (all the basics we love) and added anchovies.  It comes with a butter crust and boy was it yummilicious!!!!  I loved it!  Pizza had the right amount of sauce (I like my pizza saucy) and loaded with cheese and tomatoes.  LOVED the butter crust, so light and crispy!   Our waitress was very attentive and friendly!  Great service and great food, would definitely come back!
Best Deep Dish pizza in Chicago & I like the new system they use where if there is a long wait you can order and your food is ready right when your table opens up :)
Been to New York and liked their pizza but now I've been to Chicago and absolutely love their pizza pie thanks to Lou Malnati's. Our dinner was fantastic and the service was phenomenal.
First time trying deep dish - coming from nyc pizza, I didn't find it impressive. Pricey too.

The BEST deep dish pizza I've ever had! The secret is in the sauce and the vine ripened tomato sauce is A+! The cheese was melts, tasty and plentiful. Great setting and waitstaff but the pizza sells itself! Highly recommend!

Came for an early dinner with my family on a Monday. We were seated right away but had to wait about ten minutes before seeing our server. She was very apologetic and gave great service the rest of the time.  The food was absolutely delicious. I am not a huge fan of deep dish pizza but this one is fantastic. It isn't as heavy as other deep dish places so you can eat more than one piece without feeling engorged. We got the "Lou's" pizza and my daughter could not get enough of the sausage. It was fresh, tasty and unlike anything I had ever had on pizza before. Definitely skip the other pizza joints and come straight here. You won't be disappointed.

Came here for dinner last night and left very disappointed. Our waitress was super slow with everything. Waited over 15 minutes before she even came by our table say hi and take our drink order. Good was mediocre at best. I've had better Chicago style pizza in SF! Very bland, and Luke warm. We were seated directly underneath an AC vent that was, for some strange reason, blasting cold air while it was barely 40 degrees outside. I asked 4 times to 4 people if they could lower it or turn it off, each one nodded and walked away, never handling the situation.

Visiting Chicago for a quick weekend break. Haven't had deep dish before so was excited to experience the real deal. We went on Friday night quite late. About 8pm. But the place was buzzing. Had to wait about 30 minutes which was OK, we got some beers and waited patiently to be seated. I ordered a small pepperoni deep dish. Ion being seated we had to wait about another 20 mins or so but finally it arrived. And it was definitely worth the wait. Beautiful. I didn't finish the crust but devoured the pie. The service was just OK . The waitress said she would close out our tab down at the bar for us but she didn't. So we went home forgetting out card. No big deal all in all.

I'm an East Coast guy so not really a deep dish pizza fan but I went here with a coworker one night and will admit I left happily satisfied.  My first was deep dish from one of the famous Chicago deep dish places was way too greasy and just had too much of everything leaving me with that i just swallowed a brick feeling.  I was hesitant to go here but my coworker wanted deep dish. This was a completely different experience, it wasn't greasy...yes the crust was buttery but tasty.  Cheese and tomato sauce were just enough.  They had a good selection of beers so I left very satisfied and view deep dish in a different light now.
Ugh, this place will kill me one day but it will be a happy death. Love them, love their pizza. True Chicago classic.
can't make up mind which was better - the staff or the food?! equally fantastic!

The first time I had Lou's sausage pizza I was impressed about each bite of my slice. The slab of sausage all over the pizza was amazing. Each bite was just an experience that honestly I would say hands down best Chicago pizza experience. Every time i had Lou's pizza I always discover something different about that pizza flavor and yes I love Lou's Pizza!!!
always solid pizza but since we knew the pizza was going to take awhile to arrive - we ordered an app.  It took forever too and then got delivered 3 minute before the pizza - FAIL.

The crust, oh the crust. I have been a Giordanos regular on my sporadic visits to the Chicago area. But upon recommendations from locals decided to give it a try. It was amazing. I loved "The Lou"! The only negative is my 18 year old niece prefers ham and bacon and Lou's offers neither. So check the topping choices if that is a concern for anyone in your party. Our server was fantastic too, and she was busy with a large party along side us.

LOVED this place, great vibes and great hospitality. The food takes quite a while to prepare so definitely make a reservation if you can, to avoid waiting for a table. I got a personal deep dish pizza which may look small, but it is actually SO filling and even hard to finish! Will definitely want to come back here one day - it's a true Chicago treat!
If you're not a fan of their crust (like me), order the crustless pizza - the "crust" is a layer of sausage piled with tomatoes, sauce, mushrooms, and loads of cheese - yum!!

Went on a Wednesday afternoon.  Ordered soup di giorno and the Chicago classic personal pizza. Man the crust was crispy yet not dry and the mozzarella was perfect. The Italian sausage, tomato sauce and mozzarella all came together nicely. I really like how the mozzarella was stuck to the crust.

This is by far the best pizza joint in Chicago. Yes it takes some time to make a deep dish style pizza so make sure to order as quick as you can. I also want to point out that the chicken wings are amazing, so you may want to try if you're diggin in this direction.  The Malnati Chicago Classic was by far the best decision, this pizza was delicious. My friend and I could not stop talking about this pizza the entire trip. We wanted to go back for seconds but didn't have time. That cheese and crust!!! To die for! I highly recommend this, it's called the Malnati Chicago Classic for a reason! Also, there most likely will be a wait so plan accordingly. I ended up eating here later on a Thursday evening and avoided most of the crowd.

Second best only to Due's! Always a perfect crust and perfectly cooked toppings. Loaded with cheese and hearty tomatoes. Spinach pizza is outstanding, as is pepperoni. I've been to numerous locations and the food and service has been absolutely consistently excellent.

Lou Malnati's is amazing. We were in Chicago for a few days last week and we had the deep dish pizza. It's amazing! Plus, the place was very crowded at first which is a good sign to me as a visitor to the city. I'll definitely come back!

This review is strictly on the quality of the food that we had delivered to us (it's about half a mile away). Originally we planned to dine-in but when we got there, the place was crowded and they said the wait time would be nearly an hour (and this was on a Monday night). We opted instead to have the pizza delivered to our hotel and relax with a movie since we weren't up to deal with the noise and figured the pizza would get cold on the walk back if we got it to go. We ordered "The Lou" and the combination platter and it took about 45min which was fine. I was excited to try the butter crust that everyone has been raving about but I found the crust plain and doughy rather than flavorful and flaky like people had described. The cheese was not gooey and stretchy; instead it felt like I was gnawing through a block of cheese. I'm not a fan of marina so that's why we got the Lou but were disappointed with the lack of flavor - we might as well have gotten the original just for the flavor aspect. The combination platter was alright - you can't really go wrong with breaded and deep-fried foods dipped in ranch - but nothing spectacular. For all the hype, we were not impressed especially for the price (come to around $40 with tax and tip). My sister had just had Giordano's the night before and she said she preferred that to this place. It may be a different experience if we had dined in and got to enjoy the food fresh out of the oven/fryer but in the case of delivery, just.... don't.
My first and amazing deep dish pizza in Chicago and it was perfect. Try the spinach bread for appetizer it is delicious  Very nice staff also  Thank you guys
It takes an hour to get a pizza in their restaurant. It is to go or no go. The food is fine,  the service is non existent. I know they are aware of the issue,  but haven't fixed it for years.
Like all their places they have a standard that would make their dad proud. Great for lunch or before the show. Quaint place a little out of the way from south loop I like the nice walk.

THE BEST PIZZA EVER!!!  We had an awesome deep dish one night, and went back the next night for an equally awesome thin crust.  The deep dish pizzas take nearly an hour to make, so they have you order your as you check in.  Smart!! We didn't have their dessert pizza, which I understand is some sort of chocolate chip cookie and I'm told not to be missed. Oh well, next time! We took a city tour where our guide dissed Lou's and said this other place by the Willis tower was the best in town (don't remember the name now, sorry).  After we visited the tower (tip: go there early to avoid huge lines!), we stopped by for a drink, and the place was not that busy, and the deep dish looked so so.  I suspect that our tour guide was getting a kickback to plug the place to visitors. Lou's is ALWAYS packed!  What does that tell you?  I've also heard locals say that it's the best. This review was written based on the Gold Coast location, it's much larger and more modern than the original location, but either way, deep dish or thin crust, their pies ARE NOT TO BE MISSED!!

I had the Malnati's Chicago Pizza and it was good. I'm giving it 3 stars because the taste of the pizza was alright. Butter crust is bland and sausage lack seasoning. It is loaded with cheese and sauce was delicious. I've had other Chicago deep dish pizza much better than this for around the same price.
One of the best pizza I ever have. The quality totally justified the $25/ea price. I just wish they had more meat choices.

I'm a New Yorker so I was a little skeptical to start trying the Chicago pizza but I had to! I love pizza and wanted to see what all the fuss was about. I've got to admit, it was so freakin' delicious! We got a deep dish sausage pizza which was so good. Thick but not too thick and just so full of flavor. We had a huge table of 15 people but they were able to accommodate us pretty nicely. Our friend called ahead since they're obviously busy but we also went later around 9PM so maybe a bit easier.Overall, if you have time, I recommend going here!

The wait is ridiculous! They need to find a better way for seating people...like using an online reservation system like most restaurants do. It is so unproductive to have to put your name on the list in person, to have to wait in the small cramped area in the front with 50 other people waiting for that magic text that says "You are up". They recommend that you give your order to the cashier as you wait so that when you are seated your food would be ready. After sitting down we still had to wait an extra  30 minutes for our food to be ready. The pizza tasted rushed and the waitress was clearly overwhelmed. Sighh...

I don't get what all the fuss is about with this place. I am not a native Chicago resident so when we first moved here this place was talked about all the time. I was so excited to try this place after a few others were great (giordanos and Genos east) but left feeling ripped off as the pizza really wasn't very good especially for the price. It was beat they had little samples to snack on as you wait but the pizza really wasn't anything to rave about-what am I missing? Is there a specific pizza that is better than the others? I'm not seeing it, sorry :/

This is the only location I've been to.  We've been here to eat in and buy frozen pizzas to take home many times.  Lou Malnati's is my FAVORITE deep dish in the world.  There are other good deep dish places, but this is my favorite.  I love their thin crust but there's a couple others I like a little more.  My only complaint is that their frozen pizzas are too small.  It would be nice if they sold a large size like Gino's East does.  Their crust is excellent, cheese is of great quality as are the meats.  Sauce is tangy and chunky, just overall really good.  If you have just one chance to eat Chicago pizza give them a try.
Sososososossosososo long to wait for a 6-inch pizza. Almost 1 hour. I have drunk out of 5 cups of water when waiting for my pizza. Very disappointed.

Firstly, the pizza here must be made by Jesus himself. THAT is why this review is 4 stars.   My main issue (and reason for not awarding 5 stars) is that they prefer for you to place your order while your waiting.  In theory, I think this is a great concept.  Where it goes wrong is that you can only order pizza ahead.  A member of my party was planning on ordering pasta, and we had planned on an appetizer of the cheddar cubes (so good, btw) and were assured that this would come out at the same time as the pizza (even though we couldn't place this order til we got to the table).  WELL, not only did we wait 30 minutes for our table we also waited 35 minutes AT our table for the pizza.  When it came out it was DEFINITELY worth the wait but the pasta and appetizer STILL hadn't come out.  We waited an additional 20 minutes for it(while everyone else anxiously/nervously tried to eat as slow as possible so that we would still have food when the pasta came).  (And the pasta was watery and virtually tasteless when it did come. My sister waited forever for something she couldn't even eat.) The waiter did compensate us for this, so the situation was rectified, but this process of advance ordering may need to be thought through a little bit more or done away with altogether.  When back in town we will definitely have to get some more Lou Malnati's pizza and cheddar cubes!
My absolute favorite Chicago style deep dish pizza in the city.  I love the buttery flaked crust and the robust crushed tomato sauce.

When I booked my trip to Chicago I knew I had to try some deep dish pizza. After reading up on different locations of establishments claiming to have Chicago's Best Deep Dish Pizza I settled on choosing Lou Malnati's and I am so happy I did.  We were greeted by our waitress Laura from the minute we walked in and asked us if we were first timers. I assume being such a popular establishment that is usually the first question to ask. Laura explained the menu to us and even added on an informative tip of it taking 30 minutes for the pizza to be made. With that in mind we started off with ordering the garlic bread for an app. Garlic bread was delicious. It was perfectly drizzled with just the right amount of garlic and olive oil. Good choice.  Now the deep dish pizza. I must say I am bias towards my NY style pizza and still prefer getting a slice versus a personal pie. However this deep dish pizza did not disappoint. The crust was extremely fluffy and soft and included the right amount of sauce and cheese. The pizza came straight out of the oven so it was nice and hot. After the second slice I was completely stuffed and satisfied.  If you're looking to try a Chicago style pizza I would go to Lou Malnati's!

There's always an intense disagreement about the best Chicago pizza in town. The place isn't by favorite, but it was solid and good. It's super busy on the weekend but worth the wait. Take a walk around the neighborhood while you're waiting for your table. You'll want to burn some calories before you partake.

Second time in Chicago, second time at Lou Malnati's. Prepare to wait if you get gere at peak lunch and dinner hours!  Ordered minestrone soup to start (as wait for deep dish pizza is 40 mins! So had to kill time somehow!) and Buffalou's Wings to hold me over. The wings were fried, breaded, and smothered in Buffalo sauce--satisfying and solid.  My wife had the house salad w italian vinaigrette--classic iceberg lettuce, red onion, tomato and cucumber--all very fresh and crispy.  As for the deep dish pizza--definitley worth the wait!  A steaming heap of cheese piled upon veggies nestled on a buttercrust dough.  And the crust--"how dare you not eat it goodness"!  The beer and wine selection leave much to be desired.  Basically, a littany of your classic brews (Miller, Corona, Blue Moon) and generic California wines. We showed up at 11:45 am on a Thursday and luckily found seating. But, it does get very packed and very loud.  The TVs are tuned to ESPN and a standard mix of modem and contemporary pop is blaring from the speakers.  As for ambience--very casual w framed sports jerseys decorating the walls.
Exceptional deep dish pizza. Love the tomatoes on the top rather than bottom. Crust is great and never soggy. Flavorful sausage and lots of cheese. Truly a masterpiece for pizza lovers.

Overtime I have a out of town guest and they ask for pizza I have a great excuse to introduce them to wonderful pizza :) This place is always the best... Anything you order is good and the service is great. Sometime it;s a little busy but the food is why it's crowded,
Look, there is simply no better Pizza in the entire world! Deep Dish w/ Butter Crust, OMG...it is why we do not move to a warmer climate, enough said!

BEST PIZZA EVERRRRRR I came to Chicago for a concert on St. Patrick's Day, and you know how when you're traveling people suggest places for you to go? Well I'm fucking glad I listened to my friend and actually went here.  Now let me just start by saying, I'm from Ohio. We don't have shit. If you want decent pizza you have to order from Papa John's or some other low key shit chain. I also hate pizza crust.  This place has the best pizza crust I've ever eaten. I don't even know how to explain it, but it's fucking phenomenal. My group ordered the Malnati pizza, and I'm so glad we did. Best shit I've ever eaten. So good. 10/10

When we arrived on a Tuesday night around 8, the wait was 30-35 minutes. The good news is that they input your cell number into this pad and  text you when your table is ready plus it also tells you what position you are in line. We're from Miami and we wish the restaurants there were as organized. You also preorder the pizza you want when you walk in so that when you finally sit down the pizza is almost ready for you to enjoy. We ordered a medium sized pepperoni, sausage, mushroom, with extra cheese deep dish. The pizza was delicious. What I remember most is the plum tomatoes on the pizza and how juicy they were. My husband and I were only able to eat 3 1/2 of the 6 slices. That's how filling this pizza is. Our table was not 100% cleaned properly but I guess with all the business they do in a day the table will have a few extra crumbs on the side and the floors will be a bit sticky. I give 3 stars for cleanliness.
I like it better than Gino's cause it doesn't have corn meal all over it, but personally I'd go with Giordano's when possible.

Very small place, so expect a wait. The pizza was good - but since it was pre-ordered (while we were waiting), I felt it wasn't as hot as I'd like (it had definitely been sitting out for a bit). The N. State St. location is much bigger, and nicer.

Me and wife came to spend the weekend in the city and a friend recommended this place and we had to try it and I'm thankful we did. Oh boy oh boy was it great we had the Malnatis clasic and it was really good and the prep time was not that bad but the wait time to get seated can take a while so plan ahead.

Decent for a first deep dish experience but tastes very franchised and chain-like. The cheese is very stretchy and does not taste fresh. The sauce is warm and delish but tastes a bit canned. The crust is dense and oily - sinfully delicious but on the heavier side. Try to not cut the pizza until right before eating because the bottom of the crust will get soggy from the tomato sauce else wise...

Disappointing. Server or kitchen forgot to make my order and I had to ask them to check on it while all my neighbors dined on their hot pies. My pie came out 45 minutes after I ordered it and was only somewhat warm. The cheese tasted plastic-y and the crust was not crispy. Note: ordered poultry sausage- do not recommend

Always a good choice for Chicago style pizza! I love the sausage pizza because it is a solid layer of sausage. It is definitely way way way better than Giordano's or even Gino's East, which is sad to say because I once loved those restaurants. Lou Malnati's has it in the bag though, so definitely go here when you're craving that Chicago Style deep dish!

I've been meaning to write this review.  I did it. I FINALLY had authentic Chicago deep dish pizza. Only took me all of my life. And let me just say, I am a fan. Order an appetizer, as the wait for the pizza is a little long, but so worth it. Loved the sausage deep dish here. It's a lot of food, so maybe go with a big group and order a few different ones so there can be more of a sampler.

My favorite deep dish.  This place is the standard, and the best part about Lou's is that their various locations are highly consistent.  One tends to be as quality as the other.  My favorite is The Lou, add sausage.  The Lou's salad is great too, not so much healthy, with all the blue cheese and bacon bits, but very tasty.  Loves me my Lou's.

You Only Live Once- That's the Motto. I like to consider myself a pizza queen. So being in Chicago, I had to try the Lou Malnati's. I've been dreaming of this day ever since I was a young child, have pizza so cheesy i could pull it for miles, and sauce so drippy it's like im eating soup. Chitown, you're a beauty, but my NYC side is kicking in. The cheese is much saltier compared to NYC cheese, I'm thinking they probably soak they're cheese in salt water? Cheese was pully, but where's my deep dish sauce at? With inches of cheese, the sauce is ignored. One slice is good enough to keep me full for the whole day. Came to Lou with Zhenni L. and Winnie L., as they mentioned below, a piece of hair was found in our pizza. Spoke to the manager about this incident and he gave us a thin pizza on the house. I prefer deep dish over the thin pizza. The thin pizza was more of flatbread just loaded on top of cheese.  Glad I got to check off deep dish in my pizza bucket list. Though we had a small incident in the beginning, Lou Malnati handled the situation in a professional manner!
Lunch special was delicious and the  perfect size. Pizza special at $8.95 includes side salad & drink. Check it out for a taste of Chicago pizza.
It's good for what it is... deep dish. I'm a NYer so I'm biased and extremely picky when it comes to pizza

Was looking for a really good Pizza Pie and I found one! I ordered 4 from Taste of Chicago Lou Malnati's Pizzeria. They prepared the food the same way they make it in the restaurant and ship it directly to your house anywhere in the U.S. This pizza was the best that I have ever had! Arrived at my place in Jacksonville Florida in 2 days!

I want to preface this review by saying that I am totally a NY/New Haven pizza girl. Deep dish is not really my thing but I thought I needed to try it while in Chicago and I had heard that Lou Malnatis was one of the best. When we arrived, we had to wait about 20 min for a table which was not bad and they actually have you order while you're waiting so your pizza is ready faster when you are seated- this is a good system. We grabbed a drink at the bar and were seated shortly thereafter. We ordered the Lou Malnatis original and one other pizza. We though the personal pizzas would be too small so we got 2 small pizzas. It was way too much food for us! Since the pizzas are so thick, you would probably be good with a personal pizza for each person. We also made the mistake of ordering an appetizer which filled us up a little too much.  The pizza was good. The crust was delicious and I loved the sausage in the original pie. If you haven't had deep dish and want to try it, then I would give this place a chance.
The best pizza in my experience.  Crust is amazing. Staff was friendly. I stuffed myself, then walked down to Blue Chicago.  Perfect night.

Foodie bucket list - check. Awesome deep dish pizza fulfilling the dream. Stayed with the primary proposition...Classic (with sausage), a house salad and  a beer (ok two). Very similar to Uno but like their garlicy  butter crust. Must have been destiny for seating under Larry Bird's jersey.

While in Chicago on business, my coworkers and I decided to stop by this place to try some of Chi town's famous deep dish pizza.  I think I ordered some garlic bread as an appetizer. The garlic bread was incredible and left me almost. I room for my pizza. I ordered a plain cheese personal deep dish. I was able to take it back to my hotel and finish it there. It was definitely very rich and well made. It had a lot of cheese so I don't think that there is a need to order extra cheese.  We sat at the bar and the bartenders were really helpful and attentive. They gave us options and explained some of the menu to us. They even gave us suggestions on a few places to visit while in chicago.
AMAZING! Lived in Chicago four years - Best pizza in the city. Always good.

I'm not a huge pizza person (don't eviscerate me), but I'm already yearning my return to Lou Malnati's. This place gets packed, so get there early. There's a line to put down your name, and another to preorder your pizza (nothing else, the rest you order at your table). It's quite an efficient system, and they text you a link that updates what position you are in line.  We ordered the 'Malnati Chicago Classic' in small and it fed two people comfortably. Never had deep dish pizza before so this was a nice change. There's a layer of sausage hidden beneath the flavorful tomato sauce that satisfies a carnivore's palate like mine with each meaty bite. The presentation itself was not as 'deep' as I had imagined, but I don't care about the aesthetics of food. Overall, easily the best pizza I've ever had and wish they'd expand to Philly.  Oh.. we also ordered wings, but they were whatever.

Any version of the pizza is delicious.  And at all the locations.  If been to the one downtown, Gurnee, Wilmette, Buffalo Grove, Libertyville.  Never a disappointment.  I've even had them sent to Washington  to have 2 pizzas meet me there when I flew in.  And Those were mouth watering.  A little pricey 60.00 for 2 9" pizzas.  But I ate very last crumb.

I'm just going to summarize it all down.  Pizza was amazing!  Waitress was polite Service was slow Host was a totally rude person that had an extremely bad attitude and cursed out customers while walking away from their table. This and the fact that it took FOREVER to get your pizza even after you pre order was the reason why I gave it 4 stars. It would had been 3 stars but honestly, the food is pretty freakin amazing.
The 45 minute wait for the pizza is well worth it! A nice touch of wine in the sauce too was delicious.

Minus half a star.  Two reasons for a half a star  One: is the host/hostess will give astronomical times for a wait.  Two: there are sections where the a/c vent blows on you constantly.  The pizza however is amazing.  Now I'm from the east coast and I'm well aware of what NYC style pizza is. I mean I have been to Lombardi's on several occasions.  Deep dish like this is a totally different monster.  The pizza is excellent.  I was expecting some kind of greasy oily after taste and there was nothing but exceptional flavor of sauce cheese and pepperoni with the slightest hint of the buttery crust.  I have new had deep dish like this and feel lucky to live 2.5 hrs away where I can take the trip and get a pizza like this  I lived in Texas for nearly 3 years and their idea of pizza is comical at best.  I will be attending this establishment again in the near future. Amazing.

First time trying deep dish pizza!  Everyone says it's a must try whenever you go to Chicago cause we all know Chicago is known for this. Few of my friends told me it's nothing special so I went in without high hopes. Also because I'm not a big pizza fan :x  The waiter cut the pieces for us the second he brought it over and put it on our plates. Before I even get to take a bite of my own piece, my friends and I found a hair that we pulled out from the cheese from the remaining pizza slices on the pan lol I think it's kinda funny because so far our eating out experiences in Chicago have been terrible.  My friends and I told the waitress. She acknowledged what happened and told the manager. He came to us and apologized - super friendly and understanding. Not once did he blame it on the workers or question if it was ours. He said "No one knows how it got there and things happen unfortunately so I apologize for that." This is the kind of manager we all love working with.  He offered us a thin crust pizza pie to try since we already have the deep dish pizza slices on our plate. We were really full by the time he brought that over. Then he kindly told us that the pizza will be on the house and apologized again. He definitely knows how to make a bad situation better.  Our bill came and we only got charged for the appetizers - calamari and spinach stuffed bread. It came out to be $5 per person only so we decided to tip extra. Gave about 22% tip because of the great service. My friends weren't too crazy about the pizza though. I thought they were okay but we came to the conclusion that Chicagoans haven't tried pizza until they try NYC pizza.

I expected more. We ordered their pepperoni pizza and it was just ok. The service was nice. The order was timely. The restaurant is clean but the pizza just felt like it was a little mass produced. There are better options.

I was on a mission to try the best pizza joints in Chicago. I was only going to be there for three days so I had to be meticulous with my selections and...Lou Malnati's was the winner! (Pequod's and Gino's were the other two I tried) The buttery crust was outstanding especially because it was crispy on the edges. The tomato sauce was exquisite, every element of this pizza blew me away. This was exactly the experience I wanted before I left Chicago. Sure, it might be touristy but its family owned and the service was wonderful. It's so good, don't miss out on giving it a try. FYI I cry sometimes because Lou Malnati's isn't in LA

Great deep dish pizza. The butter crust adds such great flavor you might consider starting with the crust.  On draw back...  If seated in the back room, the noise levels are off the charts. Very difficult to hear yourself let alone have a conversation with someone.  Regardless the food is fantastic...

Well I finally tried the famous deep dish pizza of Chicago!!! I loved every layer of it; sauce, toppings inside the pizza, cheese, and crust blended perfectly together every time I took a bite. I ordered a medium sized pan but was full after eating two slices.  Another dish that people should order are their barbelou wings!!! One of the best wings I've ever had. It was cooked with just the right amount of tenderness, crunchiness, and sauce.  I came here during lunch on a weekday but didn't have an issue getting seated or difficulty with service. My waitress/server was very helpful in giving us suggestions and was willing to have a conversation with us despite it being a little busy. Lou Manalti's you guys are awesome.

This is the best deep dish in Chicago. I have eaten at multiple other Pizzerias, and in my semi-professional opinion, this one takes the metaphorical "pie". I have never had a more spiritual experience, not even in church. Seriously, eat this pizza. It's amazing.

Lost my deep dish - ginity to Lou. Literally. The Lou came LOADED with spinach, mushrooms, sliced roma tomatoes, and three types of cheese. Would I ever do it again? Probably not. But it was a great one time thing.  My friend described this pizza as a casserole. It's extremely thick with too much "stuffing", which in my opinion ruins the point of a pizza. It was a heavy dish in every way. The bottom became too soggy and droopy to be eaten without a fork and knife. I'm all for folding my pizza in half and eating it by hand, so this was a no no for me. But again, if it did and had all the things I liked then it wouldn't be a deep dish. For what it is, I think Lou Malnati's did it justice.  Also ordered the same pizza but with a thin crust. Basically, a NYC pie. Crust was thin and crispy. Toppings weren't as overwhelming. It was good, but I wasn't able to take more than two bites because I was already stuffed from a slice of deep dish.  For appetizers, I had the calamari and spinach stuffed bread. Calamari was soggy and the breading was coming off. The bread was delicious and you should definitely order it!  Apart from the food, the service was stellar. One of the nicest bunch of staff I've ever come across. Had an incident with the food but the waitress and manager were so cooperative about it. Ended up covering the pizza bill. That itself deserved the 4 star!  Great experience overall. Would recommend people coming here if they never had deep dish before and wanted to give it a shot.
Was visiting my sister and had lunch at Lou Malnati's. This was my first time there and my first time to have a Chicago deep dish pizza. The staff was friendly and the food was delicious.

We were visiting from out of state, and wanted a true chicago deep dish pizza experience.  Our friends suggested we come here, as it's their flagship store, and as well as Ginos, and Giordanos, supposed to be one of the most authentic tastes.  It was tasty, it was $40 for a medium pizza (6 slices) which I felt was steep, and as tasty as it was, i felt like it was overpriced.  The crust was really tasty, we ordered it crispy, and buttered - which was suggested to us.  So it wasn't bad at all, the service was good, just overpriced. We didn't try the other two places for comparison, but we wish we had in hindsight.  So we left Chicago somewhat underwhelmed by the deep dish pizza experience we have heard hyped so much.
that butter crust pizza!!!

I love there pizza so much,The crust is thick and the toppings is very full of spices. They have so many flavors to choose from. What a great combination of flavors, so great. It makes your stomach full :D. It was so delicious. And the taste is irresistible.

Lou Malnatis was our first stop on our weekend trip to Chicago. Coming from Los Angeles, my girlfriend and I were very eager to sink our teeth into some deep dish! Initially, I was not very impressed. It was a bit thin, and lacking sauce. The cheese however, was fantastic. What really saved this slice was the butter crust, good lord those bites where the crust met the cheese and sauce were just magic! We were stuffed with two slices each. While I can't say it was the best I had that weekend, it was definitely special.
Greatest deep dish pizza in the world, nuff said!

The best deep dish pizza in America.Not even a close 2nd. If you're in Chicago, they have 44 locations or so, and need to expand to other states (like California/NYC). This is the main tourist (Miracle Mile location), so wait will be an hour plus during peak times (expected), but it's prob best to go to another location which is basically the same dining option. This location has the original memorabilia, plus you can write all over the walls, the tables, etc in crayon and marker. Pretty fun and takes you back to um, 1st grade, yeah 1st grade. Definitely not last week on park bench. Definitely not. The deep dish is ridiculously filling so get 1 or 2 slices max. It's huge and like an entire pie. It's not a regular pizza slice. Be warned. Get it to go as well if you get extra. It's delish heated up the next morning. Service is excellent. Be prepared for food coma.

My go to pizza place in Chicago.  I ship it out to my kids in California and they are always thrilled to get some Lou Malnati's!  My favorite is "The Lou" with spinach, mushrooms, 4 cheeses and roma tomatoes on top.  I also love the Malnati's salad. Service isn't the best but the pizza is superb.

I don't like pizza, but you can't go to Chicago without trying deep dish pizza, right? I'm glad I chose Lou Malnati's. I called to place an order in case there was a wait. The order was ready in 30 minutes and we took the pizzas to Millenium Park to eat. I got a personal Lou pizza and my friend got a personal classic. She loves pizza and she loves Lou Malnati's. Even though mine, the Lou pizza, only has veggies and cheese (no meat), I thoroughly enjoyed it. For deep dish pizza with butter crust, come here! Keep in mind, it usually takes at least 30 minutes for pizzas to be made.
What a great pie. Coming from Canada we don't have a pizza place like Lou so this was a experience I will never forget. The pizza is amazing. The staff were phenomenal.  I'll be back again.
First time trying real Chicago pizza pie. It is really good! Personally, I thought that the butter crust is a bit too crunchy, but other than that the pizza was really flavorful.

45 min wait for pizza. Wrong Pizza comes not cold but not too far from it, with an explanation that waitress didn't hear us well,  we had to take it due to wait time or wait another 45 min for a different pizza. Asked for forks for a different dish I ordered since pizza came with things I don't eat and waitress forgot about it so we shared forks.  Not a good experience at all.
Love their gluten-free pizza! A refreshing change from the flat and bland crust offered at Giordano's.

If you're looking for traditional Chicago deep dish pizza, this is the place! Not only is their pizza good, but they have a beer called the 312. Being a Californian, we enjoy the 805 beer. The 312 holds it's own. It's a wheat beer that's easy drinking. The place filled up quickly, service was great, and atmosphere is loud and family style. Perfect Chicago evening spent here!
I've been coming in for years and really enjoy the carry out. Still can't get used to thick frisbee-like covering of tasteless sausage. Not my cuppa tea.

The crust on this pizza is so good, the sauce was great, I would have given it another star but this time when our pizza arrived the center was luke warm.  When you have a deep dish pizza it has to be nice and hot and gooey other wise you are chewing in to a block of cheese.  I've never had this problem so I will definitely be back, my other visits have been fine and I feel that anyone can have an off day. The waitress wasn't too happy when we asked her to pop it back in the oven but she did and it came back to the table perfect.
was really sad that we experienced such awful rude, combative, and condescending service from Mr. David. **insert sad face emoji** Pizza and caesar salad were both wonderful.
Eh... I prefer Giordano's. I felt it lacked taste but overall was an ok pie. The sampler platter we had was great though. I could eat those cheese cubes all day.
My favorite deep dish.  For me its Lou's or Gino's and never Giordanos

Believe me. I'm a tourist and I went to giordanos first. Big mistake. I came here a day after and wow. What a difference. Delicious pizza where you can actually taste the ingredients. Highly recommend. I will be back one day. Oh and try the bruschetta ! Mmmm

The wife and I ate here two days in a row during our first time in Chicago early February. We've been in Houston our entire lives and never had a Chicago deep dish. Lou Malnatis was excellent. The buffalo wings were a hit. We will definitely make this a regular visit whenever we travel to Chi-town.
Best pizza ever, thin ,deep dish this is THE PLACE to go! Everything is great salads, appetizers and service! They treat the customers great. Never a bad experience!

It was good but it wasn't distinct from any other deep dish pizza joint in Chicago. The special crust? It's just butter brushed on the crust. Whatever. I had a personal size classic pizza and a beer. The bartender/server was friendly and efficient. There was nothing here that would motivate me to visit again.

Best gluten free pizza I have had and I have tried a lot.  Crust is nice and buttery and flaky.  Only wish they offered bigger size for gluten free as very small sized pizza for the price, so I just treat myself every once in awhile versus making it a staple weekend order.  A friend told me a local bakery supplies the crusts, so please owners, have them make you all a bigger version.
I've only ordered out but Lou's sausage and pepperoni pizza is probably my all time favorite, although Milano's in Beverly is hard to beat...
Of course, the only pizza that matters! mmmmm, delish. Lorelei's earlier review describes the sauce and crust perfectly. I disagree with her Giordano's assesment though. Gotta Go To Lou's
Malnati Chicago Classic pizza is THE BEST!!! I love this pizza so much.
I just don't like Lou Malnati's deep dish. The crust is rock hard, and the sauce is too acidic. I really wanted to like it, but I just did not enjoy it at all.

Love MALNATI'S deep dish. All locations I have been to seem very consistent. It all started with UNO'S on Rush street. MALNATI has carried on the tradition with only very slight differences. I sincerely hope they never change or cheapen anything.
My favorite pizza place in Chicago!

Lou's, I have a love hate relationship with you.... You're butter crust keeps bringing me back, but your minimal amount of sauce and ridiculously expensive prices are not cool. Ordered a medium deep dish (serves about 2-4 peeps) with half cheese half peppers/onions. Barely any sauce- mostly cheese and the veggies. Paid almost $30,  plus tip (delivered). Not cool Lou, not cool...
Ok so this is my favorite deep dish pizza. I have tried them all but this takes the cake! Buttery crazy and tons of cheese! Yes please!

Oh my goodness!  You will never have a better pizza crust.  Their butter crust pizza is amazing.  I am not a fan of deep dish, and always get thin crust, but for Lou Malnati's, I will make the exception!
Chicago is known for deep dish pizza, and It's hard to trey them all, but I gotta believe a contennder for the crown is Lou Malnati's.  Get the "butter crust" as it is extra-crispy.

Everything I hoped and dreamed a real Chicago style pizza should be, I've eating at the other hot spot pizza I forgot the name but the crust is chewy and had a cracker like crust, I've eaten here several times when I'm in Chicago for work and it never disappoints! Just make sure you're near a bed to crash out after!

My Husband orders some pizzas from here and had them delivered to us in Virginia. It was worth the wait. You've  never lived until you had their deep dish pizzas. I'm not a fan of sausage pizza, but they seriously changed my mind. I would order again, no questions asked!

Visiting from out of town and I got what I was I looking for! Ordered the Small Malnati Chicago Classic with spinach mix. The wait time was about 35 minutes for 2. It was great that you had the option to preorder since this place was so busy, but by the time we sat down and and waited for awhile until actually got our food, it would have taken about the same time to order once seated and receive our food at a different place. Our waitress was friendly and the meal met my expectations for a classic deep dish! Overly buttered on some parts of the crust to where I felt like I was eating straight butter, but that's a minor detail. I wasn't sure that a small would fill hungry ol' me and my large 6'2 friend, but our eyes were a lot hungrier than our stomachs- we struggled to finish it all. Great overall experience and I would recommend this to anyone visiting!

Had my birthday lunch here, the service was lovely! The staff brought me a birthday dessert with a candle. I am not a dessert person but this tasted amazing! We had the LOU pizza and the crust is the best I have had. Though I must admit I have only had a Chicago deep dish pizza a few times and only at 2 other restaurants. I would definitely go back
Man this place rocks. I don't think better pizza exists anywhere else in the world.

Best pizza in Chicago, hands down! It's one of my favorite things about living here. My favorite pizza by far is The Malnati Chicago Classic: Made with Lou's lean sausage, some extra cheese and vine-ripened tomato sauce on Buttercrust. Good salads too! Can't be beat. Worth the wait!

Giordano's has the overall better pizza, but there were a couple elements to Malnati's that I really enjoyed. 1. The sauce - VERY acidic (which I love). I wish it was more of a sauce than a collection of tomatoes, but it was very tasty. I love acid. 2. The butter crust - Beautiful, just beautiful. I'm not a crust person and I didn't eat the crust on Giordano's pizza, but you best believe I ate the crust here. I love this crust. The things lacking in comparison to Giordano's: 1. The cheese. There's simply not enough cheese on the pizza to make for that stringy, I'm-going-to-drown-in-cheese experience. 2. Giordano's flavor combinations blend together in an irresistible way. You taste individual components on the Malnati's pizza, but they don't come together. If only someone could combine the two, you'd probably have the most amazing pizza ever... PS - After we got off the plane, a lady told us that Malnati's has the best caesar salad in the city. So we ordered one. I think she meant that they have the best caesar dressing, because that was effing delicious and clearly made in house. The lettuce, however, was sad and limp. Too bad...
I dont know what all this hype is about but i really don't like their pizza and don't like their dough period
The pizza took about 45 minutes, which was expected. It was alright, but I rather have thin crust. We also got their spinach bread, which was good. I've tried better pizza places!
really loved their spinach bread! thought the chicago classic (?) pizza was just okay. water had a weird taste, prob would stick to sodas or something else if i go again.

Expect a wait!!! Don't come here when you're really hungry because that hunger will turn into hangriness.  It's deep dish pizza so it'll be about 30 minutes before your meal arrives.  When you arrive it's suggested you order before being seated so that your wait time diminishes a bit.  If you arrive before 6:30 the wait won't be terribly bad.   When I touched foot in Chicago this was the first deep dish pizza place I tried and I was expecting the crust to be extremely thick, but it wasn't as thick as I thought which was nice.  I love pizza so I eat the entire pizza and the crust wasn't bad.  I tried the pepperoni and cheese and the Chicago classic.  Both pizzas were good, but I really liked the Chicago classic.  I loved the different toppings especially the sausage.  I was seated in the back table and I get a little weary sometimes because it's easy to be forgotten about, but thankfully the servers weren't like that here so plus on service as well.
My first ever Chicago deep dish! YUM.  I had the house salad and he Chicago classic.  The crust is decadent and the sauce so sweet.  Friendly service by Joe the bartender too.

Delicious deep dish goodness. Perfect amount of crunch, perfect amount of cheese , it's just perfect period. Grab a beer, watch the game and enjoy your pizza.... Wait did I mention the buffalo wings ? Fantastic!

This is my happy place when we wanna get our pig out on when its cold & we need a movie night in. We always do take out so I have no idea how eating here is. All I know is we always get the dinner salad & a thin crust medium "well done" mushroom, onion, green pepper pizza and it is always awesome. The salad is super fresh and lasts a couple of days because the house dressing is on the side, might I say the dressing is incredible. The pizza does not last as long... sadly... sniffle, sniffle.

I know they are famous for deep dish, and it may just be a CA thin crust style pizza lover thing, but, yuck. Mouth full of sauce that burnt by tongue. Skimpy cheese and other toppings. Tables to close together and too  heard to hear even the person right next to you. Took too long to be seated with no direction by host. UPDATE: THESE PEOPLE OFERED TO CALL ME AND NEVER DID THUS ANY DEFENSE THEY MAKE ON YELP IS QUESTIONABLE AND MISLEADING!!!!
Love their buttercrust! It's standard for all thin crust pizza. Also, they have hot giardaneira as a topping option, which I love. They have nice quality sausage as well.
If you are looking for the perfect Chicago style pizza -don't look no more. This is it. Great dishes, service, prices, ambiance. And it was within walking distance from my hotel so very convenient.

I went to the location in River North on Feb 13th (for the heart shaped deep dish).  There was about a 20 minute wait, but it didn't feel that long. It was crowded in the front, but once some of the to go orders were processed it cleared out. We also could put our pizza order in before we were seated to get it started right away. We had the small deep dish pepperoni in the heart shaped pan.  Once seated, in a cute two person booth, we were promptly offered to order drinks by both of the waitstaff on our floor. Drinks were fast enough and then we entered the order for an appetizer (buffalo wings). We had the appetizer in about 15 minutes and just as we finished the pizza was coming out.  The small was perfect for two people, with two decent sized slices per person. That with wings and the cookie pie for dessert was enough to fill up up but not leave us overly stuffed. This was a late lunch/early dinner. My only complaints were 1. I hit my head pretty hard on a brick overhang, although this wasn't really the restaurants problem- just my own clumsiness and 2. The A/C and heat were changing back and forth. This is in the middle of February when its freezing out and I want to be warm. I ended up putting on and taking off my coat about a dozen times in the hour and a half at the restaurant as i was getting too hot then too cold then whole time.   Overall- It was good. I enjoyed my food, beer, and thought the heart pizza was a cute option for Valentines day.

Chicago locals will tell you Lou Malnati's is their favorite deep dish place. Even my Uber drive agreed! And the crowds on a Friday night didn't lie; this place is popular. Packed with a 50+ minute wait on my visit.  It was worth the wait. I got the Lou's Deep Dish, in going with my policy that a dish good enough to name a restaurant after is probably a safe bet. This was one delicious pie! However, the surprise favorite of the meal may have been the bruschetta appetizer. It is everything you want in a bruschetta: perfectly crunchy garlic bread and fresh flavorful tomatoes topped with delicious parmesan cheese and herbs. Just perfection. Great food all around.
We order all the time..everytime some is wrong..we ord er .noore that you our anniversary  (fed 14).the food was wrong again.l work with people  in a fast food it not that hard

My buddies and I have stopped in two times already (both times on a Saturday). This review is long overdue, so here it goes.  The very first time we came here we waited a while to be seated, the host advised us to order right away so that we would not have to wait more once we got a table. I appreciated that! We ordered the classic deep dish Lou's pizza - it was amazingly yummy (first time trying out Chicago style pizza), we got truly stuffed and were content and satisfied!!!! The restaurant atmosphere was great! Service was decent! There is no other pizza joint that compares to Lou's pizza, I'M IN LOVE WITH THIS PLACE! KUDOS!

Best pizza ive ever had. Delicious.  Right to perfection.  Thick and full of delightful flavors. Come with appetite for sure and a empty belly. Hahaha. It would definitely fill that belly of yours. Great ambience.  Good crowd.
We got the deep dish Lou pizza with sausage. YES. The best deep dish I've had in Chicago. I make it a point to visit every time I come to the city. And you should too!

Chicago pizza is good, but this place is the best! Amazing food and staff. There's a bit of wait for food and seating but that's normal for good food. Laura was our server, she was just super friendly and accommodating!!

Where do i even begin. I am from California on a road trip, decided to stop here and grab a bite, one of the greatest decisions I have ever made. Amazing food! Amazing staff specially our server Laura! Had a great time! The food is beyond great! Ate so much, everything was amazing except the wait, and that's because I hate waiting. But it was absolutely worth it! Garlic bread was so good. The pizza was just the best I have ever had, I don't think it could get any better, and remember to look for Laura, she's very helpful and a great server.

This is THE BEST pizza in Chicago.  Hands down.  The crispy crust, the flavorful tomatoes, oh my!  I'm addicted to the deep dish spinach and pepperoni, but, their thin crust is also out of this world.  It took me years to think of trying it, I wish I'd known how good it was sooner!
Service was attentive and helpful!!! But, about the testy of pizza and soup, it is not good as some people told me!! Maybe it was the kind of taste that I don't like - sausage!!!

Ships out of state!!! So excited to have Lou's delivered to my door and I don't live in Chicago. It arrives frozen in foil deep dish pans, you keep in your freezer until you are ready to bake. Best frozen pizza!!! Even tried the crustless pizza which is sausage based.

I have had Deep Dish in Chicago a few times. This, by far, was the BEST! Warm and gooey throughout the pie and the buttery crispy crust was delicious. In fact, now that I am talking about it, I am now getting hungry!

If I could give it more stars I would...it was that good. Don't come starving as you will have to wait 40-50 minutes for your pie.  (it takes that long to bake it perfectly)  We had the chicago classic with butter crust.  The crust was amazing, the toppings of sausage, sauce and extra cheese were perfect. I can't wait to have it again! Our server was wonderful, couldn't have asked for more.
Sat at the bar for lunch on a Thursday. Pizza was awesome, bartender was very attentive and friendly, but not intrusive. Had a lovely glass of pinot grigio also.

I'm giving this four stars because the overall experience was great. The waitress was very polite and attentive.. The salad and deep dish pizza were both tasty but the pizza wasnt as hot, melty, and flavorful  as I wanted it to be.   Maybe I'm just being spoiled...it was good- its just that I've had way better.

If you're looking to eat at a place that serves Chicago Style Pizza it's definitely between this place and Giordanos. The reason I usually go for Lou Malnati's though is the CRUST. I love how crunchy and buttery it tastes and compliments the rest of each slice so well.

Say it with me, people: THIN CRUST. I know you all love your deep dish stereotype, but thin is where it's at with Lou's. Also the Lou's salad is actually to die for. Little known fact. Wine is surprisingly well priced.
As far as Chicago pizza goes this place is top notch! I eat far to much pizza and this is one of the reasons why! It's so damn good! Enjoy this Chicago original!

My husband & I went here while in the city for the weekend. It was the first night of our Anniversary getaway. One of if not the best deep dish pizza we've ever had. Perfect blend of sauce & toppings. The crust wasn't too thick, & had a nice light buttery crunch to it. High recommendations to go here!! Oh, let's not forget about the spinach cheese bread for an appetizer. Yum!!!

Just had an amazing meal! My sister and I ordered a deep dish cheese pizza and loved it! I usually am not a fan of deep dish and find it too greasy, but this was the best deep dish pizzas I've had. Highly recommend!

It's everything is in Chicago pizza should be. We had the butter crust. We had 10 crest. We had a deep dish with fun ingredients. Pictures of beers cocktails is a fantastic experience always start off though with a salad or something cause a pizza takes 40 minutes but it's worth the wait.

The best pizza I have had in Chitown yet. Ambience great. Staff great. Pizza flavors to choose from, great. It would be nice to get traditional Chicago style pizza outside of Chicago. So far, I haven't found it. Will always frequent this establishment upon return to Chicago.
Best Deep Dish Pie in Chicago - Nuff Said.
Great food. Love it all. Place is nice. Just wish the service wasn't so laid back .. take it up one notch. But otherwise great pizza place to go to.
Very traditional classic deep dish pizza without any unnecessary frills or pretenses. Chicago-style sweet tangy tomato sauce. Friendly warm service.

Meh - it was just barely ok. I have had better fried mozzarella sticks from the local grocer's freezer section. I definitely wouldn't go out of my way to have this deep dish. I just gave half of my leftover pie to a very nice homeless lady. I hope I didn't offend her by handing off this kinda bland pizza.

Everyone has their favorite pizza joints but Lou's makes a great case to beat most of them.  The signature sauce and classic buttercrust makes them stand out from the rest.  Don't forget to try their sweet vinaigrette dressing on the Malnati salad.

Mmm Mmm Mmmmm..... This is arguably the best thin crust pizza place in Chicago. The pizza is crunchy, cheesy and the proportion of sauce to cheese to dough is perfect every time! Ask for a "pie-cut" if you don't want your pizza to be cut into little square pieces. If you are visiting Chicago, don't miss this. And if you're from Nor Cal, bring me back a pie!

I am not from Chicago, so I wanted to try some famous Chicago deep dish pizza that everyone raves about. I really enjoyed Lou Malnati's hot wings, yummy! The restaurant is really nice inside. There is a long flight of stairs to climb to the extra seating on the 2nd floor. The pizza was good, not great, but I was comparing it to Giordano's which I had tried the night before (Giordano's dough had more flavor to me). Trying it once was good enough for me :-)

I like almost all pizza; as a visitor this place seemed pretty representative of the Chicago school of pizza. Sometimes I need a break from my go to, New York thin crust style.  By the way, as a former resident of one and a current resident of another,  I have no idea what typifies "Boston" or even "San Francisco" style,  I recommend that if you walk into a pizza place that boasts either of these styles,  just walk out. Anyway, the place is crazy busy, so be ready. Like everybody else, we ordered what we wanted and put our names in. What happens next is up to you, but you will most likely not be seated. So we went to a nearby bar and drank until the text message came in that our table was ready. As soon as you are seated the pre-ordered pizza shows up right away. Not a bad system actually.  Good salads as well, friendly staff. Oh, and pizza portions are huge.

Not that this place needs ANOTHER review.. We designed our own food tour of chicago and this was our first stop. We ordered a small deep dish to share between two of us and it was GOOD. More than the food, i'd like to compliment the service. Our server was excellent and I wish I could remember his name. He had a great energy about him and gave us some more recommendations of food to try in Chicago. He also brought us some Fannie Mae chocolates to sample. Thanks again!

I dream about "The Lou" deep dish pizza. I am from Chicago and Lou's has always been my favorite deep dish with their butter crust and sauce that has chunks of tomatoes vs just a paste. When I went to college in FL, I used to stock up on the take out frozen pizzas to fly back with me. I've even flown 8 pizzas to Toronto and my Canadian friends haven't stopped talking since. Ice tried the other deep dish pizzas in Chicago and there's no competition!
Love their deep dish pizza.  Whenever I have friends from out of state, I bring them here to try their deep dish.
This is my Favorite Pizza in all Chicago land. Large Pan with that awesome sausage !!! Thank You Lou Malnati's for opening one in Cary,IL  now I can pick up for home!!!!

Meal 1 in Chitown deep dish pizza......duhh. My thoughts... solid tasting pizza just not what im used to. Eating NY style pizza for nearly 30 years will result in quite a bias. To me deep dish is Sicilian or pizza hut. Now this is much better than pizza hut im sure even though I was probably 10 the last time I ate pizza hut. The beef I have with this style pizza is 1. it just seems super rich an unhealthy and 2. you cant just get a slice. In NY when your running low on time, rushing to catch a train or what have you, being able to just grab that slice and go is key. Also a classic NY slice will run 300-350 calories. One of these baby pizzas will cost you over 800.  Still giving four stars here though. It was delish and service was friendly. I will just stick to my roots.

I'm not a deep dish pizza person and this was the first time trying real deep dish in Chi Town. Bruschetta was really good. I liked how it was buttery and toasted but not too hard that it would cut your mouth up. Chicken wings were really good as well. For the pizza, I tried a small, half Lou's and half Chicago Classic. I preferred the classic over Lou's. I liked how it wasn't too salty.  The Lou's had too much veggies which made the crust more doughy and killed some of the crunch.  One reason I usually opt for thin crust over deep dish is because the cheese and toppings usually make it too salty on deep dish and also the crust comes out too doughy. I usually also go for pepperoni over sausage, but in this case I had to try it the way it was to see what it was all about. I wasn't disappointed. Very good crust.  Haven't tried the other joints yet, but I will on return visits to the Windy City.

Took some family members to Lou Malnati's as they had been wanting to try "Chicago Style" pizza. We started off with a family style sized portion of the chicken Caesar salad.  This can easily feed 6-7. Great value for the price. We then split a large Chicago style pizza that feeds 4.  Which is perfect as we were a party of 4. The pizza looked great, but lacked taste that day. I've been coming to Lou Malnati's for a while and this pie just lacked that "it" factor today. I feel bad as this was my family's first trip to LM's and they didn't leave with the best impression. The highlight was our salad and when coming to a pizza landmark, is not the best thing to remember.
Just your typical chain pizza.... but it kills.  This pizza makes me cry (deep dish), only bummer is the wait time. TRY THIS. Super touristy but so worth it!

Food started out as amazing! I went with two coworkers during a business trip to the city. We shared two apps and then each ordered a personal pizza. They both got cheese and I ordered one with sausage.  Fast forward, 6 hours later, I was not feeling so great. Ended up getting food poisoning from the sausage and it made for a really awful day between meetings.

This is pizza this the best in Chicago. If you are looking for traditional Chicago pizza, this is your place. The pizza is consistent and always taste great. One thing you need to know when ordering deep dish pizza in Chicago is it takes at least 45 minutes to cook usually. Make sure you order apps if your hungry. This place is casual, great for families and can hold big parties.

When asking for recommendations of good deep dish in Chicago, this name came up more than a few times!  They were right!  We only had time for 2 places, so we tried the 2 big ones.  Lou's was the best.  The portions are perfect, the price is right, and everything tasted soooo good!!  Our server was a lot of fun too!  I just learned i can order them for shipping, because pizza hasn't been the same since!

Final verdict: Lou Malnati's  is so much better than Giordano's. The Malnati Chicago Classic pizza blew the deep dish pizza served at Giordano's. It wasn't only the golden brown buttered crust, but also the fresh ingredients (particularity the sauce) which made my experience worth the 5 stars of this review.  Tip: the bruschetta is a great appetizer to start off with.

Was so excited to try Chicago deep dish pizza while I was in town for business.  This place did not disappoint. Excellent pizza and one of the best salads I have ever had.  A very positve experience. Just wish i had a bigger stomach so I could have eaten more!!

First time for Deep Dish and Lou's did not disappoint. This place came highly recommended by the concierge at our hotel. I had mentioned Giordano's to him and his comment was that Lou Malnati's is traditional Chicago Deep Dish, while Giordano's is "stuffed" pizza, that is, a top and bottom crust with filling inside. I wanted the authentic thing, so the fam and I went to Lou's. We couldn't have been happier or more full when we left. We got the Chicago Classic which literally has a thin homemade sausage patty under the layer of cheese. It was fantastic. It might have made the pizza a touch heavy, which was bad because I wanted to eat more. The crust was unbelievably light and flaky, with a wonderful buttery flavor. The pepperoni pizza we ordered was the group favorite, simple but delicious. Their sauce is excellent as well,

You are an idiot!!!!  And have not lived life until you eat at Lou Malnati's on Wells Street, Chicago.  So here's what happened:  visiting out of town from DC. Coworker was like , "Dude!!! If you don't do anything!!...You MUST eat at Lou Malnati's River North". I'm thinking, "why this guy keep pressin me to eat at 'illuminati's'..I got a good Fed Government job with a secret clearance and don't need to get caught up in no evil conspiracy cult".  Dude was like, "noooo! Not 'illuminati', Lou Malnati's". I'm like, "fine. When I get to Chicago I'll check it out". Of course in my mind, im thinking "Pizza is Pizza" but whatever. I got money.  God has been good. I'm blessed. I've done brick ovens from NYC to Napa Valley so I KNOW pizza. But since I gave my word, let me just get it out the way.  Leaving the W Hotel Lakeshore, I told Uber, "take me to Lou Malnati's". On the way there, this old uber driver dude that can bare drive drops me off at "Due's" pizza place.  I'm thinking, "man...this ain't the place".  After he left, Ask me why I caught another uber again and ended up at this Lou Malnati.  Walked in. Hostess were friendly. Sat at the bar and I ordered my pizza.  David G the bartender, who was fast and friendly btw, took my order but told me it would take 30-45 minutes as the kitchen whips it up from scratch with tender loving care.  I'm thinking, "that's a long time, but fine."  The game is on at the bar. They playin Michael Jackson in the background, and the patrons were friendly and conversational.  After chatting it up and watching the game, my son face timed me from DC. Went outside to take the call, and after about 10 minutes, David G the bartender came out in the freezing cold and said "yo! Your pizza is hot ready. Take your time but I got you". After ending the call, I came in to this Master Piece of a dish.  In my mind I'm thinking "I hope this tastes as good as it looks".  Long story short.... I took one bite and I thought i died and went to heaven.  OH MYYYYYY GOD!!!!!!!!!!!!   There are absolutely NO words to describe how good this Pizza is. So I won't even try. If I do it will sound like I'm exaggerating and it won't do it any justice.   All I can say is that if you have not been to Lou Malnati's  you have not eaten pizza.  I swear!!!  That pizza was so good that I don't think that I can ever eat another pizza from any other establishment in my life ever again!!  That's real talk.  To make matters worse David G comes back to check on me and says, "if you like that, then you absolutely have to try the giardineiera peppers on the side. I'm thinking to myself "how the heck can this pizza get any better. I have never had anything like this in my entire life". So David G proceeds to bring out the peppers. I sprinkle a little bit on one of the slices and literally thought that I was going to go into a food coma.  Hands down, Mahlnati and David G have changed my life forever!!!!!!!!!!!!   So I repeat. If you have not been to Malnati's to eat pizza you are a complete idiot and haven't lived life.

I've heard so many great things about Chicago deep dish pizza but was met with disappointment at Lou Malnati's. I simply didn't see what the hype was about and the flavoring of the pizza wasn't all too different from say Pizza Hut or Domino's. I really wish this restaurant lived up to my expectations... We also ordered wings as an appetizer and they didn't blow me away either. Remind me again why there is such a long wait for dinner at this place..? (Maybe I don't understand the deep dish love?!?!)
Best Deep Dish Pizza hands down. Great Prices and friendly staff. Comforting atmosphere. Love the breadsticks and the bruschetta is excellent! Definitely give it a try!
Great place, great food, great service, but some things (like the fried calamari) are spicy which limits what the little ones can eat.

AMAZE-BALLS!!!! My first ever Chicago Deep dish pizza was incredible. Not only did the we get the classic deep dish but we ordered the bruschetta...fan-freaking-tastic!...and the BBQ chicken salad....knocks your socks off!  If you're in chicago you need to go here!!

Pizza was great but when we left we over heard our server complaining loudly how we didn't tip her enough, when we were literally a couple of feet away from her. Our friend did accidentally tipped incorrectly by accident but the way she handled it was disrespectful and rude.
I feel like Chicago Style Pizza is being done more and more places. That's cool. Most are really good. Lou's is still the best.
Buttery crust pepperoni deep dish.. i... am... drooling...... I love Lou's. I personally do not like the sausage base. But everything else is beyond perfect!
By far my favorite deep dish.  The Malnati Chicago Classic is the way to go.  I don't understand eating it any other way.  If you believe deep dish is a pie, then you have to eat it this way.

The BEST thin crust pizza in the hood!   Everyone talks about the deep dish here, but the real star is the thin crust.  It is light, crunchy and delish.  This location is always busy.  If you are looking for a great atmosphere, you may want to go to the North State Street location in the Gold Coast.  This is all about the food!  The salads are fresh and complement the pizza.  The pepperoni is the best!!

Visiting Chicago, of course we had to get deep dish pizza. After careful Yelp research, we chose Lou Malnati's. There were 5 of us so we ordered a large Chicago classic. 4 of us were full off a slice so that leaves 4 slices right? My boyfriend ate half the pizza by himself... Impressive or gross, I don't know. Anyways, the pizza was good. Lots of meat and cheese. I think there should've been more sauce because it was on the dry side. I was disappointed by the crust. I thought there would be more flavor but it was so plain. The server was friendly and attentive. Next time I'm in Chicago, I'll have to see if there's better.
Great pizza great salad but service a bit bad. Should have told us pizza was going to take ages. 4/10 for service
absolutely love Lou's - never lets us down; perfect blend of yeasty, savory dough, fresh cheese and very fresh-tasting tomato sauce. Perfection in a pan.

My review is on their suburban delivery service - not the Wells St sit-down. LOCAL delivery service is superb .  And their app is amazing!  They ask if you want it pre-cut.  Why?  It effects how well it travels, they said. Who knew?!  And they put a piece of saran wrap on top which keeps it so hot. Why doesn't anyone else do that?  I'm a convert.
Love Lou's!  My first Chicago pizza was from here.  Awesome!
Deep dish was better than Giardanos.  Nice little place.  Ambiance was ok but the pizza was delicious.

Aside from UNOs this was the only other Chicago deep dish style pizza I had time to try. I'm sure there are others out there! But this was on my list so I gave it a shot. I shared a Small Malnatis Classic with sausage cheese and tomatoes. Pros: The portion is more than enough for 2 people, the cheese has a perfect chewy consistency, and the tomatoes are fresh and flavorful. Great service. Con: The hard buttermilk crust wasn't that good and the overall flavor is powerful yet nothing special. Maybe I just prefer NY thin crust..

Lou's is a staple for Chicago deep dish, but I recently had their lasagna with meat sauce and Lou Malnati salad. It was incredibly delicious!  As a word of caution, be careful parking here (N Damen Ave location) if you leave their parking lot for any reason for even the shortest period of time you are likely to get booted by Parking Solutions. Not a very pleasant experience to go with a delicious meal.

Casual, nice atmosphere...about what you would expect from the typical pizzeria. Pizza was alright, not the best not the worst. The highlight by far was the dessert baked chocolate chip pizza cookie! Fresh baked in a personal pizza sized pan with vanilla ice cream...outstanding!

You hear about how Chicago is the home of Deep Dish Pizza.  Chicago has a variety of places to choose from starting with the original Pizzeria Uno, to Gino's East, Giordano's, Chicago's and a whole bunch of others.  When it comes down to the best deep dish, I have to say hands down my favorite is Lou Malnati's! One of the best attributes to a deep dish pizza from Lou's is its butter crust.  This is definitely what separates Lou's from the rest.  The beer sausage on the sausage pizza only enhances the experience as well as the cheese that covers your favorite pie. The other night, I was feeling like pizza but not feeling deep dish.  Decided to try their thin crust sausage pizza.  To my amazement, the crust was the same used on their deep dish but just thinner and less cheese.  So if you're thinking about thin crust at Lou's, I would definitely vouch for it. Lastly, their Lou's salad is definitely the way to start off your meal. Lou's definitely got their mixture right when they created this salad!
Love the deep dish with pepperoni.  The tomato sauce they use is more sweet than others and the crust is very flaky.  Not as thick and cheesy as Giordano's and better than Gino's
What can I say about Lou Malnat that hasn't already been said? Wonderful great the best. And every time I hear the name I feel like running out and picking up one of their super great pizzas.

I know, this is a staple, and I'm a Chicagoan, so I know my Chicago-style pizza. But I prefer Giordano's, and here's why: Lou Malnati's has a tendency to choke me. The cheese chokes me. The slab of sausage (which is like a layer of sausage smooshed into the bread) chokes me. I like the tomato slices on top, but that's not worth giving an extra star. The crust is ok, but I prefer Giordano's again because Lou's is too dry. In this city, choosing your pizza place is like choosing your baseball team, and I've had drag-out fights over this Lou's business. But I'm sticking with my Giordano's (or the original Uno).
Thank you Lou Malnati's Pizzeria, we started to understand the meaning of Chicago deep dish pizza :) Btw. We arrived at 2:30pm thus no need to wait for 1 or 2 hours in lane...
My first time in Chicago and I had to have deep dish pizza.  The pizza was delicious. The ambiance was perfect and the service was friendly without being hovery.

I'll emphasize again that I just may not understand this whole Chicago Deep Dish Pizza phenomenon.  Everyone around me savored every bite of their pizza and made those "oh... ah... this is soooooo good" noises and paired it with eyes rolling to the back of their head. I double checked 3x to make sure I was eating out of the same pizza box as everyone else. I was. Maybe it's a Californian thing. Or maybe Lou Malnati's has been hyped up too much.
