Or maybe I don't know..... I'm not meant to enjoy Chicago pizza. I will emphasize that everyone I shared the pizza with, including head chefs at popular River North restaurants loved the pizza. Maybe you'd be better off following their reactions, not mine.
Oh my goodness... So good! We ordered the Classic and came back before leaving to get it to-go on the plane! Definitely one of the best pizzas I've had.
Came to Chicago for the weekend and this was by far the best pizza I've had in a very long time. Shout out to Alex and Justin for the great service. Will come again!  #blessup
The Real Chicago Deep Dish

Came here pretty late, about two hours before they close. Perhaps I should've chosen a better time but it felt like they have no quality control here. I had no issue with the server, he peeked at us (corner seating towards the front), but what was weird was it seemed like we were his only table on this side. The glass we were given for water had some weird brown smudge on it, when I asked for a replacement, the waiter didn't question, he just promptly brought me another. We got the classic Chicago deep dish and the Lou, their two signature dishes. This pizza is over hyped. Also the butter crust tastes no different from the regular crust. Neither of which had any taste to it. The tomatoes tasted like it came out of a can. To top it off, the Lou had a piece of hard plastic the size of half a pinkie tip. We left super super disappointed in Lou Malnati's.

My first experience with deep dish pizza was...cheesy, a little too cheesy, perhaps. Having never had it before, it's hard for me to judge the quality at Lou Malnati's. The ingredients were fresh and served piping hot, so I'm guessing it's just a matter of personal preference. That said, I would have preferred more topping choices, less cheese, a chewier crust...oh wait, now I'm just describing Pizzeria Regina in Boston. Anyways, a trip to this classic Chicago establishment is totally worth it regardless of your pizza preference. Just be prepared to wait, both in line and at your table for these monster pies to cook.

Coming from Seattle we were advised to go here. I've never been a deep dish fan, but I figured eating it from it's place of origination would be a much more enlightening experience.  I was wrong. I was not converted. The food was OK. Just not convincingly amazing.

Took my first trip to Chicago and one of my main goals was to eat pizza.  We went to Lou's ordered two pies. The Signature Pie and a Cheese with peppers and onions. Both pies were fantastic. Lou's approach to deep dish or appears to be taking a thinner crust (not wafer thin but not a huge rising crust) and form it into a deep dish pan. This crust is amazingly crisp and tasty. After the crust it is a thicker layer of very fresh clean tasting mozzarella cheese, not really greasy at all. Then it is a loaded layer of house made sausage very flavorful and loaded across the whole pie. Finally, there is a very hearty fresh tasting layer of sauce to cap off the entire pizza. It was very tasty and much fresher not greasy pizza.  On the personal opinion side, I thought it was very good but not what I was expecting with a deep dish which I thought was going to be more of a thicker crust but it was still very good.

Such high ratings for this place... But i wasn't super impressed.  I called the order in advance, which was super easy and the guy was super nice. That was the one really positive note. I got there a little after 1pm. It was busy but not crazy in the restaurant. But the staff still seemed frazzled. (maybe lunch rush was crazy right before) I waited at the cash register about 10 minutes with only 2 other people waiting and 3 staff standing by the register talking. 2 or 3 more people come in and were a bit more pushy and the hostesses helped them over the couple of us already waiting, which wasn't super fair.  I ordered The Lou - since vegetarian. Based on the description of spinach, mushroom and mozzarella, I expected this to be more like a creamy alfredo or blanca pizza. It wasn't at all what I expected. The buttercrust I thought would be airy and light.. it was crisp and crunchy. There wasn't very much sauce on the pizza (good because it wasn't soggy by the time I got back to the office, bad because I didn't taste too much pizza sauce). The cheese was mostly cheddar. I didn't taste any garlic.. Honestly this pizza reminded me of when I was in grade school and use to take english muffins with canned tomato sauce and cheddar cheese and pop them in the toaster oven for a bit... tasted about like that... It was okay.. but I definitely don't think it is 5 star pizza. And I really don't think my personalized size pizza was justified for the $10 price tag on it. It was just so-so.

Sorry, we have tried them all and the pizza here is just not as good as at Pizzeria Uno or Pizzeria Due or Gino's East.  The crust just does not have the same texture or flavor of that at the other pizza places downtown.  They do put an ample amount of pepperoni on the pie, but if the crust means something to your pizza  experience, pass them by.

Best deep dish ever!! I've tried Lou malnatis as well as giordanos and Lou's pizza definitely stood out on top. My friends and I ordered the sampler, the cheesy spinach bread and two small deep dish pizzas! There was more than enough food for the 5 of us. But left overs are even better! The pizzas took a little while to come out, but it's expected since it is a Chicago styled deep dish pizza. We got the classic as well as Lou and both were so good! Just the right amount of cheese and the crust was awesome!

As a native New Yorker who loves his daily slice of thin-crust goodness, there was no way I could pass by this place without trying it. I ordered the Malnati Chicago Classic and it was so flavorsome. The combination of italian sausage, homemade tomato sauce, fresh cheese on top of a thick buttercrust made my mouth feel things that it normally never feels. Their three cheese bread is also very rich and packed with flavor. I must say, the city of Chicago has it pretty good, even though I would still prefer thin-crust, chicago style pizza here is the bomb. This place is huge and decorated with a lot of sports memorabilia so you'll appreciate this place even more if you're a sports fan.
Meh... I really don't get the obsession Chicago has with Lou Malnati's. The sauce is far too sweet and the crusts are both crispy and chewy.
One of the pizzas I have ever tasted. Quick service. Polite staff. Best crust EVER!!   Only issue was that they forgot to send our soda with the delivery.

Sorry Chicago, we tried, but we aren't deep dish fans, it tasted like a common franchise pizza brand that we won't name. Maybe because we ordered the vegetarian version, as I heard the other pizzas on the menu are much better. Waitress never came to check on us and kept passing us to check on the table behind us. Had to ask another server for a drink refill and never got extra napkins. Oh well, at least we tried it.
great pizza!  give it a try! I enjoy the thin crust pizza

I'm probably breaking an unwritten rule by writing this review but I don't see what all the hubbub is about. I think my expectations were too high. Our pie was good, not great. There was way too much cheese on it, so much that I had to take about half off and it was still plenty. I did like the ability to order online. I was on my way to Midway to catch a flight and didn't have time to order onsite. As promised, the food was ready on time.  Looking forward to visiting Chicago again but I think I'll be trying another deep-dish staple in town.
This is my second favorite deep dish pizza, but probably the most typical example of proper Chicago pan pizza.

Well it definitely didn't live up to the hype .... I was expecting a lot more . It was busy and packed so I understand if service was slow . Our sever was nice but he forgot to put in our appetizer order . He also forgot about us completely when we told him we needed to pack up the rest of our food and the check .  The deep dish pizza - I was hoping for more , but was let down . The sauce was bland . The Sausage was not good AT all .  Appetizer : we got calamari which was not good at all . The sauce they used was a little weird
The crust tasted almost cake like, delicious. The Chicago style had a deep crust with the next layer being cheese, followed by the meat, and a top layer sauce. Best pizza I have ever had.
Lou's is always going to be the best pizza, hands down, for deep dish you can't go anywhere else.

For my first time in Chicago, I wanted to try a deep dish pizza! Many people and articles recommend Lou's. My experience was good. Customer service was amazing. Everyone was really friendly and helpful. I was seated immediately. They get 5 stars for customer service. Their food is what made me rate it 3 stars. It's OK. The classic deep dish pizza itself was underwhelming. There was a lack of flavor that was being overcompensated with a massive amount of cheese.
Average. Just okay. Go to pequods or aurelios for chicago style pizzas.

Wow, wow, wow ... my first experience with a true deep dish Chicago pizza.  Full disclosure, I had a personal pizza, so missed some of the great out of the pan sliced up in front of you presentation.  That being said, a couple of beers and the sausage pizza was an incredible lunch.  They took our order and we waited about 10 minutes for a table.  The 25-30 minute wait for a pie is real.  It gets a little tough seeing others eat this tremendous pie in front of you ... but worth the wait.  A must stop for visitors to Chi-town.

A must in Chi-town.. Love the ambiance in the place, you really get a feeling of Chicago.  Make sure not to over order, just know that you will probably be full after 2 slices of pizza, so don't go overboard haha.  This place delivers as well!

Hands down one of the best pizza places in the city! Every time I order, whether its just for my self or the whole family, everything gets devoured. Ingredients always taste fresh and the sauce is the right kind of zesty and the thickness of their pan pizzas is just superb. This is the kinda pizza that just wants to make you do a song and dance!

Came in to this popular restaurant on New Years Day, and was seated in less than 20 minutes. Service was great, but food did not live up to the hype. Food was served warm to cold, and the taste did not jump out as a great pizza. Buffalo wings were salty and calamari was soggy, not crispy. If you have to try it, by all means, but be prepared to bring your jacket on a cold day (even when you're seated) and hope you don't come on an off day for the place (despite the service being 5-star quality).  Update: Just talked to the manager and straightened everything out. Really appreciate the customer service to ensure they make things right. Would try again when I'm in town.
Hands down the best pizza that Chicago has to offer.  As Paula Dean's son said on his trip to the original in Lincolnwood "That's the best damn thing I've ever put in my mouth".

Glad I was able to finally check out Lou Malnati's Famous deep dish, boy was it scrumptious. Came on a Thursday and it was really packed, waited about 35 mins and was seated and greeted by our server. Server was very busy with the crowds that swarm in at all times, as I was told they are always busy.  Ambiance is nice and resembles your typical Pizzeria, this place was packed so people watching at that point. We were really starving so decided to order a family salad to hold us over before the Big Kahuna of Deep Dish was to be brought out.  Holy Moly this Chicago Classic style pizza was hefty & mouthwatering all in one bite!! The flavorful buttered & flaky crust was the bomb!! Truly a staple of a Pizzeria if your ever in the Chicago area one must visit Lou's for Deep Delectable Damn Good Deep Pizza.

Went to Chicago on a mini vacation and stopped by here the first night. I've never had a real Chicago deep dish so I was pretty excited. We ordered the Classic and The Lou. Took about 45 minutes for the food to come which is my only complaint but I knew that before going in, so not too bad. The classic was pretty good but The Lou was outstanding. Spinach mix, mushrooms, tomatoes, and 3 cheeses. I thought I wouldn't enjoy it because I'm not a big fan of mushrooms but it's not too noticeable and adds flavor to the pizza. Definitely going here again when I come back

Lou Malnatis was recommended to us by a lift driver so we decided to check it out. Being it our first time in Chicago, we ordered the classic deep dish pizza. It was yummy but (in MY opinion) extremely cheesy, though those in my group seemed to enjoy that. Our server was also great and attentive. The large pizza was plenty to feed 4, we actually had enough left over to have it for dinner. Overall, this place was good and I would maybe visit again, but I would order something with a little more meat

My boyfriend and I were visiting Chicago from New York and figured we would try the famous deep dish pizza. The waiting area was packed but we ended up with only a 15 minute wait. We decided on calamari as an app and the Lou because of all of the yummy pictures that were posted. Our server immediately asked us for our drink order. We were sitting next to a very large party so it was quite loud but that's not the restaurants fault. Drinks were delivered quickly and the appetizer arrived in a decent amount of time. Then came the pizza. Being from NY (home of the best pizza in the world), I wasn't expecting much but I have to say, the sauce is great! The crust could've used a little more salt but it wasn't bad. We had a good experience and I would definitely go back if I'm ever in town again.

I just don't care for the sauce they use... the crust was ok, the meats were ok, but the sauce had that nasty, sickish-sweet taste that adding (too much) sugar can bring out... made it inedible as far as I was concerned.
Ordered a medium deep dish cheese pizza. It was great! Delivery arrived at a normal wait-time. Would definitely recommend to others. :)

Over the years different offices I have worked in have ordered from here. Everyone raves about the pizza, and locals love it. It's a solid choice, but nothing outstanding.  I have also been in the restaurants, and the catered food is consistent with the food in the dining room--again, a solid pizza choice, but no "wow" experience.

What can you say about Malnati's? The deep dish is fantastic and the thin crust is tasty beyond belief. My guess is the difference is the ingredients - the cheese in the deep dish pie is wonderful. And the crust on the thin is so good that I actually eat it! Yep, I'm still a kid and rarely eat the crusts. I visit the Wells and the Gold Coast locations most frequently. Service is always A with an occasional B from someone having a bad day. But always a great experience. My recommendation is like everyone else's - eat this pizza!!
Always a classic Chicago Pizza place. I will be going back shortly.

The best deep dish I've ever had. I wish I had some right now. It was very crowded when I went, but was totally worth the wait. The staff was very friendly and worked hard for everyone to get seated and get their food quickly. The Three Cheese Bread is a wonderful appetizer, but you must be careful. It is easy to get really full before the pizza even comes. I suggest going here when you're starving because it allows you to eat as much as possible. I highly suggest this place. I want it now.

I've tried the carry-out from Malnati's at a different location but never dined in before.  Had dinner here last week and it was a decent experience.   Service was indifferent - not bad but certainly not good.  The the crust of the thin-crust pizza was very good. We ordered one thin and one pan (or deep dish not sure what they call it) along with two salads.  Unfortunately the crust on the pan was soggy and disappointing.  The tomato sauce on the pan pizza was excellent and the cheese was tasty.  The slab of sausage across the top was a little much and overwhelmed everything else.  Unfortunately the salads were sub-par. The house salad was soaked with oily dressing and the Malnati's "special" salad had an overly sweet dressing.  I'd probably try the pizza again but the overall experience was not great.

Hands down, without a shadow of a doubt, my favorite Chicago deep dish pizza restaurant. Their crust is amazing. Garlic cheese bread is deeeelicious and the pasta is super creamy. Service was fantastic as well. I highly recommend!

If you think you have had deep dish pizza and never been to Chicago, then you are sadly mistaken.  This is one of the best places to give it a try and expect to walk away impressed and in a food coma.

There are many pizzerias that I enjoy but Lou's has been a favorite of mine for nearly forty years. You can go into any Lou Malnati's and the quality will be consistent all around. Along with their pizzas, they also have a Thousand Island dressing that is creamy and delicious.

So i never had real deep dish before coming here and I wasn't disappointed. The wait wasn't bad at all and we were lucky to sit at the bar while we waited for our table. But there was a group of ladies standing behind us who would not stop complaining. They were saying the bartender was ignoring them but they only been standing there for like 5 mins...In a fully packed restaurant... Really?!? They ended up tipping him like a dollar so we gave him extra tip.. When we sat down we got calamari for an appetizer and demolished it within 5 mins then came the pizza. The crust cheese and sauce taste like a buttery heaven. I was so happy. I ate two slices of a medium and was more than satisfied.  As a bonus we saw a couple of players for the 49ers since the Bears were playing them that weekend. They were huge and ate a ton.
Incredible buttery crisp crust and fresh ingredients! Always consistently delicious thin and Chicago style pizza.

Delicious deep dish pizza, try "the Lou", its vegetarian and incredibly good. If you're going there with kids its good to call ahead, they can start the pizza cooking and by the time you get there the wait will be minimal!
We were actually at the Lou's in Elk Grove Village and it was super.  The best pizza ever.  Now we moved to TX and have to have it shipped here but go to Lou's whenever we get back to Chicago.

What an experience! The deep dish pizza was one of the best pizza I have eatten. The toping is very fresh & juicy. Spicy buffallo wings is also very yummy & juicy. We end our meal with the choc chips pizza.. It's warm with icecream & fresh cream topping. Definitely worth coming back for.
Pizza is phenomenal, well worth the price paid. If your visiting town forget all the other "must have" pizza places, Lous is the best Chicago deep dish
Pizza was AMAZING. Came to Chicago on vacation from Florida for some cold weather, but my heart and stomach was warmed by this culinary delight!!
Great Chicago deep dish pizza to take your family or other tourists to when in town. I like to order for delivery myself. The sauce though. . so good.
Yummy and one of a kind. It was crowed on The Saturday night, but we got our table in less than 30 mins. Service was good, food was good too. Medium was too much for two of us.

This was the last deep dish pizzeria we tried on our recent visit to Chicago.  We only waited around 15 minutes despite being told it was about 30-35 minutes.  I appreciated being able to pre-order the pizza and the text message set up for the wait list.  We ordered a small Lou's classic deep dish for 2 of us, an individual house salad (which was actually sized for 2 people), and the tre dolci dessert (chocolate chip cookie, peach cobbler, and tiramisu).  The pizza was delicious. All the ingredients were very fresh. The crust was good, but could have been a little more buttery.  Other than that, it was excellent and now one of my favorite places.  I will definitely eat there again on our next visit to Chicago.  The salad was decent, nothing special, and the dessert was pretty good.

I'm a huge fan of Chicago Style Pizza! Anytime we are in town one of our first stops is for Pizza! I've tried them all! Giardano's, Gino's East, Uno, and Due! Up until today Uno was my favorite!  Lou Malnati's has just moved into the top spot! The crust on the pizza was amazing, and we absolutely loved the lean sausage that topped our pizza! We will definitely make this one of our top spots to eat!

Thin crust sausage or the Lou pan is awesome!  The buttery crust is so addicting and I would recommend this to locals and visitors.  If you want a taste of delicious Chicago pizza this is the place to go.  Quite honestly I don't think many people from Chicago actually eat deep dish pizza,  that's more of a tourist thing.  We definitely appreciate the good thin crust or pan pizza instead.

Been to Chicago 3 times and the highlight of the trip is always deep-dish pizza ... I must say after having  Duo, Giordano,  and now Lou 's hands down the crust was the best I've had. Tried the spinach stuffed bread and a personal pizza and wow ... amazing. ..only wish I could Stretch my stomach to try all their food ...it's a must try if you visit the windy city.

As a disciple of Malnati's Pizza for many, many years we dragged our two friends from AL/FL in to this location to join us for the definitive Chicago style pizza.  Our server was alerted to their nubi-ism (sp?) and he went out of his way to make sure he answered questions and served up a great extra cheese, sausage and butter crust gem with a terrific chicken caesar and cheddar cubes.  The setting here is fun, location super convenient and as has been the case for over 30 years for us, it is the BEST DARN CHICAGO STYLE PIZZA IN THE WORLD PERIOD.

THIS...IS...PIZZA...PERIOD!  I've been to several Chicago locations, and hands down, it is my favorite pizza restaurant in America.  I know many Americans prefer thin crust, or New York style, but I have to vehemently disagree with them.  Lou's is the place to go in Chicago, and I wish they had a few restaurants in South Florida.  Yes, I know you can have a pie shipped to you, but nothing beats a fresh pie at the actual restaurant.   It's hearty, flavorful, and it goes down great with a cold beer.  Want an idea of my perfect Chicago summer night?  Dinner at Lou Malnati's, then head to Wrigley Field for a Cubs game, followed up with bar hopping in River North.  Lou Malnati's I miss you, and anyone who visits Chicago, I beg them to stop in for a bite to eat.
This is my go-to place in Chicago for real deep dish. You just can't beat it! Also, they ship everywhere in the US!
My favorite of the big 3 deep dish Chicago Pizza places! I will be back!

Want to know the place that all of the locals would like to keep secret? The one that wins their vote for Chicago's best pizza... You found it.  We arrived on a Sunday around 1pm and were sat by the nice hostess immediately. It took awhile for the waiter to acknowledge us and then take our orders. He seemed a bit discombobulated, perhaps high on pizza or in a food coma. Either way, he sucked... it was a good thing that I was wow'd by the cheese. I'm not a huge pizza fan, and I'll disclose and consider that. I chose the personal deep dish lunch special which was $8.95 and included side salad and a soda or unsweetened tea. Since unsweetened is my tea us preference, I was in luck. But if you prefer sweet tea, you'll have to add your own sugar. The side salad came on a tiny plate, piled high of greens, tomatoes, etc. They really should considered a bigger plate. I was a fan of it, but made a mess as I tried to keep it between my mouth and the plate. The pizza, oh the pizza! The sauce was chunky and topped the pizza. The depth of the pizza was mostly cheese. The cheese was the best part... stringy, gooey, excellent cheese. The crust wasn't as thick as you would think, nor was it at all doughy, as some deep dish pizzas are. My husband and daughter split the specialty Malnati Chicago Classic, made with Lou's lean sausage, some extra cheese and vine-ripened tomato sauce on Buttercrust. I tried their pizza, which came with sausage slices. I actually liked their sausage pizza more than my pepperoni pizza, but I didn't taste the butter on the crust. The crust was my least favorite part. We all sort of picked around the crust. My second least favorite part, was the sauce. I wasn't a fan of the chunky sauce, but my daughter fell in love. I scooped the sauce off and she scooped it off of my plate and on to hers. Yeah, love will make you do strange things.
Butter crust is delicious! I'm a thin crust eater and I loved this deep dish! You can pre-order so if there's a wait you'll get your food much faster after you're seated.

meh is right... came in here to get that "Chicago Style" pizza and it was meh. Was it worth the wait, meh. We got sat right next to the kitchen doors and it seemed as if every other runner/ server was dropping something. Yet the server was a bit slow getting to us and or checking in on us.

Met up at Lou's with a few friends for pizza Sunday night and overall we enjoyed our experience! For our group of 5, we were initially told 45 minutes for the wait but were actually seated in just a few minutes which was a pleasant surprise. Even if you do have a long wait, you can place your order so your pizza can begin to cook. (They take at least 30 minutes) We enjoyed a large deep dish with sausage and mushroom which was delicious. For dessert we shared a warm chocolate chip cookie with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream. The only complaint we had was that the service was a bit slow. We had a hard time finding our waitress for napkins, drinks, knives, etc. She was, however, very nice to our group so perhaps her absence was due to the restaurant being short handed.

Locals may not eat deep dish pizza all that much, but our local friends in Chicago took us here.  I'm craving that pizza as I write this review. The deep dish pizza we had was absolutely delicious. I liked that the crust at the bottom wasn't soaked with grease as it has been at some other places. The pizza arrived steaming hot and delicious.  We took some slices home and they heated up very well!
pizza is great, the place is nice, customer service is good too. My only complaint...i wish i could eat more pizza! haha

It's okay.  Exactly like Gino's East, Uno, Due, Giordano's (who sold out about 4-5 years ago and is not so great but has incredibly long lines so go figure!). The place on Wells and the new one on Rush are both nice. I like Connie's, (so that may be a guide for Chicagoans). It's the Chicago Pizza.  Just do not go to their other place, Pizano's on Rush. Ugh! Not nearly as good, in fact, not good with crumby service. Now, if you are looking for delicious Chicago pizza that is not deep dish or pan, which are exactly the same thing here in Chicago, ... you must have Pompei.  They spell it with one 'i'. The one on Taylor is the best! The original owners, well, his grandson.
Best pizza in the USA if not the world.  LOL Their butter crust is to die for. :)

Fine Chicago deep dish in a very crowded place. I am always amazed at how each Lou Malnati's serve so many people so fast and well. I almost always have the same cheese, onions and spinach medium deep dish with butter crust. The butter seems to make the crust crustier and taste smoother.
I love this place! Their sauce is nice and chunky! They're known for their deep-dish, but don't pass up their thin crust! It's fabulous.
One of my favs.  So glad they now have a location in the West Loop.  The sauce is the best.  Be prepared to sit a while, but it's worth it.

Always incredibly crowded, and to me it seemed a little overhyped.  Though I certainly enjoyed the pizza, I'm not sure I'd wait around for an hour to have that experience again.  The service was decent, everyone just seemed a little overwhelmed.
Good enough pizza, but chock full of tourists looking for the "authentic" experience.  There are plenty of other good pizza joints in the city, but Lou's will do if you like a ton of decent food.
So Yums!!! Had a deep dish pizza with a couple bottles of wine. Loved the seating in the dining room. And super odd comment but I thought the bathrooms were really cool too haha.

Great chain of Chicago if you want the traditional deep dish. The Lou and classic are go to favorites and worth it. Worth a try just wish the service was a bit faster. The desert chocolate chip  pizza is a must try absolutely delicious.

Chicago Pizza! wow I'm in love! If you're a fan of deep dish, this would change your world, especially if you are from out of town.  Coming from Cali, I have to say this place was awesome! Good service, very mellow, good eat and drink place but not for pre-party! just good old fashioned beer and pizza!

Garbage. Don't deliver cold soggy pizza that I would have to put in the oven to finish cooking! Wings were garbage too - soggy and not complete, they were like pieces of a wing. I'm literally grossed out and had to throw it away. Waste of money! Never. Again.
My favorite Pizza place of all time! On the weekends the wait can be a little long but delicious! The Lou is the best pizza ever!

I had some crap vegan food for lunch today. I would cut off a finger to rewind time and have Lou's instead. It might be a long weight but it's because you're getting something amazing. Have a salad while you wait because they're 1000 island dressing is the best around too.

We had a few people recommend Lou Malnati's to us prior to our trip so decided to check it out. We got the bruschetta and the Malnati Deep Dish, which were both good but nothing outstanding. The service was pretty slow and the waitress also never brought my soup (they took it off the check after I mentioned it to them). Overall I really thought this place was just "ok".
This location doesn't have the memories the Northside location has for me, but the pizza is just as good and so is the friendly service.  Who invented that wheel of sausage? Brilliance.

Finally!  Deep dish pizza, I loved! Being a tourist and trying to find that pizza w legit reviews got me on a deep dish pizza hunt. I tried Giordano's first,  wasn't so impressed. Came here hoping this place wouldn't let me down... it sure did not! Enjoyed a glass of red to accompany my delicious pizza. The sausage spread at the bottom,  the flavors n sauce was in sync on  combination and the crust tied it perfectly together.  Shall be dreaming of this forever,  until next time Chicago!!!

A few weeks ago, I took my first trip to Chicago. From all of my friends, I heard that Lou Malnati's was the place to go for deep dish in Chi-town. I must say, it did not disappoint. The first night there, upon arrival, I picked up the "Lou" and took it back to the hotel. It hit the spot and was a great midnight snack. It was a slice of pizza heaven. So, the second night, we ordered and had the "Lou" delivered to the room. Finally, on my third night, I figured it'd be good to have it fresh so enjoyed the "Lou" at the restaurant and had an order of wings for good measure. So, so, so good.
Fantastic deep dish Chicago style pizza.  What a great treat. Pre ordering your pizza while you wait to be seated is a great idea.  Thanks for a great ending to a fun Chicago weekend.

Food is worth four stars, but we had an issue being seated. There were two parties of 14. They seated us and realized we were the wrong group and asked us to get up, go outside and wait longer. This wouldn't have been that big of an issue had it been handled a little more graciously. It was a bit harsh and without an apology. That being said, Lou Malnati's has a warm & inviting atmosphere, great pizza, and our server Brandon did an excellent job making sure we were taken care of during our meal.

First time trying deep dish pizzas in Chicago. The classic deep dish pizza definitely lived up to its name, very simple and straight forward, but I can't help but feel that there was something missing. The sauce was good and the lean sausage was excellent. I really enjoyed it but I wasn't super amazed. It's a great simple deep dish pizza though. The pizza chips (I think that's what it was called) were good to share. There were three dips- one garlicky, one creamy, and one like hummus. Those were quite nice with the freshly diced tomatoes on top.

Started with the calamari AFTER we reminded the server we ordered it. Lou Mulnati's is just ok. It comes with cold marinara sauce. You may want to ask for it to be warmed. Pizza is flavorful but I definitely prefer Giordano's over Lou Mulnati's. The salad with creamy lemon garlic dressing was unique. It was the bright spot of the meal. Part two, the food runner that brought our food to the table spilled my drink all over me. Accidents happen so that is not the issue. The issue is the spill was left on the floor until we were finished eating. The server, Samantha, even came back to the table and didn't say a word or get it cleaned up. The guy at the opposite table slipped. Then the buser came to clear the table and looked at me like, how did I make such a mess. Final straw, they didn't even remove the drink from the bill that was dumped all over me. Horrible,horrible, horrible, customer service with mediocre deep dish pizza.

In Chicago for a convention. Asked a waitress at a bar where we went for lunch about where to get Chicago pie and she said go to Malnati's. Long wait outside in the cold, but you get updates about where you are in line, the crowd outside is pretty friendly, and it didn't take too long. They start cooking your pie while you wait, so once we sat down I think it was out in about 15 minutes, right after salad. I haven't had a lot of Chicago pizza, but I really liked this stuff a lot. It was huge, you know, like a pizza casserole, but I have to say, the crust was surprisingly delicate and the flavors were all really well balanced. It looked like it was going to be just a big cheesy mess and it was-in the best possible way, but it wasn't over the top goop. Turned out to be a great night, sitting there having family style pizza with my coworkers and taking in the atmosphere of the place. I would definitely go here again. Very highly recommended.

Best Chicago style pizza IMO. Between Lou's and Giordano's, I don't think there's any competition. Lou's wins hands down. There are probably some smaller name shops that the locals know and love. For this out of towner, I won't be able to visit Chicago without going to Lou Malnati's. You already know the pizza is amazing. FYI, the sausage is not crumbled. Instead, it's a like a sheet of sausage that covers the whole pizza. I like it but I can imagine some would prefer the standard crumbled sausage. Just know that the pizza is very filling and takes upwards of 45 minutes to make. Have one of their surprisingly good salads while you wait. Just don't fill up and try to book a hotel with a fridge in your room so you can take the leftovers to go.

I was recommended here by a friend, but the pizza was not edible. It was not cooked fully and the servings were small for the price. Great staff at the State street location, she recommend other dishes for us to taste.
We love Lou Manati's pizza with Buttercrust. My kids are also fans of the Chocolate Chip pizza :)
This place changed my mind about Chicago style deep dish pizza! The wait is extremely long but the service, pizza, atmosphere are outstanding!

Very busy, we got there at 4 and the place was packed, and we waited 30 minutes. This is a good sign though! I like Lou Malnati's more and more each time I try their pizza. If you wanna go the classic Chicago route, go with Lou's classic.. (The one with sausage, extra cheese, etc) its sooo good! Their house salads are great, especially since you wait about 40 minutes for your pizza to come out.. its nice to have. Thin crust is very good as well.

This definitely made up for going to Pizza Uno's previously. What a difference!  We started with the stuffed spinach bread which led to a very good indication that the pizza was going to live up to expectations. This bread was delicious and the loaf had a similar crust to that of the pizza crust. Went with The Malnati Chicago Classic and was absolutely wowed by the flavour of the sausage, the flaky buttery crust, and the gooeyness of the cheese. Every single bite was delicious and it tasted just as good reheated the next day. We visited on a Saturday around lunch time and I am glad that we did because the place kept getting busier and busier. Our original plan was to go for dinner so this worked out much better since we didn't have to wait for a table. Service was excellent, we actually had two because one was in training and both were fantastic. I really wish they could deliver to Canada. Needless to say I am glad I have a great reason to keep visiting Chicago so I can also keep coming here for their deep dish pizza.
I've been eating at Lou's for so long I cannot give you an accurate number!  It's amazing, always has been amazing and is hands down, my favorite pizza of all time!

I always expect the same thing I go here, each time.  Oooooey, gooooey, delicious pizza.  Deep dish, winderful goodness.  I give 4-stars, why?  Sometimes its perfect, sometimes its 95% what I expect.   If you want deep dish, butter crust, and a sauce that is a balance of salty sweet, get involved.

Art of Pizza is the way to go for Chicago deep dish. Lou Malnati's has always been overcrowded and overhyped, with pizza that really lacks in flavor/texture, even for deep-dish standards. This is for tourists.
We loved it here. Kind of off the beaten path and not nearly as crowded as some of the other spots. Try the spinach bread!

I'm going right for it 5 stars.  For some reason people have had a hard time believing that I came to Chicago for pizza. What's even less reasonable is the fact that I believe it was worth the 2 hour plane ride from New York. This pizza was unlike the traditional New York pizza I'm used to. The biggest contrast is obviously the thickness of the pie, but what else is interesting is that it is constructed with the cheese on the bottom and the sauce is on top. The sauce was absolutely packed with flavor and chunks of tomato offering the bite needed to compete with the various textures present. The crust was buttery, flakey and delicious. What was truly impressive however, was how it remained crispy under the substantial weight of pizza filling. For me the real seller was the significant presence of mozzarella cheese oozing out of every bite. Finally, there was a pleasant surprise, a layer of sausage underneath the sauce. I didn't even realize what was happening until the second bite. All in all I must tip my hat to this mid west treasure. Mr. Lou Malnatti, wherever you are, you have earned my respect and admiration, thank you sir!

The best deep dish pizza, ever. I know everyone has their preference but after trying several different places in Chicago, Lou's is the official winner. The pizza is perfection. From crust to the sausage, everything is exceptional. Salads are also very good. Much better than a little salad you would expect at most pizza places. The one we had reminded me of the maggianos house salad with prosciutto and Gorgonzola. The perfect accompaniment to pizza.

My friends and I shared the Chicago Classic with additional garlic, spinach, and mushrooms, and it ended up being the best deep dish pizza I had ever had. The crust was the perfect density: firm on the bottom, and crunchy on the edges. The sausage was juicy, flavorful, and probably the best sausage on a pizza I've ever tasted. The toppings were arranged well: the sausage was laid out in strips, and every bite was packed with flavor. Mushrooms. Garlic. Sausage. Spinach. Cheeeeeese. Mmmm!  We ordered a calamari appetizer which was slightly above average -- the chunks of squid were large, but each bite seemed slightly soggy. While we were intimidated by the large crowd assembled at the entrance when we arrived on a Fri night, we were pleasantly surprised by the ease of being seated. The waitress took our pizza order in advance, as the pizza takes 45 minutes to cook, so by the time we were seated 25 minutes later, we only had a small wait for our food. Additionally, we devoured the free pizza samples while we waited. Lou's is MUCH better than Giordano's in my opinion, mostly because I've been underwhelmed by Giordano's soggy crust. I'm already dreaming of my next visit to Lou's!
I cannot put into words exactly how greatly awesome the pizza is here. Their unique crust is top notch.

When in Chicago do as the locals do and go for the deep dish pizza it is worth the wait.  Not such a fan of their NY style.  We love the new Lou Malnatis in Lincoln Square.  It has a great indoor outdoor environment for nice days and nights.

I love Lou Malnati's pizza!! Deep dish and thin crust, you can't go wrong! This place is always busy so plan accordingly and call ahead! The pizza sizes are smaller than normal and more expensive but it is so good! The Lou Malnati's sweet vinaigrette dressing is to DIE FOR!!!!
Hands down my favorite deep dish pizza. Perfectly balanced ingredients. Make sure to ask for the butter crust! Their thin crust is also pretty good. Share a Lou's salad for an appetizer!

This place was good. The pizza was not anything exceptional. But for a late night meal it serves he purpose. Our server was young, uninformed and seemed uninterested. Other than that I've had better pizza at places like Bacino's on Wacker Dr. (which I think is closed) but not far from here.
Best deep dish pizza I have ever had. Was my 1st time eating real Chicago deep dish. Ate at Pizzaria Due as well and Lou Malnati's was better. Love their tomato sauce.
This place was really pretty terrific.   If you like pizza and want an authentic Chicago deep dish, try the Malnati Chicago classic.   After you have an orgasm, you can thank me.
If you want true Chicago style deep dish pizza, do not go elsewhere.  Lou's is the very best.  None compare.
This pizza is truly a staple. Chicagoans love Lou's. Deep dish here is so satisfying and well-prepared. Don't get annoyed about the wait because trust me - it's worth it!

On a quest to find the best deep dish pizza in Chi-Town... we stumbled upon Lou Malnati's. OK not really stumbled, more like every single local we asked told us about the infamous "LUMANNITI'S" (what we originally thought was the name- LOL).  after several recommendations, we knew we had to try it.  Lou Malnati's pizza heavenly. I don't have to explain how great the atmosphere was, or how our waiter was so friendly and pleasant-- the pizza alone is reason you should come.

This place is happening during the noontime. Seems like an efficiently running place. Someone to check you in when you first walk in.  They even have you pre-order your pizza because of the cook to order process the deep dish pizza.  You'll get a confirmation text once you've checked in. However when I got my text to say they were ready and when I actually sat down was 15 mins. (Seems like they should only text you when your table is actually ready) You can tell the staff is doing their best during the rush.  The pizza sausage and sauce is extremely tame.

I know people don't normally go to a pizza parlor to eat salad. However, you must try the Malnati's salad - OMG my mouth is watering just thinking about it - with the house dressing. You would not repend, if you don't like olives, just set them aside and enjoy the crispy bacon. My favorite pie is the Lou - who knew - for as much as I like meat, the vegetarian pizza won my heart. However, I eat the Malnati's Chicago Classic just as often - the sausage, the extra cheese, the tomato sauce on the buttery crust is one of the best Chicago style pizza in town.

Best pizza in the City of Chicago.  Thin or thick crust, absolute best.  We go for a pizza at least twice a month (more if I can help it!).  I am a huge fan of Lou's.  Thank you for great service and awesome pizza.

Amazing deep dish pizza. Try the "Lou". It is worth the wait. The server let us know up front that it would take 30-40 minutes for the pizza to be cooked and be served, which was great as we ordered an appetizer, bruschetta, also excellent. Very crowded for a Tuesday evening. The food was incredible. Service was great. The only reason this isn't a five star review is the tables are really close together and if you have a large group seated near you, you can pretty much forget about a quiet dinner.

Food was great, services were nice and friendly. Although they were really busy, our waiter was always making sure to see if we needed anything. This is the meatiest cheesiest most satisfying pizza I've had. And the malnati  salad is  bomb.com . Defiantly recommend this place!!
The pizza is delicious and the service is great. I will recommend this restaurant to all pizza lovers.

I just tried this place..and let me tell you.. it was delicious!!! Wow!! The classic was to die for, this just became my favorite pizza place.  My friends that were visiting from SF tried it first and they loved it, I can't believe I didn't know this place existed!!! Was I living under a rock?? Well not anymore!!!

*Update 1/4/16: I want to thank the business for their great customer service. Their social media person and store manager both followed up with me even though I had given them 4 stars! Also, the store manager offered my a gift card for our troubles. Very nice of them. I look forward to trying you out again. I was determined to eat some Chicago deep dish on my most recent trip. Our shuttle driver said that Lou Malnati's was the place to go. I also overheard a fellow conference goer talking about his experience and he recommended to go here. I was originally planning on a different pizza shop, but changed my mind after hearing this place recommended twice. My mom and I walked over from our hotel and it was quite a nice walk. It was not busy when we arrived, but quickly picked up by the time we were being seated. They gave us the option of ordering our pizza in advance so we would have less time to wait at our table. Note: you only order the pizza, not additional items such as salads.  We were seated upstairs after about 15 minutes. Not bad. Our food came out very quickly. I find it odd that the employees need to cut up and serve the pizza. We could have really done it ourselves. I think this slows down service quite a bit. More on that later. The salad was fine. The pizza was pretty good. It wasn't as deep as I expected. Also, it didn't seem to have as much cheese as I am used to with deep dish. We thought it was good, but not spectacular. We both prefer the deep dish in my hometown. The major issue of our visit came with trying to get out of there! Our waitress took forever to get us our bill. We were just sitting and sitting. We see her delivering pizzas and taking others, but completely neglecting us. When she came with the bill, I had my card in hand for her to take cause I was worried about how long it would take for her to get back to us. Oh man. We were both very disappointed with the time we had to wait.
Frankly I found it over-hyped. I would prefer Pequod over Lou anyday. I feel the seasoning disappointed us here. But the ambience here is definitely good.

A new Lou Malnati's opened near my house on Lincoln and Montrose. I'm still relatively new to the area and I've been told LM is the best place for deep dish. I'm not a fan of deep dish really, but Lou Malnati's was so good, it may have converted me...at least if I get it there! Plus, the waitstaff was helpful, fun and _fast_! The best part?  We had enough pizza to stuff four people, had some drinks and the bill was lower than most tabs our group runs up.

Best Chicago Pizza. All others will be judged against this standard. Fresh ingredients. Their sauce is not sweet. Sausage is issued out as a patty and not chunks, so every bite is amazing. Seriously, I've only met a few Chicagoans that do not rate this as the finest example of deep dish pizza, and those people are crazy.  Get the pizza uncut if you get delivery, so it stays hot and prevents the sauce from getting the crust soggy.
Fantastic deep dish! Love the butter crust which was nice and crispy. Also loved the bruschetta and thin crust pepperoni. All around good experience.

Had the Lou deep dish small size and it's good! Man I was so stuffed after eating it. It's good size for 1 really hungry person w/ a huge appetite or two people with a regular sized appetite. Bf liked the chicken wings alot too.

We are visiting from California, and wanted to try the best Chicago pizza there is!  Well this place didn't disappoint!!!  It was the best pizza I have ever eaten!  Joe and Alex at the bar were amazing!  I wish this place was in California!

THE GREATEST PIZZA ON PLANET EARTH!!! If you don't agree with me than you HATE America. I'm told the NSA gives out samples at JFK International Airport and if a traveler turns it down or takes a bite and tosses it they are put on the terrorist watchlist. I can not confirm this in a court of law but I was told by a reliable source.

Giordanos? NO. Pizza Uno or Dos? NO. Lou Malnati's? YES!   You have come to the right place, the clear winner in Chicago deep dish. This location has got to be the smallest however... so know that goin in for wait times.  I would probably go to the newer and bigger one at 1120 N State Street. Or really MAKE a reservation if you can! Why is this the best in Chicago? The sauce on the pizza RUNS LAPS around the others....dough is fantastic...cheese is lovely....and the experience is great all around.  Pizza is about the sauce and the dough...toppings are what you make of it.  Lou takes home the Chicago crown...end of story.

No doubt Lou Malnati's Pizza is the best for me but I'm giving this specific restaurant location one star because they didn't only failed to provide silverwares with my family dinner order but also failed to send them after I called immediately after delivery. Almost an hour passed so I give up. How do they expect my family to eat salad without silverwares???? Shameful. I have visitors that are so disappointed.

The food and atmosphere were great. Comfortable setting, unique building and floor plan.  Why 2 stars you ask? Service.  We don't like waiting to be seated but for a place as popular as this, it's unavoidable.  They let you "order" when you arrive so your pie will be ready shortly after you're seated.  Nope. It took an hour and a half from the time we ordered our pizza until we had it at our table.   We told the server when we received our pies we wanted to order the dessert. He said, "Great! Should be ready in 15 minutes!"  45 minutes later, after sitting with a bone dry glass, reminding him several times for a refill, we still had no dessert.  Now, a lot of that can be blamed on the kitchen... But we noticed everyone else's service speeds around us. We must have been special.  He would walk back to the drink station, be back there for 5+ minutes and walk out with one drink for another table. "Oh yeah! You need a refill? What was it again?" Our total experience took us nearly 3 hours.  It wouldn't have seemed so bad if we had refills or communication on what's taking so long. Good food. Unacceptable service.

Been going several years and have not had a bad pizza yet. And while waiting for the pie, salads are fresh,,delish. Only way to experience this pizza is in house, carry outs just don't compare. Wait staff always quick and friendly.
Great pizza, I had the deep dish Lou's and my husband had the thin crust sausage. Both were very good. You have to try the Gold Coast Old Fashion....absolutely fabulous.
Only place for Chicago deep dish. We have a carry out place in our area and everything is hot and fresh.

Tried the Lou and Chicago classic. Both were very good! The Chicago classic would be a must for meat lovers and the Lou for veggie lovers. Nevertheless, both were great to try. The butter crust is very yummy!  The service here is a bit slow though. Took about 20-30 minutes to get our pizza on a slow day.

This is the only deep dish to get in chicago. My roommate and I live literally across the street from Giordano's, and still order Lou's to be delivered instead. The buttercrust is my lifeblood, so good.

Our Uber driver recommended this place for deep dish pizza. We were expecting a line, but got seated pretty quickly, and even though the place was relatively packed, our waitress was extremely attentive and very quick. They noted that the pizzas usually take around 30-40 minutes, so she took our order immediately, and the pizza came out extremely fast.  Both SO and I have never tried deep dish pizza, and unfortunately weren't super impressed. Since this is our first time trying, and it was okay. It definitely wasn't bad, but it wasn't great-- the cheese was chewy and it felt like everything was just completely thrown on top of each other. Might have to try it again!

Came here at 9am at on a sunday and still had to wait 45 mins-1 hour to get seated.  Luckily we were able to order while we waited.  We got the the Malnati Chicago classic with Lou's lean sausage, some extra cheese and vine-ripened tomato sauce on Buttercrust.  The butter crust was AMAZING! The night before I was disappointed with with Gino's East crust but this did not disappoint!  It was so cheesy and juicy!   I was in heaven!  We also got the Chocolate chip pizza.  A freshly baked chocolate chip cookie prepared in a deep dish pizza pan, topped with vanilla bean ice cream and whipped cream.  There was WAY more ice cream than we expected but we were happy none the less.  This is what chicago pizza should be!
Best pizza in Chicago! We love there family driven attitude! Delivery is fast and efficient. The pizza is pure Chicago!

What the heck?!? Since Zachary's, Paxti's and Little Star are my favorite pizza places, one of the things high on my list of things to do while in Chicago was to have Chicago deep-dish pizza, and according to Yelp this is one of the best places to go. So we went, at lunchtime on a weekday and it was *packed*. There is very little space to wait for a table, but we figured it was worth it. We ordered The Lou. But when the pizza came, the crust tasted like Bisquick, the cheese wasn't tasty, the toppings were just OK, and the whole thing was so not what I was expecting. Maybe we went to the wrong place? Maybe I don't like Chicago Style Deep Dish Pizza after all, I just like Bay Area Style Chicago Style Deep Dish Pizza.
Yummy deep dish pizzas! Our salad was very average. Good ambience and good drinks! The pizzas are pretty famous so definitely try it out while you're in the area!
Great food... pasta is a must and their deep dish is to kill for!!! Friendly service and wonderful environment!

I was contacted by customer service for Lou Malnati's and by the General Manager, they both apologized for our experience that night. David the Manager was kind enough to call me and discuss our experience. He was very gracious. It is hard for for restaurants to accomodate the tastes or palate of every diner that walks in the door.For example all of us would not be able to agree to the what the best tasting pizza is. Malnati's is different than what we are used to. That said we discussed the service experience and will give their place another shot when we are back in Chicago.

Deep dish is not my favorite kind of pizza, but if I'm going to eat it... I'm eating it at Lou's. This place does deep dish, best. There isn't too much crust, too much cheese or too much of anything. It has just the right amount of each ingredient to make sure you can taste and enjoy each and every one. Since we were starving, and a pizza takes 40+ minutes, we ordered some hot wings to hold us over while we waited. Great decision! These are some of the best wings anywhere. Yum!

I don't get it, with all the talk about Lou's - and with the outcome - it sounds like people like the trendy ambience - but that won't make up for the mediocre pizza.  The pizza chips were a lot better than the pizza - they were crunchy and the artichoke and the garlic hummus were tasty. I wish I had tried another pizza place, because for now, I prefer "Masa of Echo Park"'s pizza Waay more - which is a bit disappointing as I wanted to have some great Chicago pizza IN the windy city - Service was nice and polite, and the look of Lou Malnati's is clean and on the hip side. It was very crowded every time I passed by, which made me think twice - as I noticed there was also a long line for the Grand Luxe, Starbucks and Chipotle - that's gotta tell you somethin'

The pizza was great, but coming from the east, I can't say I love deep dish pizza.  Everyone there was super friendly and the service was good, but it did take a while to get the pizza.  They were not super speedy.

I highly recommend the sausage deep dish. You won't regret it. They put a complete layer of sausage as opposed to bits and pieces. It was surprising and delicious.  Their pizza is great. Their desserts are lacking. Go somewhere else if you want dessert.

I've been going to this location since the 80s but hadn't been there since the South Loop location opened. What a disappointment. The service, not the pizza.   We actually thought the flavor was slightly better than South Loop; however, the pizza I order at 5:40--that was supposed to be ready at 6:25--wasn't ready until 6:50. My pizza orders usually take 35 minutes.  It's like a science.  Occasionally when they're busy and are running behind, they apologize, but it never takes longer than an additional five minutes. At 6:30, they apologized and told me me that my small pizza was actually going to be a medium pizza (at no additional charge) and that my wait wouldn't be much longer.  Neither one of those things turned out to be true.  The pizza was small and the delay was almost 25 minutes. I wasn't actually interested in a larger size--but why say that and then not deliver?  However, The real problem was the delay.  Your estimate for pick up times should not be that far off. Ordering the pizza was supposed to be a quick dinner solution after a late evening pediatrician appointment on a school night--minutes count. Still the best pizza, but service matters too.  They used to be the best at both.

I am a fan. THERE IS SO MUCH CHEESE. This little baby may look small but it sinks like a savory rock in you tummy. Get ready to eat. I like this place because they are fairly quick and it is NOT oily. A lot of other places manipulate their flavor into "good" because they put a Sh*t ton of butter and oil on the food. Nope, not here. just sauce, cheese, and a crispy and soft crust. I may not go again because i personally dont like pizza as much as i should. however. it was pretty good.

Deep dish butter crust Pizza was amazing.  The 3 cheese bread was light and crispy to perfection!  Came in on a Sunday around 12:30pm after a nice walk from the park. Plenty of room and service. Will definitely come back.

Deep dish pizza excellence.  My go to for visitors and for our home when we eant deep dish pizza.  Love love love the pizza both in restaurant and even the frozen available to purchase and go.  It beats the others for deep dish and the thin is great too!

For the sake of your taste buds, please try the spinach and garlic deep dish. It's SOOO worth not being able to kiss anyone for a week after consumption. Freshest ingredients without a bellyache. Team Lous for life!

I'm a big fan of deep dish pizza and have frequented a few in the area.  Lou's just didn't do it for me. We had the classic and it was a little bland for my liking. Very crowded so clearly it's popular. My stomach was upset after  (TMI sorry) so that definitely knocked off a star. Bartender was quick and overall service is good.

I consulted Yelp for the best Chicago deep dish pizza and Lou Malnati's was the answer. We came here on a Saturday night and it was packed, which was expected. While you wait, you can put in your pizza order, since it takes a while to make, so we did this. When we got seated (about 30 minutes later) our pizza was at our table the same time our beer arrived. We got the traditional Chicago pizza, and it was everything I expected. Definitely worth a visit when in Chicago!

I took a poll among my friends to help me decide where to get deep dish pizza while I was visiting Chicago in October. I heard the same answer repeatedly - Lou's! We were seated quickly and our waiter was very friendly. We ordered our pizza and beers, and our waiter warned us that the pizzas are made to order and do take some time. I think our wait was close to an hour, but I amused myself with editing photos from our Chicago exploring that morning. However, I would consider the fact that Lou's would not be a good lunch option for those working close by as it can take some time. I selected the "Lou" personal, and my husband ordered The Malnati Chicago Classic™. Though hard to believe, I think this may have been my first true deep dish experience. It was definitely soupier than I had expected (is that normal?), but I thought the pizza was really tasty.

The pizza was alright but would have been much better if it warm. I placed an advance order for delivery 2 hours later at 7p. The driver didn't arrive until 7:15 and had only brought half the order. He said he would be back in 10 minutes with the rest. Thirty minutes later, I called asking for an updated status and was asked if I still wanted the rest of the order--um, yes? I explicitly told the driver I wanted it. They only offered to either refund that part of the order or let me keep waiting. It has now been 45 minutes of waiting, an hour past the scheduled time, my original delivery is cold and I was told the driver was leaving the door 15 minutes ago. Poor customer service for delivery. Be wary, even for simple two item delivery.

#128 Knowing that most people expect the Giordano's experience when they visit Chicago, I wanted to treat my friends to something different.  I remember Leona's from when I was a kid in the North Side off Belmont, but things have changed in the last few decades, so we thought we should try Lou Malnati's Pizzeria--and it was a great choice! The line was a bit long, but I always say, "This is a great sign that the food and service are good..."  And, once again, I was right. The pie was so thick and delicious.  I am used to Zachary's and Star while in the Bay Area, so this reminded me exactly what Chicago deep dish is all about.  Thick, thicker, thickest... The pie comes so steamy hot that it almost looks dangerous to eat.  The sauce is piled high on top of the multiplicity of cheeses underneath the mile high other toppings.  One piece is really a full meal.  My group ordered appetizers to start and I thought this might be a bad idea, as I remember how filling these Chicago pizzas can be.  But, alas...hungry people with BIG eyes. Everything was super amazing--but all I really remember is the pizza.  I will dream about that pie for years to come.   Thank you so much Lou Malnati's for making my trip complete with that PERFECT DEEP DISH. Stephani Smiles for Lou Malnati's Pizzeria ;)
Lou Mals is the BEST.  I won't order anything else when it comes to Pizza!
I know people are big fans of this place but it's just OK to me. Reasonably good quality but not very exciting. Not much else to say about it.

Despite nothing about a deep dish seemed like a good idea to us, my husband and I couldn't let ourselves leave the city without giving one a try. We chose Lou's for its consistently positive reviews. We came in for an early dinner with two friends and shared a medium sized Malnati's special.  The pizza was made to order and took about 30 mins to be served. The Malnati's  special consisted of lean sausage, fresh tomato sauce, mozzarella cheese, and buttered crust. Other had claimed that the buttered crust was what made Lou's stood out from the rest of deep dish chains in the city. From our tasting, I thought the crust tasted like stale, crusty corn bread. The filling was fine. Sausage was sausage, sauce was sauce, cheese was cheese. Definitely not worth wasting an entire meal for this. I will eat my papa john's, Pizza Hut, dominoes over Lou's any day.  Overall - Chicago deep dish way overrated. NY style all the way.
Bomb deep dish pizza. We had the traditional Chicago pie and the Lou's special. Chicago did not let me down.

We ordered pepperoni with bunch of veggies as toppings, but when our pizza came to our table, it only had pepperoni and olives as toppings. We informed the waiter and he first asked if we wanted to wait for our correct order, which will take another 30min. We already had waited over 30min to be seated, so we said we would rather not and we just ate the pizza with just pepperoni and olives. We usually like our pizzas with lots of toppings, so we didn't enjoy it as much, but it was good! Later on, the manager came to our table and apologized for the mistake. He gave us a 50% discount. Although we were a bit disappointed about the wrong order, we were satisfied by the service.

Since Pizzeria Due went downhill many years ago, this is the best chicago deep dish pizza source. Terrific fried calamari too. Always nice and efficient staff. Needs a better craft beer selection though.

Nov.11,2015 Schaumburg location. Ate at Lou's last night with the golfing  Buddy's and enjoyed EVERYTHING ... Ordered the LOU's house salad and  A Butter Crusted,  sausage/garlic deep dish .  One of the best dinners I've had in a while.  My  family generally order pizza for takeout at Lou's and is always good  But to have it served at your table  Directly from the oven is GREAT !! You can't go wrong with Lou's....

Growing up in Chicago... you try many many different type of deep dish pizzas.  I used to really like Bacino's but I really like Lou Malnati's.  Giordano's.. blegh... haven't tried the Gino's pizzas yet. This place is a bit of a wait... the back room is noisy.. tried to take some work calls but I had to go outside and stand.  I would recommend you ask for a table and pre order your pizza.  Please keep in mind that each slice is super heavy.. so I would guess you probably can't even eat more than a slice (if you are petite like me). Got the sausage, pepperoni, mushroom, black olive, and spinach garlic blend.. it was yummy.  Oh.. I also got the minestrone soup.. not that great. And no... there really isn't anything healthy on the menu.

Service, amazing. Pizza, classic, best chain pizza you'll EVER eat. Apps, and salads, SO good or will surprise you. Beer selection solid, slightly lacking compared to a brew pub, but solid overall.  Place has solid management, great service and an amazing corporate team, love that they are bringing their pride and quality outside of Chicago Land!

So called "the best" Chicago pizza in CHICAGO. We sat and waited 25-30 minutes (after pre-ordering) and another table that got here 10 minutes after we got here just got their pizza. That's just plain RUDE. I brought it up to the waitress and she didn't have anything to say. We only came here because friends told us to. This place is hyped up and is not what it is expected to be. Bad service and a long wait is what you're getting yourself into. Sorry, not worth it.

If you're looking for great pizza in Chicago, you're in the right spot. I recommend eating this pizza for dinner because if you eat it for lunch you'll need to take a nap! I love the deep dish cheese.

What does a girl do when she's in Chicago for a day, but hasn't had a chance to try deep dish pizza?  I stopped by Gino's first and they only served four slices -- taking 40 minutes to make.  I had to catch a flight, so I really wanted a quick deep dish.  Luckily, Lou's was there for me! They have a personal size (practically a meal) for $6.  It took about 20 minutes to make, which was pretty quick.  It came in piping hot.  I was eating it on my way to the airport in a cab, but it didn't make it any less delicious.  It was cheesy, with chunks of tomato and a crunchy crust.  I highly recommend if you're in a rush.  It was also not that messy, able to eat with a fork if you tried.  Also -- loved that crushed red paper flakes and parm cheese was included.  Thank you Lou for being my first real deep-dish pizza experience in Chi-town!

Disclaimer: This was my first experience with Chicago pizza. My group of 3 arrived just before 5 on a Saturday and was seated right away. The lobby was sardine level packed when we left, so I feel we got lucky. Our waiter kindly reviewed the menu with us newbs and recommended a salad as an appetizer to start since the pizza would take about 45 minutes. We mistook that to mean all appetizers were quick and ordered the wings, which took about 25 minutes. It was okay in the end though, because the wings were incredible! I highly recommend them. We got the Malnati classic, and it was a really, really good pie from the crust to the cheese. It wasn't as thick as I imagined, but I don't think I could have finished my two slices otherwise. Overall, Lou's was a fine experience from service to food and I would happily return.

It's tough to compare Lou's to Giordano's because I feel that they're almost different types of pizza. I tried Giordano's first, which I was very impressed with. But I kept having people suggest I'd try Lou's so I was expecting it to be way better or something. The pricing is a bit cheaper here and there are more size options, which is nice esp if you want a deep dish to yourself. My bf and I decided on a medium (6 slices, which is equivalent to a small at Giordano's). We did half of the Chicago classic and half of the Lou's special. The waiter warned us that the wait would be about 35 minutes for the pie to be ready, but I'm sure it took almost close to an hour. The tomato sauce here is a little more wet and the crust is definitely not as thick. I liked the Chicago classic better than the lou's. The fresh tomato on the lou's special made it a little more tangy. The butter crust was very tasty and easy to eat. I honestly can't decide between the two after trying them each just once. Therefore, I'll be back again!

I have never gone into the restaurant to eat Lou's but have ordered it in at least a handful of times since I moved here. And it STILL beats all the other deep dish pizzas I've had (3 other popular places). Hands down one of the most delicious things I've ever eaten. The Lou is my favorite by far.

Get the deep dish with the sausage! While here in Chicago I tried another deep dish but this one won hands down!  The thin crust isn't to bad and was enjoyable.  Would suggest to friends.  The pizza does take 30mins to make so if you are hungry order a snack.  We went with the mozzarella sticks.  Very good!   We were only two but there was a wait for the other parties.  I imagine this place gets super jammed on the weekends. All and all very yum!

Dare I say BEST CHICAGO Pizza! I'm new to the area (only a year in Chicago) so I think I can give my honest opinion. This is my "go-to" when exposing out-of-town guests to Chicago Pizza.  AND, get a bottle of the amazing salad dressing to take home. Yes I said it, get a salad - a little green to go with your pizza. LOL Run don't walk here when you want pizza, there's multiple convenient locations

Awesome pizza and cheddar cheese balls..i order a diet coke with a little ice and it was amazing the ice was frozen it kept my soda at perfect temperature. I recommend having ice with your drink if you want it to be cold.

Best pizza to have it.The deep dish pizzas take nearly an hour to make, so they would like you to order as you check in.  Nice ambiance. I had tried Salad also once, which was great. Good place to visit atleast once when in chicago.

Their pizza is the best in Chicago. The buttery crust is so delicious. I tried both Lou Malnati and Giordanos and this one beats Giordanos no doubt. The crust was buttery, had the right amount of cheese, the sauce was flavorful. I would come back to Lou Malnati's the next time I'm here. We got the sausage with green peppers added to it. Next time I will probably do Pepperoni based on the other reviews. The only reason I knocked off a star is that their cutlery was dirty and when we told the server she didn't apologize and she almost seemed annoyed at us for asking her to get us a new plate and fork. There was sauce stuck on it! I'm just glad the pizza that came made up for it! We had it with a spinach salad as well. Ps. A small is more than enough for 4 people to share unless you are very hungry!

I love Lou Mal's! I order it way too much which is why my BMI is over 25. It's hands down the best deep dish in Chicago and don't let anyone tell you otherwise or I will slap them.  Even the thin crust has grown on me through the years to the point where it might be my favorite.  Anytime an out-of-towner asks for a pizza recommendation, it's always Lou's.

So disclaimer, I am not the biggest deep dish fan. NY style is more my preference. That being said, when in Chicago I eat Chicago food.  We ordered a basic pepperoni deep dish pizza and even before eating it the smell was driving me crazy.  After diving in everything was delicious; from the buttery crust up to the pepperoni. What really stood out was their sauce and mozzarella though. This pizza was stacked with cheese and the sauce was so good. I wish I could make sauce like this. We will be back.

After listening to the hype, I had to try Lou Malnati's pizza.  Well, it was o.....k.  Nothing to write home about.  I found it to be a little under-seasoned and sparse with the meat on the actual pizza.  I prefer Pequod's or Giardano's over LM.

Very very good Pizza. My party split the sausage deep dish biggest size pizza they had. The service was pretty good. We also enjoyed the cookie pizza for dinner and that is a must!! Go here it was a nice environment but try to show up before 5 on the weekends beacuse it gets filled with people in line.

My first deep dish in Chicago. Wow. I mean I'm from the real pizza capital of the US, New Haven, but Chicago deep dish is a whole different game. This isn't your chain pizza (at least across the rest of the states like Dominos, Pizza Hut, etc). It was a great atmosphere and place to eat a pie and watch the important sporting event of the day. I had the Malnati Chicago Classic™ and boy was the Lou's lean sausage good with the extra cheese on Buttercrust.™ You must get the Buttercrust. That being said, I'm still not sure how nutritional facts are not a part of pizzas across the US, but that's the pizza EMPIRE striking down any regulation. Here are the nutritional facts for the LARGE(ST) pie I ordered: Serving Size (g): 271, Servings Per Container: 8, Calories: 730, Calories From Fat: 390, Total Fat (g): 44, Saturated Fat (g): 17, Trans Fat (g): 0.5, Cholesterol (mg): 90, Sodium (mg): 900, Carbohydrates (g): 50, Dietary Fiber (g): 1, Sugars (g): 2, Protein (g): 35. HOLY CRAP. Each SLICE is 730 calories. I had four of the 8 the large came with ... yeah, that's 3600 mg of Sodium. 200 g of Carbs. At least I got my 140 g of Protein? Haha, yeah just some side commentary on the lack of nutritional facts on pizza. No wonder we're so fat as a country.  I digress, check out Lou's. I too love pizza regardless and per some recommendations Lou's was great and Pequod's should be the next I check out. Cheers!

I have been the biggest fan for years. However in the past few weeks I have had nothing but issue with this location. It all started several weeks ago when I had placed a very large order. When it showed up it was late cold and incorrect. I called the restaurant to let them know I was very disappointed. At the time I call the woman I spoke with told me they were so sorry and would credit my account. In fact that is not what happened at all. Instead of crediting me they charged me twice. I have spoken with several different managers at the restaurant . They have told me that they can't access that one single day on there company records. They can see every day of the year just not October 7th. With that being said I have tried to be understanding. One of the managers was very nice  and for all the inconvenience offered me a free meal this past weekend. We were having people over and I took him up on the offer. Unfortunately when the order arrived It was not hot and incorrect. Fast forward 3 days and I called to see if we had found any resolution to the overcharging issue I also wanted them to know the the order they had sent me was less then satisfactory. I was put on the phone w a "manager ' that was rude basically implied I was making this all up. When I told him I was simply trying to resolve an issue that has been ongoing for over  a month. I have still not been credited $180 zero communication from the restaurant. If the owner of this local happens to see this review please reply. I'm really trying to resolve this issue however I will not just sweep this under the rug and except thus as a loss. REPLYING BACK FROM THE FOLLOW UP : it has been well over a week since I have spoken with the district manager. When I spoke with him I told him I was willing to take store credit. I did this because it seemed as if it would take forever to resolve my issue. I was told that they would send me a gift card in the mail in the sum of $200. It's been way over a week and I have received nothing.. So for the record nothing has been resolved. It seems as if the ball has been dropped again!
Fantastic deep dish pizza. If you come to Chicago it's a must eat before leaving!
Amazing deepdish. Friendly staff.

I was here on a short weekend. Before my flight we had lunch here for pizza.  I'm not a deep dish fan so while I liked the pizza I would pick a Chicago dog. I'm giving it 3 stars because it's not for me but I can definitely appreciate them for their culture.

A must when you're in Chicago.  The difference between Lou's and gio's is that Lou's is a thick piZza with toppings on top whereas gio's is like lasagna essentially with all the toppings in the middle. Make sure you get the butter crust!!! Pizza takes forty five minutes to cook.  Lou's salad is delicious. The thin pizza is also really delicious too!!!  Butter crust!!!!!

I made it a point to try Giordano's, Pizano's and Lou Malnati's and I have to say Lou's was my favorite Deep Dish out of all 3 pizzerias. I ordered the Malnati Chicago Classic it stood out to me because I could taste the various ingredients put into the pizza. The sauce was not too over powering and the buttery crust was delicious I didn't leave any on my plane and I am notorious for leaving my crusts behind. We also ordered their Caesar salad and the small bowl can feed about 4 people, it's huge!
Love it. Some of the best pizza in Chicago. Deep dish is where it's at. Strangely large layers of sausage if you order it, so avoid that topping unless you LOVE sausage.

We have been here before and really loved the pizza and service.  This time everything was just a bit off.  The wait wasn't bad for our table, we pre-ordered our pizza as they recommend, we enjoyed a bottle of wine but when we were finally sat it seemed to take forever for our pizza to come out.  The biggest disappointment was that it wasn't that warm bubbly pizza we remembered, the cheese was chewy/cold.  Not sure I will come back, too sad from our first fantastic experience.
