I'm not one of these cats that try and break down the texture of crust n pepperoni n ish; or the robustness of the tomatoes. If the food is good then no need to put it to a science yo. With that said your boy opted for the deep dish pepperoni and I'll say this, I approve. I got the 9" because I got the build of a king so a king size portion is what I'll take. I've had deep dish from other places outside Chicago and I must say I'm happy I took the trip. The pepperoni spicy, the tomato sauce choonkie, the cheese mad cheesy, and my favorite part the crust perfectly crisp on the edges and chewy on the inside. On some real ish tho your boy was reconsidering getting a 9" (wild pause) because I was ready to tap by the 3rd slice. I came on and empty stomach and still almost had trouble finishing. Needles to say I'm no quitter and handled my thug thizzle like a true g. If you like white iPhones n ish or enjoy ballads by Drake then they got a 6" that might satisfy your personal needs too. Overall this place is great; it could get a five star review, but; my experience with deep dish is kinda limited ya know? They also have a full menu with all types of Italian dishes that looked appetizing but I ain't go there for that. If you ever in Chi Town and want an authentic deep dish experience check out Lou Malnati. Aight oneski

I went to visit Chicago for the first time last weekend for my BFF's bachelorette and I was bombarded by recommmendations to this place. Now I know why. It was my first time eating a deep dish pizza. We ordered the Malnati Chicago Classic and The "Lou" i liked the "Lou" but i loved the Classic! so much flavor and pizza to the bite. Two slices and I was so full. we also had the calamari for an appetizer. It was very well cooked. I thoroughly enjoyed my experience here. the service was good and the food was great.

The most authentic deep dish pizza in town. Usually pizza for delivery and take out tastes bad once you get home but lou malnatis always taste just as good as in the restaurant. The ingredients are so fresh and good. I recommend getting pepperoni tomatoes basil mushroom and peppers. It really is phenomenal!

Speaking as a true Chicago gal that loves her deep dish, Lou Malnati's can suck it! If you want real Chicago deep dish go to Pequod's pizza down on Clybourn. The crust is buttery and crunchy and the suace is divine! Lou Malnati's has soggy crust and the pizza suave taste like SpaghettiOs suace. Make sure when you got to Pequod's tell'em I sent you and order a sausage and onion pie!

The wait time was a bit much for take-out, but it seemed longer since the only waiting area was occupied and the hosts weren't much welcoming. However, the deep dish pizza was amazing. Could've used a bit more salt and pepper. Overall, it was an amazing first time experience at a deep dish restaurant.

My first experience trying a deep dish Chicago pizza and I was not disappointed! We went back for seconds before flying home.  They delivered it to our hotel room so we never got the dine in experience. We ordered the traditional deep dish Chicago pizza both times. The cheese was amazing! The butter crust... drooling!!! We also ordered calamari and that wasn't as good but I blame it on delivery. The sauce it came with was yummy. Next time we are in town we will be dinning in.
I'm from Santa Barbara California so this was first deep dish pizza when I visited Chicago. WOW! Did I overeat! Amazing food - thank you !

This is a never disappointing place to eat. I went to lunch there and had their lunch special; salad, drink, and personal deep dish. It was great. I love that I can go there during my lunch break at work and still have a deep dish freshly made. This is an iconic pizzeria in Chicago and if you have never had it please do yourself a favor and treat yourself to a Lou Malnatis deep dish. The buttery crust, melted mozzarella and fresh toppings will delight you. I have never been to a Lou Malnatis location that had bad staff. I always come out of there feeling happy.

Im glad I read previous reviews about the long wait time I ordered a house salad to start to hold me over. Let me tell you, it is definitely worth the wait! So freaking good. They are very busy here so everything takes a while to get but try the local beer selection! You won't be disappointed:)

This was my first experience with deep dish pizza and it instantly has me addicted. My group of 5 shared a large deep dish, family salad and order of garlic bread.  Salad- This was your average salad and they were so kind to allow us to pick multiple dressings for the group.  Garlic Bread- This garlic bread had the best mozzarella cheese on it. It was cheesy heaven.  Deep Dish-  We ordered the sausage option and it was amazing. I love that the sauce is on top to prevent the buttery crust from getting limp under all those toppings. The menu said a large would feed 4 people but it easily fed all 5 of us and we were stuffed.  Lastly I want to mention how attentive our server was. This place was packed and he was attentive and quickly replaced a dirty plate for us. I would recommend this place if you want to try some deep dish pizza!

Yay for gluten free Chicago pizza!! Not true Chicago pizza as it's not deep dish...but the crust was amazing!!! Definitely one of the best gf crusts I've had...and I've tried a lot (Celiac). Also, reading other people's reviews about the regular "buttercrust" makes me think they try to make their gf crust the same. It was very buttery and delicious. Not too thin or cracker-like. I didn't feel cheated at all  about not being able to eat the authentic Chicago pizza. FYI the gluten free pizza comes with just cheese so you need to add toppings if you want meat, etc. I got it with sausage, and it was perfect. My non-gluten free friends loved their regular pizza as well! Definitely lived up to these reviews. When we put our name in, they told us it would be an hour wait. We put our name in and then proceeded to order our pizza. When we sat down, our pizza arrived in 10 min. It was great timing and awesome that they have that option to speed up the process. I recommend doing that if there is a long wait!

The Malnati Classic was probably the best pizza I've ever had. I didn't even care about waiting 40 minutes because it was that f'in good. Came highly recommended from a waiter and I was not disappointed.

I tried Deep Dish at Lou's in 2006 and from what I remember it was delicious! Fast forward nine years and after waiting for over an hour at 2pm on a Monday to get a table, the pizza we got was dense and flavorless, what a bummer.  The reason for 3 stars instead of the one star the actual pizza deserves is the location and service. The staff were all really nice and handled the mess of a huge wait with grace and efficiency. The location is historic and the whole restaurant is decorated with history.  So if my silly little yelp review is going to help you decide if you are going to try Lou's I leave you with this. I am a huge Neapolitan pizza snob. I like my crust thin and crispy, so it's possible that my preferences are influencing my opinion. I say, Eat at Lou's and decide for yourself.

Just about the best deep dish pizza I've had in life thus far... The "lean" sausage was excellent, the pizza came together very surprisingly well! I ordered a personal size of their original sausage pizza over the phone 30 minutes before arrival and ate it at the bar. I will definitely be back in the near future...

Very mediocre! Had The Lou's and it lacked any flavor. It was like eating hollow calories. And the "Buttercrust" didn't taste buttery .. It was so dry and hard we pretty much left the crust out. Ugh!  Service was great and that gets 5 stars.  So disappointed after having such high hopes for deep dish pizza coming from on Atlanta (no deep dish pizza in Atl).  I guess I will stick to my fav Italian style instead.

NY 1 Chicago 0  I love the idea of a deep dish pizza with more space for toppings and a thicker layer of cheese but despite that this pizza was flavorless. And in my opinion the tomato sauce was to blame. It was not a thick spiced up sauce..It tasted like diluted canned tomatoes!!  One star for the salad that was great and fresh and one star for the crunchy crust other than that NYC WINS!
My favorite Chicago deep dish pizza...need I say anymore?

Food: Always great. We had the appetizer sampler and chopped salad to start. The sampler included fried motz, fried zucchini and cheese balls. I never had cheese balls before. They were pretty good. The salad is a must. Then we had a large sausage deep dish, a large plain deep dish with extra sauce and a plain thin crust. The deep dish pizzas were terrific. While I didn't try the thin crust, it actually didn't look all that interesting, but my daughter liked it. Service: no complaints. Nice and attentive. Atmosphere: busy, casual, pretty typical for family restaurants like this. Will try to back whenever I'm in Chicago.

I'm honored to have eaten Lou Malnatis pizza as my first deep dish pizza.   I ordered Lou Malnatis classic chicago deep dish and it definitely surpassed my expectations. Because deep dish is known for their layer of cheese, meat, and tomato sauce, I thought it would taste extremely similar to a lasagna but it was far from it.   Crust was crunchy on top yet very fluffy on the inside but not enough to be mushy on the bottom.   Cheese was savory and wonderful.  Although there was a decent layer of cheese, it never felt greasy at all. Amount of meat toppings was more than enough and tomato sauce was light and sweet.  I would definitely visit Lou Malnatis again when I am in town.

Great lunch spot. We snuck in before the lunch risk started and were immediately seated upstairs. The rustic feel to it was inviting, complete with chic Edison bulbs everywhere. We were greeted quickly by our waitress who was friendly and accommodating and provided great recommendations for beverages, salads, and pizza. We started with a few beers, surprisingly ones from Michigan, but delicious and lived up to their name.  We got thw house salad, a blend of tomaine and spinach topped with fresh tomato, mushroom, gorganzola cheese, olives, and my favorite part, the crispy salami bits. I could've just feasted on those the entire day. The regular portion was the perfect size for two as an appetizer, and only left a few minutes before finishing that and our pizza arriving. Which was delish. Our small pizza was perfect for me and my man, I'm a small eater and he's a big eater. We got "The Lou", which was decorated with spinach, mushrooms, and fresh tomatoes. The crust was crunchy, almost buttery, albeit kind of bland.  Deep dish deliciousness all the way and the toppings picked up the slack. Definitely a noteworthy Chicago deep dish go-to!
Great tasting pizza that'll slip you into a food coma within an hour! :) I'd recommend getting the personal size as it'll still last you 2 meals!
First time I've had the chicago famous deep dish pizza and it was delicious the best one in the city.
We order a thin crust with easy cheese and double mushrooms almost every Friday night.  My favorite thin crust pizza in the city.

Decided to eat here based on fellow yelper reviews. It was close enough to our hotel so we walked the mile to Lou's. We got a seat at the bar and had fantastic service from Mark. We ordered the Malnati salad and the classic pizza - both of which were amazing!  Such a great experience for our final dinner in Chicago. A must for all.

Food was great! But,,, I asked for the cold air to be turned off/made warmer 3 times now and it's still not changed! Myself and a few other tables have mentioned it's cold! Waitress says the manager has to change it? Wouldn't be back, as it has spoiled the meal, pizzas got cold so quick!
Good pizza. We ordered the special. Got a seat outside and had some beers. The service was snarky and slow. Only nice when handing off the check. Probably wouldn't return. But the pie was good.

My boss took me here for lunch last week and wow was it good. I wanted a deep dish Chicago pizza and this pizza was wonderful. The service was attentive and the food was great! If you're in Chicago and want to try Chicago style deep dish pizza, this is the place to start!.

This is the place to eat Chicago pie (deep-dished pizza). We came here at 1930 and had to wait 40mins for the table and another 30mins for our pizza. But guess what!!? It was worth the wait. The pizza was so yummy and it was soooo big. We ordered a medium and hardly finished it. And for $26 (before tip), it's worth the money...

Apart from the amazing pizza and the pretty amazing sides, I have to comment on the stellar customer service I received today at Lou's. Gloria our server found out that I had just moved to Chicago and went out of her way to bring me a CTA map and show me how to navigate it.  Definitely coming back.

My favorite deep dish pizza in Chicago! I've tried the other establishments when I visited my sister and Lou Malnati's is by far my favorite.  The pizza isn't true deep dish by the look of the crust thickness but it's not thin crust.  The dough is yummy and the toppings are fresh. I had more slices than I expected but at the end of the day didn't feel uncomfortably full.

Lou's!!!!!!! Yelp wants us all to write these great big, looooooooong reviews, but what more do you need to know than THIS IS CHICAGO PIZZA? That is all, right?!!! Lou!!!!!!!  You are so yummy,  You are fine,  Your'e not too fancy,  And your sauce is sublime. You're an old school parlor  In this hip modern town.  Please show them all  Where the sun's going down!

Overall: classic Chicago deep dish. Good for tourists and for being unhealthy Food: for tourists reading this review, Chicago deep dish is basically in a deep pan with dough lining it. The inside is filled with sauce, cheese, and other toppings. It is just as unhealthy and delicious as it sounds. Bring friends. Lou Malnatis was my first exposure to deep dish and boy did I take a... Deep dive. The menu is pretty simple, with salads, apps, and of course, deep dish. Each pie takes about 30 minutes to bake, and seem to go longer on busy days. And it was busy the entire time we were there. I got the vibe that the waitress wanted us in and out when she constantly offered to take our plates. Oh well, I guess Chicago just moves faster. This place is worth checking out for the experience of authentic Chicago.

I don't get it. Calamari excellent, salad amazing. Deep dish Medium pizza  pepperoni, onion and green pepper. Not good at all. Really I love all kinds of pizza.  Bottom of crust very crispy top mushy and soft. Taste was ok if you scrapped it off but the whole bite just was not good. Love the energy and the system to handle crowds of people was good too.  Too bad really  that the pizza had me saying whatda.....

I usually don't crave deep dish pizza but recommended it to my friends to try it due to the high ratings on Yelp. We ordered the The Malnati Chicago Classic. I have to say that the amount of sauce, cheese and sausage was perfect. All the ingredients balanced each other well and didn't overwhelm each other. I'm also a big fan of sausage and glad that Lou Malnati's was very generous with the amount of sausage that was on the deep dish. It's been a few years since I've been to Gino's and Giordano's but I appreciated that Lou Malnati allows you to put an order in while you wait to be seated. It definitely made the wait less longer since we already waited about half an hour for a spot during a mid-Saturday afternoon. I'd definitely recommend and return to Lou Malnati's!

Definitely my favorite deep dish pizza place in the city!  The pizza has a nice buttery crust, which is not too thick, not too thin, and never doughy.  The crust is really the star and they don't overload it with the other ingredients like some places... I primarily order delivery.  It's always correct and the service is excellent.

i guess i forgot to write a review when i visited a few years ago a photo popped up on my instagram and i was reminded of how i fell in love with the pizza here thick sausage patty with stretchy, gooey cheese  all smothered in that tangy sauce held up by that buttery, thick crust i hate LA! just kidding

Overrated I'd say.  We'd seen this place listed as one of the top Chicago style pizzas in Chicago.  So we waited the 90 minutes for a table our first night in Chicago and ordered a couple pizzas from the extremely uninspiring waitress.  We were expecting great things and were disappointed.  Not as good as a Chicago style from Paxti's or Little Star in SF, 2,000 miles away from Chicago.

Right near my new condo, how could I not check out one of the most established deep dish pizza venues in Chicago. My girlfriend's family had come to visit from Toronto and we wanted to ensure they tried some Chicago deep dish. We ordered the BBQ wings, calamari, and a few large 'The Lou' deep dish pizzas. Our waiter was very attentive and humorous and kept us entertained. The deep dish was good, however, not the best pizza I've ever had due to my travels in Italy and specifically, Naples. Will definitely return for some of their other menu items -  Best, Charlie

Wonderful pizza- deep dish of course. But the staff really make the place what it is. My boyfriend and I ran in an awful downpour of rain and came in soaked. We were warmly greeted and seated immediately at the bar. The bartenders were both very talkative and friendly. Waiting 40 minutes was worth it for the pizza, and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Will definitely return to this location specifically for the people who work there. My only con is that the pizza was a little burnt. Still delicious though.

This is Chicago pizza!  Excellent preparation, always cooked perfectly.  Whatever toppings you choose, make sure it includes their fantastic sausage.  I still think Old Style beer is best with Chicago pizza.

had a good time. employees were friendly. Very crowded. Expected a long wait. Put name on list and was told 1.5 hours. Was told to put in food order at the same time because the length of time required to make the pizza. Put name in and went down the street to grab a beer and come back. Took 2 hours to get seated. Not a problem we enjoyed their local selection of beer. Food took another hour to arrive after getting to seat. Not sure why we put in order early. First time eating Chicago deep dish. Underwhelmed with "butter crust". and topping/filling selections. Sauce flavor was good with an interesting red pepper kick. Very filling. We ordered 2 larges for a group 6 well fed men. We had 3 pieces left over. Good to experience, but probably not a repeat.

Place was a madhouse when we arrived (Saturday night around 7:30pm) and were quoted an 1 hr and 30 minute wait for a party of four. Inquired about take-out and there was a 50 minute wait for that and we just decided to wait for the table. Wait estimate was spot on almost to the minute so good job on that but I guess we were secretly hoping it would take less time. You can pre-order your pizzas while waiting but since this only saves a few minutes I'm not sure what the point is. Service was a bit slow once we were seated as we didn't see a waitress for almost 10 minutes and from that point every time we needed something we had to flag her down. We tried two pizzas - the Malnati Chicago Classic and the Lou. Both were pretty good, we debated at the table which was better and I think we were split 2-2. The serving estimates in the menu were very accurate for us as we ordered two smalls and it was perfect for the four of us but we had also ordered the Spinach salad which was also pretty good.  Overall the place was good. The service could have been better once we were seated and I don't think the food is spectacular enough to justify the long wait times. If I were to return it would have to be at a time where we could get right in.

This place was just a short walk from our hotel and all the locals recommended this spot. I wasn't about to leave Chicago without getting my fair share of deep dish pizza! My family and I came here on a Monday night and this place had a line surrounding the door.  It's a bit different than what I'm used to. Here you order before you're actually at your table. Order while you wait and then once you get seated your food will be ready. Well, at least this is the idea. The inside of this place is really crammed. Everyone is really close together and there's constantly someone trying to get by. The walls are covered in sports memorabilia which really gave a really nice feel and warming atmosphere.  We ordered a few pizzas to share amongst the five of us. Two deep dish and one thin crust. The server will cut the pizza and serve everyone at your table which I thought was really convenient since it's a bit crammed inside. I was so excited for the deep dish but I really think the thin crust stole the show. It was delicious and addicting. However, the deep dish was also rich and fluffy. I loved the fact that it wasn't dense to where you couldn't enjoy it. The toppings are piled on so make sure you love what you order! I can't get this kind of pizza at home so this was a really nice change of pace. If you're new to Chicago or just visiting put this place on your list!

Best pizza ever I had tried in Chicago. Great service as well. I left my new camera at the table and once I got back,realized someone who seem to be the manager of the place had taken the camera to a safe place only within minutes of my departure there. This showed a great care they had for customers and I was really appreciative of that.  This place is definitely my go to place for pizza and delivery as well. So glad I tried it

The wait is something you must factor in. And if you get there in the wrong 15 minute block the line is insane. They must print money. The pizza coming from a New Yorker was average. I heard there's spots Chicagoans go to that's not this spot. This is more of a tourist spot. Wife and I wasn't mad we went but wouldn't go back. You won't be mad but it has to be a better spot that reps Chicago.

YUM. This pizza is super delicious. I'm not a huge fan of deep dish (I know, crazy, right?), but when I do crave the additional carbs, I go for Lou Malnati's! I've never eaten in the restaurant, just delivery.

Choices choices... When you are in a city for only a certain limited amount of time, it's hard to narrow down places you want to eat. So many places to eat. So little time... Lou malnati came highly recommended via YELP and as YELP has never steered me wrong, I decided Lou Malnati's will be my Chicago pizza experience. As I walked up to the much anticipated pizza place, my heart sank... There was a mob of people waiting already... Boo boo... Ok... My fault for going at prime dinner time 630PM...so, I put my name on the wait list and grabbed a drink at the bar. The bar is not big but it is sufficient. The beers ranged in variety from local brews to domestics and the prices are good...  Thankfully the wait was supposed to be over an hour but we were seated much earlier than anticipated. Now... On to the food!!! We ordered a salad that had candied maple bacon. Yes please...More please... One of the best salads I have ever had! We also had the calamari which was battered perfectly and was still moist and juicy unlike most places where the calamari is dry and stringy.  Oh the pizza!!!! We had the sausage pizza and lemme tell you... I can usually do damage on pizza, averaging 4-5 slices. However, this pizza... after two slices I was stuffed and couldn't move. It felt like each pizza slice weighed about a pound of yumminess. They certainly aren't stingy with the sausage. Instead of sprinkling morsels of sausage, it's like a a blanket of meaty goodness cooked to perfection. Also, as most people commented, the butter crust... Ridiculously good. It was so buttery, crispy and not greasy what so ever. I could just sit there and eat the crust... All day.  A must try if you are in the area!

Was contacted by the manager shortly after posting previous post and was sent in the mail a gift card for a pizza of my choosing!!! Talk about customer service. They were apologetic and most accommodating. Thanks guys, I will recommend the deep dish moving forward.
Lou's is always a fav. They make the perfect deep dish and the classic Lou is amazing. If you're from out of town, trust a true Chicagoan!
Great deep dish pizza. Hubby and I came here for lunch and got a small The Lou pizza which is just enough for the both of us.

Love deep dish pizza and this is one of the best places in town to get one. We ordered a roma tomato with spinach mix (garlic, oregano and basil) small deep dish pizza and a small Caesar salad (which feeds two easily). It takes about 35-40 minutes to cook the pizza so be sure you have time to relax and enjoy the moment. My fellow Yelper (Aliya J.) introduced me to this place a few years back when we were in Chicago so I definitely wanted to make my way back to it when I returned to the Windy City. We got great service and a window seat to boot so it was a great way to spend the lunch hour and then some. The pizza was perfecto! Still as good as it gets!

We heard this was one of the best or known pizza places in Chicago and so I just had to come here since I'm a pizza lover. We ordered "The Lou" which is pretty much a veggie deepdish pizza. All of their deepdish pizza comes with a buttercrust which was very scrumptious, especially if you love bread like me! We also got a dessert coupon from our hotel (Hyatt in magnificent mile) and so we decided to get the Chocolate Chip Pizza. It's pretty much the exact same thing as the pazookie from BJ's--it's a chocolate chip cookie in a deepdish pan (served warm) and has vanilla icecream on top of it. I also heard The Original Gino's East was really good. That was right by our hotel and we passed it all the time when walking around, and there was always a long line at night which is a good sign? I definitely want to try there as well next time.

Good Pizza & Good service What more can a customer really ask for?? Yes, of course there is an ample wait for not only your table, but your pizza, but thats ok! Its a deep dish pizza, so idk what to say aside from its well worth the wait! Plus, you can grab a drink at the bar in the mean time.  The crust is nice and buttery with a good crunch. The sauce is flavorful and the sausage on the classic is perfect!
1 word. Horrible. Worst. Pizza ever made. We are visiting from NYC and this was garbage. Don't waste your time!

Pizza is definitely 10/10, however, I felt extremely unwelcome at this location. The front person was not very nice and seemed bothered that we needed help since it was our first time here.  Here's the kicker, I'd come in a few days prior to ask for a pizza box to take a picture with it in front of the Millennium Park bean. They wanted to charge me $2 for an empty box. I exclaimed shock at the price to which they responded "do you want us to charge you more?" I stated I'd prefer if they didn't charge for empty pizza boxes. It was pretty audacious of them to have given me such a hard time for an empty pizza box but I thought I would give them the benefit of the doubt.  I came back with a group of 4 to share the Lou's experience with them. Again, the employees were very cold and you could very much feel that they disliked tourist.
I love Lou Malnati's. Even thought they are known for deep dish, the thin crust pizza is OUT OF THIS WORLD, butter crust and so amazing. My kids love it!

Best deep dish in town!  really great apps too!  great, chill atmosphere, and even though the wait is usually 30-45 minutes its worth it, plus they can take your pizza order beforehand so you don't have to wait so long once you sit down.
I continue to try new Chicago pizza places but always end up disappointed and end up coming back to Lou's. Deep dish, butter crust, extra cheese with the Malnati salad- it never disappoints!
Great ambiance - good food - not my personal food choice, the deep dish is bulky and very heavy. But if you are into that kind of food then it's a great place.

The best pizza I've had in a long time. The line is crazy/insane but you can simply order your pizza online and set a pickup time for take out. Highly recommend taking out if you don't want to wait over an hour.

I obvii had to get some deep dish on a recent trip to Chicago and I heard that was the real thanggg. I also heard Uno is good but I used to get that all the time in California as a kid..so idk how real it is.  Anyways, so it's really nice that they warn you that deep dish is made to order so takes 45min so obviously allocate time! I got myself the house salad ($6) and a beer ($5-7) so I wouldn't eat my friends hand off during those 45min hehe. Salad was good but if you aren't hungry, just wait to eat your pizza cause you don't need any sides!!  So I got the Lou which was the veggie one with spinach, mushrooms, and tomatoes. INCREDIBLE. YUmmmmm. Recommend if you are vegetarian and don't want the reg cheese.  5 stars mostly because our server (Tina!) realized I was kinda in a rush to get the airport, told me how to get there the fastest way possible, got the check to the table when the food came, and immediately ran it and brought it back, and with boxes. So nice when you're not like hELLOO im gonna miss mah flight cause you cant run a credit card!

How good is Lou Malnati's ?  How about this for you -- Whenever I have to change planes at Midway I try to give myself a 4-6 hour transfer delay window . Just enough time to get out of the airport, go to Lou's, scarf down as much Deep Dish as humanly possible and get back to the airport and catch my connecting flight. I am convinced, absolutely convinced, that this is the best pizza in the country. Nothing compares on either coast. I've had every pizzeria in Seattle and while some are pretty damn good, none are in Lou Malnati's tier. I've spent some time in New York, Pennsylvania, Ohio, pretty much all up and down the East Coast. New York's large fold able slices have nothing on rich thick deep dish. That fennel sausage at Lou's is just to die for. I don't understand how Lou's hasn't managed to get out of Illinois and open up some restaurants in a few major metropolitan areas. Opening a Lou's in Seattle, San Fran, L.A. , New York, Miami...it's literally the equivalent of printing money.  Best Pizza in the Country and possibly best on the planet.

Be prepared to wait! I don't think it matters what day you go, there will be a wait. A touristy spot? Well, yea but so what! You go to the hostess put your name in and you order while you wait. It doesn't really matter that you put your order in way in advance because when you get seated, you'll still have to wait.  The deep dish: This was my first time having real "deep dish" pizza and I loved it! I was expecting it to be loaded with bread, but it was the total opposite. The crust is thin, crisp and loaded with toppings (a little too much toppings for me) but it's delicious! I was with a party of 5 and we split 2 mediums with about 3 slices left over.  The thin pizza: let me just say, if they had this pizza where I'm from, I'd definitely eat it once a week! I absolutely loved the thin crust way more than the deep. The topping is layered between the crust and cheese and it's different from what I've had before.  If you're not from here you should check this place out. Really enjoyed the food!
Waited 1.25 hours on wed. night for table. Wait staff rude and overworked. Pizza so not worth the wait. Much better pizza other places in Chicago much less wait.

Horrible service.  Went on a Tuesday night, waited at least 15 minutes for waitress to bring our beers.  She barely spoke to us when taking our order and even worse, raced past our table as to not have to speak to us if not necessary.  Food delivered in an hour- 45 min was what she quoted. Again, Tuesday night and not a full house.  Pizza was absolutely disappointing. I could have ordered Domino's and got better pizza. The crust was gooey and undercooked while the bottom of the crust-burned.  Such a waste of time and money.

We put our name down at 12:39. Preordered out pizza at 12:47. At 1:15 we got seated. At 2:05 we still didn't get the pizza.  Waiter didn't seem to care when asked to check on our pizza. So we left. Sorry Chicago, you may have good pizza, but what good is it if you can't even prepare it in time?   Horrible experience. Never again.  Wow. The Lou Malnati team really delivered. Following my earlier post regarding my bad experience at the restaurant. The customer service team immediately responded and took care of me. Bernie and team sent me a gift certificate to be used for my online order for pizzas; they are on their way to NYC.  I am very impressed with the outcome and have restored my faith in the business. The people at Lou Malnati do care in addition in making great Pizzas!!!

This review is to comment on the service my husband and I received last night. Several minutes after we sat down, our waitress came over to take our order. We ordered a small pizza and a personal slice. She asked if we wanted an appetizer because the pizza would take 45 minutes to come out. We didn't really want one because we we didn't want to ruin our appetites for the pizza, but we were so hungry we decided to order an appetizer too. We ordered the 3 cheese bread appetizer and were told the appetizer would take 10 to 15 minutes to come out. 3 other groups of people came and ordered after us. 30 minutes passed and we still didn't have our appetizer, but two of the other tables had already received their appetizers and one had received their entree. We decided to ask our waitress when our appetizer would come out since it had been so long and all we ordered was cheese bread. She told us it would be out in a few minutes. My husband jokingly said, "Sorry, we're just starving." To which the waitress rudely replied, "So is everyone else." About 5 more minutes passed and she came by apologizing for the wait and told us that the appetizer would be free. Several minutes later we got the appetizer which was literally just garlic bread with cheese on it and marinara sauce for dipping. I'm not sure why that would take about 40 minutes to make. Between finishing our appetizer and receiving our entrees, it took another 20 minutes. During those 20 minutes, the 2 of the other groups of people received their entrees and one of them had completely finished their food, paid for it, and left. When we received our food, the personal pizza seemed like it had been sitting out for a while because it was not hot at all compared to the small pizza that was still steaming. Despite the bad service we received regarding the time, there were a few good things about the service since the waitress did apologize for the wait and she was pretty friendly except for that one rude comment. However the experience we had is enough that we will avoid coming to this restaurant again especially for dinner. Bottom line, don't make up arbitrary time limits if you can't back them up.

Heard about this place from numerous people. First we tried the rose(?) beer. Tasted great especially in the hot HUMID weather. We ordered the Lou's special and a Lou's salad, which was highly recommended by our waiter. I like salads but this is the BEST salad I ever tasted! Yummy! Must try! Also the pizza was soooo good. Loved the buttery crust. I would have married this meal, I loved it so much, had I not scarfed it down so quickly. Never stood a chance.

This is the story of the waitress that legit forgot about us...  So once upon a time I went on vacation to Chicago and decided that I probably should try some deep dish pizza. After a busy day of shopping my friend and I decided it was time. We visited this place on a weekday right before the dinner rush in order to avoid any waits.  We arrive and are immediately seated, the restaurant was pretty empty at the time. Our waitress comes over probably a minute after we arrive asking us if we know what we want, we tell her we need more time. Literally three minutes later she comes back and asks us if we know yet. We barely had a chance to look at the menu and haven't even had a chance to glance at the drink menu. We order our pizza anyways, we split a sausage deep dish for two. She tells us it will take about 30 minutes, which is fine, we try and tell her we want to order drinks too, but she rushes away before we can say anything else.... so she doesn't come back at all... and then our pizza arrives. I asked the poor guy that brought us our pizza if he could get our waitress for us. In retrospect I feel kind of bad for that because I was kind of rude to him, but I was very annoyed we didn't have drinks or silverware so we couldn't eat our food and it could get cold. She then comes over apologizes and gives us silverware and we order our drinks, which we then get quickly. After that she came over a bunch of times to tries to makeup for disappearing originally, well the moment was unfortunately lost.  Besides our waitress the food was great, very filling and cooked perfectly. The décor was very nice as well and I felt the restaurant was reasonably priced.

First time here (passing through Chicago) and well worth it. I called ahead and glad I did because it took 40 minutes for my order; I ordered the deep dish classic and a salad. Everyone there was super friendly and I can see why this place has high reviews!

Yummy pizza but even at 2 pm there was a half hour wait and the only seating we could get was outside. That being said it was worth the wait and you can preorder any deep dish pizzas so they get to your table when you're seated.

The first time I ever heard of this restaurant was visiting my friend back in November 2010. When she mentioned taking me it sounded like she said illuminati. I was expecting jay z posters everywhere and whole pizzas in the shape of a triangle besides the slices that are already in triangles. When we got there the wait was over 2 hours so we went to Giordano's instead. No confirmation of Jay Z or triangle pizzas.  Fast forward to 2015, we planned to visit Chicago again, thus made it my life mission to try their pizza. Unfortunately there's no Jay Z posters in sight but the pizza was so damn good. It was worth the pizza blue balls for 5 years. We had the Chicago classic with pepperoni as a deep dish and the thin crust with pepperoni and giardinera. (Omg totally in love with giardinera but that's another story) wow, both pizzas deep and thin were the best pizzas I've ever had. I mentally scanned through all the pizza I've eaten from my home town Houston, TX to my travels to Las Vegas, New York, LA. Nothing compares to the pizza foodgasm of Lou's.  I totally feel with J.Cole in his song "power trip"... "Well this has gotta be the longest crush ever/If I ever get to **** it'd be the longest bust ever" well that is if J.Cole was talking about pizza.
Good ole Chicago pizza. This is my go to place when my St. Louis born husband lets me indulge in our home town style. Only have had it for delivery and its delicious

I took a UBER in Chicago and the driver highly recommended this place. Many other people also mention this place when asked about Chicago style pizza. As expected, the place was super crowded. We were seated after 40 minutes of waiting. It was weekdays, so I guess if you visit on weekends, waiting time would be longer. But it was worth waiting! I visited Chicago 7 years ago and the pizza I had at that time was thick but dry. I didn't have good memories on that. Also, some friends living in Chicago didn't recommend deep dish pizza. They said it's just a one time thing. But this one was thick but still juicy and cheese and tomato sauce mixed really well. Four of us all really enjoyed the dining here. Prices are reasonable too. I paid only like 10 dollars and felt very full afterwards. I took out a star just because you need to wait quite a long time and the servers were pretty busy. In terms of food though, I would recommend this if you want to taste really good Chicago style pizza.

Lou's serves great pizza.  It has a wonderful flavored sauce and the cheese is fresh and melted perfectly.  If you like Deep Dish you must try this place.  The only down side is because it is made fresh to order and is deep dish, it takes about 35-40 minutes to get your pizza.  The staff informed us of the wait before we ordered which was really nice in case we were in a hurry.  The side salad was not great.  It was dressed in dressing (1000 island), but was way too dressed, made the lettuce wilt and had too much Mayo added.  Stick with the pizza and you will love this place!

Was visiting from Toronto and wanted to try Chicago's well known deep-dish pizza!  I went on an off day with my friend (Monday around 12-1pm) so it wasn't crowded at all. No line up and seated right away. The pizza does take about 30-40mins though, so if you are short on time..schedule it accordingly. We tried the Chicago classic Medium size ($20) and a penne pasta lunch special. I would skip pasta and just do pizza.  The pasta didn't have much flavour to it, just felt like I was eating pasta and cheese. For pizza, I would suggest their Classic or Sausage version (we tried sausage a few days before at a food event where Lou's was at too). Both are good!  Service was okay, decor was interesting. You can see jerseys of athletes hanging on the wall. We were in a booth that sat right below a Cubs jersey. Lol.  Restaurant is good for all ages and families.
Great pizza. Tried the thin crust and it was so good. Also the three cheese bread is amazing!
I asked if they could deliver a pizza for my daughter and I. Just flew in from out of town.  The girl hung up on me!

I work in tourism back at home (Puerto Rico). So as soon as a I met someone from Chicago or the Chicago area I asked them. What is the pizzeria that you go too? And 95% said Lou Malnati's. And it was! Hands down the best pizza I had in a very long time!

Food is delicious. Wait times are its Ackelies heel. We were seated quickly though because our group was relatively small but if you order a pizza add another +30-45 minutes to your stay. We were Ok with that though and we really enjoyed the food.  If you have time and money to spare, you'll like it. If you're a rushing tourist who is trying to soak in as much as possible of Chicago, take a moment to see if it's worth spending 1-2 hours here. Luckily, they have Wi-Fi if you need something to do besides talking while you wait.  The pizzas are huge. The salads are huge. I recommend both. You'll love it! :)

Yes, yes, and yes.  I was visiting Chicago for a wedding, and went to Lou Malnati's for an early lunch based on the bride and groom's recommendation.  We got there on Saturday at 11:10 AM and were seated immediately.  (Side note: I am so glad we didn't wait until noon because the place was full by then.  We left just before 1 PM and there was a wait at the door.) My friends and I ordered the stuffed spinach bread for an appetizer based on the waitress's suggestion.  I would order it 10 times over and would have been happy ordering it as a main meal.  It was awesome. I also ordered a personal size deep dish pizza, and the portion size was perfect -- exactly what I'd expect for something called "personal."  My husband ordered a small and had some leftovers. Now that I am back home, I am craving Lou Malnati's and slightly regretting my decision to write this review knowing full well that it is an 11 hour drive away.

My advice, if you haven't been to this location, come in early and pre order while you're waiting. We came here about 4pm and the wait was about 20 minutes (not bad). When it was our time to sit on our table, we didn't know that the pizza would take 45 minutes, we should have pre-ordered. We were hungry! We ordered calamari for appetizer and finished it really fast. While waiting for our pizza, my friend and I stopped by Firecake donuts and got us some dessert, while our boyfriends just waited for our pizza. Our order came after 45 minutes; it was the "Lou" and the Chicago Classic. My favorite was the Chicago Classic; it's got lean sausage, cheese, and vine-ripened tomato on a butter crust. I wished I added sausage to the "Lou" pizza, it's all veggies. It would be perfect if it came with sausage. So now I know what to order next time. If you're not hungry, they also serve a personal size (1 person) or a small size, which feeds 2 people. Our server was nice, but didn't refill our drinks. The place was packed when we left. I will definitely come back for more Lou Malnati's deep-dish pizza.
Absolutely favorite! Also nearby my school and easy transportation if needed :) My fav pizza was the classic, can never go wrong with that!
Better than the other deep dish places. Just get the pizza. Don't get the calamari... Nothing wrong with it. Just not worth the money and stomach room when there's pizza on the way.

A must for visitors and seemed popular with the locals too. Stick with the traditional toppings and expect a wait. Totally different from my expectation of deep dish pizza. Not at all greasy, but definitely a food fest situation. Yum!

People will talk on and on about their stuffed pizza - which is great don't get me wrong - but I don't think the thin crust gets enough love.  It's a hangover recipe in a box and is basically my Sunday go to meal.  But that's not to discredit this place - I've gone many times and have never been disappointed.  A great representation of Chicago pizza.

First stop for Chicago Pizza has to be at where it all started and was created. I have seen Lou Malnati's on all the pizza food shows and always wanted to try it. Pepperoni Deep Dish, small - $13.65 - The crust is amazing. Thick and buttery with a nice crisp. Loaded with a ton of cheese and pepperoni. The red sauce is so simple but full of flavor.  Great way to start a pizza journey.

So we were in Chicago for five or six days and I haven't been in years. I love pizza. And I mean, I LOVE pizza. All kinds of pizza. Thin crust, deep dish, New York, Chicago, Neapolitan, whatever. I'll eat frozen pizza, leftover pizza, pizza that may or may not have fallen on the ground. In my books, even bad pizza is pretty good. And while Lou's was FAR from being bad pizza,I was just a tad disappointed, just a little let down  and perhaps a victim of my own sky-high expectations. Oh well, it was still pizza and it was still pretty good.  So starting at the beginning (finally) we had limited time and settled on going to the two biggest players in town (so far as I could ascertain), Lou Malnati's and Giordano's. Now I know that there are a LOT of other options but again, limited time and a long absence made me want to keep things as simple as I could.  So although I did cheat and have a thin-crust at the place next to our hotel, we stuck with the plan when it came to deep dish.  First off, the place is huge and even though we were relegated to the dreaded upper level, service was still good and they were more than accommodating with our many questions and various restrictions. Honey had the gluten free and I dropped the mushrooms from "The Lou" (despite the 'no substitutions' request) and all was good. We each ordered salads and I'm glad we did, seeing as they were both quite tasty (she had the Spinach, I had the House) and that the pizza took quite a while to get to us...but that's deep dish for you. But after all of that it was just okay. She's had better gluten free and I've had better deep dish even in Toronto. Mine looked great and was more than acceptable but just wasn't as doughy, as savory, as buttery and as cheesy awesome as I was expecting. I don't know why, I really don't. It was fine and it was pizza and I still liked it but I felt a bit let down. When the salad is the best part of the meal, there's something not quite right. So on our next trip we probably won't be back to Lou's, given the vast array of other choices. Still, like I said it WAS pizza...and there's rarely ever anything wrong with pizza in my book.

Picked up The Lou. Spinach, 3 cheeses, garlic, and tomatoes. Was a great deep dish pizza. My first in Chicago and first ever. I was referred here by a long time friend and the restaurant and food did not disappoint. I suggest doing online orders as this place was jam packed inside and outside with people all over. Will be sure to come here for my pizza when in town, that's for sure! Great place for the family.
Most popular deep dish pizza in Chicago and it should be, I would say it is in the top 4 and can't crown any #1. Pequods, paizanos, and my pie all tied in their own way.

We arrived at 6:25. We were told we had a 45 minute wait due to our fairly large group. We ended up having to wait for an hour. After finally sitting down at around 7:30, we were hungry. The waitress claimed she had to "pull strings" to get our appetizers, even though it took her at least 20 minutes to get them for us. What kind of business has to "pull strings" to serve their customers? After another 30 minutes of waiting, I finally asked the waitress when our pizza would be delivered to our table. We were restless because the table next to us, who arrived after us with an even larger group than our own, was served their 5 pizzas before our waitress even knew when our 3 pizzas would be ready. The pizzas was good, but unfortunately the service did not match the quality of their product. Now we are sitting and waiting for our waitress because she disappeared after serving our pizza.

We enjoyed Lou's pizza.  We ordered the classic-Lou pizza, with a family sized Cesar salad.  The pizza was absolutely delicious, very flavorful & filled us up!  The combo appetizer was not tasty to us.   It seemed as if all was frozen food & just fried.....nothing homemade about it.

Was visiting friends and we decided to get a delivery to have a quick dinner before going out for the night. Typical delivery time, about 45 mins or so. When the pizza arrived it was still perfect! Hot, cheesy, crispy. I am obsessed. I can't imagine how amazing it would be getting it fresh out of the oven! Can't wait to go back.

Chicago's best pizza? Just might be! Service was quick and attentive. Since deep dish takes some time to cook, we were able to order our pizza ahead of time while we waited for a table. We started with Calamari and both the BuffaLou  and Bar-B-Lou Wings. The Calamari was fried perfectly with a tasty Marinara sauce and the wings were plump and juicy. Just a perfect amount of sauce to not make it too messy to eat! Then out came the star of the meal....The Malnati Chicago Classic. The Buttercrust makes the pizza, along with the sausage, extra cheese and vine-ripened tomato sauce. No room for dessert here! Make this the fist pizza place you checkout in Chicago!

Came here while visiting Chicago on vacay. You have to get deep dish in Chicago right?!  The wait was long so be warned but it really played well onto the suspense. Only good places have long wait times! Unfortunately I'm docking two stars for pre order service. (We had to wait an additional 45 min after our almost 2 hour wait for a seat...) The host informed us that we could pre order our pizza in order to expedite our order and we obliged. (Take a lesson from us and make sure to confirm your name and that the order was placed). Well as you expect, our order never went through... So.. 3 stars for service/experience but..  The deep dish Pizza was great :) Pros: - amazing crust -yummy pizza  Cons: -long wait times -they might mess up your pre-order!!!! Tip: -if you have a common name. Use an uncommon alias! ;)

I tried coming here Friday night and the restaurant was packed (should've known!). We went somewhere else instead because we didn't want to wait. However, we returned on Sunday night for dinner because we were not leaving Chicago without having deep dish pizza! ;) My friend and I got there and were seated right away. Even for a Sunday, they were pretty busy. Our food came an hour later - they tell you upfront that it will take about 45min to make the pizza. The food was was pretty good, but the wait kinda sucked :/

this place is AMAZING. We were in Chicago for three days and we went once on a Friday and again on a Saturday. On Friday, we got there at around 6 and the wait was 15 minutes. On Saturday, we got there at 4 and the wait was an hour. The pizza is so good but the cookie and ice cream dessert was my favorite part. Hands down the best ice cream I've ever had. When we went on Saturday, the cooks didn't make the dessert at the same time as our appetizers like we asked, so the manager gave us the desserts on the house. The food is great, the staff is nice, and it's in a good location.
always will be my favorite chicago pizza joint. however their excellence does vary depending on location. not a fan of the downtown spot.

it would sacrilege to not have deep dish pizza visiting chicago.  pretty good!  the caesar salad was delicious.  the pizza--i liked how the crust was not super greasy.  i think the sausage could have had a little more seasoning, but for those being health conscious this is not necessarily a bad thing.

I'm not a huge fan of deep dish pizza.  However when choosing a deep dish, Lou Malnati's is THE ONLY choice.  I think what makes them particularly unique is a cornmeal crust which adds a lot of texture and natural sweetness, not to mention a crunch and flavor that isn't as bland as a straight flour crust. Their famous red sauce with chunks of tomato isn't too sweet which lets the natural flavors of the tomatoes come through.  There's always lots of cheese, pepperoni, and sausage, which is how I  like my pizza.   When guests come to town and want to go for deep dish, Lou's is the ONLY choice.
Excellent. Had the deep dish personal pizza with sausage and pepperoni. Absolutely delicious. Mark, the bartender, is also the man! Highly recommend it.
Pizza is unbelievable! First deep dish pizza I've ever had and no regrets there. So cheesy and filling but couldn't stop eating!

Fantastic deep dish pizza! The service was excellent. There was a long wait, but well worth it. They will take your order while you are waiting so you get your pizza quickly after being seated. Highly recommend!

All we wanted on our recent trip to Chicago was the deep dish pizza. Lou's was recommended by multiple people. When we walked in there was an hour wait, but the restaurant takes your pizza order to get things started. The bar is lively so you can grab a drink while you wait. We were seated earlier than expected and promptly served. The pizza was delicious! The best part was the butter crust which I highly recommend. Overall, if you are vacationing and looking to grab a deep dish head here!

Absolutely delicious!!! This was my second taste of real Chicago style deep dish and so far the best! I can't wait to try another famous pizza restaurants tomorrow to compare. Caution, you will leave stuffed!!!
It's my favorite of all the deep dish establishments. The garlic crust puts this place over the other local chains. If you have to choose one deep dish, this is the place.
Spinach salad was great! Pizza with butter crust and pepperoni was really good.  I would go back.  Very crowded.  First come first served.  No reservations.

Lou's deep dish was good but the butter crust was a bit too buttery tasting for me after the first piece and it wasn't very saucey. We ordered a Medium Pepperoni, Medium Sausage & Pepperoni, and a Family Salad for a family of four (we had 2 slices leftover and were stuffed!).  The salad was HUGE and very good!  We liked the Pepperoni better than the Sausage Pepperoni combo.  After being in Chicago all week and trying Giordano's (twice), Gino's and Lou's once each, our favorites were in order: 1) Giordano's (best overall deep dish) 2) Gino's (best sauce) 3) Lou Malnati's (good but not as good as Giordano's or Gino's in our opinion). I would eat here again but if could only go to one place while in town would go to the others first - Giordano's if only one chance to eat pizza in Chicago.

Coming from the East Coast I've never been a huge fan of deep-dish, but I had to have some while I was in Chicago.  I was aware these pizzas take a while to cook, but Lou's was definitely worth the wait.  On ordering, I chose "butter crust" over "dough crust" (I wasn't really sure what the difference would be and just rationalized that butter might taste better), and I was not disappointed.  Some of the pizza photos of other local favorites just struck me as gooey incoherent messes of cheese, but this pizza was well balanced in all elements, so I can see how it could appeal to a wide base when there are so many tough critics out there with different tastes.   Our server was very friendly and helpful in suggesting beers to go with our pizza.  The bar seemed a little overwhelmed for a Monday, but this wasn't a big deal since I knew we had to wait a while anyway. If you've got the time, make a stop in and get ready to eat.

Well, we tried this place since my fiancée's friend said this is better than Giordano's.  First off, I got us lost getting off Grand on the Blue Line.  We walked in circles until I gave up and spoke to the nearest local.  Finally, I realized that she was right about the Brown Line and saw that there was a line out the door here.  Next, we placed our order for the Lou vegetarian deep dish pizza.  It took about 30 minutes until we were seated with an appetizer salad.  Then, it took another 30 minutes until pizza was ready.  Overall, a good experience but was too full at the end and decided that was all the pizza we could eat.  Would it be worth to try again?  Probably just stick to Giordano's since it will open up in Minneapolis-Uptown late this summer.
I really liked the pizza. The crust was buttery. Cheese was rockin but I wasn't a fan of the sauce on top. I realized I'm more of a ny style than a Chicago style. Not a biggie.
Gotta love some classic loud pizza. My favorite Chicago chain by far.

We went to another location, but I can't remember the location. Anyways.... ordered the cheese bread and the fried veggie plate as apps. Both very good. The spinach bread probably would have been good,  but it wasn't hot in the middle. I ordered the classic original , I think.  I forget what they called it. But it was the sausage pizza  with extra cheese. Their specialty.  It was soooooo good. Lots of crushed tomatoes. Full of sausage and cheese. Could only eat one slice. Server was very nice. Would highly recommend.

Two New Yorkers enter a deep dish pizza joint.  They leave satisfied.   He ordered the sausage.  I got the veggie Lou special--great flavors and textures. And, they smartly let you place your order before sitting down since it takes a while to cook.

This was my first time having Chicago style pizza and it was great. That said, we had no idea how filling it would be and really over ordered. Between the salad we ordered as a starter and then the pizzas, it was just too much. We had a large salad and two large pizzas for 4 adults and 4 kids and took home a lot of it.

Solid Chicago pizza joint.  We had the Malnati Special, and it was delicious, everything you would expect from Chicago pizza!  The atmosphere was very nice and comfortable, the service was great.  Highly recommend!

While visiting Chicago, people kept suggesting Giordano's for authentic pizza, but I decided to venture off and try something different. Omg, was I glad I did! This pizza was seriously the BEST that I've ever had. I followed the suggestion of other yelpers and got one with butter crust and it was phenomenal. I seriously can't WAIT to go back.

I came with a group of friends that had never had Chicago style pizza before. The four of them decided to get the Malnati Chicago Classic. Since I don't eat meat, I ordered the Lou's personal pizza. I feel like my review might be higher if I had tried the pizza in the big pan versus the personal one. The personal one doesn't come in a pan, and it honestly is a bit pricy for what you get! Flavors were ok, but wasn't wow.  The rest of the group, however, enjoyed the classic! I believe they do half and half, so do that if you can!

I'm visiting Chicago for the first time and wanted to try out the pizza. Yesterday was Pizzeria Uno and tonight was Lou Malnati's Pizzeria. For me, Malnati's is way better. I would even say it's the best pizza I've ever had.

If you want to wait an hour for mediocre pizza, this is your place. We ordered their signature pizza (the chicago classic). The butter crust was very good. But the rest of the pizza was severely lacking. It had way too much cheese, not enough sauce, and the sausage was pretty bland compared to what I expect on a pizza. Oh, and to top it all off, when we asked for some extra sauce to combat the excessive cheesiness, our waitress delivered us ice cold (fresh out of the fridge) sauce to put on a hot pizza? Really? And then they had the nerve to charge us for it too. Go to Gino's East or Giordano's instead.

Eh. We ordered the sausage pizza. It was bad. It was super bland. The reason I love pizza is because of all the flavors in one slice. This had none of the pros of pizza. If just felt like eating a giant slice of soggy bread.  The service was slow and the girl was sarcastic to the point where it was rude. I asked for water without ice because cold water hurts my teeth. She yelled out "we have a complicated one here!" Half jokingly.

A solid deep dish place. We ordered the "Lou" and the Malnati Chicago Classic. The Lou was our personal favorite but both were quite good. The buttercrust is excellent and I think makes the pizza in many ways. It's worth noting that the personal-sized pizzas are not very big; a reasonably hungry person could definitely handle a small by themselves.

This was my first experience with Chicago deep dish pizza and I gotta say it was pretty darn good! My mom and I came at 5:30PM, and it was already pretty crowded. We were supposed to have a twenty five minute wait, but we ended up waiting only five minutes! YAY! Also, if you had to wait more than I did, there's the option to order the pizza before you are seated, just because it takes so long to cook. Plus there's a really nice diagram in the front register area to see what the sizes of the pizza look like.  My mom and I ordered the Spinach Salad, the Stuffed Spinach Bread, and a small Malnati Chicago classic pizza. The spinach salad was pretty average, but I was still happy that we got a salad because the rest of our meal was so carby. It was nice to be able to eat something while waiting for the ~grand finale~. Nevertheless, our appetizer, the stuffed spinach bread, was delicious. It was kind of like it's own extra mini deep dish pizza with marinara sauce on the size, and I definitely recommend it if you aren't planning to eat an entire pizza!  The pizza was really good - the crust was crunchy, the tomato sauce was good, cheese was melted, the usual. Everything you want in a pizza! The only qualm I had was I wish it was a little more hot when it arrived to our table. Maybe it was just our pizza, but the cheese was pretty solidified after like five minutes which was kind of annoying.  Just to give you an idea of how much we ate - my mom and I ate all of the salad and spinach bread but only ate half of the small pizza and took the rest to-go to eat later. Overall, I thought this was a great place to try the deep-dish pizza: good service, good venue, good food. Check it out!

My my my! This is by far the best deep dish pizza I have ever tried. Tip for the wise, PRE ORDER!!!! Deep dish pizza takes an hour to make. I recommend ordering about 45-50 minutes ahead and sit down with appetizers. The calamari is exquisite. I'm a classic girl and I got the original. It was great. We added meatballs and it made my day.

I waited 45 mins for them to prepare my pie. I've never had deep dish pizza before so it definitely took me by surprise (ie I was not expecting the cheese to be layered first).  Definitely was an amazing first experience.  I love cheese and there can never be too much.  The sauce was very fresh and more rustic than your typical pizza marinara sauce.  The sausage was top-notch.  All in all, great pizza.  Would I go again? Yes.  5-stars? Not quite there.

Best deep dish in Chicago!  I've tried them all, including Gino's East which was underdone and doughy.  Lou Malnati's trumps them all.  I even got frozen ones online for my husband's birthday.  Same great taste at home.  Love it.

I took my brother and his girlfriend to Lou's and I expected more. The wait went on forever...first to get a table - 15 minutes longer than quoted - then to get the pizza that was preordered - 40 minutes after being seated - and lastly to get the check. Apparently the restaurant was having issues with the credit card machine and the waiter kept stopping by to say, "still working on it". Finally I asked to speak to the manager, but I was told he's busy. Eventually we said we are leaving (we arrived around 7pm and it was 10:30 at this point) and he asked if he could write down my credit card to run it later. I agreed and headed out frustrated that I had to give my personal information (on a napkin) to someone I didn't know. This morning I woke up to see that the charge to my card included a 20% tip...hummmm...apparently they just tip themselves for the inconvenience they caused. I expected the manager to comp the entire meal initially, but agreed to pay when I left. I did NOT, however agree to tip the waiter for what I felt was a poor dining experience (whether it was his fault or not).  Going forward I think I'll stick to Pequods or one of the other 5 deep dish restaurants that treat their customers better. UPDATE - Bernie, the Manager at the location just called to apologize and get more information about the experience - she is looking into the tip issue to understand the issue we had that night, but perhaps more noteworthy, she is going to send a gift certificate to ensure we give them another chance. At the end of the day these issues happen and I think we all understand that, but it is how you handle the issues that separates a restaurant I will give another try compared to those I give up on...looking forward to a better experience next time!

Could we stop ourself not to come to this place two days in a row? Nop! Every bite of our pitzza was a ceremony in our mouth. The combination of cheese and layers of tomatoes and fresh basil was magnificent.  And the crust? I can't find a word for it. Try this place! You won't regret it.

Great location and obviously amazing deep dish pizza!  Nothing beats sitting outside on a cool summer night with some deep dish pizza, and looking out into the triangle.  Nice al fresco dining!  Lou malnatis is a must if you are visiting Chicago, and definitely a great decision for a last minute meal. The time it takes to make the pizza is well worth it! The drinks are strong, and I love their Pinot noir.
Absolutely the best deep dish in Chicago! Their butter crust makes all the difference. Highly recommend their Chicago classic version.

Pizza was actually only so, so I thought. I got the sausage and cheese. Maybe it's my lack of experience with deep dish pizzas but I must say I prefer my Digiornio which is more flavorful. This pizza was very one dimensional in terms of taste but the crust was on point. The place was packed so it must be a local favorite.

Well let me start by saying this is my first Chicago deep dish, and I loved  it. Real busy resturant even on a Sunday. Was told the wait would  be 1 hr. I like the notification system for sitting patrons. Give you the ability to go  look around the city while you wait. But it was racing so I didn't. We ended up getting some  help from a hostess from upstairs and only waited 30 mins. Great customers  service up until we sat down.  The waitress seemed confused with  our preorder pizza ( where they have fix it then finish it  off  in the oven when u are seated so  it comes out quicker) well that was a fail because we waited 30-35 min for our pie. We ordered the classic Chicago deep dish. It was phenomenal. Just what I wanted, buttered crust, full  of cheese and top with one of the greatest tomato sauces I've had.  Glad I went with yelpers  suggestions and  ate at this place first.  So after my pizza high I hit a low again because the waitress was no where to be found and we told  her before we got the pizza we wanted the dessert cookie. S we wait again. Glad we had good convo while waiting. We get another waitress to  put  in our order. When it arrived  it was  perfect. The best cookie  that  has ever graced my palate. I was full and I wanted to  order another one. So I  have to return to chi town for some more. Great  place  just  wished the service was  better. EAT UP!!!

If you're curious about trying deep dish then by all means LMs is the way to go. It's affordable though not quick. You'll wait a minimum of 30 mins as each pie is made fresh, which is a great thing. Being from NJ/NY Area we know our pizza and deep dish is a good thing to have once in Awhile but give me a regular or thin slice any day. I do love pizza though and I sure I'll give deep dish a go at another time lol.. We got a coupon from our hotel for a free deep dish cookie dessert.. 'Twas delish though they could've kept the ice cream and tons of whip cream.. After scraping that all off I found cookie gold!!

I have been looking forward to earing good deep dish pizza since I ate at Giordano in Orlando. I was a bit scared that I just wasn't I fan of deep dish. Thank goodness I came here. When we say down we ordered the calamari and the pizza right away since it takes them around 30 min to bring the pizza out. The calamari was amazing the brought it out accompanied with a sweet and tangy sauce that was to die for. It was finger licking good. When the pizza came I couldn't wait to dig in. It was the most delicious pizza I ever had. It wasn't too loaded but it had everything it needed. It was honesyly the best pizza I've ever had. I very much looking forward to eating here again.

Deep dish pizza is a must when you visit Chicago. My recommendations are the "Lou" or "The Classic." The crust is crispy yet the pizza is very thick which was a good contrast. The spinach cheese bread is also amazing. When ordering a salad, just be aware that a single salad could feed probably 3-4 people. The family size was huge and was good enough for our table of 12 people. The spaghetti was alright but nothing out of this world. Pizza is the way to go. This place gets packed. Luckily, we came in just before the lunch rush. Be prepared to wait in line. Rain or shine, patrons are willing to stand out the door for their pizza.

The real Chicago deep dish. Great. The long wait is worth it. There are other deep dish hot spots in Chicago, but the sauce and the crust at Lou's is truly great.  They can handle two or twenty very efficiently.  We got two individual size for lunch and brought two slices back to the hotel.  The use of texting for the waitlist and to order was fun and efficient.

This was my first deep dish experience and WOW!!! This place is amazing! I remember watching the Bobby Flay vs Lou Malnati showdown and couldn't wait to try it! Lou Malnati's lives up to the hype and delivers a phenomenal deep dish pizza! I may return for dinner tonight!

This has been our favorite pizza place for many years. We had to wait an hour and 45 minutes for our pizza even though we pre ordered it. And then it came somewhat undercooked with soggy crust. We didn't bother to complain because we knew it would take another hour and a half for it to be replaced. Will never go to this location on Wells street again.

Soooooo good.  The only thing is that I made the tiny mistake of filling up on an appetizer so I could only eat a slice and a half of the amazing pizza.  Next time I'll know - save yourself for the amazing pizza.  Service was excellent.

Piiizzzzaaaa!!! This was great Chicago style pizza.  Don't try to build your own, go for the Chicago classic. While the food was great the service was rather discombobulated.  Nothing major to deter you from coming here, just seemed like a bunch of staff that didn't know what they were doing. We came in around 5 on a Friday and were seated immediately, but wow this hot spot fills up quick.  Go, and go early.

I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this place. We went on a Sunday night and the place was packed so the wait was about 30 minutes. No worries - my group just went and sat at the bar where they have several draft brew selections and a good amount of seats. I love the open atmosphere. We ended up sitting on the edge of the restaurant where the patio meets the inside seating but everything was opened up since the weather was so nice. The waiter was very friendly and attentive. We ordered a regular deep dish pizza and a gluten free pizza for myself.  My wife absolutely loved the deep dish and I ate my gluten free pizza up. The calamari is also an excellent appetizer choice. This is definitely a place I will be visiting again on my next trip to Chicago.

Lou Malnati's is a staple in Chicago. You definitely need to eat deep dish pizza when visiting in Chicago, and this is one of the best chains you can find. However, at the location we went to, the pizza was just ok, the service was average to slow, and the wings were great. I wouldn't attribute all Lou Malnati's to be this way, but I also wouldn't say Lou M's is the all time best place to get your deep dish pizza fix.

Never had deep dish pizza before and this was my first food stop in Chicago. Guess we came at a good time as we were seated immediately and taken care of right away. Since we were starving we ordered a plate of wings and two deep dish pizzas. I had the mini pepperoni pizza and my BF had the Lou malnati. We definitely underestimated how filling one pizza could be. Mine was good but the Lou malnati was hands down one of the best pizzas I've ever tried. It was oozing in cheesy deliciousness and baked with some sausages and meats. It was so good and even the tomato sauce was flavorful. We didn't end up eating it all and took some to go. But if you're gonna try deep dish, come here.
First taste of Chicago-style pizza and it was great. Very filling - believe the menu when it says small serves 2!

I've been a couple of times and it's pretty good. Love the filling; they lay out the sausage in a thick layer and smother it in cheese. A lot of people say they come for their special buttery crust, but I actually am not as big of a fan as I had hoped. I prefer a bit more flakiness than a crispy, cornbread type crust. That being said, fantastic pizza. Good service and good beer, plus the outside seating (limited) are huge bonuses. If your ever on the West Coast, check out Zachary's pizza in Berkeley and Albany. Dare I say it's better Chicago-style deep dish than Lou's?

When in Chicago, you must get deep dish pizza! Lou Malnatis did not disappoint. We got there early, around 6:30pm and didn't have to wait for a table. We did wait a little bit to get a server though. By that point we were ready to order since we knew it would take a while to get the pizza. The 3 of us started with a family size spinach salad with chicken. The salad was good, strawberries were ripe but there was not enough of them. Also not enough chicken in my opinion. Thankfully the same was the case with the dressing, but I hate salads that are swimming in dressing. The salad would have served 4-5, so we probably should have done the regular size. Once the pizzas (finally) arrived, we were all happy. I ordered an individual size cheese with spinach and green pepper. I ate half and was full but not stuffed. My coworkers shared a 2 person pizza which ended up being 4 slices total. They were pleased with their selection as well. The wait is worth it.

Went on a Friday night. Arrived at 6:30. They took our order at 6:38. We were seated around 7:00 and our server kept coming to say that the pizza was not ready. We ordered an appetizer and the pizza was still not ready. Evidently the 45 minute wait for pizza was extended to 1.5 hours because someone forgot to actually give our order to the kitchen. No, they did not admit this. Everyone around us who arrived after we did got their meal, ate, and left before our pizza arrived. I asked to speak with the manager, and said I wanted our appetizer and desserts free. He agreed to give the whole meal free, and said he would place our dessert order himself. He came back as we were finishing the pizza and said the dessert would arrive in 10 minutes. After another delay and more excuses, we left at 8:30, having had no dessert since it never arrived. Was the pizza good? Yes, indeed. Would I ever eat there again? NO, nor would I recommend to anyone. Such a shame that horrible service spoiled what would have been a really nice meal. Another customer told us their whole large group felt terrible eating their pizza when it arrived because we had been waiting since their arrival and were still sitting there hungry when all their many pizzas arrived.

Long waits and no reservations are the only reason to mark this place down. Pizza's are consistently good and go down with a beer. Staff is always trained and do a nice job. I bring my family and clients to this Lou's whenever they come into town.

We went to visit Chicago and stumbled upon this place. We ordered garlic bread,  beer and the "Malnati Chicago Classic" pizza This restaurant is delicious. I was mainly impressed by the tomato sauce. It was so savory, sweet, fresh and hearty.  The crust was so crunchy and buttery, something I didn't expect from a deep dish (I'm a native New Yorker btw) I will definitely recommend and return when I visit Chicago again.

Just returned from Lou Malnati's as our first meal in Chicago. The wait was over an hour but it was a Saturday at eight o'clock so we were ready for that. They do give you a chance to preorder your pizza while waiting which makes it faster once seated. As we were waiting, we ordered some buffalo wings and I swear they were spectacular. Once seated, our waitress recommended their signature pizza which was tomato, sausage and cheese. Although we would have loved for it to be hotter, the taste was everything we were hoping for.  I would definitely recommend this place not only for the food but also for the service.

Okay, let me preface this review with I'm no pro at deep dish pizza...I don't know much about it, don't have much to compare, and I definitely don't know how to make it. SO now that that's out of way... OMG it's like PIZZA PIE! it's delicious! Cheese, meats, crispy crust... I had to eat it with a fork, because it was just too much for my inexperienced self to handle! I wanted every bite to be a perfect combination of everything they managed into that pizza. Their fried variety appetizer thing was delicious too!

When in Chicago, deep dish is a must! I called in about 15 minutes before heading over to see if there would be a wait and to place my order (since I hear it can take almost an hour). The guy was nice enough to put my name down and got the pizza started. We still waited about 30 minutes once we got there.  We got the sausage/pepperoni and meatball spaghetti. One slice was enough to fill you up! Soo stuffed afterwards, had to walk it off...definitely recommended!
