In 1983 I had my first taste of Lou Malnati's deep dish pizza and have trumpeted its superiority over competitors Giordano's and Gino's ever since. After this visit, my opinion has changed. The pizza was down right mediocre to bad. Maybe the kitchen staff had a bad night, I don't know. What I do know is that I had built this pizza up for my youngest daughter and then had to take her to Giordano's two days later in the attempt of giving her a better experience. I cannot put my finger on it, but the pizza just did not taste good. We had the old standby -- sausage and mushroom -- and the sauce was not very good, the sausage was scarce and did not have the best flavor and the crust was pretty bad ... rather cardboard-like and not the butter crust I yearned for. I had been to this location in the past year and had a good experience, so maybe they are trying to milk more profit by cheapening ingredients or something. The service was slow, but it was a Friday night and they were busy so that is understandable.  Whatever it was, it was bad and I am not likely to return.  Since I felt like my daughter did not get a good impression of the heralded Chicago pizza, I took her to Giordano's two nights later and the pizza was outstanding.

Told my friends the one thing I had to do during my first visit in Chicago was try a deep dish pizza. So happy we came here! Since we try to steer clear of pork products (I know, blasphemous!), we ordered the cheese the and the Lou. Both were so delicious!! The Lou was especially yummy; I think it was the tomato and the cheese.  Even though I don't quite understand their portions (a small for 1-2 people?! No way; that is too much!), I can't wait for my next visit to try the rest of their pizza.

Malnati Classic was thick layer of cheese on top of the crust then sausage on top then tomato sauce. My favorite part was the crust. I thought the pizza was very bland. Only the tomato sauce added extra flavor to the pizza. I liked the thick cheese but even that didn't have much flavor. Then when it got cold it was just a thick layer of unmelted cheese, which wasn't that great.
What can I say that others have not. The quintessential Chicago pizza. My go to pizza when I want a pan pizza.. The best.

Awesome Chicago deep dish! This was my first time trying deep dish pizza, and I think I definitely made the right choice. I tried the classic, which had a little too much meat for my taste, but it was definitely delicious! I think next time I would try something with more veggies, but I will definitely return!

I took an hour and a half detour from my cross country road trip to get some infamous Chicago deep dish and I'm definitely impressed! The crust buttery yet crunchy and the house special was really tasteful in its use of sliced tomatoes in lieu of the tomato sauce. The prices are kind of absurd, however. I wonder if it's strictly their reputation that justifies a 25 dollar large pizza.

Yea I'm #1800 review and I'm telling you it rocked. Out of bounds rocked. Get the classic, pick your size, chow down. It pains me to say that as a born and raised Chicagoan who moved I was always a thin crust guy. Too much dough, Malnati's is close enough for me to almost jump sides. Almost. This is as good as it gets for deep dish, not too much and cooked perfectly throughout. We got a Giordano's on the northside, c'mon Lou you have 25 locations in Chicagoland, can't you move one down to Indy? Excellent pie, well deserved reviews.

Indulgent? Yes. Deep? Definitely.  Knocked my socks off?  Ah, no.   I won't even get into the NY vs Chi situation here, just judging what I tasted.   I went simple with it, cheese, marinara.  It was good but it didn't take me to a place of pizza ecstasy unfortunately.  I wanted to taste each element, but it was really just marinara and crust for the most part, and the crust .....bland.   Not to mention that bar service was bland too. Neither here nor there with it.  Chicago has a good rep for friendly service and people, the bartender wasn't either one of those things.   You wouldn't be missing out if you didn't go but not awful if you do.   Do with that what you will.   Rating: Two complacent nipples.

Just had dinner with my family and comparing to Giordanos on Rush.  We had the classic pizza and it was amazing!  Crust was better, service was better and the servers knew the product well.   Deep dish here was a thicker sauce made with real tomatoes.  The outside crust was amazing, bc the classic is made with a butter crust.  The pizza dough seamed to be thicker on the outside and thinner as it got to the middle. Have to say, for a cold breakfast this was much better than the Giordano's. We will be back and will refer others!
My Favorite pizza in the chicago area!! When i first moved from Michigan I wasnt really a fan of deep dish... but this spot caught my heart lol I'm not sure if its the sauce or what it is..

Ugh. SO GOOD. I can't even begin to explain how nothing else compares to the deep dish they have here at Lou Malnati's, so I won't and  you'll just have to go and try it yourself. Get "The Lou" if you're a vegetarian or you can go with their Classic. We also ordered a side salad (which we hardly touched hehe) which was a nice way to feel a bit better about ourselves. If you don't mind not eating in the restaurant, call or order online ahead of time and just pick it up when it's ready!

oh. my. god.  "Deep dish" Chicago pizza in the Bay Area will never compare to the actual thing!!  My sister, her boyfriend, and a coworker put in an order for pickup (we didn't want to wait for a couple hours on a Friday night) and ended up getting a large " The Lou". What is this? A freakin deep dish of spinach, tomatoes, and mushrooms with a blend of cheeses, all on top of a garlic buttercrust. We're all huge fans of garlic so this pizza was just freaking off the charts with the garlic. MMMMMmmmMm.  Unlike some restaurants in the Bay area like Zachary's and Little Star that boasts authentic deep dish, Lou Malnati's is the real deal. The mix of the tomatoes, spinach, and cheese was the perfect combo, with the mushrooms adding nice flavor to each bite as well. The crust was nice and soft, brown and golden on the outsides. I've always thought Chicago style pizza was just "whatever" after having slices of pizza COVERED in tomato sauce at Zachary's (I think imo doing this makes me stop at one slice because the tomato sauce is just too much for me). Lou's has changed it for me--it was not slathered with a huge later of tomato sauce. Instead, it was just the perfect balance of crust, cheese, and filling. Mmm. Give me more (or ship it to me! PLEASE?!) Another thing we had on the side was the Malnati salad...but there's not much to say. Who care's about salad when you have amazing pizza to drool over? Anyway, the salad came with several toppings--we could hardly eat any after being so stuffed with the pizza (you read that right....... we went for the pizza first)

Enjoyed sausage deep dish with spinach. Crust was thin and of an excellent taste, balance of toppings good (maybe more spinach? Cheese amount was perfect though). I'm not from Chicago, so I can't comment on authenticity.  Interior was pleasant, good mix of raw materials and finish. There was adequate space for the tables.  Spot on logistics even in a packed place with a crowd outside.

Overrated pizza. Too cheesy and soggy crust. If you are from there bag area, Zachary's, little star, or paxti's are way better. Disappointed because deep dish is local and expected more. Very efficient seating system. Placed order ahead of time and was only 10 min after seated before we ate our pizza.

As a rare visitor to Chicago from a city not known for its Italian, it would be easy for a deep dish to fail to live up to my dreams. However, my sausage-spinach mix pizza was nothing short of perfection. The crust was sweet and buttery, the cheese generous but not overwhelming the rest of the pizza, and the ingredients fresh. To top it off, the creative and scrumptious deep dish cookie smothered in ice cream was flawless in taste and presentation.  Excellent service despite my party's relatively small bill- my cherry diet coke was always filled (great job Michael!). Our 45-minute estimated wait took only 20 minutes, texted to my phone when our table was ready.  Fun ambience with march madness playing in the background, a mix of families and couples and friends, and roller skates hanging from the wall. Clean booths and general interior.  A must-visit for anyone seeking delicious Chicago deep dish in a positive environment. Thanks Lou!

Fellas and hunnies - I just want to say... I'm sorry. I'm sorry I didn't take a picture of the pepperoni pizza I just devoured - but you'll never believe what happened!  I took one bite. Immediately followed by another. And another. I just kept eating and eating simply because this is the BEST #%&! pizza I've ever had! Holy cow. The cheese - the high quality mozzarella - hits the taste buds and forces their demand for me to raise another slice to my pie-hole. The perfect amount of sauce paired with the fresh vine-ripened tomatoes packed a wonderful flavorful punch. The crust. I ain't  a crust guy. Like a 2 year-old, I typically eat around them and toss them in the garbage. The soft and buttery crust of this deep dish disappeared into the intestinal abyss after just one taste.  Accept my apology, and go to Lou's.

This is, hands down, the best pizza I've had in my life! I've never really had legitimate Chicago deep dish, so when we decided to head there for St. Paddy's Day, I made this a requirement! After being referred there by more than a few friends, we decided to give Lou Malnati's a shot! It ended up being SO delicious that we went there a second time (in just 3 days!) and this was definitely the better location, mostly due to the additional seating. Since we were there the morning after St. Paddy's, I can tell you that their hangover-friendly bloody mary is fantastic! It's not too thick, and it has just the right amount of kick, if you order it spicy. I shared a house salad, and while it was fairly standard, it was nice after such a health-less weekend to get some greens in... Then comes the best part - the pizza!!! We'd tried the Lou and the Chicago Traditional one on Friday night, and my heart ached for the veggies of the lou... but my stomach said I needed protein. So, we created the best pizza I've ever had - the lou + sausage! This was the thickest, most delicious, fresh pizza EVER!!! I only wished I were hungry enough to finish another slice. The veggies taste great, especially the mushrooms and roma tomatoes. It does take around 30-45mins for the pies to cook, but I promise, they're worth the wait! If you're looking for a great Chicago experience, and some too-legit-to-quit-(eating) deep dish, look no further! Lou Malnati's was -the bomb-!!!  (Tip: Send someone ahead of your party, as there will almost certainly be a wait.)
If you visit Chicago, you owe it to yourself to get pizza. This was my second time at a Lou Malnati's, but this was a new location near our hotel. Fantastic 'za, fun server, plenty of leftovers.

We came here for dinner on the day of the Saint Patrick's parade. Needless to say, even at 9 p.m., the streets were swarming with people in the restaurant had a mile long line. We put our name on the list and were surprised at how quickly we were seated. The restaurant staff handled the crowds really well.  Of course, as out of towners, we came here because we heard that Lou had the authentic chicago deep dish pizza.  For starters, we had the spinach stuffed bread. It was served quickly and warm with a little side of marinara. It was a perfect appetizer as we waited for pizza. There was a slightly long wait for the pizza but I'm sure it was due to the fact of the restaurant was at maximum capacity.  The pizza itself had mushrooms spinach and tomatoes (we opted to go vegetarian) and was quite tasty. However, coming from Houston, I feel that we've had pizza as good as this, if not better. That's not to say that we didn't enjoy this meal very much and the pizza was delicious, but for some reason I was expecting an out of this world, ethereal food experience. I would come back again. We also witnessed an expertly handled customer situation that could have gone quite wrong! The table behind us had two people, one of which had passed out in the booth (a little too much St. Paddy's celebrating). The staff expertly dealt with this and got the person up and home to safety. Good job

I have tried other Chicago pizzas when I'm on vacation at the tourist places like Gino's or Pizzeria Uno/Due, but this place beat them all!  The crust is a butter crust, which really comes through and balances the acidity of the tomato sauce. We ordered the meat lover's pizza, which was loaded with meat. It as if  someone rolled out their italian sausage so it covered the entire pizza. The delivery came faster than they told us. My favorite Chicago style pizza yet...

This was my second experience at this location. It is always crowded and takes over an hour to get your food, even if you order your pizza the moment you walk in. That is to be expected and the pizza is worth it. However, this last time, we had horrible service.  Our server, John, was nowhere to be found for most of our meal. We waited a very long time before he even took our drink orders. I think he forgot about our pizza, because it was just warm when it finally arrived. He came around once to ask us if everything was alright, when there was only one slice of pizza left. Then, he put down our bill without asking if we wanted anything else. We ordered dessert and my boyfriend asked for a refill. Before my best friend and I could ask for more water, because our cups were empty, he was gone. He clearly wasn't paying attention and did not seem to care. The only time he was fast was when he came to pick up our check. I would have at least understood if it was busy, but it was not even crowded while we were eating.  The redeeming quality was their manager, Peter (I think was his name). He was very apologetic and offered us a complementary pizza due to the terrible service. I was pleased that they actually cared about the quality of their service and our experience, not just their famously delicious pizza--which was very delicious.  I will return, but hopefully I will not be served by John!

I visit Chicago fairly often but do not understand why I never gave this place a try.  It turned out to be the best deep dish I've had in Chicago.  Buttery crust,  adequate amount of cheese,  and just enough sauce made it impossible to put away.  I recommend this place to everyone if they want to have the best deep dish in town!

I got to school in Dallas, and whenever I go home to Chicago, I always go straight from O'Hare to get some deep dish pizza.  I would highly recommend that if someone were to visit Chicago, then they should visit Lou!

My favorite U.S. style pizza anywhere.  Pairs excellently with the Goose Island Matilda, believe it or not.  Last time I went I had a free coupon from my hotel for the cookie pizza.  That was amazing too.

Exceptional Chicago-style pizza, true deep dish, not 'stuffed' like Giordano's.  When it comes to pizza in Chicago,  I prefer the pizza at Lou Malnati's (5-stars) over Giordano's (4-stars) and then prefer Giordano's over Gino's (3-stars).

This is what the best deep dish pizza looks like.  Be sure to get low fat cheese - it makes NO DIFFERENCE in taste.  Also - have them take the extra 10 mins to cook the pizza well done.  It makes it a little more crunchy on the bottom and a little more refined on the palate.  When I come back to Chicago - THIS is my first place I wanna go.
Simply the best al long as you order the butter crust!!!! Service its always great. Salads fresh but it's all about the pizza

Lived up to my expectations - fresh tomato sauce, delicious mozzarella. We had the classic sausage and the pepperoni. Both made me very happy. The servings were large and I took the leftovers home. They taste great cold too! Also a fun, relaxed place to go with friends. Staff were friendly.

Can I say that the pizza is amazing! !!! So me and my girlfriend came in for lunch for our last day in Chicago.  We ordered the lunch special that came with a salad, personal deep dish and s soda for almost $10.00.  The salad was good, but the pizza was amazing!!! Yummy!!!  The only reason this place could not get a 5 star is because of the sketchy liquor.   I understand this is pizza place not a bar but when you oder stoli it should taste like what the bottle says. I know businesses do this but I am an avid vodka drinker and cheap LQ makes me sick...literally.  The bar tenders face turned red so I knew it was a problem already.   The staff took me drink back and I ordered crown on the rocks.  It was sketchy too but the pizza made up for everything! I will definitely come back when I come back to the city!!

My husband is not a fan of deep dish. However, numerous friends insisted we try out this place & it didn't disappoint! We knew it had to be delicious when the entire place was packed out on a Thursday night around 8pm with folks still rolling in.   Even though our order was messed up at the counter & were initially charged more, both our server & manager were extremely great about it. They reduced our bill price, still received a larger pizza & the manager brought it out to serve us. Very friendly and apologetic. It wasn't even that big of a deal for us. Very pleased!  The atmosphere was perfect! Noisy, comfortable pizza joint. We even had the Bulls game right next to us which is the one thing my husband hoped for - so that was a bonus.  Great place to bring family & friends. We order the Lou deep dish with pepperoni. Fresh tomatoes :)
Great pizza joint! Add butter crust to any pizza along with a pitcher of the 312 draft beer and your up for a great night!

So I came here after already having a first dinner at a nearby Japanese restaurant.  Why? Because when this LA boy is in Chicago, that means a local shortage of pizza is about to happen to the local market. Here there was a wait of about 20 minutes or so for a party of one. Big crowd is a good sign!  I took a seat at the bar and the guys behind it took real good care of me. If you're in there, sit at the bar if Justin and Joe are working they give great service, have awesome tips for local places, and are all around goodfella's.  I was chatting up some good friendly local regulars at the bar and laughing a bit louder and longer than I would in LA, thanks to the anti-hero beers, (look for the draft with the green fist tap handle), when my pepperoni personal sized pizza arrived right at the bar for me.  Heaven followed! I mean real taste-bud, eye rolling, temporary loss of consciousness culinary heaven kids!  The tomatoes on top are fresh, not canned. The texture of freshly chopped tomatoes is unmistakable. Yup turns out they use fresh globes for the pies.  The cheese and crust are perfect! Ooey-gooeyness meeting crunch in absolute harmony.  It was a filling dinner for one (not counting my previous dinner only an hour before). Ladies and gentlemen I've had pizzas from all over the world. When it comes to pizza "pies", Believe me, this place does it the best, and gets a rock-steady, blues harp jammin', sweet home Chicago wailing 5 stars from me.

I'm a New York/New Haven Pizza Guy through and through, but when in Chicago, you have to have one of their deep dish pizzas and while there are no shortages of deep dish pie in the Windy City, Lou Malnati's is definitely the best.  The crust is rich and buttery.  The toppings are rich, plentiful and fresh.  It was so good.  And the service was top notch.  A must-stop whenever I'm there.

Lou Malnati's is the exception to my non-deep dish rule. And that's based off of just their delivery cheese pizza. That's how damn good we're talking here.  Like I said, I'm not a huge fan of deep dish pizza. In fact, I pretty much thought I hated it up until Lou Malnati's. And you know what else I'm not a big fan of? Delivery. I love my pie fresh and hot. LM blew these notions out of the water.  The first thing I noticed about this pie was that it holds heat WAY better than a thinner crust pie. So that kicked my delivery judgement out the window. Secondly, how is this thing not the greasiest thing ever? It just isn't. I have no idea how, but hot damn it's good. Third, that sauce. You can actually taste the fresh tomatoes--obviously homemade. The sauce had enough flavor to carry this entire cheese pizza. Fourth, this is REAL deep dish pizza. That stuff in Cleveland I thought was deep dish, isn't. Can never be.  Now I know, only Chicago knows deep dish and Lou Malnati's just might be the best.

Pretty good pizza! We got a small deep dish with 3 toppings. The yelp reviews were super convincing. So I think my hopes were set pretty high. Honestly it was just good! Not the best I've ever had but pretty good! I'd come back.

Eh. I've had better. Was expecting more due to the reviews but I was very disappointed. We ordered delivery so maybe that's different than eating in but either way, our pizzas were nothing to write home about. We ordered a GF pizza and a regular classic deep dish and both crusts fell far below our expectations. Maybe it's one I will have to give a second chance but for now, 2 stars it is.

Oh Lou Malnati -- how do I love thee -- let me count the ways! If you are searching Yelp and have landed at the Lou Malnati's reviews you need not search Yelp any further. STOP searching Yelp, and experience Lou Malnati's pizza for yourself. Yeah, yeah, bada-bing, bada-boom, you are definitely at the right spot for Chicago style deep-dish pizza. The quality of ingredients is above 5-stars. Malnati's was voted number one deep-dish pizza several years in a row by Chicago locals, and for good reason.Yes, it is better than Gino's East, Pizzeria Uno, Pizzeria Due, Pizano's Pizza, Pequod's, Nancy's Pizza, etc. For the gastronomical experience of a pizza life time it doesn't get any better than Lou-Lou! When we lived on the corner of Illinois and Orleans, years ago, we used to walk here regularly. In the summer time, we enjoyed huge salads, ordered a few brew-skis, and our favorite deep dish pizza (sausage). The crust is crispy, never burned with a buttery and meritorious flavor! The dough is made from scratch daily, so you can taste the quality and freshness at first bite. Also, a crispy exterior creates an almost irresistible situation. The toppings are endless and the tastefully satisfying plum tomato sauce makes for the ultimate amalgamation. For some of us, it is a matter of personal preference or taste as to "which" place in the City has the BEST 5-star or 10-star Chicago deep dish pizza. It's the bite you always look forward to and multiplied to serve you ubiquitous satisfaction. This is exactly what Lou Malnati's does time and time again! For the most part, this location is filled with people who live in the River North and/or the Loop surrounding areas, so you have your local Chicago peeps, coupled with a few tourists. Yes, people come from all over the city, but I like that this place has more "locals" than tourists. I also like the diversity of the crowd here and the cool vibe that the restaurant offers. This isn't NYC pizza, so don't expect that kind of pizza here. Hey, this is Chicago where we invented deep-dish pizza that you eat with a fork and knife! This restaurant has been around for a long time now, and for good reason. If you come to Lou Malnati's when it is warmer weather in Chicago walk around the neighborhood and explore the River North neighborhood (known for art galleries and antique shops). The area has changed a lot since we lived here over 15-years ago, but it is still a vibrant, trendy, artsy section of Chicago.  It is difficult to find street parking around here, so you may end up having to park in a nearby parking lot (which could be pricey) or simply take a cab or public transportation to this location. Reservations are not accepted. You may have a long wait if you come on a Friday or Saturday. Expect to wait any where from 45 minutes to 1-1/2 hours!  4-stars = Parking (challenging; a pain in the a$$) 5-stars = Pizza - excellent -- awesomeness 4-stars = Service 4-stars = Beer and other Spirits 4-stars = Price-Point 2-stars = TV (why oh why does every restaurant feel the need to have one) When the moon hits your eye Like a big pizza pie, that's amore When the world seems to shine Like you've had too much wine, that's amore .....;D ...and this is what Lou Malnati's is to me!!!
Must try the Malnati Chicago classic!!!  I was a die hard Giardano's fan,  but this is even better.....  Believe it or not.   Prices are reasonable too.... $$

Lou Malnati's over Giordano's every day of the week. Both of these are widely-popular, go-to, and Chicago-styled pizzas, but Lou Malnati's is clearly superior pizza. Only problem is the limitation of toppings. They don't chicken for crying out load!

Like this place needs another good review .. I'm going to leave one anyway. The very long wait was well worth it. I've never had pizza like this before, and i'm not sure I will again, until I visit Chicago next. I appreciated them having NBA on the TV too, although it was a date night, my wife knew an important game was on and didn't mind my odd glance at the TV here or there.

My husband and I chose Lou Malnati's for our Valentine's Day wedding dinner. We wanted our out-of-town family to have a Chicago-style meal. We didn't go thru catering because we didn't want all pizza and salad. I love the Talapia Piccata! I called 5 hours beforehand and the man on the phone carefully took my order being careful to get the details. We had them deliver it to our hotel and it arrived at the time requested. It was almost perfect except we would've liked a side of cheese for the pasta and a side of dressing for both salads. I couldn't believe feeding 11 people with delivery and tip was under $180! We even had pizza leftover for us! Our guests enjoyed having a variety of choices as we showed them the menu beforehand so they could choose exactly what they wanted. Being a small wedding I didn't want to have a set menu. Thank you River-North!

Who doesn't love a decadent pie smothered in cheese and tasty tomatoes? The crust. Oh my. It's very similar to the crust in a quiche and I love it!!!!!!! Service was exceptional. The place was packed with locals and tourists alike so don't be afraid that you'll be ending up in a tourist trap. Even if this was a touristy place, my taste buds wouldn't care!

This was by far the best deep dish pizza in Chicago! The quality is amazing and the place is cozy with a great family feel! I don't know if I can eat any where else for deep dish after eating here. We loved it!

This pizza was amazing!! We ordered the classic Lou the crust was perfect: crispy, butter, and held the toppings perfectly. I've tried other pizzas and the crust are soggy. The pricing is great we ordered an appetizer, salad, pasta, pizza and sandwich all for 50. The portions are great! We were stuffed and didn't have room for dessert.

It was good but not the best.  I was on a business trip and I came by here as soon as I got out of the airport.  We stayed in a hotel in the North River area about 1.5 miles from this place.  We walked it and got there - no wait and ordered a few beers and the mozzerella sticks to start off.  My fiance and I split the deep dish and it was pretty good but not as good as the other two in town ;-) I do have to say that the service was on point and she took good care of us.

Coming from out of state, this was highly recommended from friends and local Chicagoans to come here. I have to say that the hype was a waste of stomach space. The classic pizza was a classic disappointment due to the watery tomato sauce topping and the bland crust that we didn't even eat. The sausage tasted like a regular breakfast sausage layered with some cheese. Best part of the meal was the tiramisu and the service and their special Lou's salad. I would not recommend this place for deep dish pizza and would say that it does not live up to the hype.

Egh, perhaps this place was a little too hyped up that it led to my disappointment. I guess I was expecting the best deep dish in Chicago but sorry this place fell short. I tried their traditional deep dish pie. Sauce was pretty bland and my crust was soggy. I made it a mission to try as many deep dish locations on my visit to Chicago but this place was my least favorite food wise. Service on the other hand was phenomenal and still worth the experience. I just wouldn't say it's the BEST deep dish in Chicago bc for me it definitely was not.

Always stop by this location when I'm in Chicago, the best deep dish in the City, even though Geno's East is good too.  Service at this location is great and it feels like a neighborhood bar if you sit at the bar.  Fun atmosphere and you can of course take home a frozen pie for later too.

Not only does Lou's have great pizza, they have amazing customer service. I had the opportunity to send a group of 20 hungry students to Lou's River North and when asked for special requests they happily complied. They followed up the week of our event and even called to make sure everything was ok when our group was late arriving.  There is no other option for deep dish when you visit Chicago...Lou Malnati's is the best - hands down!

Good deep dish pizza. The mixed chopped salads is delicious. My family enjoyed it. This is pretty authentic Chicago pizza. Fun environment  and friendly staffs. So many locations to choose from. I also ordered the  Calamari. It was very fresh and crunch cause I hate it when restaurants bring about soggy ones.

Came to chicago for my husbands graduation for bootcamp and you can't come here without trying some deep dish pizza so yelp reccomended this place to us and boy was it delicious!!! My favorite type of pizza is deep dish so I couldn't wait to have it here in Chicago!  Coming from San Diego we have a couple places that do make deep dish pizza but never tasted like this! We ordered the calamari for our appetizers and it was delicious as well and a large pepperoni and vegetable deep dish pizza. It took about 30-45 minutes to cook but trust me it was worth the wait! When it came out it was huge! I was only able to finish one piece! Our server was an older lady and she was so sweet and even gave my husband a complimentary brownie because he was in uniform! Everyone here was polite even the customers who seemed to be regulars were very welcoming and seems like most of the customers knew all of the servers!  Boy do I miss deep dish pizza right now San Diego defintely needs to step up its game and bring lou malatis to the west coast!

I ordered a deep dish pizza for delivery right before I left for the airport. They sent a completely wrong pizza. Thin crust and completely wrong toppings.  The girl that took the order on the phone was rude too. I would not recommend this restaurant.

I'm from California so I was excited to try my first ever Chicago deep-dished pizza. After doing some intense research on the internet, Lou Malnati's seemed like the #1 place to go to. However, I wasn't too impressed.  Food: Pizza orders take about 30-40 minutes to make so you definitely want to order an appetizer if you're hungry. We ordered the 3 dip appetizer. I liked the spinach artichoke the most out of the roasted garlic, spinach artichoke and hummus. As for pizza goes, I ordered a personal Lou pizza (spinach, mushrooms, roma tomatoes) and added pepperoni. I felt like my pizza was a bit too greasy and the crust was really hard, making it difficult to bite into.  Service: Our waiter was very attentive and friendly. He constantly checked if we needed anything (food/order wise). We also asked him about the night life in the area and he was kind enough to write us a list of suggestions of where to go! Service included, I would probably rank Lou's with four stars but the food itself was okay (The ranking I gave was purely on the food because that's what Lou Malnati's is famous for =P). I tried Giordano's the next day and I liked Giordano's pizza a lot more. But overall, I really don't know what the hype for deep dish pizzas is all about.

Amazing pizza. The best Chicago deep dish pizza that I have had to date. The bread is flaky and rich in flavor. The tomato sauce is perfectly balanced. Since I live in LA, I order the pizzas online. It is fairly priced and arrives quickly. The sausage pizza is delicious. You will not be disappointed.

Good if you like Chicago style pizza.  The tomatoes taste really fresh and the rest of the toppings are top notch.  I prefer a non-lasagna-esque pizza however so I'm probably not the best reviewer.  If you end up visiting Chicago and you want a decent pie.. This one is better than the other three I've had in town.

Service and location are great. The garden salad was not good. The veggies didn't taste fresh and the red wine vinaigrette was very oily. The pizza was good (classic, add spinach), but extremely salty. Everyone had dry mouth the entire evening/night after and woke up parched.

Another great stuffed pizza place! If you like the pizzas, they can ship them to your house.  I will be ordering some once I clear some space in my freezer. There is a family friendly dining area and a full bar if you wish.  The waitress we had was a riot and very friendly. Make this a stop for some real Chicago style pizza.

"Majestic." "Holy...." "Oh. My. God."  These were words used to describe the glorious goodness that is Lou Malnati's deep dish pizza. We got pepperoni, and when asked if we wanted a buttery crust, we responded with a "heck to the yes!" This pizza is like nothing I've had before. Definitely better than Costco.

This place gets a five star rating from me. It was so AMAZING! It was the best pizza I have ever had in my life. The tomato sauce on the pizza is so rich. I got a deep dish pepperoni pizza with extra cheese and garlic. My boyfriend got sausage on his as well. We both love it. Also we got Chicken Marsala Rigatoni pasta that was absolutely delicious. The wine was even great! I highly recommend this place if you are coming to Chicago. Love love love!
I really enjoyed it it was worth the trip. nice atmosphere enjoyed the basketball game on the big screen TV. It has a nice neighborhood feel about it

Perfect buttery crust... BEST DEEP DISH IN CHICAGO! I have been coming to Lou for many years and am never dissapointed. This location is a bit older compared to the renovated Schaumburg location but it adds to the feel of a homely family tradiational chicago favorite deep dish.  I highly recommend this location for the restaurant vibe, quick wait time, friendly staff, cleanliness and outstanding Pizza!. My favorite is the Lou w/ the butter crust.  Only downfall is they only have 1 TV so if your going to have a few beers and pizza this isn't your best spot but this is a personal preference as I don't go to restaurants to watch TV.. that's what Bars are for.

In town on a quick trip and we wanted deep dish pizza. This place was great. The service, the suggested appetizers, the salad, and at last the pizza were all so good. The atmosphere was great as well.

We ate at Lou Malnati's Pizzeria during our stay in Chicago in October. It was very windy and cold so a deep dish pizza seemed like the perfect end to our day. We had a 45 minute wait, not even during prime-time dinner hours. It was like 3:30pm. However, while we waited we could put our pizza order in which was fantastic since these pizzas take awhile to cook. When we were seated, we got some drinks and still had a bit of a wait.  This was my very first taste of Chicago deep dish and we were very impressed! The crust was thick and buttery, and the cheese perfectly melted and sauce on top. We couldn't finish our pizza so we had to take half of it back to the hotel.   I can't wait for my next trip to Chi-Town this year so I can go back to Lou Malnati's. I'd like to be able to try other toppings and flavors and maybe get a salad. So I can justify eating loads of cheese and buttery crust. Oh yeah.

Chicago pizza WINS, hands down, over all other pizzas!  Casual restaurant for a consistent experience for everyone: couples, families, friends who have all brought their appetites.   The butter crust is a must.  It's rich, crispy and gives the pizza a warmer and more decadent taste.  The pizza is a little less cheesy and a bit more cheese than the other popular chains in Chicago, so Lou Malnati's would be my vote every time.   Also, if you plan accordingly you can even sneak in an order of calamari.  I was with my sister and we split an appetizer of calamari and a personal pizza with spinach and it was JUST ENOUGH.  I think if we had ordered a bigger pizza we would have needed to be rolled out of there. I canNOT wait to go back.  Sigh...why can't this be a national chain?

To preface: I am a New Yorker and I'll always choose NY pizza over Chicago. I was expecting greatness at this place when I read all of the reviews from people in the tri-state area, and was a bit disappointed. I thought the garlic bread was delicious, very tasty and cheesy just like I like it. However, the sauce of the pizza was just too tart for me, and the cheese was not as melty as I would like it to be. I think I also expected the crust to be more buttery than it actually was. I get that this is how Chicago style pizza goes, but I could never move there :P It was also a different experience because most pizza places in NY are family businesses and not a chain, but the staff was really friendly and accommodating.

Lou Malnati's Pizzeria satisfies every time.  On my last trip out to Chicago I was lucky enough to try the big three of deep dish pies and must admit that Lou Malnati's was a serious contender to Giordano's while Pizzeria Uno was a distant third. Malnati's has a polished if not expected touristic feel to it but the staff is friendly enough and considering each pie takes 45 minutes to fire, they do a good job of keeping the masses flowing. Their menu is extensive but my play was the obvious: I am here for the Pizza and Pizza only.  The "Lou" was what I opted for, a whimsical affair featuring spinach mix, mushrooms and sliced roma tomatoes covered with blended Mozzarella, Romano and Cheddar cheeses on a thick, yet flaky garlic "Buttercrust". This Pizza is very good. No, scratch that... it is excellent. A perfect cheese to tomato ratio and the crust is doughy in the inside but does not overwhelm the other flavors. The meats follow through in the finish along with a hard hit of Garlic. One piece had me feeling pretty full but I went all in on a second slice since we simply do not have pies like these out west and I walked out feeling like the Michelin man.  The small will feed two at $16.00 and is a great value in my mind. I will most certainly be back next time I visit the windy city... After I have already had Giordano's that is.

Edit: Added a star for the complimentary dessert after we sent back our pizza. They cooked it longer and the manager came out to offer us the cookie dessert. Good customer service, but still expected more out of the food.  ---- Very disappointed with the pizza given all the reviews. We got the "Lou" pizza which should've been a pretty safe bet as one of their specialities, and we even just got a small pizza for two of us. So there should be no reason that our pizza would arrive undercooked. The flavors weren't to die for either. We also ordered the bruschetta appetizer (bread was great but the rest was eh), and a pear salad. My favorite thing of this whole meal was the salad, and that's saying something for a pizzeria.

We usually go to Gino's East when we're in Chicago but this time we wanted to try someplace else so we chose Lou Malnati's.  Next time we're back to Gino's! The pizza was "ok" but nothing special.  The sauce was very bland, like a can of tomatoes with no spices at all.   We waited 45+ minutes to get a table (which we expected - 6pm on a Saturday night) but since we ordered the pizza when we put our name in for a table, I didn't expect to wait *another* 45+ minutes for the pizza.   The service was also "ok" but not great. The waitstaff was running their tails off, but the place seemed sorely short-staffed, like half the servers had called in sick that night. Overall it was ok, not great.  We probably won't go back - lots of other choices in the area.
Excellent and better than Gino's. I had Gino's last month when I was in Chicago but believe it or not this was better. You can't go wrong with the classic and a revolution IPA.

Finally! I have finally had authentic deep dish Chicago pizza. I have to say, I do miss the tons of toppings that we usually pile our pies with in California. The salad my friend ordered was pretty good too and glad we didn't order much more because the pie was good, but really filling. Unlike the pizza that I'm used to, the toppings are underneath the cheese, not on top. The crust reminded me of a cracker/bread. It wasn't dry, but had more mass than a thin crust (of course). It was different and considering this was my first experience, I would like to try the other spots (Uno/Pequod's/Burt's).

"There can be no deep disappointment where there is not deep love." --MLK Jr.  I chose Lou Malnati's as the deep dish pizza try on my recent Chicago trip.  It was just okay.  Exactly as I expected.  There is really no point making comparison to other pizza styles, either, due to the fairly significant differences between the deep dish and other styles.  At this time I can't say whether Lou Malnati's represents a good, average, or poor product of the style.  However, odds are not great that I would ever truly *love* a dish that resembles a meaty, cheesy casserole with pie crust.  I might enjoy a slice or two when hungry.      We had one each of the "Lou" and "Chicago Classic".  Both of them were decently made, tasted fine, if just a bit greasy.  The amount of food was a bit overwhelming.  This might appeal to families.  We also had the chicken wings which were all right.  Nothing was especially memorable. I did not like the atmosphere very much.  It was very 90's chain restaurant and also a bit touristy in terms of the clientele (myself obviously contributing).  It sounds like I should give this experience 2 stars.  But I decide to give a 3 by default until and if I have tried more similar places on future Chicago visits.

Never really had Chicago deep dish pizza before. Got a personal size of Lou's specialty pizza (w/ mushrooms, spinach and tomatoes). It was actually pretty good and not crazy heavy. I probably wouldn't have it again any time soon but it was enjoyable. Also the wait staff was very nice and attentive.
Long wait...pizza was rather bland. But it tasted all right. Not the best deep dish around. What is to die for is their trio dip.

The staff was friendly and attentive and the pizza was sublime.  It took about 30 minutes for our pizzas to arrive, but it was well worth the wait. I split a "small" "the Lou" with a friend and we were both satisfied. I'll be dropping by again next time I'm in the Windy City.

Came in for lunch during the weekday. I had their deep dish pizza in personal size. The pizza was ok nothing special. Perhaps it was the small size that i got... I felt like i ate more crust than anything.... But I'd be willing to come back and try their larger sizes to see if there'd be more cheese, sauce, and flavor to them
yes the pizzas are all wonderful BUT ORDER THE HOUSE SALAD with house dressing Mmmmmmmmm

If you're coming to visit Chicago you have to find a place to try quintessential Chicago deep dish pizza.  I really recommend Lou Malnati's.   I really like this place. The Decour wasn't what I expected for a pizzeria , hockey shoes on the wall couldn't really make sense of the rhyme or reason for the decorations. But otherwise is a busy hubbub of a  place to eat pizza.  Great bring kids because it's so loud in there nobody will even notice that your kids are behaving poorly if indeed they do.  Judging from the way the locals talk about it the food is pretty consistent too.   Our group of six with seated within minutes without a reservation. The waiter came quickly and today I drink orders and reappeared with them very shortly.  In no time the server had made suggestions, and taking a rather complicated order. And in very little time our Malnati salad arrived. This salad is unique and delicious.  It is a mixture of romaine lettuce, tomatoes, black olives, mushrooms, salami bits and gorgonzola cheese with our Sweet Vinaigrette and romano cheese.  We ordered  family size for $12.25 and there was plenty  for six with second helpings (4 guys & 2 gals) and the sweet vinaigrette dressing was amazing and addictive. You have got to try to salad dressing.  One of our party does not eat pork and they gladly prepared a small version for him.  By the way, they have several gluten free options here. We ordered 3 large pies, which reportedly each serve 4.  The Lou (spinach mix, mushrooms, tomatoes, covered with mozzarella, romano and cheddar cheese) is DELICIOUS and the cheddar cheese blends perfectly with the spinach for a unified pizza experience in each bite.  The Malnati Chicago Classic (sausage, loads of cheese and a chunky tomato sauce) does not hold back on the meat.  This Housemade Chicago sausage covers the entire pizza.  I actually think it was one large pizza size patty!  The third was a build your own pizza ( can't remember the toppings). The crusts on all three was the trademark Buttercrust.  This crust lives up to its name with its buttery goodness.  At first glance I thought a Buttercrust would clash with the savory toppings, but no it's the perfect accompaniment for Lou Malnati's fresh pizza toppings.  The Lou's crust includes garlic which minimizes the sweetness a bit and helps to create the perfect crust for a savory all veggie pizza.  Eat here when you visit .....they have over 25 restaurants. But if you don't wNt to wIt you can order online, I am!
I'm not much of a review writer but the pizza here is no joke. "Terrible". The dough is undercooked. U can still see the layers of cheese. No flavor. What else can I say? This is not food.
Ever notice that all the stellar reviews for this dump are from people not in Chicago???

Pepperoni deep dish pizza. I must be in pizza heaven.  I came here despite the common tendency for tourists to visit Giordano's or Gino's. So glad I did. The service is amazing, and not packed at all (well it is 2pm).  Food takes 30 minutes (they tell you)to make so get here before you're starving. Lovee itt~

Deep-dish pizza, I owe you an apology. For years I thought lesser of you than your cousin from New York, probably due to the pasty and forgettable offerings from chain pizza joints scattered throughout the Midwest. But here in Chicago is the real-deal thing that slapped my taste buds upside the head and made them call it "Sally" and beg for mercy. This pizza is simply unlike any other pizza I've ever had. Living in New York for two years, I found that the vast majority of pizza places (usually with the name "Ray" in the restaurant title) were pretty interchangeable. But the deliciousness I had here is truly one-of-a-kind. So, which is better, New York or Chicago pizza? IT'S A TRICK QUESTION. They are two separate and delicious things. The "classic" that I had at Lou Malnati's is a sit-down-and-savor type of meal, not something you absentmindedly nosh while watching terrible reality shows. This was like a beautiful crimson pie stuffed with meat and other goodness. I'm a husky gent, and even I could only finish two enormous pieces before being stuffed beyond belief. That's OK, though, because it meant I had pizza for days and days. And when I finished my last piece back home in Cleveland, I almost wept, because it meant that I live six hours away from this treasure.

We came here mainly to try their deep dish pizza - one of Chicago's must haves! We ordered: HONEY GARLIC CHICKEN WINGS It wasn't anything special but I thought the ranch sauce was really good DEEP DISH PIZZA (with extra sausage and bacon) First bite and I was already convinced I would come back to Chicago just for more of this. But we ordered a large pizza which was way too much for 4 people (I could only eat 1.5 slices, the guys had to finish our portion hahaha). We all got so full, we had a consensus that one try at deep dish pizza is enough for our entire trip to Chicago :P

We came here for lunch, because it was walking distance from our hotel and had really great ratings. My husband was craving a deep dish Chicago pizza, I just wanted a salad and my son wanted a pizza. They had an awesome lunch special with drinks, personal pizza and a salad. My three year old son and I split our meal. My husband said it was okay, but would have probably been better if we had ordered a whole pizza and split it. He said it wasn't the same. I don't know, because I've never had one before, and I wasn't in the mood to try it. My salad was great, lol. There was no wait at brunch, so that was nice, the food came out pretty quick too. The restaurant was quaint and it had pictures of people on the wall and it looked like the bottom of a ships' keel was used as the ceiling. We attempted to come back here the following night with friend's and family, we had a group of nine people. It was a Friday night, and the streets were full! We should have made reservation s to the restaurants that would accepted it, rather than roam the street in hopes that we could find food somewhere. The wait here was two hours and you could call them in advance and they will cook your order halfway and finish it when you were seated. We waited for about 30 minutes before we were done. We decided to leave and grab something else; because there was no way we were going to be able to sit outside for another two hours in the freezing cold with our three year old. Keep in mind, it was December.  The three isn't because of the wait, it's actually based on the meal we had. It was okay, but nothing I would wait two hours for. That's just me though.

Happy to have found this gem in our trip to Chicago! When we went to Chi, we were expecting to have an amazing deep dish pizza anywhere we went. Sadly, we were disappointed! Almost all of the pies we had were just "okay"....except this one. We went with the barbecue wings and a medium Chicago classic. First and foremost, you need to order the WINGS... TRUST ME. The pizza was absolutely delicious, and neither of us were big sausage fans. We practically ate the pan too!

Great deep dish pizza!  We were quoted a wait time of 40 minutes but somehow got a table within 10 minutes! Not going to complain but maybe keep that in mind if they quote a long wait time? We wanted to get some chicago deep dish and knew that deep dish usually takes a while to cook, which we were expecting. Love the fact that our server checked back with us periodically while we were waiting for our pizzas since most places i've gone to for deep dish pretty much ignores us during the time our pizzas bake! I had "the lou" pizza which was delicious! My friend had the pepperoni which was good too, so if you're just looking for a simple pizza, can't go wrong here! you must also get their cookie or brownie dessert! Both are delicious!!

Wanted some authentic Chicago pizza while I was here on business. Lou's was only a short ride from the hotel and had good reviews. Service was great at the bar, limited selection on hard alcohol, but the food was amazing.

Just touched down in Chicago and was looking forward to a good deep dish. I had the Chicago classic which totally didn't hit the spot. The last time I was in town I had Gino's but based on the reviews and a recommendation from a woman on the plane decided to give this place a try. Needless to say I'm still craving a good deep dish!

I don't see or taste what the deal is. I am not impressed though admittedly I am stuck on NY street pizza.  Dough was salt less. Sauce was too salty and devoid of spice flavor filled w chunks of canned tomatoes. Cheese was boring at best.  Catch the next plane for NYC and get something worth biting into.

The smell right when you come in the door was of fresh baked bread and marinara.  The waitress was very friendly and we did not wait long to be seated.  We were told that pizzas would take 30-35 minutes so we put our order in right away.  The waitress got us to add the butter crust to our cheese pizza which I did not overly enjoy.  The place was good and the staff was friendly but it was nothing to write home about.  The atmosphere was warm and nicely decorated but I probably would not return because there are just way too many good pizza places in the world.
Did not disappoint. There was a bit of a wait but we knew that going into it. We ordered the bruschetta it was so good! We got a regular deep dish and it was amazing!!!

Walked into the restaurant and was really excited since the food looked so great and the items on the menu sounded perfect for what my friends and I wanted in Chicago. Little did I know the first impression would quickly change. When we were seated and the waitress came over she was nice but seemed to have a bad attitude about something. My friend wanted to watch a football cotton bowl game and asked the few people at the bar if they minded if they changed the channel to the game he wanted. After confirming no one minded, he proceeded to ask the busy bartender to change the channel and his reply was, "No. I'm watching this." As he was constantly walking around and not watching the tv at all and just told the customer no. One of the managers overheard and didn't question anyone.  The food wasn't anything impressive at all and the people who work there should not work in the customer service industry.

For being a chain. They worked out pretty good.  The pizza was the best I had in Chicago in the short time.  Still have many more to try on next visit.  Service was ok and they serve some local beer so you have something besides a domestic.

Being from Queens, NYC...I am really hard on "Other People's Pizza," I am not down with "O.P.P" but since I was in Chi-town, I decided to peep out their beloved Pizza. And I must say, it was really tasty-like a nice twist on the concept of pizza. The service-accommodating and friendly. The decor-nice brick structure with historic art on the walls. The Pizza-really flavorful, hot and cheesy. **Note: If you are dating a pizza lover then this place is a great introduction to Chi-Town, its history and its deep-dish style pizza. So, check it....I ordered a peperoni large pie, some rolls and a drink. The rolls were tasty and the pizza was really fulling, you will need a fork the eat this pizza but it's full of flavorful sauce and cheese. I wish that they sold a slice of pizza to try 1st but they don't sale slices because it's made in a dish, which means that if you come here alone, you will be having leftovers-unless you are hungry as hell and can eat what is like the equivalent of two regular pizza pies. So, if you are visiting Chi-town, this place should be on your list of places to dine at.

First time trying Chicago deep dish. Went in for lunch on a Wednesday and grabbed a seat at the bar. It was early (11:15am) so no crowd yet. Took the bar tenders suggestion and ordered the classic (deep dish with sausage).  He said it would take 30 minutes and it took 45. No big deal but certainly feels like a long time when you're anticipating pizza.  The pizza itself was good. Not bad at all. If I was at home in Cali I would say pretty good deep dish. The only reason I can't give five starts is because it was a little greasy and didn't blow my socks off. I still have to try the other so called "best deep dish in chicago" before I can really make a fair comparison. But it's worth trying for sure!
Atmosphere, food and service were just perfect! The waiters handled the crowd well and the pizza was melting in your mouth.

Best pizza EVER!!!!!!! We had the signature Chicago classic pizza, tomatos were so fresh and meat was so tender and juicy. Small size is good enough for serving two, just so filling! Absolutely 5 stars for the pizza, but negative 1 star for pasta and waiting time.

Everyone who has a brain knows NY has the best pizza. However on my last trip to chicago I wanted a good deep dish pizza and everyone told me to come here. I didn't know if it was a conspiracy or they were actually this good when i got there but the place was packed!  I ordered a half meatball half pepperoni Pie and have to say it was delicious!  If your in Chicago I highly recommend you stop by here anytime your hungry.

I wasn't overly impressed with this place, but it was okay.  I tried the minestrone soup (below average), calamari (below average), cheese bread (fantastic), and personal deep-dish pizza with butter crust (average).  Between my husband and I, we also sampled 6 of the desserts on the trio platters (all average).  The best thing there was definitely the cheese bread :)!

We're from New England so we love our thin crust pizza. Did not have high expectations for deep dish.....it was fantastic. The light buttery crust, sauce not overloaded with spices but featuring a great fresh tomato taste. My husband fully expected to not really like it, he said it was great and he'd come back again and so would I!! Takes awhile to get the pizza but worth the wait. GO

Got seated quickly on a saturday night however took 5 mins to be greeted by server. She seemed annoyed n not overly friendly. Plates at table had pizza sauce from the last person on it. Kinda gross.  Bruscetta appetizer wad really good n so was fettucine Alfredo.  Yum! Pizza was pretty good but not the best (thin crust). I liked the casual environment but way overcrowded and extremely loud

Let me just begin to let you know that i am NOT a fan of deep dish pizza but guess I have been dinning at the wrong places....THIS PLACE EXCEEDED ALL MY EXPECTATIONS AND BEYOND! Tried their deep dish pizza (thin crust one) and it was delicious.  STRONG 5 STAR IN MY BOOK!

We had a great time here!! Even though there was minor mix up with the gift certificate we won, they took care of us. Before they were even aware of the "issue" they treated us awesomely!! The food was great. True deep dish (may not as deep as you would think for Chicago but to us, it was  better because we could actually enjoy two whole pieces of pizzas each without feeling like we ate a big ball of dough). The pizza was flavorful, service was wonderful,and the Blue Moon pitcher (on special) was great!!! The decor and atmosphere is cool too!! I am exited to recommend this place to future visitors to Chicago!!!!!!

Months before my trip to Chicago, I was extremely excited to try Lou Malnati's pizza. I had read several great reviews and was convinced that this was where I wanted to try some classic Chicago deep-dish pizza. Although my family from Chicago advised me that UNO Pizzeria was better, I decided to still try it out. We ended up ordering a classic pepperoni deep-dish pizza and I was fairly disappointed...It was good, but it didn't meet the high expectations that I had expected. Particularly, the crust was my favorite part about their pizza. It was very nice, flakey, and buttery,  but I guess I was expecting a thicker pizza with more sauce/ less cheese. Personally, I prefer a fair amount of sauce on my pizza and the Lou Malnati pizza had a lot more cheese vs. sauce. So, I will say that the pizza from Lou Malnati's was good, but the pizza we later ended up getting from UNO was GREAT.

I went here for lunch today, since it's near my workplace and I had a major pizza craving. I chose it over The Pizza Window because I really wanted some salad to go with my pizza. I now wish I hadn't.  I ordered the personal deep dish cheese pizza and a side of salad with the creamy lemon garlic dressing. That salad dressing is really what ruined this lunch for me. It was neither lemony nor garlicky and just tasted like straight-up mayo. It even had the consistency of globby mayo straight from the jar, it was that thick. And they just plopped it right on the salad like you would a scoop of frickin' ice cream. I took two bites of that salad, the second one just to make sure I wasn't imagining things, before putting my fork down and pushing the plate away. I was so grossed out. As for the cheese pizza, the marinara sauce is a bit bland for my taste, sort of a raw tomato flavor. The crust though, is very nice. Crispy and golden. Sadly, that lovely crust is not enough to bring me back.

*BIASED NEW YORKER REVIEW, READ AT YOUR OWN RISK* This is a STRONG 2 stars, the extra star I'm giving is for the mozzarella sticks, because they were good. So I tried deep dish, finally. And in my opinion, it simply does not hold a candle to the NY style pizza that I grew up with.  You tryna tell me that a personal pizza takes 35-40minutes to make? I'm a tourist! I got places to see and money to be spent! So thats why I ordered the mozzarella sticks so I don't die of starvation in waiting for this pizza. It doesn't help that the waiter just comes back to our table to ask my girlfriend and I if we were doing okay every 10minutes while he sure as hell know that we're just waiting and wondering when the hell we will get to eat. Mind you, my girlfriend's vegan so she can't even have the mozzarella sticks (and don't dare say the dough isn't vegan, we had believed it was...let us live that lie). They messed up on my girlfriend's pizza first of all. It was literal bread and tomato sauce, when she had ordered it with veggie toppings...making my gf hanger is not wise. And it is not beneficial to me, especially. And mine was...blah. I don't mind the fork and knife technique, but I was just not impressed! You know what it reminds me of? School pizzas. Too much bread and not enough sauce/cheese. BAH!

Got the Lou and the Chicago classic.. both were good, but I liked the Lou better.. we got the personal pies.. I wish we couldve ordered individual slices though..  I think it would've been much different-- better, actually

The "classic" pizza was delicious! The "Lou malnati" salad was so good but you'd have to like sweet. The service was ok. Our waiter had to keep going downstairs for our beer, they should have a cooler for bottled beer so it's more convenient. That's a lot for a waiter to keep going up and down. Our pizza came before our salad, apparently ours was given away. Our waiter never noticed until we told the person who delivered our pizza. Thank god we weren't charged for the salad. Overall, love the food'

Great appetizers. I took pizza crust chips with tomato and cheese with 3 sauces,. One of the best appetizers I have ever eaten. Be careful thouth it is big so if choose it only if you are really hungdy and you plan to take smaller pizza. Pizza is delicious. I have eaten also deep dish in Gino's and its safe to say that both are similar. I think Lou is better though :-) It is deep dish so you need to take into account that it is tick. A lot of chees and the crust with butter makes perferct combination with the sousage and pieces of tomatos on the top. I strongly recommend to try it if you didn't. Service is great! Nice and helpful, the lady even adviced us not to take the large pizza because this would be just too much for us!

Warning! This review will make you hungry!           I was in Chicago, and well, who leaves Chicago without eating deep dish? So I definitely had to stop here, and let me just say, it was so worth it!          We started with appetizers. We got the Malnati salad, and mozzarella sticks. The mozzarella sticks were AMAZING! The cheese was so gooey, and it was breaded perfectly. The salad was out of this world! It was fresh & crisp, but not too filling, so that we had room for the amazing deep dish.          I don't even know where to begin with the deep dish pizza. I could easily call it one of my favorite pizzas in the world! Their tomatoes come from California, and the cheese comes from Wisconsin. It was so gooey, and just amazing! As soon as the first bite hit my taste buds, I knew I would love it!          The service was pretty good. The only concern is that our drinks took 10-15 minutes to come. I do want to point out that the pizza takes 30-35 mins to cook, but they say it in advance, so that pleased me. Overall, this restaurant is beyond amazing. I'm definitely coming here next time I stay in Chicago!

1. Verdict/Value: Decent food, decent prices, and a solid choice for deep-dish pizza in a town full of deep dish choices!  Folks looking for personal sizes of pizzas will appreciate this place. 2. Food: The Bar-B-Lou Wings ($8.75) featured just 8 drumsticks and wings, but they were big, meaty, juicy, and flavorful.  Order it with the honey BBQ sauce on the side, since they normally come over-smothered in sauce. The Malnati Chicago Classic personal sized pizza ($8.95) comes with tomatoes, sausage, and plenty of cheese.  For $0.90, you can get extra toppings; pineapple worked well for this Hawaiian diner.  Unlike some of my fellow Yelpers I had a reasonably soft crust - likely because the Classic comes with a special buttery crust. For dessert, I couldn't resist the Chocolate Chip Pizza ($3.50 personal size) - who can resist a soft, thick/deep-dish cookie served with vanilla ice cream and a cherry on top?! 3. Service: It's a hopping place, so given that, the service was good.  My waitress came often and various wait staff passing by constantly were willing to help. 4. Atmosphere: Old-school brickhouse where sports memorabilia adorn the walls.  It's clean, comfortable, and classic-looking, like the pizza they serve!  Rooms allow for private functions and they can host small and large groups easily.

Good pizza. I expected more...more flavor, more thick Chicago style crust, more sauce; All of which would have contributed to actually filling the deep dish much more than our pizza did. I enjoyed this pizza and would go again but it did not live up to its reputation as the best Chicago deep dish pizza. I love that you can put in your order while waiting to be seated, such a smart way to order!..except our server got confused by the preorder and mixed up with another preorder but a very nice option to offer non the less.
Good Chicago pizza, but I liked Giordano's better. Waitress was kind of weird. Went for lunch during the week so no wait time. Pizza prep time was 45 minutes, which is standard.

Part of a local chain but don't let that deter you from choosing this pizza place. The deep dish pizza was delicious. Crispy crust and not soggy. It takes about 35 minutes to get your pizza so order a salad to bridge the gap. Clean, family friendly and roomy for big groups.

Best pizza in Chicago! There is a bit of a wait but you can pre-order your pizza which is nice. Then you sit down and it comes out in no time. We got a pepperoni deep dish and a ceasar salad. Definitely a must when traveling to Chicago.

Great deep dish pizza ! Recommended by many people and they did not steer us wrong. Get the Classic you will not be dissapointed. We ate at the bar and our Bartender Lamar was a rock star, we loved everything he recommended,  and will definitely be back next time we are in Chicago.

I really don't know what to say that the almost 2000 other people who've reviewed this place haven't said already so I'll keep it short and sweet. Fantastic food, great pizza, and definitely a place to go to if you want a deep dish. They did lose a star because my waiter was practically non-existent, and I interacted more times with my food runner than him.

We were starving so we ordered an app sampler while we were waiting for the pizza. The appetizers are huge, so if you are hungry you might want to pace yourself. The dip platter was good, but could have fed 6 people. The calamari was good as well, but  also a giant portion. We ordered way too much. The pizza was really good. Super heavy on the cheese and with extra sauce. The only thing that I didn't care for was the way that they do their sausage. It is more like a patty that covers the entire pizza and is then covered in sauce. All in all, we had our deep dish experience. They have a bar as well there which was mildly busy. I was satisfied with the experience and can say that I have had Chicago pizza now. Host staff and wait staff were pleasant.

I was in town for a work trip and the river north location was close to my hotel, so I decided to see what the deep dish pizza was all about.  I ordered the personal size "The Lou" pizza and it was damn good. Get yourself a deep dish here!

This place was my introduction to authentic Chicago deep dish pizza!  I was in town on business and had yet to try the city's iconic pizza style. I was walking around and it was cold as f*ck outside and I pulled up the Yelp app on my phone and searched for deep dish from my current location.  This was the closest place and I ducked in.  There wasn't much selection of craft beers unfortunately and it took a good half hour for them to make the pizza. The bathroom was really cramped and awkward too.   All in all, I think I'm more of a NY pizza guy - though I'm not really a pizza guy anyway.   The bartender/server was cool though. True Chicago guy and a Knicks fan like me :)

The truth is, it's not distasteful pizza, Lou Malnati's is just very far from my preference. The crust is far too solid, similar to a bread cookie...their sauce is, for lack of a better word, not very "saucy"; if you like a chunkier, raw tomato texture and taste, it'd probably be ideal for you. Not to be a complete negative nancy...I did appreciate the fact that their menu offers a personal size...something many deep dish pizzerias should adapt to! Their atmosphere is welcoming, staff is friendly and prices are competitive to other local spots! I'd lie if I told you I'd visit again, but I certainly encourage other pizza lovers to give it a try! Many of my friends loved it, even preferred in over Giordano's...crazy, I know. 2.5 Stars, and in summary, just not my thannng.
Good Pizza.  It is definitely a good Chicago style pizza.  Ingredients are plentiful.  Their lemon garlic dressing for their salad is excellent.  Service pretty good as well.

I am by no means a pizza fan, but this may be some of the best pizza I've ever eaten. The cheese and crust were perfectly cooked and the rounds were delicious. Original chicago style was the most popular at the table of 7 I was at.

Had this pizza delivered to my hotel while I was there. Definitely will be back. Great crust. It was crispy, buttery, garlicy. I've never had a pizza that had a layer of sausage. I'm giving this 4 stars because the pizza was good but the Calamari was mediocre.

Lou Malnati's has always (and forever will be) my favorite pizza place in Chicago. I have been going to Lou Malnati's since I can remember. Typically, I go with family and share the sausage deep dish pizza and a house salad (creamy lemon garlic dressing is awesome for a splurge on the salad).  I recently tried "The Lou" pizza with spinach, mushrooms, and sliced roma tomatoes and a blend of mozzarella, cheddar, and romano cheese. I made two variations to it by ordering it on thin crust and adding sausage. It was so good - the thin crust was crunchy and not as filling as the deep dish pizza crusts. The sliced roma tomatoes (usually I do not like these on pizza) were a great touch and the cheese blend was perfect. This might be my new favorite pizza at Lou's!

Loved this place. Beats the pants off Gino's East. Crispy, buttery, crackery crust... can't beat it. This and Pequods were my favorite pizza in Chicago, and this is the best downtown option. Here is what you do: walk inside. There will be a big cluster near the front, and you will be unsure if there is an actual line or not. Find the employee holding the iPad, and give him your name. He will tell you the wait time, and then you put your order in at the front register. You will also give him your phone number, as they call your cell when your table is open. During the wait, walk to the end of the block and go into the bar/ resteruant (Bear and the Bull I think its called), and grab a beer. It will likely be too crowded to stay at Lou's and grab a beer there. Watch whatever game is on. Nod to the other people who are also waiting for Lou's to call them. Wait for your phone call. When the phone does ring, walk back to Lou's and walk behind where the guy with the Ipad is. Tell the worker in the little hallway that your number rang. She will seat you. Then eat the best damn pizza in Chicago.

While shopping in the area we decided to grab a pizza today.  What a disappointment.  Arriving around 1:45, the place was losing the lunch crowd.  Server informed us of the 30-40 minute wait for a thin crust pizza.  That seemed pretty silly but fine, I'm in my seat and it's raining out.  After 45 minutes, the pizza arrived to be semi-warm.  Apparently our server was more interested in the Bears game than watching for our pizza to serve it hot.  He then disappeared to never return for a beverage refill, ask of how things were or anything.  In fact, he took the order of the table immediately behind me and never looked over our way.  My husband got up to find him to pay and we went on our way.  Never coming back.  Pat's Pizza on Lincoln is 1000 times better and I'll hop in a cab and head north before stepping into another Lou Malnatti's, much less this one.  Pizza was ok due to the nice crust.  Only good thing I can say about the experience.  I should have known how it was going to go when the surly girl at the entrance desk appeared quite annoyed to be working.  I hope the manager actually reads this and takes note.  Tourists have many pizza choices in this town and as a local, I'm steering them anywhere else.
Hands down, the best pizza in Chicago.  'Nuf said.  Thanks Lou!
Food was amazing. Great experience. Be sure to order in advance when prompted. Two thumbs up.

Delicious pizza...their crust is to die for, light & crispy around the edges and thick and hearty in the middle. A true deep dish of amazingness. I went with the Lou which was perfect for me, and I definitely suggest, even if you are ordering for 1 to go with the small. The personal size comes on a plate and then you miss out on the whole deep dish experience. You can always take it home people! I also suggest sitting at the bar, great service, quick with the drinks and you can take in the entire atmosphere which is great. Reminds me of a neighborhood spot you would see on tv, and I loved how it was busy with what seemed to be regulars.  Definitely a must eat while in Chicago!
Overrated. You wait 30-45 for your pizza, and at the end you get it cold! Plus, the reviews I read, made it sound like its the number one. I think its "okay". Got the Cheese small pie and the Veggie.

This was our third deep dish pizza restaurant to try during our 4-day vacation in Chicago, and third one's the charm. It was my favorite because of the soft crust , lots of cheese and the tasty sausage patty they put in the pizza. We got a small Chicago classic and loved it. We also ordered the Chicken Louie and devoured all those carbs. The pizza takes a while to cook but I am so glad we came here. Better than Giordano's and Pizano's in my opinion.

Classic. Get the Lou Malnatis special. Chicago style deep dish pizza made with buttercrust topped with mozzarella cheese, sausage, then marinara sauce - in that exact order. Cheese on the crust, and then sauce? It works. Everything blends well together. The buttery thick crust cut by the sauce, and the creaminess of the cheese with the saltiness of the sausage. Yum. The crust had some chew to it, but it does have to support a load of toppings. Fork and knife is the way to go for this pizza.  We also sampled their calamari, and it was fairly decent. They serve both a white sauce and a marinara sauce for your dipping pleasure. Wait time is reasonable. There's a quick turnover time for tables. I'd come back again - probably order takeout to save some time.
Iconic pizza joint.  It's a cool place to get a Chicago deep dish.  Friendly staff and fair prices.   During the summer months there is a line so keep that in mind
Delicious deep dish pizza! The best I've ever eaten! If you are in Chi-town, you must have it!

I want to preface my review that I am not a huge fan of deep dish and I prefer thinner crust pizzas.  Generally speaking, however, this place is pretty good.   I actually prefer their deep dish over Giordano.    Location: This location is near the magnificent mile and because of the cold we decided to uber a ride here.   We waited about half an hour to get our table.  Place: The location is pretty big.   Nice environment with several big screens.   Place is generally pack so you should come here early.   Food: We ordered the deep dish lou's classic.  It's pretty good but I did not expect them to put that much tomatoes on top.   Also ordered the peach cobbler to end the night and it was fantastic.    Service: The lady that served us is pretty nice.   She came back frequently to check up on us.  We ordered appetizers  and beers and it came out quickly.    Overall, this place is solid if you don't mind the wait.

I was told this was the best place to get pizza in the city and I was not disappointed! From the delicious sauce to the buttery dough, I was in pizza heaven. There was definitely a post meal food coma.

I wanted Chicago deep dish and I got it. This place came highly recommended by several of my friends. Went for lunch and got a personal pepperoni deep dish with the buttercrust. It was delicious. Sat at the bar and service was great. Hotel gave me a coupon for free dessert. Cookie pizza equally delicious! You must go if you want Chicago deep dish.

Between here and Giordano's, I'm totally TEAM LOU MALNATI'S!  My friend was raving about this place and wanted to come to eat, as well as bring some home before our flight back. We ordered the following: The Malnati Chicago Classic Deep Dish: The crust was all buttery goodness! Personally, I think this is a bit heavy for me, but I enjoyed the bites I was able to experience. The "Lou" Deep Dish: MY FAVORITE. Once again, buttery goodness of a crust. Having such heavy ingredients, the vegetables helped to balance it out. This was my highlight and I'd come back to eat this one. We ordered both as small sizes and it was more than enough for the both of us. We definitely had some leftovers.  Also, helpful tip is to not come here starving as it takes a bit of a while for it to come out and be made. Keep calm and avoid being hangry (hungry+angry).

Wow what an experience! One of the things I was most looking forward to on my trip to Chicago was trying the much talked about deep dish pizza. My friend and I settled on Lou Malnati's as our deep dish choice. It was extremely crowded when we came in and the wait was about 35 mins. We were finally seated upstairs. I discovered a hidden gem lost in the midst of all the pizza hype here. The buffalo wings! My goodness Lou Malnati's has some of the best wings I've ever had in my life- I was so impressed. If you like wings at all, I would highly recommend this. Then came the pizza- my friend and I ordered a medium Lou and a medium Malnati Chicago classic.
